fullDescription:
Heard of us?

We're an award-winning bank; backing people to fulfil life's hopes and dreams.

Now is your chance…

The People Team is a key enabler for business success. We attract talent; by being fully immersed in our business, influencing and understanding our short, medium and long term aspirations. We develop our people; to ensure they fulfil their hopes and dreams, whilst continuing to meet the needs and expectations of our dynamic business.

We are a high performing, high profile team. We have worked hard to establish ourselves as trusted advisors; providing the correct balance of knowledge and challenge which supports managers and leaders to make the right decisions at difficult times.

The role of Systems and Data Analyst in our People Team is really important to us. You will operate with the key purpose of devising our vital monthly MI reporting within the People function.

When the time is right, we would love to welcome you to our Cardiff office. In the meantime you will be based remotely. You'll be made to feel part of your new team by your Line Manager, People Systems and Data Manager and colleagues through regular contact and virtual interaction.

What would your day look like?

  • With a passion for the interpretation and analysis of People data, you will create and present People MI on a monthly and ad-hoc basis, delivering this invaluable information to your colleagues within the People function.
  • You will run and build new reports in line with demand, deriving information utilising various Business Intelligence tools across a range of sources, including our People systems and Oracle.
  • With an eye for detail, you will drive and deliver updates and improvements to the reporting suite, providing access to information for your People colleagues.
  • Solutions focussed you will take the initiative to solve any problems you may identify with report availability.

What do we expect of you?

  • Experience of working within a People or HR function.
  • Responsibility for the creation and provision of monthly MI reporting, which illustrates business performance.
  • Ability to interpret and present data to the People function, utilising Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
  • You may have worked with Oracle before, but if not, we recognise that exposure to other HR systems will give you the foundations you need for this role.

What can you expect of us?

  • A friendly and flexible culture, synonymous with our proposition to our customers.
  • A growing organisation that defines itself as being nimble, lean and strong.
  • A drive for continuous improvement, which you will be empowered to get behind from day one.
  • A communicative, accessible and approachable ExCo.

And of course, you will be compensated competitively, with a good range of core benefits and bonus potential.

Still Curious?

MotoNovo Finance forms an integral part of Aldermore Group, having been brought together with Aldermore Bank, under the First Rand umbrella. Whilst our parent company operates internationally from their HQ in South Africa, we are a UK-based financial services specialist that supports our customers across a range of products and services.

Underpinned by our strategic blueprint, "backing people to fulfil life's hopes and dreams", we thrive upon saying "yes" to our customers. Thousands of customers choose MotoNovo Finance every week to buy their next car, van or motorbike.

This is where you come in. We are on a journey. A journey defined by a destination; to deliver on our purpose over the course of the next 3 to 5 years.

Join us today and we will make the same promises to you as an employee, as we do to each of our customers. We value your differences; welcoming applications from all sections of society. We continue to build an inclusive, empathetic and creative environment; where your views and contributions will inspire new ways of thinking.

#backingyoutobringyourbest

MotoNovo Finance is an equal opportunities employer.

We do not accept speculative agency CVs. Any CV received by MotoNovo Finance will be treated as a gift and not eligible for an agency fee. PSL agencies should only send CVs if authorised to do so by Recruitment.

Where a DBS check or CIFAS check is identified as necessary, all application forms, job adverts and recruitment briefs will contain a statement that an application for a DBS certificate or a CIFAS check will be submitted in the event of the individual being offered the position.

fullDescription:
An exciting temporary opportunity for an advanced Excel user to join a business that is going through a period of change within finance. This role will help support the team with cleaning up financial data and assiting with creating new processes for the input of data into their new finance system.

Client Details

My client is a highly reputable business with a reputation for the way in which they change people's lives in the local community.

Description

The role will involve, but not be limited to:

  • Cleaning up data and ledgers in current finance system, ready for integration into new system
  • Assisting with the process of taking data from one system to another
  • Cleaning up spreadsheets
  • Creating spreadsheets
  • Data extraction and manipulation

Profile

The successful candidate will:

  • Be able to start at short notice and be open to a temporary role
  • Have strong Excel skills - look up's, pivots and use of VBA
  • Have worked with large sets of financial data previously
  • Have a basic understanding of the key accounting principles

Job Offer

  • Flexible working - some office based, some based from home
  • Other great benefits - please apply to find out more information

jobDescription: Macildowie is pleased to be working with an NHS organisation based in Nottingham as they look to add some temporary resource to the team,whilst managing the additional workload that has arisen due to Covid 19. We are looking to secure the services of a candidate with intermediate plus MS Excel Skills, as this project is collating and recording results of the internal staff Covid testing programme. In addition, you will have stron...
fullDescription:
Macildowie is pleased to be working with an NHS organisation based in Nottingham as they look to add some temporary resource to the team,whilst managing the additional workload that has arisen due to Covid 19.

We are looking to secure the services of a candidate with intermediate plus MS Excel Skills, as this project is collating and recording results of the internal staff Covid testing programme. In addition, you will have strong attention to detail with speed and accuracy being critical.

You will be working across a number of spreadsheets to record information, and must be comfortable with this as well as managing the influx of daily data.

Whilst you will be part of a team and have a direct line manager, you must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.

This role requires an immediate start and we require remote working, there will be a couple of days induction on-site.

The role falls inside IR35 and will therefore be paid PAYE via our payroll or Umbrella company.

Macildowie is a specialist recruitment consultancy with a rich history of enhancing the careers of professionals across the Midlands and the Northern Home Counties. We have an unrivalled understanding of the local market place and recruit for the majority of the region's premier employers. To search for all of our live jobs please visit us at macildowie.com.

Macildowie are a recruitment business working on behalf of a client to recruit this role. Your personal data may be forwarded to that client company as part of the application process. After applying for this role you'll be sent a request for your consent to hold your data on our systems. If you would like information on how we will process your data please go to our website and view our fair processing notices which are located at the bottom of the page under privacy policies. Within the fair processing notice for Candidates there is guidance on how to amend your contact preferences or exercise your rights relating to personal data. We can't provide direct links as email address and website urls within our job adverts are removed by some of the websites on which we advertise.

jobDescription: Finance/Data Analyst  Location: Lakeside North Harbour, PO6 Salary: Competitive Hours of Work: 37.5 Hours per week, Monday to Friday 9am to 5:30pm About the Company: Our client is a leading European provider of quality insurance products for over 100 major brand clients. Their people are Innovative, energetic, and enthusias...
fullDescription:
Finance/Data Analyst

Location: Lakeside North Harbour, PO6

Salary: Competitive

Hours of Work: 37.5 Hours per week, Monday to Friday 9am to 5:30pm

About the Company:

Our client is a leading European provider of quality insurance products for over 100 major brand clients. Their people are Innovative, energetic, and enthusiastic and their values lay at the heart of their business. They can boast many accolades including being the first mobile phone insurance provider in the UK marketplace, the most diverse provider to the online mobile device insurance channel, the first UK insurance business to offer a walk-in repair facility to policy holders as part of the service proposition and one of the leading insurance providers in the Education insurance market. Based in exceptional offices in Portsmouth with lakeside views this is a great opportunity to join a business in a period of growth.

They’re also part of the group, which makes them Europe’s leading affinity insurance provider, and the largest provider of Mobile Phone Insurance in Europe.

In addition, due to the nature of our client's business, they are unable to employ any candidates with adverse financial history or unspent criminal records. Any successful candidates will be subject to background and Cifas checks, full details available upon request.

They currently have an opportunity for a Finance/Data Analyst to join the growing team. You will be reporting to the Deputy Financial Controller, you will be responsible for data consolidation, analysis and report production for internal and external stakeholders and underwriters.

Finance/Data Analyst Responsibilities:

  • Perform analyses of project financial metrics and prepare reports in order to ensure that contracts are within negotiated and agreed-upon parameters and regulation guidelines.
  • Take part in project forecasting and scheduling and perform and/or assist in financial analyses such as Return on Investment and project profitability, as well as sales outlook, and variance analysis.
  • Support in the implementation of a new MI software, such as Microsoft Power BI.
  • Preparation of reports and analysis of underwriting performance for individual Underwriters, on a client by client basis.
  • Constructively challenging each area to deliver cost savings through the identification and presentation of potential savings, and through rigorous expense discipline.
  • Assist in preparing the new financial year budgets and business plans.
  • Build and maintain strong working relationships with the Finance team and various Business Partners.
  • Determining and implementing value added analysis and recommendations.
  • Assisting in various reconciliations across the finance team.
  • Assist in ad-hoc requests and projects.

Finance/Data Analyst Requirements:

  • Good analytical skills and strong attention to detail
  • Strong numerical skills and a proficient understanding of and experience with Microsoft Excel
  • Good collaborative interpersonal skills for written, oral and face to face communications and presentations
  • Capable of dealing with multiple stakeholders
  • Has an ambition to pursue a career in Finance or Business Management
  • At least 1 year’s finance experience, or a degree in Finance or Business
  • GCSE grade C and above in English and Maths (Essential)
  • A-Level or equivalent (Desirable)

Finance/Data Analyst Benefits:

  • Bright, modern and comfortable working environment
  • 30 days holiday inclusive of Bank Holidays
  • Workplace pension scheme
  • Free on-site parking
  • Strong skills development and career progression
  • Eye care vouchers
  • Flu vaccinations

If you think that you are suitable for this Finance/Data Analyst role, please apply now!

As Data Analyst you will be responsible for:  Capturing relevant dataProcessing, analysing, and presenting data to clients and customersInterpreting 3D dataAssisting other...
fullDescription:
Experienced Data Analyst required for a great organisation based in Oxfordshire, my client a specialist within their field are seeking a Data Analyst with a geographical background to join their expanding team.

As Data Analyst you will be responsible for:

  • Capturing relevant data
  • Processing, analysing, and presenting data to clients and customers
  • Interpreting 3D data
  • Assisting other departments with ad-hoc support

Skills and Experience required:

  • Proficient with MATLAB or Python
  • Data visualisation software
  • AutoCAD
  • SQL skills experience is highly beneficial
  • Excellent communication and organisational skills
  • Strong attention to detail

This is a great opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to join a great organisation going through exciting growth. If this is of interest please contact us as soon as possible.

Please note: Only candidates with the relevant skills and experience will be contacted regarding this position. If you do not hear back from us within 5 days you have unfortunately been unsuccessful in your application for this position, however we may contact you in the future to discuss other opportunities.

Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. Every candidate will be assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualifications and abilities to perform the duties of the job.

jobDescription: We are looking for dynamic people with an interest in data collating and analysis to work with Surrey County Council’s Adult Social Care Directorate. We currently have two positions available. One is offered as full-time (36 hours per week) and one is offered as part-time (18 hours per week). The salary for part-time hours will be £13,821 per annum. The role of Data Analyst will include:  Collating and ana...
fullDescription:
We are looking for dynamic people with an interest in data collating and analysis to work with Surrey County Council’s Adult Social Care Directorate.

We currently have two positions available. One is offered as full-time (36 hours per week) and one is offered as part-time (18 hours per week). The salary for part-time hours will be £13,821 per annum.

The role of Data Analyst will include:

  • Collating and analysing regular performance data, investigating discrepancies within data, supporting teams to improve their data and producing performance reports
  • Supporting the delivery of statutory reporting requirements
  • Working collaboratively with others to obtain performance information and communicating effectively with colleagues across the Council
  • Developing data visualisation skills using tools such as Tableau

The role and work are varied, so you will need to make sense of lots of data and information to provide quality performance analysis for managers. You will be expected to be a key contact for a locality social care team to drive performance improvement.

You will need to possess initiative, be able to work flexibly and deliver to tight deadlines. You’ll be a highly effective team player with excellent organisational and IT skills as well as possessing a good knowledge of performance management systems, possibly from working in the public sector.

You will be an excellent communicator (orally and written), have strong IT skills (Excel, Word and PowerPoint) and be forward thinking with a positive, "can do" attitude.

This is an exciting role for the right candidate with opportunities to be involved right at the heart of the organisation to ensure that it delivers the best possible outcomes for the residents of Surrey.

This position sits within the ASC Business Intelligence Team. The Business Intelligence team lies at the heart of the Adult Social Care Directorate and supports the leadership of the Directorate by taking a proactive approach to anticipating future initiatives and supporting the design and delivery of effective services.

For more information, please see the full job description attached to this advert.

Job Advert
Additional Information

Contact Details

For an informal discussion please contact Charlotte Langridge by e-mail at .uk.

We look forward to receiving your application. 

Additional Information

The job advert closes at 23:59 on 30th December 2020.

Interviews will take place the week of the 11 January 2021 and will include an Excel test.

From flexible working to job sharing (where possible) we are committed to providing a healthy work life balance. A laptop and mobile will be supplied if applicable to your role. You will benefit from 26 days annual leave, rising to 28 days after 2 years’ service (pro rata for part-time staff), a generous local government salary related pension, as well as the option to join our car lease scheme. For more information about the wide variety of benefits you can take advantage of please visit MyBenefits for Surrey County Council staff.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.

Please do not apply if you have been unsuccessful at interview stage previously for this role for any team across Adult Social Care in Surrey County Council as your application will not be considered for 3 months from your interview date.

Company Information

Our Values

Our values are what support our vision, shape the culture and are crucial in delivering our corporate strategy.

fullDescription:
Badenoch + Clark is working with a growing Financial Services organisation towards the appointment of a Data Analyst for a 12-month fixed term contract. This role is a brand-new function that will allow you to have first-hand input in driving the business forward.

You should be confident using excel (Vlookups/ Pivot Tables) with strong data modelling skills and the ability to convey technical information to staff at all levels of the business.

Key Accountabilities:
*Production of monthly data analysis
*Conduct behavioural analysis
*Identify trends and supply subsequent commentary
*Author procedures for models
*Streamline processes and seek continuous improvements for data quality
*Model development, user acceptance testing (UAT)

Essentials:
*Finance background preferred but not essential
*Strong Excel capabilities essential
*Strong exposure to data modelling
*Forward thinking, confident individual who is willing and able to give input

Badenoch + Clark acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers. Badenoch + Clark UK is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Badenoch + Clark. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement explains how we will use your information - please copy and paste the following link in to your browser: https://en-gb/candidate-privacy

jobDescription: Data Analyst required for my client a supplier of key services to the health and social care sectors. Joining a team responsible for the UK IT environment and infrastructure of this international organisation. Benefits include: Free Parking, Company Pension, Healthcare, Annual KPI bonus. The successful candidate must have a strong understanding of how to move data between systems and generate meaningful and dynamic business rep...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst required for my client a supplier of key services to the health and social care sectors. Joining a team responsible for the UK IT environment and infrastructure of this international organisation.

Benefits include: Free Parking, Company Pension, Healthcare, Annual KPI bonus.

The successful candidate must have a strong understanding of how to move data between systems and generate meaningful and dynamic business reporting.

Working closely with colleagues and the management team in both the UK and USA, you will require excellent communication skills and the confidence to advise appropriately.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Extract and transform data from a bespoke ERP system.
  • Gather transactional data and feeds into SQL servers for analytics.
  • Combine analytics from other business applications such as Salesforce, MS Dynamics, PeopleHR, iAuditor and AssetTrac.
  • Report production using SSAS, SSRS, MS Excel & Power Pivot / Power Query.
  • Creating Data Visualisations and Dashboards.
  • Manage SQL / SQL Server.
  • Data Warehouse / Database Concepts.
  • ETL to RDS in AWS and Azure.

Essential skills and experience:

  • Strong Excel experience in include Power Pivot / Power Query
  • Experience using Power BI or other reporting suites such as Tableau, Qlik, SAP BI.
  • Excellent SQL Server.
  • Ability to analyse, model and interpret data, ETL procedures.
  • High level of mathematical ability and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively with key stakeholders.
  • Strong planning and organisation skills, able to meet deadlines.
  • High level of accuracy and attention to detail.

This role is suited to candidates who wish to join a company with excellent opportunities for progression, have an excellent "team" environment and have a work hard play hard mentality.

Please note, if your application is suitable, one of our consultants will call you within 5 working days. If you have not heard from us within this time, your application has unfortunately been unsuccessful, however, we will keep your details on our talent management system to consider you for future opportunities.

ASC Connections Ltd acts as an employment business for temporary positions and an employment agency for permanent positions. We are committed to equal opportunity and diversity.

jobDescription: Great interim opportunity for a period of 6 Months working for a Leading private equity backed Media organisation.You will be supporting the FP&A Manager following a successful implementation of Data Warehouse by the IT department this is working as the middle person between IT & Finance. Responsibilities:  Support separate IT DataWarehouse team with design and implemen...
fullDescription:
Great interim opportunity for a period of 6 Months working for a Leading private equity backed Media organisation.
You will be supporting the FP&A Manager following a successful implementation of Data Warehouse by the IT department this is working as the middle person between IT & Finance.

Responsibilities:

  • Support separate IT DataWarehouse team with design and implementation of new DataWarehouse system.
  • Support Group Finance with budgeting and forecasting cycles. Support provision of consolidated group Board Reporting.
  • Adapt reporting to meet evolving business requirements and data landscape.
  • Utilization of various systems and DataWarehouse to deliver and enhance the management information that drives the Group.
  • Share best practice with the finance leads of the other business units.
  • Helping to identify process improvement opportunities to build streamlines and scalable solutions.
  • Delivering step changes to quality and efficiency of management reporting.
  • Assisting in development of business cases and supporting operational leadership in financial aspects of proposals.
  • Ability to manage databases and think outside of the box to provide deep business insights.
  • Attention to detail and ability to do in-depth data mining, methodical approach to work while also seeking to understand the big picture.
  • Ad-hoc projects and analysis as required, for example working on integration of acquired businesses or process improvement.

fullDescription:
Data Analyst - Risk - London

Data Idols are working with a well know client who are looking for a Data Analyst to join an existing data team. Our client are in the Finance industry and have offices based in London.

THE ROLE

Within this role as a Data Analyst you will be working within a broader team of analysts and you must be able to derive insights from data and present findings and assees the impact on the business.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Experienced in Python and R
  • Experience in manipulating large datasets
  • Able to use SQL to retrieve data
  • Ability to translate data into commercial insights

This is an outstanding opportunity for a Data Analyst to join an exciting company on a permanent basis with a great salary and benefits package. Please submit your CV for consideration.

Data Analyst - Risk - London

jobTitle: Scientific Data Analyst - Machine Learning, Python
jobDescription: Scientific Data Analyst – Machine Learning, Python  I’m looking for a Scientific Data Analyst with Machine Learning and Python experience to join a R&D company in Oxford, working on ground-breaking and life-saving research projects!   The Role  As the Scientific Data Analyst, you will join a research group focused ...
fullDescription:
Scientific Data Analyst – Machine Learning, Python


I’m looking for a Scientific Data Analyst with Machine Learning and Python experience to join a R&D company in Oxford, working on ground-breaking and life-saving research projects!  

The Role


As the Scientific Data Analyst, you will join a research group focused on improving the accuracy of my client’s medical diagnostic device. The Scientific Data Analyst will be tasked with developing and implementing algorithms and Machine Learning methods from scratch, as well as producing reusable and scalable software tools in Python. 

The Scientific Data Analyst will be interacting heavily with Scientists, helping to plan and execute experiments, so communication skills and a strong understanding of scientific methods are key! 

The Company


The Scientific Data Analyst will be joining a truly exceptional company and one of Oxford’s most exciting R&D institutions. Originally an Oxford University spin-off, the company have now grown to close to 500 people, with multiple offices around the globe!  The Scientific Data Analyst will enjoy benefits including: 

  • 10% bonus 
  • 25 days holiday 
  • On-site gym
  • Free parking 
  • Private Healthcare 

What’s Required?


For this Scientific Data Analyst position, we’re looking a bright individual with strong problem solving skills and the ability to understand complex scientific concepts. We’re ideally looking for: 

  • A PhD in a mathematical subject (Maths, Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science) or equivalent experience 
  • Experience building and implementing algorithms and Machine Learning models from scratch 
  • Scientific software development experience with Python 
  • Ideally, a knowledge of biology/life sciences 

What Next?


If you’re a Scientific Data Analyst looking for a new role with an exciting company then please apply today to learn more about this role! 

Scientific Data Analyst – Machine Learning, Python

Corriculo Ltd acts as an employment agency and an employment business.

jobDescription: Job Title: Telephone Billing Analyst Location: City of London Salary: Competitive Job Type: Full Time, Permanent The company is a leading IT, Print and Telecoms Solutions company in the heart of the City of London. They're based at the centre of the business district, and are surrounded by bars, restaurants, cafes, pop-ups, and there's even a bit ...
fullDescription:
Job Title: Telephone Billing Analyst

Location: City of London

Salary: Competitive

Job Type: Full Time, Permanent

The company is a leading IT, Print and Telecoms Solutions company in the heart of the City of London. They're based at the centre of the business district, and are surrounded by bars, restaurants, cafes, pop-ups, and there's even a bit of greenery nearby!

You can find their office in the middle of multiple transportation hubs, such as Liverpool Street, Old Street, Moorgate, Barbican stations.

They believe in creating an environment in which people can thrive; they encourage everyone to maintain a healthy work/life balance, and they strongly believe in investing in employee's futures. They're looking for ambitious, driven, and hardworking people to join the team.

The Role:

Due to new business developments, they are looking for a telecoms Billing Analyst. It is the perfect Billing Specialist position for an ambitious individual looking for a long-term career within an expanding company.

On a day to day basis, you will:

  • Ensure Daily Call Rejects is resolved on a daily basics
  • Ensure Monthly CDR's are imported in a timely manner
  • Ensure un-costed/fixed charges are allocated
  • Ensure all Rejected Calls have been allocated including Matching CLI's to Customer accounts and Call Rejects before running the bill run
  • Run the monthly bill run for both IT and Telecoms
  • Deal with invoice queries and credits
  • Run Monthly commission reports
  • Control and manage high call alerts on a daily basics
  • Check for any customer leaving notifications and deal with them accordingly
  • Apply Call Barring for non-payment invoices
  • Load contract details for Telecoms & IT Clients

Key Requirements:

  • Previous working experience in a similar role (essential)
  • Telecoms aBILLity Billing Platform knowledge (Not essential but an advantage)
  • Good analytical skills
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills
  • Meticulous organisational skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent verbal and written skills
  • Knowledge on SQL (Not essential but an advantage)

What you get in return:

  • Basic salary
  • 28 days annual leave (Jan - Dec), which increases one day per year to a max of 33 days (including Bank Holidays)
  • Pension Scheme
  • Private Healthcare
  • Life Assurance
  • Good Attendance Bonus Scheme
  • Long term career opportunities
  • Training and Development
  • Company Days Out
  • Team recognition events

If this role sounds like a fit for you, please click the APPLY button to send your CV & Cover Letter for this role.

Candidates with experience of: Data Scientist, Data Solutions analyst, MI Analyst, MI Data Analyst, Business Insight Analyst, Data Insight Analyst, Data mining, Data modelling, Statistician, Econometrics, Data Modelling will also be considered for this role.

jobDescription: Are you a successful Data Analyst? Do you have a passion for what you do and want to share these skills with apprentices? REED are working in partnership with an excellent Training Provider looking for the best Data Analysts to train Apprentices. Role: Data Analyst Trainer - Delivering and facilitating training, coaching and mentoring to achieve learning and results in the workplace -...
fullDescription:
Are you a successful Data Analyst? Do you have a passion for what you do and want to share these skills with apprentices?

REED are working in partnership with an excellent Training Provider looking for the best Data Analysts to train Apprentices.

Role: Data Analyst Trainer

- Delivering and facilitating training, coaching and mentoring to achieve learning and results in the workplace

- Monitoring and reviewing learner welfare on a regular basis

- Working with employers to set projects for the apprentices

Hours: Full time

Contract: Permanent

Salary: Up to £55k

Location: Manchester

Ideal candidate will have knowledge of:

(Essential)

  • Significant programme specific knowledge and experience in the subject field as advertised. (i.e Infrastructure, Data, Software etc).
  • Knowledge of Digital IT standards and requirements.
  • Knowledge of Safeguarding, Prevent and E&D.
  • Knowledge of apprenticeship standards particularly digital and tech and work-based learning
  • Knowledge of the current Ofsted Education Inspection Framework
  • Good track record in being part of supporting apprentices to achieve merits/distinctions at EPA

    (Desirable)
  • Knowledge of Government funded IT apprenticeship programmes.
  • Knowledge of the Ofsted Education Inspection Framework (EIF)
  • Knowledge of remote and e-learning delivery.
  • Experience working in a previous teaching role.

Ideal candidate will:

  • Have or willingness to work towards Teaching Qualification
  • Strong communication skills
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Ability to drive for results and a positive solution focused attitude
  • Strong presentation skills

If you are looking for a new challenge and fit the desired criteria please submit your up to date CV.

jobDescription: (12 month FT/Secondment) Are you a Data Analyst looking for a new challenge? Do you want to work in a Community Trust? Are you interested in Business, Operations and clinical services? Are you looking for a role that’s data focused but also has something different? Here at CLCH, within the operations division, the data analysts work very closely with clinical staff, clinical leads and Clinical managers as well ...
fullDescription:
(12 month FT/Secondment)

Are you a Data Analyst looking for a new challenge? Do you want to work in a Community Trust? Are you interested in Business, Operations and clinical services? Are you looking for a role that’s data focused but also has something different?

Here at CLCH, within the operations division, the data analysts work very closely with clinical staff, clinical leads and Clinical managers as well as conducting contract reporting and performance support.

The CLCH North West division is an operational team, working across a number of areas but mainly within Harrow, Central London, West London and Hammersmith & Fulham for a large number of Adult services. Within the Business Team we have an opportunity for a 12 month fixed term/secondment to support the division and the post provides opportunities to support the division with analytics to support transformation and improvement projects, clinical system changes/ projects within the division as well as monthly contractual returns.

We’re looking for someone with both the advanced excel skill sets to support the reporting processes but also someone that wants to help improve areas for Clinical services by understanding the clinical systems (S1& EMIS) to offer improvements on data flow and data quality.

This is a challenging role but is a great step into the operational services and business functions of the organisation.

Due to the pandemic, the candidate may be required to work weekends and bank holidays as required.

jobDescription: Do you want to be part of a talented team of analysts building an innovative analytics product that helps inform and empower decision makers across the NHS? Would you also like to study for an MSc Level 7 Apprenticeship while also gaining real world experience? The Health Informatics Department at University Hospitals Birmingham (UHB) has an exciting opportunity to join the team responsible for building the HED (Healthcare Evaluation ...
fullDescription:
Do you want to be part of a talented team of analysts building an innovative analytics product that helps inform and empower decision makers across the NHS? Would you also like to study for an MSc Level 7 Apprenticeship while also gaining real world experience?

The Health Informatics Department at University Hospitals Birmingham (UHB) has an exciting opportunity to join the team responsible for building the HED (Healthcare Evaluation Data) tool, an online analytics platform providing benchmarking and performance analysis to NHS organisations across England.


In your role as a Graduate Apprentice Data Analyst in the HED team, you’ll get to:

• Apply your skills in SQL, data management and analytics to tackle compelling technical problems within healthcare
• Develop an in-depth knowledge of the NHS datasets, processes and analytical techniques used to update our system and deliver value to our customers
• Collaborate with our business managers, web developers and data scientists to design and implement data-centred developments which benefit the NHS
• Empower users by responding to technical queries and creating bespoke analytical reports
• Develop new skills and learn from within a close-knit, enthusiastic and highly effective analytics team with a strong ethos of personal development

To find out more about HED see our website listed under the 'Further Links' section.

Alongside this role you will supported with appropriate study leave in order to complete a Digital and Technology Solutions Specialist MSc Degree Apprenticeship with Aston University, under the ‘Data Analyst’ specialism.

This role is conditional on being accepted onto the course, which has the following requirements:
• An undergraduate degree (at least a 2.1 or overseas equivalent), with consideration for candidates with equivalent knowledge and skills gained through other formal training and/or professional experience;
• Functional Skills level 2 in English and mathematics (equivalent to GCSE level 4 / grade C).

Shortlisted applicants will first be invited to a brief phone interview, with the best-performing candidates invited back for a longer second interview via video on MS Teams.

This role is based at Yardley Court, Edgbaston but will initially be based remotely due to the current coronavirus restrictions. The post is currently offered on a 30 month fixed term basis in line the length of the course.

jobDescription: Junior Data Analyst – Stevenage, Hertfordshire Currently due to COVID we are working from home and therefore all IT equipment will be provided for this role. Mountain Healthcare Limited believe in recruiting the highest quality staff to support their service delivery model, with the ethos that we care for each other and do the best we can! We believe we can m...
fullDescription:
Junior Data Analyst – Stevenage, Hertfordshire

Currently due to COVID we are working from home and therefore all IT equipment will be provided for this role.

Mountain Healthcare Limited believe in recruiting the highest quality staff to support their service delivery model, with the ethos that we care for each other and do the best we can! We believe we can make a real difference within the health sector and would love for you to join our team and are pleased to offer an exciting new opportunity for a passionate individual.

A large part of this role will be managing and interpreting data and producing accurate and informative reports along with putting together monthly and quarterly contract performance reports. Tasks will also include but are not limited to

  • collating data, maintaining, and documenting accurate and up-to-date electronic and hard copy records
  • ensuring the confidentiality of data, particularly when dispatching data to external agencies
  • monitor trends and providing informative analysis of Mountain Healthcare’s data to ensure high quality service delivery, as well as identifying issues and underlying patterns
  • responsible for the up-keep and inputting of accurate data for the Oasis record keeping system
  • assist in the preparation of management information as required by individual contracts
  • ensure accurate data input into several different applications; including but not limited to Sage Accounts, Rota Master, the HUB and Excel records
  • additional administration tasks required to provide a consistent and efficient service.  

 Your guidance will enable and support the development of our high-quality services. The post holder will be an important part of national MHL team, as well as working with local teams to provide support and expertise.

 We are looking for someone who is organised and has experience of using Microsoft Office 365 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Excellent levels of literacy and accuracy are essential to be successful in this role along with high level communication skills and the ability to manage workloads. We require someone who is results orientated with good communication and interpersonal skills. Experience in administration, including data collection, excel spreadsheets, providing reports and manipulating data is essential. Previous experience of working in a data analyst role would be desirable.

The Salary range for this role will be £22,000 - £25,000.

Successful applicants will ideally live within easy reach of Stevenage and hold a full driving license with access to transport. The post-holder is required to work Monday – Friday 9am-5pm. This post will be for a fixed term 12-month period.

Candidates must show a willingness to support the business where required including showing flexibility to operational demands and working hours where required. We expect a lot from you; however, we promise to support your development with training opportunities, and we listen!

For more information about the service please read the Job Description attached.

Mountain Healthcare is committed to safeguarding, and promoting the welfare of the people we serve. Therefore, all successful candidates will subject to pre-employment checks, including an Enhanced DBS Check, Police Vetting, and satisfactory employment reference (s)

jobDescription: A permanent post has become available become available within the Workforce Analytical team within Health Education & Improvement Wales. SALARY BAND: Band 6 On 1st October 2018 a new statutory body within NHS Wales came into being, working across the health and education sectors. Health Education and Improvement Wales (HEIW) oversees the strategic development of the health ...
fullDescription:
A permanent post has become available become available within the Workforce Analytical team within Health Education & Improvement Wales.

SALARY BAND: Band 6

On 1st October 2018 a new statutory body within NHS Wales came into being, working across the health and education sectors. Health Education and Improvement Wales (HEIW) oversees the strategic development of the health workforce in Wales, including workforce planning, leadership development and education commissioning. It sits alongside existing Health Boards and Trusts to be the eleventh member of the NHS Wales family.

This role will support the workforce analytics department on the implementation and utilisation of workforce pay modelling techniques and analysis to support Welsh Government and NHS Wales. The postholder will be the expert on pay analysis, implement best practice, develop innovative methodologies, design complex models and communicate findings to a wide range of stakeholders.

This role will develop new ways to model and present complex data to non-technical audiences through a variety of media. The postholder will need to utilise PowerBI, create and develop Excel models and understand system dynamic modelling.

The post will be part of the wider analytical function of HEIW and will be involved in all areas of the team ranging from workforce modelling, database design, survey analysis, demand modelling and operational research.

The ability to speak Welsh is desirable for this post; Welsh and/or English speakers are equally welcome to apply.

Closing date: 21st January 2021

For further details / informal visits contact:

For further details/informal visits contact – Ryan Cunningham, Head of Workforce Analytics

E-mail: Ryan.Cunningham@wales.nhs.uk

jobTitle: Referral to treatment RTT Data Analyst
jobDescription: Two new opportunities have arisen to join our friendly and dedicated specialist Trauma and Orthopaedics team on 6 months fixed term contracts as a Referral to Treatment (RTT) Analysts. The role is varied, interesting and crucial to ensuring an excellent  patient experience every step of the way. This demanding role offers the opportunity to develop a range of administrative tasks, communication skills, attention for detail, outstanding custo...
fullDescription:
Two new opportunities have arisen to join our friendly and dedicated specialist Trauma and Orthopaedics team on 6 months fixed term contracts as a Referral to Treatment (RTT) Analysts. The role is varied, interesting and crucial to ensuring an excellent patient experience every step of the way. This demanding role offers the opportunity to develop a range of administrative tasks, communication skills, attention for detail, outstanding customer service skills, a positive, patient-centred flexible approach and multi -tasking skills.

If you’re looking for a way to use your analytical and reporting skills in a fast-paced, rewarding environment where you can help to make a difference to patient lives, we’d love to hear from you.

ABOUT THE CARE GROUP

University Hospital Southampton NHS Foundation Trust (UHS) is a National Trauma Centre and leading the way is our Trauma and Orthopaedic care group providing the skill and care to many of our Major Trauma patients. Natural evolution and progression has seen many exciting developments including the formation of our Plastic Surgery service. This desire to be the best whilst providing the best care possible to our patients ensures our nationally renowned reputation, which is held in high regard, is maintained.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

Working with the access manager, you’ll be responsible for validating patient waiting lists in accordance with the Trust’s access policy, as well as providing performance reporting to be used at a high level. You will also:

  • Work to agreed objectives and monitor the department’s adherence to the 18 week targets, best practice tariffs, and Commissioning for Quality and Innovation (CQUINs)

  • Work within a dedicated specialty clinical area for trauma & orthopaedics to facilitate the smooth running of the patient journey

  • Ensure that coordinated and streamlined administrative processes revolve around the patient and their individual needs.

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

Alongside experience of working in a busy, target focused environment, the ideal candidate would have:

  • Familiarity with Microsoft Office

  • Excellent communication skills

  • The ability to work well under pressure and in a team

  • A desire to provide a first class service for patients and clinical teams.

  • You should be able to work flexibly in supporting the functions of the unit and have a genuine desire to contribute to providing a quality service for patients.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU

As one of the largest acute teaching Trust’s in England, we can offer learning and development opportunities to help you achieve the career you aspire to. We believe you deserve the best possible surroundings in which to do your job and we want to support you in doing your job to the best of your ability.

As a Trust, we support flexible working and will consider requests taking into account the needs of the service. You’ll have an opportunity to discuss this at interview. Our LiveWell and inspire programme offers opportunities, support and advice, including smoking cessation services, exercise and activity classes, and support for mental health.

UHS employees are able to access a huge range of NHS discounts, are entitled to a minimum of 35 days paid holiday (pro rata) on appointment, can access on-site nursery facilities (subject to availability), and we offer a generous pension scheme.

ABOUT OUR TRUST AND SOUTHAMPTON

UHS is rated ‘Good’ by the CQC and in the latest national NHS Staff Survey, we were in the top 10 acute trusts for staff engagement and for staff recommending the hospital as a place to work or receive care.

Southampton is an attractive place to live and work situated on the south coast, with an international airport and only an hour on the train from central London. The New Forest National Park and the beaches of the Jurassic coast are also right on our doorstep. The city offers living costs 20% lower than those in London, 13 schools rated outstanding by Ofsted and 13 nearby green spaces to enjoy.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Interviews will be held on Monday, 01 February 2021.

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION OR TO APPLY

If you’re interested in applying for this role, we’d encourage you to get in touch using the contact information at the bottom of this advert with any questions or if you would like to arrange an informal visit. Alternatively, if you’re ready to apply, please follow the link below to complete an application.

For further details / informal visits contact:

Melody Drake

Access Manager

Melody.Treacher@uhs.nhs.uk

The post holder will work with the existing informatics team within Oncology.  A key aspect of the role will be the ability to work with others, using effective communication skills.&nbs...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst - Cancer Alliance

The Oncology department is looking to recruit a fixed term data analyst to assist with the complex data collection, recording and interpretation required for internal and external reporting purposes.

The post holder will work with the existing informatics team within Oncology.  A key aspect of the role will be the ability to work with others, using effective communication skills.   The post holder will need to be able to work independently, and work with the teams to create different working processes. Key objectives will be set once employment commences. 

For additional information please contact Marianne Dabbs , Associate Director of Operations for Oncology via Becky Gow, Oncology Divisional PA ext: 2601

jobTitle: Strategy and Health Improvement Data Analyst
jobDescription: Fixed term contract Advert for Strategy and Health Improvement Data Analyst  An opportunity has arisen for a fixed-term maternity leave contract within the Analytics team to the role of Strategy and Health Improvement Data Analyst, Band 6. The contract duration is to the 24th August 2021. The post holder will provide analytical support within the Strategy and Health Improvement function of the Anal...
fullDescription:
Fixed term contract Advert for Strategy and Health Improvement Data Analyst

An opportunity has arisen for a fixed-term maternity leave contract within the Analytics team to the role of Strategy and Health Improvement Data Analyst, Band 6.

The contract duration is to the 24th August 2021.

The post holder will provide analytical support within the Strategy and Health Improvement function of the Analytics structure, supporting the development, monitoring, and evaluation of programmes within the Strategy and Population Health, and Health Improvement Directorates.

The post holder will also provide support to the CCG Incident management function, and while in level 4 response will be required to work flexible hours potentially on evenings and weekends.

Key Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Provide expertise in specialist service area for service development & support for strategic and health improvement planning.
  • Benchmarking - Horizon scan for appropriate information to support strategic planning.
  • Support submission of CCG statutory returns for specialist service areas.
  • Lead on the collation of a range of information to support the functions business processes.
  • Take a lead role in the review and delivery of data quality improvement processes within the function.
  • Monitor national data requirements.
  • Support pathway development projects and monitoring.

Key Competencies and Skills:

  • Experience and understanding of evaluating and measuring the performance of health services.
  • Knowledge of NHS data sources and definitions and an ability to practically translate these to support strategic and operational decision making.
  • Clear communicator with excellent writing, report writing and presentation skills; capable of constructing and delivering clear ideas and concepts concisely and accurately for diverse audiences
  • Ability to analyse and interpret information, pre-empt and evaluate issues, and recommend and appropriate course of action to address the issues
  • Advanced Excel and database management skills.

jobDescription: Job Title: Data Analyst Duration: Permanent AFC Band: 7 What is the Transformation Unit? The Transformation Unit is a fundamentally different organisation to many other NHS services. We provide tailored Internal Consultancy services, by the NHS for the NHS, in a more cost effective way than other commercial consultancies. C...
fullDescription:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Duration: Permanent

AFC Band: 7

What is the Transformation Unit?

The Transformation Unit is a fundamentally different organisation to many other NHS services. We provide tailored Internal Consultancy services, by the NHS for the NHS, in a more cost effective way than other commercial consultancies.

Created in 2012 to provide support to Greater Manchester, the Transformation Unit has expanded and now has a significant client base throughout the Northwest, as well as nationally. The Transformation Unit is governed by a standalone Board and is hosted by Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust.

The Transformation Unit works with clients to ensure that change is delivered within a strategic context and drives forward new thinking in how public services can be delivered, to be more effective, more efficient and achieve better outcomes for patients and service users.

What is the role?

We are looking to recruit a Data analyst to:

  • Provide specialist analytical insight to transformation programmes.
  • Research, design and manage components of analytical tools and models.
  • Support the strategic development of analytics to further build capacity in innovative techniques.
  • Support the development of junior analysts, specifically championing the technical components of their development.

The role will have a varied analytical workload, supporting and delivering on a number of change programmes. The analytical component of our change programmes can be split into three focus areas:

Health Modelling:

  • Build models which predict the future impact of service reconfigurations in small-scale, single service and large-scale multi-service transformation programmes.
  • Work closely with senior stakeholders to accurately define assumptions including the scope of activity, demographic changes and efficiency projections.
  • Deliver modelling specifics such as ‘Capacity and demand’, ‘patient flow’ and ‘population analytics’. This requires the application of statistical and mathematical modelling, simulation, and advanced analytic techniques.

Business Intelligence:

  • Sourcing, querying, manipulating, and presenting data for the purpose of robustly analysing activity and health outcomes across care pathways.
  • Designing and creating novel data visualisations and interactive tools which effectively convey key messages to different audiences. Across platforms such as PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, ggplot and matplotlib.

Financial Modelling:

  • Be involved in overseeing the production, review and use of complex financial models, providing the analytical input needed to within the modelling.

We would be delighted to hear from candidates who may be able to:

  • Ensure the robust verification and validation of modelling and analytics solutions developed.
  • Operate with a high level of autonomy to determine the most effective methods of responding to business questions.
  • Have significant experience of and presenting the results of analysis to a range of technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and compelling way.

Finally, a full commitment to the success of the Transformation Unit and high standards of achievement are expected in this position. In return, we can offer a package of interesting work; high quality support, training and development; and an opportunity to work as part of a growing and successful internal NHS consultancy.

If this sounds like an opportunity for you, then please get in touch for an opportunity to be a part of our dynamic, high-performing, and values-driven team. Informal contact is welcome.

We may decide to close this vacancy earlier than the published closing date if sufficient applications are received. As an employer we have an open-minded approach to encouraging flexible working and prospective candidates and would encourage those seeking this to indicate on their application form. All applications will be accepted via completion of the online NHS Jobs / Health Jobs form; recruitment agency support will not be required for this vacancy.

Please note that this is a re-advertisement. Previous applicants need not re-apply.

In line with the Trust’s Single Equality Scheme we welcome applications from everyone irrespective of ethnic origin, disability, age, gender, sexual preference, disability, nationality, religion, marital status, social back ground or trade union membership

For further details / informal visits contact:

Name: Alison Wright
Job title: Assistant Director of Financial Restructure and Modelling
Email address:

jobDescription: The Blood Stocks Management Scheme (BSMS) is an integral part of the NHS blood supply chain. Its core role is to promote best practice with respect to blood product inventory management in the UK blood services and hospitals. Central to the BSMS is the data  management system (VANESA), the repository for blood product stocks data from all participating hospitals and blood services. We are currently looking for an experienced data anal...
fullDescription:
The Blood Stocks Management Scheme (BSMS) is an integral part of the NHS blood supply chain. Its core role is to promote best practice with respect to blood product inventory management in the UK blood services and hospitals. Central to the BSMS is the data management system (VANESA), the repository for blood product stocks data from all participating hospitals and blood services.

We are currently looking for an experienced data analyst to join our team to work with data covering all aspects of the blood supply chain. The successful candidate will be expected to report a variety of data in meaningful ways, and in doing so contribute to developing strategies to improve stock management.

This is an excellent opportunity to join our team and make a real difference to the work that we do. In addition to your in-depth knowledge of database technologies in order to store, manage and analyse data, you will also have experience of using SQL, T-SQL PL/SQL languages and appropriate software such as (but not limited to) Microsoft Access, Excel, Power BI, SQL server and Business Objects. You will also have experience of statistical techniques and relevant software packages and you will have a degree or equivalent in a numerate discipline with post graduate level study or equivalent in a related statistical/numerate specialty.

This is a national vacancy, the successful candidate may be based at any of our main centres in the UK, final location to be agreed at interview.

For more information contact Sophie Staples at sophie.staples@nhsbt.nhs.uk

This advert will close at 23:59 on Sunday 17th January 2021 (Subject to confirmation)

Interviews are expected to be held on or after 29th January 2021 (Subject to confirmation)

fullDescription:
Job Title: Consultant Data Analyst (Senior)

Duration: Permanent

AFC Band: 8A

What is the Transformation unit?

The Transformation Unit is a fundamentally different organisation to many other NHS services. We provide tailored Internal Consultancy services, by the NHS for the NHS, in a more cost-effective way than other commercial consultancies.

Created in 2012 to provide support to Greater Manchester, the Transformation Unit has expanded and now has a significant client base throughout the Northwest, as well as nationally. The Transformation Unit is governed by a standalone Board and is hosted by Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust.

The Transformation Unit works with clients to ensure that change is delivered within a strategic context and drives forward new thinking in how public services can be delivered, to be more effective, more efficient and achieve better outcomes for patients and service users.

What is the role?

We are looking to recruit a Senior Data Analyst to:

  • Lead the provision of specialist analytical insight to transformation programmes;
  • Lead the design and build of analytical tools and models;
  • Support the strategic development of analytics to further build capacity in innovative techniques;
  • Pro-actively identify new business development opportunities, through their commercial acumen, drive, and enthusiasm.

The role will have a varied analytical workload, leading on a number of change programmes. The analytical component of our change programmes can be split into three focus areas:

Health Modelling

  • Lead the development of models which predict the future impact of service reconfigurations in small-scale, single service and large-scale multi-service transformation programmes.
  • Work closely with senior stakeholders to accurately define assumptions including the scope of activity, demographic changes, and efficiency projections.
  • Lead on modelling specifics such as ‘Capacity and demand’, ‘patient flow’ and ‘population analytics’. This requires the application of statistical and mathematical modelling, simulation and advanced analytic techniques.

Business Intelligence

  • Extensive experience sourcing, querying, manipulating, and presenting data for the purpose of robustly analysing activity and health outcomes across care pathways.
  • Design and create novel data visualisations and interactive tools which effectively convey key messages to different audiences. Across platforms such as PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview, ggplot and matplotlib.

Financial Modelling:

  • Be involved in overseeing the production, review and use of complex financial models, providing the analytical input needed to within the modelling.

We would be delighted to hear from candidates who may be able to:

  • Ensure the robust verification and validation of modelling and analytics solutions developed.
  • Advise on innovative opportunities to maximise the use of quantitative techniques and approaches.
  • Proactively maintain awareness of both national and local requirements in relation to planning and modelling.
  • Operate with a high level of autonomy to determine the most effective methods of responding to business questions.
  • Have significant experience of and presenting the results of analysis to a range of technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and compelling way.

Finally, a full commitment to the success of the Transformation Unit and high standards of achievement are expected in this position. If this sounds like an opportunity for you, then please get in touch for an opportunity to be a part of our dynamic, high-performing, and values-driven team. Informal contact is welcome.

jobDescription: East Sussex County Council is looking to expand its Public Health Intelligence team to help support their COVID-19 surveillance work and other public health intelligence functions. The post-holder will be responsible for maintaining and updating existing Tableau dashboards and databases used as part of the ongoing COVID-19 surveillance work, as well as developing new analytical and surveillance tools using Tableau and/or R programming...
fullDescription:
East Sussex County Council is looking to expand its Public Health Intelligence team to help support their COVID-19 surveillance work and other public health intelligence functions.

The post-holder will be responsible for maintaining and updating existing Tableau dashboards and databases used as part of the ongoing COVID-19 surveillance work, as well as developing new analytical and surveillance tools using Tableau and/or R programming. The job requires well-developed technical and data presentation skills in order to deliver COVID-19 intelligence products that are suited to a range of different formats, audiences and purposes; from operational decision-making to strategic assurance and governance reporting.

Experience analysing large data sets and being a proficient Tableau creator are key priorities. Previous experience of working within a collaborative or integrated population health intelligence role is valuable for this role.

jobDescription: Data AnalystGlobal Brands Research manages cohorts of human volunteers and conducts consumer and clinical studies in order to build insights, test new ideas, technologies and products. We provide data that supports business decisions and generate brand equity in the innovation  and new product development domain. We conduct testing with consumers in their homes as well as conducting scientific and clinical trials within our own R...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst

Global Brands Research manages cohorts of human volunteers and conducts consumer and clinical studies in order to build insights, test new ideas, technologies and products. We provide data that supports business decisions and generate brand equity in the innovation and new product development domain. We conduct testing with consumers in their homes as well as conducting scientific and clinical trials within our own Research Centre and with partners around the world. We ensure that our pipeline of innovation delivers real results, that our customers love. Working as a Data Analyst, you will inform the design of robust, statistically valid studies. You will assess study data in order to help screen and validate new technology performance and you will help identify insights and key trends, that will inform future study designs and feed an innovative product pipeline, ensuring it is fit for the future.

Key Responsibilities
• Ensure our all studies (e.g. self-perception home user trials, attitudinal questionnaires, instrumental studies and clinical trials) meet accepted statistical norms
• Statistical analysis and interpretation of complex study data to identify trends and insights
• Present clear conclusions and recommendations in an engaging way
• Develop and implement new databases, integrated data collection systems, data analytics, predictive models and other strategies that optimize the use of previous and new data libraries, to ensure statistical efficiency.

A bit about you…
• Ideally, you will have a degree or PhD in psychology / human biology or a related technical discipline and have experience of analysing data, identifying trends and drawing conclusions from intervention studies carried out on human populations
• Able to create study strategies and design data acquisition human trials using power calculations and sample size estimations
• Experience with statistical software (e.g. Alteryx, SPSS, SAS ect) and proficiency using SQL
• Expertise in working with large data sets, structured and unstructured, using data mining techniques such as anomaly detection, clustering, regression, classification, summarisation
• Expertise in both supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques such as regression, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction, neural networks & deep learning, natural language processing, ensembling.
• Experience with analytical programming languages (e.g. Python, R)
• Clear communicator of complex statistical principles with ability to influence and manage expectations with stakeholders. Can visualise data in engaging formats.

What we can offer you
We offer the chance to work in a consumer led environment with the chance to make an impact on a global scale. With a truly entrepreneurial mind-set, we recognise the importance of a diverse workforce who work collaboratively with shared values and ambition. We invest in our people by challenging you and developing you, and provide a great local reward scheme including:

• Competitive Salary
• 25 days annual leave, plus statutory bank holidays & option to buy an additional 5 days annual leave
• Annual discretionary bonus plan
• Market leading staff discount scheme including Boots Opticians - frames and contact lenses
• Competitive company pension scheme
• Flexible benefits scheme available ranging from private medical insurance, cycle to work scheme and many more
• Onsite Staff Shop, Opticians, Gym, Costa, Canteen and Dry Cleaning
• Boots Benevolent Fund - a registered charity that can offer support to eligible current and former colleagues in the UK, as well as their immediate relatives and dependants, at times of financial hardship

If you have any queries regarding this vacancy – please contact .

Diversity and inclusion is at the centre of everything we do. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. To learn more about our functions, explore our brands and find opportunities all over the globe please visit: https://.

fullDescription:
ESG Analyst - Data - Data Analyst - Fund Management

Our client, a mid-sized Asset manager are currently looking for an ESG Data Analyst to join their team on a fixed term contract for 12 months with potential to go perm longer term.

Sitting within technology, you will be responsible for working closely with the Head of ESG and ESG teams to provide a data plan, data delivery, data visualisation and reporting for ESG data sets. This will include looking at vendors such as Sustainalytics, TruCost and Morningstar and longer term, looking at how these data sets can be implemented into the business' investment systems.

Experience Required
  • Knowledgeable in ESG data, its uses and applications in an asset management environment.
  • Understanding of uses of ESG attributes as part of investment process
  • Experience of implementing and embedding ESG data into business systems and processes.
  • Some knowledge or experience of ESG 'ready' platforms such as:
    • Sustainalytics,
    • Morningstar
    • TruCost
  • Proven experience of more than one of the following:
    • Power BI
    • Data modelling and visualisation
    • SQL, T-SQL
    • Desk top ETL tools.
  • Proven track record within an IT function, including systems analysis and data analysis.
  • Experience in working with both Agile and Waterfall delivery methodologies.
  • Understanding of industry best practice and trends together with their application within a business context.

ESG Analyst - Data - Data Analyst - Fund Management

fullDescription:
Performance & Data Analyst
Rainham, East London
REF: 31911
Up to £50,000

About the role

Here at Babcock International we are looking to recruit an experienced Data Analyst to support our partnership with the Metropolitan Police in delivering an exciting new programme for new police recruits. The successful candidate will be responsible for conducting end-to-end data analysis to support operational business requirements and improvement projects across the PEQF contracts.

You will be tasked with the development, production and distribution of statistical performance information to assist operational, accounts / contracts, finance and management teams to effectively manage performance. You'll need to understand the customers' requirements for data and analysis, develop reports and present this in a compelling way direct to the customer.

We are looking for a real high performer with a strong analytical mind; this is an excellent opportunity to showcase your capabilities within a large, complex high profile programme.

What do I need to do the role?

You'll need experience conducting end-to-end analysis on large, raw and complex data sets, that includes data gathering from multiple sources, to support business decision making. This role requires you to have the ability to develop compelling visual displays of analytics for internal and external clients as well as providing recommendations on streamlining reporting / analytical processes.

Would also like you to have experience in all or some of these areas:

• High level of competency in system administration including the use of non-standard IT systems, including: Help Desk applications, LMS, Business MI tools, web and database applications, VB.
• Experienced and competent in the use of ERP Systems, SQL, SSRS, Microsoft Stack and databases to generate reports, analysis and visual representations of data.
• Advanced skills in Excel (VBA Programming) and Business Intelligence tools.
• Experience of designing, implementing and delivering data driven reports and analysis.

Lastly, you'll need excellent verbal and written communication skills and have the ability to communicate and influence both internal and external stakeholders.

What else do I need to know?

• The successful candidate must be able to achieve the appropriate security clearance level for this role.
• Please follow the link to find out more about how COVID-19 is impacting Recruitment and On-boarding for applicants:
• We are happy to talk about flexible working. Please ask about alternative patterns of work at interview.

About Babcock International

For more than a century, Babcock, the Aerospace and Defence company, has been trusted to deliver bespoke, highly-skilled engineering services. We help customers in the UK and around the world to improve the capability, reliability and availability of their most critical assets within the four market sectors of Marine, Land, Aviation, and Nuclear, underpinned by a deep understanding of technology integration, unique infrastructure and specialist training.

We're committed to providing a great employee experience in a supportive and engaging environment. The benefits you can expect to enjoy include a generous holiday entitlement, competitive money purchase pension scheme with life assurance and a share ownership scheme. You'll benefit from excellent career and learning and development opportunities to ensure that you grow and achieve your full potential.

Application Guidance

All applications should be made online. Please use a desktop PC or laptop to create your account and apply for a job. Once you've completed this you'll be able to apply to jobs from mobile devices.

If you experience difficulties please check our career website for more information. Recruitment correspondence is normally by email so please check your email account and spam folder regularly.

We are committed to building an inclusive culture and strives to attract talent who thrive in an inclusive and flexible working environment.

If you have a disability or need any reasonable adjustments during the application and selection stages please let us know and we will respond in a way that best fits your specific needs.

Armed Forces Covenant

We are proud to support the Armed Forces community by honouring the Armed Forces Covenant. We recognise the value that Serving Personnel, both Regular and Reserves, Veterans, Uniformed Cadet Instructors and Service Families contribute to our business and the United Kingdom. As part of the Covenant, Babcock offers Reservists and Uniformed Cadet Instructors up to 2 week's special paid leave to help them meet their commitments. To find out more please check our career website for more information.
