jobTitle: 2021 Data Analyst - French, German or Italian Speaker
jobDescription: Bloomberg runs on data, and data drives the market. Our Global Data team acquires and supplies this data to our clients. Teams work collaboratively to collect, analyse, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal  - the data ultimately feeding and moving the financial markets. In Global Data, you will apply your problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, implement tech...
fullDescription:
Bloomberg runs on data, and data drives the market. Our Global Data team acquires and supplies this data to our clients. Teams work collaboratively to collect, analyse, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal - the data ultimately feeding and moving the financial markets.

In Global Data, you will apply your problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, implement technical solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes, establish links with key players in the financial market by providing exceptional client support, and manage the financial data that feeds the Bloomberg Terminal.

The Role:

Data Analysts possess a unique combination of technical skills and business insight, as well as strong communication and ability to build relationships. They use these skills to collaborate with a variety of stakeholders to provide timely, accurate, and comprehensive data to our clients. They also play a key role in evolving our products and processes, which makes the role challenging and entrepreneurial.

We'll trust you to:
  • Utilise a variety of software solutions to extract and rationalise data to Bloomberg taxonomies
  • Analyse internal processes to identify opportunities for improvement, as well as devise and implement innovative solutions
  • Implement business rules for programmatic data validation by codifying market conventions and/or data relationships
  • Design and manage workflow configurations for critical functions such as acquisition, worklist management, and quality control
  • Contribute to continuous improvement by generating ideas to improve our data products and/or associated processes and building prototypes to validate and illustrate requirements
  • Lead ad hoc projects to optimize processes and/or improve the quality of the data set
  • Utilise statistics and data visualization skills to report on results of on-going operations and projects, as required
  • Build subject matter expertise and technical skills to generate premium content, including data-driven news stories
  • Partner with a wide variety of stakeholders from Engineering to Sales on product development
  • Provide in-depth customer support for users of Bloomberg products such as the Professional Service, News, Enterprise Solutions, and Bloomberg Law by resolving inquiries in a timely manner.

You'll need to have:
  • A bachelor's degree, preferably with combined studies in Information Systems and Finance, or related business and STEM fields
  • Strong passion for data, technology and finance
  • Demonstrated project or work experience using one more programming language such as Python, SQL and R
  • Fluency in English as well as French, German or Italian.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Understanding and experience of statistics and data modeling
  • Solid attention to detail and strong evidence of decision-making and problem solving skills
  • Eagerness to learn and collaborate
  • Stakeholder-focused mindset
  • Ability to remain calm under pressure in a frequently changing environment
  • Availability to commence a role prior to June 2021

We'd love to see:
  • Prior work experience in information technology, engineering, finance, data analysis or research
  • Exposure to Bloomberg products such as the Professional Service
  • Established presence in virtual development communities such as GitHub, Stack Overflow and HackerRank
  • Familiarity with Data Science and/or Machine Learning
  • Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau or QlikSense

Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are! Please note this is a two stage application process, following the submission of your candidate details you will receive an email with directions to complete an online assessment. Your application will not be complete until you have submitted the assessment.

In the meantime feel free to have a look at this: -data/

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for the recruitment process. If you would prefer to discuss this confidentially, please email . Alternatively, you can get support from our disability partner EmployAbility, please contact + or .

jobDescription: NHS England and Improvement is expanding their analytical capacity and are looking to recruit new apprentices to support the NHS. They are recruiting to two teams, one supporting the Midlands region, the other the South East. You will work with regional  colleagues on a variety of performance, clinical and quality areas to help support delivery of high quality services for patients.  A typical day  Design...
fullDescription:
NHS England and Improvement is expanding their analytical capacity and are looking to recruit new apprentices to support the NHS. They are recruiting to two teams, one supporting the Midlands region, the other the South East. You will work with regional colleagues on a variety of performance, clinical and quality areas to help support delivery of high quality services for patients.

A typical day

  • Design a regional data collection around hospital-based outbreaks - working with the COVID outbreak administrative teams, agree what data requires collecting, designing a form for collection and the backend to collate the returning information.
  • Developing a storyboard presentation for a healthcare community on a clinical pathway - that includes data from a wide range of sources and sets out the key messages
  • Summarise a set of data, to be regularly updated, to show how a region compares to others clinical areas, covering spend, efficiency, clinical outcomes and patient satisfaction.
  • Consider and respond to the impact of COVID on various services
  • Generating graphs and tables from various data sets
  • Producing business intelligence reports
  • Log, analyse and manage problems in order to identify and implement the appropriate solution, ensuring that the problem is fixed
  • Interpretation of data, statistics, evaluation, or simple modelling or forecasting as needed.
  • Discussing and assessing priorities with end users and customers
  • Maintaining, cleansing and exploration of data on various databases

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • You are inquisitive and methodical in applying analytical skills.
  • You have a high attention to detail
  • Use a mix of SQL, VBA, R & Tableau to work directly with large data sets and produce analysis at scale. As an analyst you’ll be taught to use these technical tools.
  • You will need to build good working relationships and be reliable
  • You need to be able to work to a deadline, fulfilling your role as part of a team.
  • Great communication skills
  • Great problem solving skills - you are an active listener and ask for clarification when building a solution

Perks and benefits

  • WhiteHat community
  • Pension

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects:

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

The position will be predominantly remote (full time until post COVID), however, there will be a requirement to go into the occasionally post COVID. The company is based in Kidderminster.

Responsibilities

  • Manage delivery of efficient solutions that are in line with business data from multiple sources
  • Ensuring compliance to overall design whilst meeting business requirements for accurate and timely data.
  • Assist with the ongoing BI Strategy, alongside management.
  • Mentor other team members, sharing knowledge, updating and documenting procedures and solutions.
  • Liaise with relevant business stakeholders to confirm business requirements and solution design, as well as providing training and support in using the relevant reports.

Required

  • Hands-on experience in business intelligence development and delivery.
  • Experienced using QlikView incl. SQL capabilities is a must!!
  • Experience of working on Qlik applications sourcing information from multiple data sources.
  • Skills in problem solving/trouble shooting errors with scheduled jobs or script errors.
  • Strong communication, process, logical thinking and organisation skills.

Desirable

  • Knowledge of database administration, software development lifecycles, technical infrastructure and IT service management.
  • Knowledge of other reporting tools including SSRS, Crystal Reports.
  • Knowledge of Sage 1000 ERP or similar ERP tools.
  • Relevant academic background.

If this role sounds interesting to you, please APPLY & get in touch with Thomas Warburton @ ITECCO on or email thomas . warburton @ itecco . co . uk

jobDescription: PURPOSE OF THE ROLE: The role of the Senior Informatics Data Analyst is to primarily lead the design and implementation of Bioinformatics Systems. The role holder must be able to manage effective relationships with key stakeholders (i.e. Laboratory / Operations / IT) and provide  support to the Head of Laboratories in analysing Bioinformatics Data.  In addition to the above the role holder will provide administ...
fullDescription:
PURPOSE OF THE ROLE:

The role of the Senior Informatics Data Analyst is to primarily lead the design and implementation of Bioinformatics Systems. The role holder must be able to manage effective relationships with key stakeholders (i.e. Laboratory / Operations / IT) and provide support to the Head of Laboratories in analysing Bioinformatics Data.

In addition to the above the role holder will provide administrative and operational support to end users as well as provide support to the LIMS Developer with regard to identifying data integrity issues, analysing the root cause and implementing a fix to the solution.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • To act as the Design Authority for UKBC Bioinformatics Systems
  • To ensure that Bioinformatics Systems are implemented and maintained to meet the business requirements.
  • Provision of data for and attendance at all internal and external data quality meetings.
  • To evaluate technologies and solutions and determine suitability for Bioinformatics Systems.
  • To report to the Head of Laboratories with regards to progress of projects, identification of issues and proposal of solutions.
  • Provide estimates on resourcing and timescales for delivery.
  • To provide operational support to end users.

ESSENTIAL CRITERIA:

  • Educated to degree level or higher in computing, scientific or engineering discipline or equivalent relevant experience.
  • Knowledge of laboratory information management systems platforms.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Good understanding of data architecture and design.
  • Experience working with complex data sets.
  • Thorough knowledge of laboratory processes and procedures and automated systems.
  • Ability to establish and maintain good working relationships with key stakeholders (i.e. Laboratory / Operations / IT).
  • Ability to communicate both written and orally, clearly and persuasively, explaining complicated matters simply, tailoring delivery methods/media to suit the audience’s needs and understanding.
  • Ability to clarify, plan and prioritise own work and that of the others in order to achieve objectives.
  • Must be self-motivated with a strong work ethic.
  • Must take pride in own work, setting and achieving high standards for self and working with others.
  • Ability to analyse complex problems and propose solutions while satisfying any constraints imposed by the business i.e. resource or time.
  • Ability to consider wider impact of decisions, assessing possible outcomes and their likelihood.

DESIRABLE CRITERIA:

  • Ability to use coaching & mentoring skills and skills of persuasion & negotiation to lead teams.
  • Experience in cloud services.
  • Line Management experience

The rapidly growing fifth specialism, and one that underp...
fullDescription:
Lead Data Analyst / Data Scientist

inro £45,000 - £50,000++ Plus Extensive Benefits

London W1 / Remote

This inspiring organisation, with operations spanning over 75 countries, specialises in providing Consultancy & Professional Services within the fields of Tax, Accountancy, Audit and Legal. The rapidly growing fifth specialism, and one that underpins all they do, is Data Science.

They have just created a new opening for a Lead/Experienced Data Analyst / Data Scientist to join their niche Data Analytics / DS team.

Key Skills Sought:

  • Strong proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Power BI (or similar data visualisation software)
  • Educated to BSc level - ideally a Graduate in Mathematics, Financial Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Opertional Research or similar numerically based Degree.
  • Strong data visualisation and data analysis ability (cleanse, mine, extract) - able and eager to tell the story behind the data
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Machine Learning experience - Python highly desirable
  • Strong MS Excel skills

In return, you can expect to work with professional like minded Scientists on extremely interesting subject matters and industries - i.e. Retail, Media, TV, Web, Social Media, Manufacturing and Finance, with projects and clients of all sizes and to be using many OR tools and techniques such as Predictive Modelling; Database Querying and Data Mining; Customer Segmentation; Real Time Dashboard Reporting; Data Analysis; Business Modelling, Machine Learning etc and for a company that actively encourages funded training to expand your skill set and who is dedicated to your career advancement.

This role represents 'the best of both worlds’: a small, niche, nifty Analytical team within the setting of a large solid, stable Global organisation.

Due to the high number of applications we receive, we are unfortunately unable to respond to everyone in person. Applications are processed within 24-48 hours, so if you have not heard back from us by then, please assume your application has been unsuccessful. However, this does not prevent you from applying again to our other roles….

fullDescription:
Data Analyst

Skelmersdale

Up to £25,000 pa

My client based in Skelmersdale is searching for a Data Analyst to join their team on a permanent basis.

Role profile

The Data Analyst will work closely within a Marketing function. You will analyse the data required for the marketing team to ensure the accurate targeting of the best commercial decisions, work on specific campaigns, implement strategy, understand consumer behaviour and work closely with other internal stakeholders.

Key skills & responsibilities

  • Developing and delivering actionable insights which inform and support the Sales & Marketing strategy and planning process
  • Work closely with the marketing team to define the brief and set realistic campaign goals.
  • Utilise a range of tools for extracting and interrogating data and delivering campaigns.
  • To monitor, measure and continually improve the quality of the data in the marketing database.
  • Can demonstrate experience in delivering campaign data for targeted marketing communications.
  • Will have strong data processing, manipulation and querying skills.
  • Comfortable with IT systems and large datasets.
  • Data manipulation, expert user of Excel including pivot tables and V-lookups
  • Provide regular reporting and key insights

If you are interested in this role but do not have an up to date CV please email me on or call

jobDescription: Our client, a well known freight forwarder is looking for a Data Analyst/Internal Salles Clerk to join their office in Basildon. This person would need to be comfortable  updating excel data, using formulas, and identifying errors within large spreadsheets. This role has the flexibility to be full time, with the potential to also assist within the ...
fullDescription:
Our client, a well known freight forwarder is looking for a Data Analyst/Internal Salles Clerk to join their office in Basildon. They are looking for a candidate with strong excel skills to work within the sales department. This person would need to be comfortable updating excel data, using formulas, and identifying errors within large spreadsheets. This role has the flexibility to be full time, with the potential to also assist within the department, quoting clients, making sales calls, identifying new business. It can also be a part time Data Analyst role, 2 -3 days a week with flexible working hours if this is more suitable. Either option would be suitable.

Job Spec -

  • Updating quarterly global RFQ’s
  • Maintaining and updating client tariffs
  • Providing statistical data for sales team
  • Spot pricing UK clients LCL Import and Exports using their in house system (time permitting)
  • Action credible sales leads provided by Management, or overseas offices and submit data into CRM (time permitting)
  • Support external sales - Maintain relationships, identify potential clients etc (time permitting)

Skills -

  • Must be immediate/advanced Excel experience.
  • Understanding of "If Statements", Pivot Tables, Vlookup. (Understanding Power Query, Index Match, X Look up, VB Coding would be preferrable. )
  • Shipping experience is not essential, but preferrable.
  • Understanding of writing formulas within Excel.

Holiday - 20 days (based full time. If part time this would be pro-rata)

Working hours - 8.30 - 5.00 (based on full time. If part time they can be flexible)

jobDescription: STRATEGY DATA ANALYST  £45,000 - £50,000 LONDON THE COMPANY:  The company are a tech consultancy that offer a variety of different solutions across various businesses, they partner with their clients to provide real time analytics. They are looking for someone who can contribute to helping clients understand how successful  their campaig...
fullDescription:
STRATEGY DATA ANALYST

£45,000 - £50,000

LONDON

THE COMPANY:

The company are a tech consultancy that offer a variety of different solutions across various businesses, they partner with their clients to provide real time analytics. They are looking for someone who can contribute to helping clients understand how successful their campaigns have been as well as look at customer analytics. This will be a hands-off role where you will liaise directly with clients to gather requirements and deliver insight back, working alongside the data science and data engineering teams.

THE ROLE:

As a Strategy Data Analyst, your responsibilities will include:

  • Liaising directly with clients to scope out business requirements
  • Work alongside the data engineering and data science teams to inform on data required for them to do the analysis
  • Deliver back insight to the clients off the back of the data

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Strategy Data Analyst will have the following skills and experience:

  • Excellent communication skills in order to communicate with a range of stakeholders in the business
  • Proven experience using SQL or Python
  • An understanding of marketing and market mixed modelling

jobDescription: Senior Informatics Data Analyst*Senior Informatics Data Analyst required by leading Biotech firm based in Milton Keynes*A leading Biotech firm, based in Milton Keynes, currently require a Senior Informatics Data Analyst to join a team in designing Bioinformatics systems for the company. The Senior Informatics data Analyst will ensure that Bioinformatics Systems are implemented  and configured to meet business requirem...
fullDescription:
Senior Informatics Data Analyst

*Senior Informatics Data Analyst required by leading Biotech firm based in Milton Keynes*

A leading Biotech firm, based in Milton Keynes, currently require a Senior Informatics Data Analyst to join a team in designing Bioinformatics systems for the company. The Senior Informatics data Analyst will ensure that Bioinformatics Systems are implemented and configured to meet business requirements while managing key relationships with stakeholders across the business, inclusive of IT/Ops and Lab services.

Upon joining, the Senior Informatics Data Analyst will not only design, implement and maintain Bioinformatics systems but also provide support to the Head of Laboratories in analysing Bioinformatics Data. The Senior Informatics Data Analyst will work closely with the LIMS Development team as well as Informatics Data Scientists to interpret and capture useable Bioinformatics data.

In terms of skills, we are looking for Senior Informatics Data Analysts with good experience of programming languages, such as SQL, a solid knowledge of Laboratory Information Management System platforms (LIMS) as well as a strong knowledge of working with complex data sets and laboratory processes.

This opportunity would suit a Senior Informatics Data Analyst who is looking to work with a leading Biotech who are helping in the fight against disease a very current issue. If this sounds exciting, please apply within!

Key Words: Senior Informatics Data Analyst, Biotech. Bioinformatician, Bioinformatics, Systems, Laboratory, LIMS, Laboratory Information Management Systems, Data Scientist, Data, Complex Data Sets, Milton Keynes

jobDescription: NHS England and Improvement is expanding their analytical capacity and are looking to recruit new apprentices to support the NHS. They are recruiting to two teams, one supporting the Midlands region, the other the South East. You will be working with regional  colleagues on a variety of performance, clinical and quality areas to help support the delivery of high quality services for patients.  A typical day  ...
fullDescription:
NHS England and Improvement is expanding their analytical capacity and are looking to recruit new apprentices to support the NHS. They are recruiting to two teams, one supporting the Midlands region, the other the South East. You will be working with regional colleagues on a variety of performance, clinical and quality areas to help support the delivery of high quality services for patients.

A typical day

  • Design a regional data collection around hospital-based outbreaks - working with the COVID administrative teams, agree what data requires collecting, designing a form for collection and the backend to collate the returning information.
  • Developing a storyboard presentation for a healthcare community on a clinical pathway - that includes data from a wide range of sources and sets out the key messages
  • Summarise a set of data, to be regularly updated, to show how a region compares to others clinical areas, covering spend, efficiency, clinical outcomes and patient satisfaction.
  • Consider and respond to the impact of COVID on various services
  • Generating graphs and tables from various data sets
  • Producing business intelligence reports
  • Log, analyse and manage problems in order to identify and implement the appropriate solution, ensuring that the problem is fixed
  • Interpretation of data, statistics, evaluation, or simple modelling or forecasting as needed.
  • Discussing and assessing priorities with end users and customers
  • Maintaining, cleansing and exploration of data on various databases
  • Work collaboratively with colleagues across our team and the wider organisation.

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • You are inquisitive and methodical in applying analytical skills.
  • You have a high attention to detail
  • Use a mix of SQL, VBA, R & Tableau to work directly with large data sets and produce analysis at scale. As an analyst you’ll be taught to use these technical tools.
  • You will need to build good working relationships and be reliable
  • You need to be able to work to a deadline, fulfilling your role as part of a team.
  • Great communication skills
  • Great problem solving skills - you are an active listener and ask for clarification when building a solution

Perks and benefits

  • WhiteHat community
  • Pension

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

jobDescription: Data Analyst, Staffordshire-based, salary c£45k Your new companyA highly rated, well-regarded Financial Services firm based in Staffordshire. Your new roleYou will be tasked with the Automation and Streamlining of systems and tasks performed daily by colleagues, analysing and understanding the business requirements and communicating to management your technical soluti...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst, Staffordshire-based, salary c£45k

Your new company
A highly rated, well-regarded Financial Services firm based in Staffordshire.

Your new role
You will be tasked with the Automation and Streamlining of systems and tasks performed daily by colleagues, analysing and understanding the business requirements and communicating to management your technical solutions to assist business functions. You will be a key part of the team and will regularly have to translate your technical solutions in to non-technical and understandable material for the management team to digest. Furthermore, you may often be asked to review Clients' systems and data, too, to help improves their efficiency and reporting capability. With help from your team, you will also develop detailed reports using PowerBI to report on the efficiency of the Business.

What you'll need to succeed
You will be working in a very small team under limited direction at times, therefore you must be a highly motivated and self-starting individual who is innovative and capable of translating technical specifications received from development teams, into digestible content without jargon for stakeholders to understand. Experience with relational databases, MySQL and PowerBI are essential for this role and you must also be proficient with using Excel. The ability to learn, understanding and use API functionality with online software such as Xero would be advantageous, though prior experience is not essential. As this role requires a large amount of autonomy, you must be an excellent communicator who is confident in presenting their solutions to board level.

What you'll get in return
You will be offered a generous package to match your level of experience.
.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

jobDescription: Our client is a North East based, tech focused energy supplier, incorporating artificial intelligence and state of the art technologies to offer a simple, modern and clear approach to all your energy needs.They are committed to being Green. 100% of the electricity they supply is from clean renewable sources within the UK. So come rain, wind or shine, their members can be rest assured that for every unit of energy they use, they ...
fullDescription:
Our client is a North East based, tech focused energy supplier, incorporating artificial intelligence and state of the art technologies to offer a simple, modern and clear approach to all your energy needs.

They are committed to being Green. 100% of the electricity they supply is from clean renewable sources within the UK. So come rain, wind or shine, their members can be rest assured that for every unit of energy they use, they ensure a unit is produced and injected directly into the UK GridAbout Our Client

Our client is the pioneer for making energy smart and insightful. Incorporating artificial intelligence and state of the art technologies we are able to offer a simple, modern and clear approach to all of our customers energy needs.

What we are looking for 

Working within the commercial team, you will be supporting data management, reporting, trading activity. This person will work closely with Finance team to ensure integrity of the data systems.  

About You 
  • Degree in a numerate/analytical discipline or relevant experience. 
  • Strong communication skills; ability to communicate technical arguments to non-technical audiences (essential) 
  • Expert computer knowledge including the use of spreadsheets ( complex macros, functions and formulas) 
  • Able to prioritise tasks, and to manage conflicting demands on time and resources, to deliver objectives 
The role 
  • Analysing and forecast natural gas & power demand. 
  • Produces daily reports and analyse data relating to customer and procurement volumes. 
  • Analyse and develop retail energy tariff pricing models for 3 competing markets. 
  • Ensure models are used accurately and facilitate timely delivery of data to the SMT. 
  • Proactively manage standards and pre-empt events and portfolio changes

jobDescription: Data Analyst - Global Events Business Up to £35,000+ Bonuses + Benefits SW London/Remote Flexibility My Client is a multiple award-winning producer of investment conferences for Africa and Latin America’s energy sectors. Due to expansion a new opportunity has arisen for a highly motivated Data Analyst to join the clients successful Marketing team. This  role...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst - Global Events Business

Up to £35,000+ Bonuses + Benefits

SW London/Remote Flexibility

My Client is a multiple award-winning producer of investment conferences for Africa and Latin America’s energy sectors. Due to expansion a new opportunity has arisen for a highly motivated Data Analyst to join the clients successful Marketing team. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen, and exceptional written and oral communication skills to communicate effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders. A successful candidate will be data and insight driven with a strong understanding of marketing KPIs and marketing automation technology.

Supported by the Head of Marketing and the Head of Digital Marketing, the successful candidate will be responsible for analysing data trends, building audience development strategies, owning the management of the database and quality of leads, and recommending channels, strategies and techniques to increase lead generation across target markets. Utilising their marketing technology platforms, you will be a champion of data, connecting it throughout the customer journey, and generating the insights that will shape our digital and live events and products.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Identify industry trends, innovations or technologies to increase data sets within new markets
  • Analyse data trends in order to recommend appropriate strategies, techniques & channels
  • Build audience development plans in line with target markets & data gaps
  • Own the integration between our marketing automation, registration and attendee networking platforms to ensure a seamless experience for customers moving from each stage of the customer value journey
  • Assist with running complex data queries to segment and personalise data sets
  • Oversee marketing asset creation, tags, naming conventions and lists to ensure database adheres to agreed structure
  • Own the marketing database management strategy that ensures data quality, supports audience segmentation and data hygiene
  • Use reports and dashboards to analyse campaign results, draw insights from data and share recommendations with the team
  • Create and distribute monthly reports to monitor data trends and benchmark KPIs
  • Manage website maintenance and optimization projects which enhance our ability to capture and convert organic web traffic

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Excellent knowledge of marketing automation and CRM technology (Pardot & Salesforce highly desirable)
  • Deep analytical skills with demonstrated ability to translate complex data into concrete business recommendations
  • Ability to articulate power of insight to stakeholders of all levels of experience
  • Strong experience in areas including database management, insight development, audience segmentation and data enrichment
  • Experience developing implementation roadmaps and processes around new technology
  • Experience in operational benchmarking and metrics including acquisition rates, conversion rates, database growth, lead nurture, engagement, MQL/SQL
  • Familiarity with data privacy regulations such as GDPR and PECR
  • Experience in events and/or digital publishing industry would be a bonus
  • Ideally some experience of working with and generating insights from data visualisation platforms (Salesforce Einstein and Power BI ideal)
  • Proficient in bringing together a wide mix of source data through the journey into insight (Instagram & Facebook etc.)

jobDescription: Join a dedicated and dynamic team in producing world leading charts and analysis in music and video consumption across the UK, Ireland and France. Contribute to Kantar’s continued growth in this sector and see yourself flourish as you progress your career within a highly successful company full of opportunities. Kantar Charts Unit produces consumer sales insight and analysis on a daily, next day cycle for some of Europe’s major...
fullDescription:
Join a dedicated and dynamic team in producing world leading charts and analysis in music and video consumption across the UK, Ireland and France.

Contribute to Kantar’s continued growth in this sector and see yourself flourish as you progress your career within a highly successful company full of opportunities.

Kantar Charts Unit produces consumer sales insight and analysis on a daily, next day cycle for some of Europe’s major entertainment markets.  This data is used by the industry to inform market size and share measurements and plan strategic marketing campaigns as well as by related media clients to reflect popular consumption patterns in a multitude of charts.

With almost 27 years of continued provision of this vital analysis for the UK, Kantar has also produced this data for Ireland since 2017 and embarks upon the same service arrangement for France from January 1st 2021.

In this Charts Operation Manager position, you will play a key part in developing close relationships with an exciting portfolio of clients, ranging from our direct chart partners, to key music and video company, retailer and media accounts.  You will have responsibility for driving and growing the day-to-day relationship with this client portfolio by understanding their business, key aims and challenges.

As much of this client group will be based in France, a high level of spoken and written French is required.  You will also be responsible for leading the internal team tasked with producing each week’s charts for France, ensuring they work to the highest standards of accuracy and meet the required delivery deadlines.  You will work in partnership with the Charts Managers responsible for the same outcomes for the UK and Ireland businesses and each report into the Charts Unit Managing Director. You will require a flexible and dedicated attitude to supporting what is a 24/7 operation.

Nobody knows consumers better than Kantar. Providing insight and inspiration to help clients flourish in an extraordinary world, we bring together 9 of the world’s leading research, data and insight brands. Our global team of 30,000 people in more 100 countries delivers specialist insight, business strategies and consultancy support.

KEY OUTCOMES

  • You will have responsibility for driving and growing the day-to-day relationship with your client portfolio by understanding their business, key aims and challenges. 
  • You will co-ordinate the team’s workload while motivating and helping staff to develop.
  • You will be contributing to team revenue performance by identifying further opportunities within client portfolio and producing relevant proposals and converting into revenue stream.
  • You will have the opportunity to work with our dedicated development team as client requirements and future projects are designed, tested and implemented.
  • Of course you won’t be doing this on your own. You will have all the support, and development opportunities you need. You will also have to get to know your team and colleagues across our business, collaborating to deliver this fantastic work.

CAPABILITIES  

  • Well organised with an innate ability to manage and plan effectively the workload for a small team and the able to meet deadlines and make decisions in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent client servicing skills with the ability to build relationships and act assertively and challenge when necessary.
  • Engaging communication and presentation style, capable of delivering concise coherent stories with clear client implications and recommendations.
  • Ability to communicate effectively in French.
  • Interest in data and numbers.
  • Desire to share ideas with colleagues and contribute to the overall team objectives.
  • Passion and drive to support our strong business growth by spotting opportunities with your clients and meeting sales target

JOIN US 

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. 

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients.  Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity, therefore we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.

fullDescription:
Join a dedicated and dynamic team in producing world leading charts and analysis in music and video consumption across the UK, Ireland and France.

Contribute to Kantar’s continued growth in this sector and see yourself flourish as you progress your career within a highly successful company full of opportunities.

Kantar Charts Unit produces consumer sales insight and analysis on a daily, next day cycle for some of Europe’s major entertainment markets.  This data is used by the industry to inform market size and share measurements and plan strategic marketing campaigns as well as by related media clients to reflect popular consumption patterns in a multitude of charts.

With almost 27 years of continued provision of this vital analysis for the UK, Kantar has also produced this data for Ireland since 2017 and embarks upon the same service arrangement for France from January 1st 2021.

In this Charts Operation Executive position, you will play a vital part in ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of chart production across each of the territories.

You will need effective communication skills in order to liaise across our varied client base. As part of our client group will be situated in France, a good level of spoken and written French is required.

Some of your duties, on a rota basis, will include out of hours evening and weekend work. Time in lieu will be accrued for the weekend duty shifts.

You will report directly into one of the Charts Operation Managers and work closely with the Charts Senior Operation Executives as well as co-operatively alongside other members of the Charts Operation team.

Nobody knows consumers better than Kantar. Providing insight and inspiration to help clients flourish in an extraordinary world, we bring together 9 of the world’s leading research, data and insight brands. Our global team of 30,000 people in more 100 countries delivers specialist insight, business strategies and consultancy support.

KEY OUTCOMES

  • You will have responsibility for maintaining professional day-to-day relationship with our client group and acquire an understanding of their business, key aims and challenges. 
  • You will co-ordinate with the Charts Operation Managers and Charts Senior Operation Executives to ensure that the team’s workload is effectively carried out.
  • You will be part of the weekly duty team on a rota basis.
  • Of course you won’t be doing this on your own. You will have all the support of the Charts Operations Managers, Senior Operation Executives and The Charts Unit Managing Director who will ensure you have the tools, and enhance the skills, required to perform in this role.

CAPABILITIES  

  • Able to work under your own initiative and as a member of a small team
  • Be capable of meeting deadlines and making informed decisions in a fast-paced environment.
  • Able to meet client expectations with the ability to build relationships across our diverse client group.
  • Good communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively in French.
  • Interest in data and numbers.
  • Excellent attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
  • Desire to share ideas with colleagues and contribute to the overall team success.
  • Passion, drive and a pride in your work output.

JOIN US 

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver. 

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

At Kantar, the diversity of our employees provides a richer environment for our employees and broader depth and breadth of thinking for our clients.  Kantar is committed to inclusion and diversity, therefore we welcome applications from all sections of society and do not discriminate on the basis of age, race, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, marital status or any other legally protected characteristics.

jobDescription: Are you a Data Analyst looking to work on a new and exciting project? If so, this is the role for you. One of Norfolk’s biggest employers is currently looking to recruit for a Data Analyst initially on a 9 Month FTC to help cleanse and input data into a new internal system. This system is going to transform the way in which they work, so it is a chance to  be a part of an amazing project. The role itself will be working alongside an e...
fullDescription:
Are you a Data Analyst looking to work on a new and exciting project? If so, this is the role for you.

One of Norfolk’s biggest employers is currently looking to recruit for a Data Analyst initially on a 9 Month FTC to help cleanse and input data into a new internal system. This system is going to transform the way in which they work, so it is a chance to be a part of an amazing project. The role itself will be working alongside an experienced data and development team assisting in a variety of areas on the project.

For the right candidate this is a great opportunity to have one of the areas most reputable companies on your CV. The duties of the role include recommending and implementing new process to help achieve system objectives, supporting the systems manager in the overall running of the project as well as assisting the development team in reporting system outputs.

Ideally candidates will have experience in some of it not all the following:-

- Prior experience in a data analyst role

- Intermediate level Excel skills

- Knowledge of implementing new systems (Ideal not essential)

- Great communicator and have a passion for what they do

Upon securing this role you will also secure a salary paying up to £25,000.

For more information on the role Apply Now!

jobTitle: Data Analyst/ Power BI Developer - Birmingham

Client Details The client is a tier 1 technology business focused on external consultancy for public sector organisations.  Description The role is to support external clients with their data journey, this will require extensive client interaction and discussion ...
fullDescription:
Power BI developer/ Data analyst is sought for a bespoke technology focused business in the City Centre of Birmingham.

Client Details

The client is a tier 1 technology business focused on external consultancy for public sector organisations.

Description

The role is to support external clients with their data journey, this will require extensive client interaction and discussion to understand clients data provision and create innovate solutions to fit requirements. The role is fully hands on but does have this important element of consultancy to it.

Profile

The successful candidate must have solid experience in the design and development of Power BI Data focused solutions and have excellent communication skills. They must be client facing and be comfortable understanding requirements and scenarios.

Job Offer

The client can offer multiple roles and an immediate start. They have a solid benefit package and progression plan in addition to the change to significantly build your CV by adding in vital consultancy experience.

jobDescription: My client is seeking Data Analyst who will be responsible for developing, delivering, administering and supporting the business's Qlik applications in line with business requirements in order to deliver business information. The position will be predominantly remote (full time until post COVID), however, there will be a requirement to go into the occasionally post COVID. The company is based in Kidderminster. The salary for thi...
fullDescription:
My client is seeking Data Analyst who will be responsible for developing, delivering, administering and supporting the business's Qlik applications in line with business requirements in order to deliver business information.

The position will be predominantly remote (full time until post COVID), however, there will be a requirement to go into the occasionally post COVID. The company is based in Kidderminster.

The salary for this role is between £25,000 - £28,000 with 25 days holiday + bank holidays.

Responsibilities

  • Ensuring Business Intelligence design meets industry standard
  • Manage delivery of efficient solutions that are in line with business data from multiple sources
  • Ensuring compliance to overall design whilst meeting business requirements for accurate and timely data.
  • Assist with the ongoing BI Strategy, alongside management.
  • Mentor other team members, sharing knowledge, updating and documenting procedures and solutions.
  • Liaise with relevant business stakeholders to confirm business requirements and solution design, as well as providing training and support in using the relevant reports.

Required

  • Hands-on experience in business intelligence development and delivery.
  • Experienced using QlikView incl. SQL capabilities is a must!!
  • Experience of working on Qlik applications sourcing information from multiple data sources.
  • Skills in problem solving/trouble shooting errors with scheduled jobs or script errors.
  • Strong communication, process, logical thinking and organisation skills.

Desirable

  • Knowledge of database administration, software development lifecycles, technical infrastructure and IT service management.
  • Knowledge of other reporting tools including SSRS, Crystal Reports.
  • Knowledge of Sage 1000 ERP or similar ERP tools.
  • Relevant academic background.

If this role sounds interesting to you, please APPLY & get in touch with Thomas Warburton @ ITECCO on or email thomas . warburton @ itecco . co . uk

Established in Didsbury, ITECCO has grown to become one of the UK's most successful and fastest growing IT recruitment companies in the UK.

jobDescription: The Job: Comtact is a well-established technology company focused on delivering managed Infrastructure and Security services to some of the UK’s best-known companies. We are expanding our team and looking for an experienced Infrastructure Engineer with a strong Managed  Service Provider (MSP) background. The ideal candidate for this position will have prior experience as customer facing infrastructure engineer ...
fullDescription:
The Job:

Comtact is a well-established technology company focused on delivering managed Infrastructure and Security services to some of the UK’s best-known companies. We are expanding our team and looking for an experienced Infrastructure Engineer with a strong Managed Service Provider (MSP) background.

The ideal candidate for this position will have prior experience as customer facing infrastructure engineer working with a wide range of Microsoft and Cloud services along with a good understanding of networking. On a day to day basis this role will be part of the 3rd Line Support and Project Delivery team where they will be using a wide range of cutting edge technologies and systems.

Location:

This role will be predominantly based at our head office in Milton Keynes, with occasional travel to our client’s sites as required.

Main Duties/Responsibilities:

· Understanding the needs and requirements of our customers, and moving to meet those needs proactively.

· Support customers in developing analytical reporting and dashboards using PowerBI.

· Processing the fulfilment of orders.

· Work alongside the sales team to actively contribute to the growth of existing clients and the generation of new business.

· Assisting with the commercial renewal process for contracted services

· Building deep and trusted relationships with the customer, at all levels and is seen as the go-to person in relation to all service delivery matters

· Managing technical escalations to point of resolution alongside our support teams

· Developing new technologies and opportunities and working as part of the presales team when required

Required Skills & Experience:

· Confident using SQL databases and writing SQL queries to analyse databases

· Knowledge and experience of creating analytical visualisations and dashboards

· Experience of data validation and data interpretation

· Good numerical skills and good attention to detail

· Experience in translating requirements into analytics

· Excellent communication skills

· Good understanding of Cloud Infrastructure (Microsoft Azure, AWS)

Company Benefits:

· £25,000-35,000PA depending on experience

· Excellent training and self-development opportunities

· Flexible working hours and Casual Dress

· Creative and Collaborative environment designed to help you do your best work

· Work with an experienced team that have all previously driven high growth companies

· The opportunity to join a growing company at a pivotal point of our evolution

· Company Events and social hours

· A great environment to work in where team spirit and your individual contribution will always be rewarded.

· Year-round fruit and refreshments, freely available to everyone.

· Takeaway Tuesday - every other Tuesday every month

· Regular team-building events

· Company open feedback process - tell the team how we can, and the company can improve

· Birthday day off as extra holiday

· 5- and 10-year service awards

· Bi-annual awards for great performance with prize-giving.

· Charity day - one day off for you to help a charity of your choosing

· Structured training programmes set with your manager to ensure your thirst for improvement is met and desire for career progression is recognised and facilitated.

· Opportunity to attend vendor events in UK

· No upper limits or glass ceiling with management opportunities for those who wish to pursue these

fullDescription:
Data Analyst

£45-55k plus benefits

An exciting opportunity working for an established UK brand who has received significant investment (£1.5 billion) to widen the current portfolio of products and take those global.

This is a brand new role due to growth.

Excel , SQL and any knowledge of Tableau / Qlik, Python / R would be advantageous.

Statistical Packages, ability to manage and analyse data and provide insight and sound recommendations.

Excellent analytical and technical skills, along with strong communication, time management, interpersonal, and problem solving abilities.

Preferably a degree in Mathematics (equivalent)

This is currently a work from home position and in-time the likelihood is it will be a monthly meeting onsite and offer full flexible working.

jobDescription: We’re looking for a motivated Data Analyst that loves wrangling data, delivering analytical insights and solving client challenges. You’ll be independently designing and implementing custom data analytic and reporting solutions from start to finish. And  you’ll have oodles of data to access. In fact, you’ll be an integral part of the team helping to ensure data integrity is always maintained and resolving discrepancies as they arise. As a de...
fullDescription:
We’re looking for a motivated Data Analyst that loves wrangling data, delivering analytical insights and solving client challenges. You’ll be independently designing and implementing custom data analytic and reporting solutions from start to finish. And you’ll have oodles of data to access. In fact, you’ll be an integral part of the team helping to ensure data integrity is always maintained and resolving discrepancies as they arise. As a demonstrated self-starter, you’ll own business processes end-to-end and will lead the identification and implementation of best practices.

You may be required to participate in periodic drug testing and background checks.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Support project delivery on small-to-medium sized IT projects for external and internal clients, including partnering with subject matter experts on project execution
  • Provide quick turnaround support, including managing multiple tasks and their timelines, by gathering and or clarifying data and reporting requirements from business owners who have rapidly evolving client demands
  • Support rapid development and evolution of custom reports and data visualization products
  • Maintain data integrity across a wide variety of Energy Efficiency programs
  • Lead or otherwise assist the larger team’s efforts to define and implement best practices that improve processes and outputs

Basic Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline)
  • Experience in a business or data analyst role using software tools like Sharepoint, JIRA or similar systems
  • Experience working with databases and BI tools such as Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (including its ad hoc reporting tool)
  • Ability to define, document, and lead implementation of business processes and software requirements for technology initiatives
  • Experience maintaining and rapidly producing regular reporting deliverables (e.g., monthly/quarterly summary reports)

Preferred Skills/Experience:

  • Experience with data visualization technologies, such as PowerBI, Tableau, and Alteryx, a plus
  • Exposure to the utility, energy, and/or energy efficiency sectors a plus

Professional Skills:

  • Excellent listening, written, and oral communication skills paired with an excellent sense of humor
  • Ability to exercise independent judgment while effectively prioritizing and executing tasks while under pressure
  • Team player with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment

In a friendly, supportive, collaborative team? Where there is an open and inclusive management and communications style and commitment to your  on-going development and training? fullDescription:
Support Data Analyst, SQL, Level 2, £21K to £24K + Benefits

Want to work for an award-winning, market-leading software company, offering innovative, industry-first services? In a friendly, supportive, collaborative team? Where there is an open and inclusive management and communications style and commitment to your on-going development and training?

Commutable from Tamworth, South Staffordshire, South Derbyshire, Lichfield, Sutton Coldfield, Nuneaton, Leicester, Leicestershire, West Midlands

Reporting to the Support Team Leader, the Customer Services Team consists of Customer Service Advisors (first and second line), Technical Support Data Analysts (first and second line), Technical Client Managers and Team Leaders.

The Customer Support Team is responsible for managing customer issues through to resolution, the management of regular service pack and project releases, as well as internal support management

Responsibilities

• Be the senior point of escalation - handle complex and difficult issues to achieve prompt resolution.

• Responsible for the management/co-ordination of all assigned calls and tickets throughout the support and remediation lifecycle including providing the customer with timely and accurate updates.

• Providing customers with product usage advice and guidance.

• Identifying and managing the appropriate priorities and required actions (e.g. escalation).

• Running SQL scripts on MS SQL Servers.

• Writing SQL scripts to correct data.

• Have strong SQL skills, being able to write complex queries in an appropriate way.

• Have strong SQL Infrastructure/Administration skills.

• Providing updates and detailed product release information.

• Collating product enhancement suggestions.

• Contribute to the attainment of internal and external KPI and SLA compliance

• Communicate regularly with team members through team meetings and individual review sessions

• Contribute to the maintenance of product release notes and the distribution of product manuals.

• Help maintain and manage the central knowledge base libraries for the benefit of the team and the standardization of responses to customer.

Skills & Experience

• Applicants should have good IT skills including experience of Microsoft Windows (XP, 2K3, Vista & Windows 7), Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Visio) and good working knowledge of Microsoft SQL 2K/2K5/2K8/2K12 Server.
• A proven track record in providing excellent Customer Support and Service
• Excellent client facing skills and experience to ensure relationships are kept strong.
• Experience in support system and ticket management.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills at all business levels.
• An excellent ability to prioritise
• The ability to work under pressure

Please send CV ASAP to maggs at HTS

HTS, Specialist Recruiters.

jobDescription: SENIOR DATA ANALYSTLONDON £45,000 - £60,000 + BENEFITS Are you a Senior Data Analyst looking to join a leading financial fintech company that helps customers improve finaical secruity? This is an opportunity to sit within their impressive centre of excellence for data and analytics. You will be an instrumental  figure helping the business to better understand...
fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ANALYST
LONDON
£45,000 - £60,000 + BENEFITS

Are you a Senior Data Analyst looking to join a leading financial fintech company that helps customers improve finaical secruity? This is an opportunity to sit within their impressive centre of excellence for data and analytics. You will be an instrumental figure helping the business to better understanding their customers. You will get the opportunity to perform advanced forms of predictive analytics using SQL, R and Python.

THE COMPANY

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work for a company who has an established data & analytics team, they offer exceptional training opportunities for the right candidate to GROW and DEVELOP. In addition to the unrivalled training, they offer they also have a great office culture and encourage a collaborative working environment.

THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will get the opportunity to perform advanced forms of predictive analytics to predict customer behaviour using SQL, R and Python. You will work on key analysis and projects such as:

  • Communicating insights to cross-functional teams within the business to help develop campaigns and marketing strategy
  • Provides insight on a range of areas including website performance, funnels, and online behaviour to help the business better understand the customer journey
  • Using insights to help support product and commercial initiatives
  • Developing predictive models using R/Python to predict and understand customer behaviour

YOU DON'T HAVE TO TICK EVERY BOX BUT EXPERIENCE IN THE FOLLOWING WOULD BE BENEFICIAL

  • 2:1 Degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science or related field from a leading university
  • Proficient in SQL having utilised it in a commercial role previously
  • Experience of performing advanced predictive modelling techniques using R and Python
  • Understanding how to join large datasets
  • Some form of mentoring or managerial experience is preferred
  • The ability to bring data to life using data visualization tools such as Tableau
  • Expert communication skills with the ability to communicate to tech and non-tech audiences

THE BENEFITS

  • £45,000 - £60,000
  • Fantastic training opportunities

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Richard Jones via the Apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
Our client seeks a Data Analyst who has experience around MI, data migration, data manipulation and other DBA tasks.

As the Data Analyst you will be up for a challenge, possess BA skills, analytical experience and the ability to deal with clients.

Candidates must have programming, data handling and data analysis experience. Previous experience with MS SQL, SSRS and SSAS is a distinct advantage. Experience of database design and database modelling is certainly beneficial.

This is a great opportunity to join an expanding team, where you will be given a mixture of tasks to deliver, supporting other team members as well as participating in project related delivery tasks.

jobDescription: Tableau, SQL, Data Analyst Data Analyst My client, an industry leading Professional Services company, is looking for a Data Analyst with strong Tableau and SQL skills to join their growing team. You will be responsible for supporting the Insight Manager and Data Engineers with delivery of actionable insight on the back of Data Analysis you conduct. You would be involved in the optimisation, development &...
fullDescription:
Tableau, SQL, Data Analyst

Data Analyst

My client, an industry leading Professional Services company, is looking for a Data Analyst with strong Tableau and SQL skills to join their growing team.

You will be responsible for supporting the Insight Manager and Data Engineers with delivery of actionable insight on the back of Data Analysis you conduct. You would be involved in the optimisation, development & implementation of databases, data analytics, but will not get involved in the ETL / Data Engineering side - that is for another team. Your role will be to make sense of that data and tell a story to a Data Led organisation to help them improve how they operate across multiple areas of the organisation.

This is a role that requires great communication skills to engage with the business and stakeholders, in addition to strong Technical skills.

Because of the various databases, you would need to have strong SQL skills to interrogate the database

This will be put to the test during the interview process.

Whilst they also use Alteryx, the greater flexibility or SQL will be utilised more in future, so Alteryx is only a nice to have.

The first 6 months will be spent sorting out their current Tableau dashboards in operation (there are many that overlap, and are difficult to maintain, so must be streamlined to increase impact).

The key thing with this role is that you need Dashboarding skills, but also the ability to tell a story using data, and demonstrate actioned insight you have offered previous places of work.

It is critical that you have demonstrable examples of your Tableau dashboards to share in interview - either a portfolio or screenshots, as the design and presentation of data is very important in this position.

Whilst you would obviously be working from home in the short term, longer term they would like you to still interact personally with the stakeholders in the business, and so would need to be in around 3 days a week in the office - based in Central London, so remote workers are not encouraged to apply.

If you are keen to work in a stable and secure organisation that has some great data to work with then please get in touch ASAP with your CV and portfolio (for your dashboards).

Many thanks

Boston Hale

Tableau, SQL, Data Analyst

You will be utilising SQL, Python and Looker as well as get the opportunity to work on a range of projects  and move towards predictive analytics within the role. <str...
fullDescription:
DATA ANALYST

£35,000-£40,000

LONDON

This innovative start-up are growing rapidly and offering the opportunity to get on board to work on data wrangling and cleansing as well as reporting. You will be utilising SQL, Python and Looker as well as get the opportunity to work on a range of projects and move towards predictive analytics within the role.

THE COMPANY:

The company are a fast-growing start-up who are forward-thinking and breaking new ground in the industry. They have had massive investment and have recently launched a new website. Through this period of hyper growth, they are looking to build out their data team and want data inquisitive and hard-working people to get on board.

THE ROLE:

As a Data Analyst your responsibilities will include:

  • Data wrangling and cleansing using SQL and Python
  • Creating reports using Looker
  • Analysing pricing, product, operations, and logistics data
  • Predictive analytics projects

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

An ideal candidate will have the following skills and experience:

  • Commercial experience using SQL
  • Ideally experience using Python
  • A numerical or scientific degree

THE BENEFITS:

The successful Data Analyst candidate will receive a salary, dependent on experience between £30,000 to £40,000.

On top of the salary, there are a number of fantastic extra benefits a candidate can receive such as

  • Opportunity to upskill in SQL, Python and Looker
  • Flexible working
  • The opportunity to move into predictive analytics
  • A brand new office and dynamic working environment

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Ria Verma via the Apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ANALYST
LONDON
£50,000 - £60,000 + BENEFITS

Are you a Senior Data Analyst looking to join a leading financial support company? This is an opportunity to sit within their impressive centre of excellence for data and analytics. You will be an instrumental figure helping the business to better understanding their customers. You will get the opportunity to perform advanced forms of predictive analytics using SQL, R and Python.

THE COMPANY

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work for a company who has an established data & analytics team, they offer exceptional training opportunities for the right candidate to GROW and DEVELOP. In addition to the unrivalled training, they offer they also have a great office culture and encourage a collaborative working environment.

THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will get the opportunity to perform advanced forms of predictive analytics to predict customer behaviour using SQL, R and Python. You will work on key analysis and projects such as:

  • Communicating insights to cross-functional teams within the business to help develop campaigns and marketing strategy
  • Provides insight on a range of areas including website performance, funnels, and online behaviour to help the business better understand the customer journey
  • Using insights to help support product and commercial initiatives

YOU DON'T HAVE TO TICK EVERY BOX BUT EXPERIENCE IN THE FOLLOWING WOULD BE BENEFICIAL

  • 2:1 Degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science or related field from a leading university
  • Proficient in SQL having utilised it in a commercial role previously
  • Experience of performing advanced predictive modelling techniques using R and Python
  • Understanding how to join large datasets
  • Some form of mentoring or managerial experience is preferred
  • The ability to bring data to life using data visualization tools such as Tableau
  • Expert communication skills with the ability to communicate to tech and non-tech audiences

THE BENEFITS

  • £50,000 - £60,000
  • Fantastic training opportunities

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Richard Jones via the Apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ANALYST
LONDON
£50,000 - £60,000 + BENEFITS

Are you a Data Analyst who has a passion for analyzing customer data and communicating back to internal stakeholders? This is a company who heavily INVESTS in technology to build digital assets to optimize workflow operations and devise a great deal of insight into their customers and business. Are you a big football fan? The company has partnerships with some of the biggest teams within the UK to support and develop grassroots football.

THE COMPANY

They are not like your traditional eCommerce gaming company. They go above and beyond to try and create the best possible experience for their customers and help encourage responsible betting and invest in charitable causes.

THE ROLE

Their exceptionally strong level of data is already there to use. It is your responsibility to use this data to derive customer and business insight. Namely, this will involve tracking customer journeys and interactions.

You get to use a variety of tools such as SQL, Python, Tableau or Mixpanel to ensure relevant data is collected, processed and then visualized. Communicating these findings back to internal stakeholders will be an essential element of the role.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • SQL and Python having utilized it in a commercial role previously
  • Experience of using digital web analytics and the use of tagging and tracking management systems
  • Utilizing modern big data architecture such as distributed systems, management cloud servers (AWS) and event sourcing through systems such as KAFKA.
  • Expert communicator who are experienced communicating with tech and non-tech audiences

THE BENEFITS

£50,000 - £60,000 + benefits

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Richard Jones via the Apply link on this page.

jobDescription: HR Data Analyst FTC - 6months starting in January! To support the phenomenal growth of Ideagen, we are now looking to recruit an HR Data Analyst, who will work closely with our operational design team This role is instrumental to the people plan for Ideagen and you will be working in an ever-changing environment  If you are driven to prove the science behind the data...
fullDescription:
HR Data Analyst

FTC - 6months starting in January!

To support the phenomenal growth of Ideagen, we are now looking to recruit an HR Data Analyst, who will work closely with our operational design team This role is instrumental to the people plan for Ideagen and you will be working in an ever-changing environment

If you are driven to prove the science behind the data and make a lasting impact, this is the role for you!

Key responsibilities:

  • Provide analytics to support business decisions involving organisational workforce design, cost implications, location strategy and internal movements.
  • Collate and consolidate data from a range of sources, producing both excel and PowerBI dashboards.
  • Maintain up-to-date data dashboards using data from internal and external data sources and challenge the accuracy of the data
  • Produce written and verbal presentation of data analysis in an informative manner, tailored to the needs of the audience.
  • Trouble shooting any data or dashboard issues
  • Occasionally support the wider People team with adhoc HR and workforce planning analysis.

To be considered for this position, you must have:

Essential

  • Demonstrable skills in producing high quality management information for key decision makers
  • Strong analytical skills, a passion for data and the ability to get into the detail while also seeing and understanding the bigger picture.
  • High level of accuracy, numeracy and attention to detail
  • The ability to manage and manipulate large amounts of data in order to provide concise, summarised analysis.
  • Technically minded individual who has worked previously with PowerBI
  • Working knowledge of HR/Payroll processes and systems would be preferable but not essential
  • The desire to drive deep the just a report!
What's in it for you?

While we take our work and deliverables seriously, we have a relaxed working environment and we want our people to be rewarded for their hard work. We offer benefits such as; 34 days’ holidays (inclusive of bank holidays), Enhanced Maternity and Paternity Pay, Contributory Pension Scheme, Private Medical Insurance and many more!

Who are Ideagen?

As a supplier of compliance management and productivity solutions with over 4,700 customers across the world using our products, it would be easy to label Ideagen Plc as a software company, but with offices across the UK, USA, Bulgaria, Malaysia and Dubai we are so much more than that. We are a company that continually works with its customers to maximise what can be achieved with effective management of their compliance system - a remit much wider than a set of products.

jobDescription: SENIOR DATA ANALYST UP TO £55,000 + BENEFITS OXFORD This role as a Senior Data analyst sits within a leading e-commerce company, in an exciting opportunity to lead the delivery of customer insights to drive revenue over the business's key areas. THE COMPANY The successful Senior Data Analyst will be working to tell a story with dat...
fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ANALYST

UP TO £55,000 + BENEFITS

OXFORD

This role as a Senior Data analyst sits within a leading e-commerce company, in an exciting opportunity to lead the delivery of customer insights to drive revenue over the business's key areas.

THE COMPANY

The successful Senior Data Analyst will be working to tell a story with data, supporting the commercial operations of the company through data-driven insights. This company focuses across multiple brands which are extremely customer-centric, as they have plans to expand enormously over the next 12 months.

THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be identifying opportunities and developing actionable insights derived from in-depth customer analysis. This role will be working on data from complex sources, delivering A/B multivariate tests across various programmes with the goal of increasing conversion and enhancing the customer experience.

For specifically, you can expect to be involved in the following:

  • Working with promotional and marketing teams to help identify the best go-to-market strategy
  • Analyse channels to deliver insight on acquisition, attribution modelling and ROI analysis using SQL (Python desirable)
  • Deliver insight to assist development on pricing strategies with a fine balance between profit margins, supply and demand
  • Presenting and delivering advanced dashboards using Power BI or Tableau

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

The successful Senior Data Analyst will have the following skills and experience:

  • Excellent SQL skills, with Python being desirable
  • Tableau or Power BI for visualisation including dashboarding/reporting
  • Experience performing segmentations, LTV, purchasing habits, churn rates
  • Significant experience with A/B multivariate testing on site
  • Extensive experience generating actionable insights based on customer and user data

THE BENEFITS

The successful Senior Data Analyst will receive a salary up to £55,000 with benefits.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Dylan Butcher via the Apply link on this page.

Requirements

To qualify for this Tableau Data Analyst role, you will require:

  • Experience building Tableau Dashboards and reports
  • Experience working with senior stakeholders to gather requirements and make insightful business suggestions using data
  • Experience wrangling large numbers of data sets using SQL ideally
  • Experience in sales and operations analytics is preferred
