jobDescription: Are you the next member of the family? We are looking for a Finance Data Analyst to join our group finance team based from our Berkhamsted office. The role will be responsible for delivering informative financial reports and analysis to support the needs of senior management throughout the organisation.  You will reconcile monthly NFI, control permanent NFI recognition, support the production of management accounts, productio...
fullDescription:
Are you the next member of the family?

We are looking for a Finance Data Analyst to join our group finance team based from our Berkhamsted office. The role will be responsible for delivering informative financial reports and analysis to support the needs of senior management throughout the organisation. You will reconcile monthly NFI, control permanent NFI recognition, support the production of management accounts, production of weekly KPI reporting, reporting on month end performance for various business units and aid the production of monthly board reporting packs. The successful individual will be Part Qualified (ACA / ACCA / CIMA) or AAT Qualified/Finalist, ideally have experience of working for a recruitment agency, be a great communicator, have intermediate Excel ability, can demonstrate success on working to targets, have a great can do attitude and problem solving skills. We truly believe in our values which are Strength, Pace, innovation, Respect, Integrity and Team Work and we treat all of our InterQuest Family with respect and will ensure that if you join the family, you will have a long, happy and successful career within the group.

What do you get in return for your hard work?

We believe in working hard, being nice to people and having fun along the way. It is important to us that our family feel rewarded well for their hard work and continuous dedication that they show to their roles. We do this in a number of ways:

  • Quarterly bonus
  • Structured career development plan
  • Quarterly development meetings
  • 25 days annual leave when you start increasing with time to 35 days!
  • Team Incentives
  • Annual awards party
  • Monthly Gym membership contribution
  • Dress down culture with music playing throughout all of our offices.
  • Fresh fruit, stocked cupboards and fridges to keep you going throughout the day/week.
  • Employee assistances programme
  • Season Ticket Loan
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Car lease scheme
  • Access to mortgage and personal financial advice
  • Enhanced maternity cover

InterQuest Group is an equal opportunities employer and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of age, disability, gender, religion/belief, race, marriage, civil partnership, pregnancy, maternity, sex or sexual orientation. Please make us aware if you require any reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process.

jobDescription: Data Analyst/IT Assistant We have an exciting opportunity with a well-established client based in Basingstoke for an IT Assistant/Data Analyst As IT Assistant/Data Analyst you will report directly to the IT Manager and be responsible for reporting, server administration and basic technical support for the organisation. You will be involved in project work, specifically in relation to data migration. Key Purpose of the Ro...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst/IT Assistant

We have an exciting opportunity with a well-established client based in Basingstoke for an IT Assistant/Data Analyst

As IT Assistant/Data Analyst you will report directly to the IT Manager and be responsible for reporting, server administration and basic technical support for the organisation. You will be involved in project work, specifically in relation to data migration.

Key Purpose of the Role:

The job is essentially part reporting analyst/data analyst with very simple tech support, SharePoint administration, and process and user guide documentation with some process analysis and mapping. 

The plan is to migrate as much data from the File Server into SharePoint as possible.  This will involve setting up and maintaining SharePoint sites, managing the file structure in SharePoint and managing user access permissions.

Job Description:

Tech and User Support:

  • Assist staff with queries and issues – simple computer triage e.g. how to connect to a printer, change email signature etc.
  • Assist staff with Excel spreadsheet queries e.g. formulas, pivot tables, formatting etc)
  • Maintain the IT Asset Inventory
  • Collate equipment requests and replacements
  • Provide training to staff on new software and systems

Process Mapping:

  • Writing user guides for software and internal software usage processes

Data Analysis;

  • Data extraction, preparation and report creation, primarily in Excel for now. Later in Power BI

Office 365 – SharePoint

  • Setting up and maintaining SharePoint sites
  • Managing the file structure in SharePoint
  • Managing access permissions

Key Skills:


Qualifications:

  • Maths and English qualification
  • Ideally IT related degree. 

Skills:

  • Strong Microsoft Excel
  • Experience of compiling and running reports
  • Data Analysis
  • Working knowledge of Office 365 and SharePoint

Desired:

  • Database interrogation (Table joining, aggregations)
  • Data Manipulation and preparation (Data extraction, cleansing, formatting and re-aliasing)
  • Knowledge of SQL
  • Programming fundamentals
  • Power BI (DAX & M)
  • Data Processing Automation
  • Office 365 Suite
  • SharePoint administration
  • Prior experience of reporting and analytics automation
  • Basic python

Hours - 9-5.30 office and home working currently plus good benefits and a growing organisation - this a new role due to growth.

Apply now for this fantastic IT Assistant/Data Analyst opportunity.

jobDescription: Due to COVID-19, this company will be conducting telephone and video interviews to hire for this role but are looking for someone to start immediately.They are currently looking to recruit a new Data Analyst to join their talented and enthusiastic team to be responsible for the reporting, insight and business intelligence delivered to their strategic clients. This position will require the candidate to interpret  results and trends f...
fullDescription:
Due to COVID-19, this company will be conducting telephone and video interviews to hire for this role but are looking for someone to start immediately.

They are currently looking to recruit a new Data Analyst to join their talented and enthusiastic team to be responsible for the reporting, insight and business intelligence delivered to their strategic clients. This position will require the candidate to interpret results and trends from data collected by their digital media projects, and present findings in meaningful and impactful reports, ensuring all client requests are met.

Working in conjunction with clients, this position will be integral to the account and project management provided to clients. As such the role will be client-facing so the right candidate will need to have experience and confidence in this. In dealing with clients, the approach needs to be consultative, presenting intelligence to them and integrating any relevant market and industry data into the findings. The candidate will also be required to interact with a range of platforms including Google Analytics, Salesforce, and Veeva to extract databases.

Their holistic approach means that they encourage all our team members to build strong working relationships with each other through team building events and social activities. Their employees will participate in regular appraisals in order to allow them to feel empowered to grow, develop, and achieve their career potential.

With employee of the month awards, breakfast bar, regular company events and activities, discretionary bonuses and additional long service benefits, and generous pension contribution, they feel it's important to make all employees feel motivated and recognised.

What they want from you:
- Demonstrable analytical experience
- Advanced Microsoft Office user, in particular Excel, PowerPoint and Power BI
- Analytical and creative mind-set
- Ability to prioritise and meet deadlines
- Desire to actively participate in client meetings and understand their goals and data requirements for the product campaigns
- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment where data testing is required for the delivery of their digital products
- Enthusiasm to analyse and validate the clients' data with Power BI to create bespoke solutions for each company's brand and their respective products in the form of dashboards and reports
- Ability to analyse and propose adjustments to improve the performance of their products as well as research and understand brands in the industry to demonstrate awareness

If you're looking to develop your skills and be involved with a successful and innovative organisation, then you'll enjoy working with us!

fullDescription:
My client is a SME organisation based near Edinburgh who has an exciting opportunity for a graduate to join their analytical team.

This is an ideal opportunity if you have graduated with a numerical related degree and are looking to develop your career in an analytical field.

This role offers a fantastic opportunity for a self-motivated, highly numerate graduate to make a
significant difference within a well-established and rapidly growing organisation.

Your day to day will consist of…….
· Proactively and collaboratively develop Analysis and Insight to support Operations
· report making to help deliver optimal management decisions
· Identify, quantify and prioritise opportunities to enhance operational efficiency and produce
world-class deliverables fit for a world-class operation to drive continuous improvement.
· Apply analytical and technical ability to ensure the team delivers the highest standards of
analysis and reporting to key stakeholders

What we want from you…...
· Minimum 2:1 within a numerically based degree i.e. Maths, Economics, Business, Psychology,
Physics etc.
· Proficient in use of Microsoft Office product suite, particularly Excel i.e. Pivot Tables and V-
Lookups
· Working knowledge of one or more of the following: SQL, R, Python, C++, Java
· Clear, logical analytical approach to problem-solving
· Ability to investigate data, find trends, forecast performance and provide insightful
recommendations

It’s a bonus if you have!
· Previous experience presenting information to key stakeholders
· Proficient use of VBA’s
· Previous experience using SAS
· Knowledge and practical experience with Power BI and Cloud collaboration solutions

fullDescription:
Robertson Bell Finance are supporting a dynamic Public Sector organisation to recruit an interim Data Analyst on an initial nine-month contract with a high chance of extension.

My client has adopted a work from home policy which is likely to carry on for the foreseeable future. Having said this, there may be an occasional need to travel into the offices, at a later date, which are based in the City of London.

Key responsibilities of the interim Data Analyst include:

  • Maintain complex Excel spreadsheets, making improvements and fixes where possible, to ensure a high integrity of data.
  • Manipulating large data sets and producing reports for senior stakeholders within the organisation to influence decision making and strategy.
  • Provide support to internal budget holders through a comprehensive business partnering service and act as a key point of contact for internal audit.
  • Acting as a super user of the Business Management System, providing support and training to colleagues when needed.

The successful candidate will:

  • Have recent experience working in a data-focussed, analytical role.
  • Be an advanced user of Excel, comfortable using VBA, SQL and making fixes to Macros.
  • Possess excellent communication skills and the ability to engage with a wide range of stakeholders.
  • Take a proactive approach to work and be able to meet tight deadlines under pressure.

Please do not hesitate to submit your application now if you are interested in this opportunity and hold the required experience.

fullDescription:
Data Analyst - FinTech - £60,000 + Benefits - Growth Opportunity

Our client is a very interesting and unique business that is up and coming within Financial Services. Their products allow their customers to enhance flexibility when spending, offering services which put the customer in control of their spending without enduring any additional costs or interest fees. As our client continues to grow, they are using technology to become a leading brand within Financial Services with second to none solutions, platforms, services, systems and more.

Our client has continued to grow throughout the pandemic showing great signs of stability. With this, they are now looking to hire for an experienced Data Analyst who will work across all the business functions regarding data analysis and reporting.

Requirements:

  • 3+ years with T-SQL (SQL Server).
  • 2+ years working with Data Warehouse.
  • 1+ years designing/building ELTs.
  • Strong communicator with requirement gathering.

If you believe you possess the relevant experience and would like to be considered for this Data Analyst vacancy. Then please apply to this post or directly to .

jobDescription: Data Analyst - Travel IndustryAn exciting data analyst position is available in an up-and-coming start-up in the luxury travel sector. fullDescription:
Data Analyst - Travel Industry

An exciting data analyst position is available in an up-and-coming start-up in the luxury travel sector. The role will play a part in identifying the key metrics that will drive the business forward and will create the necessary reports and dashboards to distribute this information across the company. You will be instrumental in the decisions that drive the business forward.

Data Analyst - What will I be doing?

  • Reporting to the CTO, you will help establish a sound data analytics framework upon which the business can make data-driven decisions.
  • You will play a large part in identifying the key metrics that will drive the business forward and will create the necessary reports and dashboards to distribute this information across the company.
  • You will also maximise the use of the available data, finding insights on customer behaviour that will inform their product development roadmap, as well as segmentation and data model projects.


Data Analyst - What experience do I need?

  • You will need to have substantial commercial experience as a Data Analyst
  • Proficiency in modern analytics and database tools including SQL.
  • Familiarity with business intelligence and reporting tools.
  • A sound understanding of web metrics and behavioural analytics.
  • Experience with A/B testing ideal.
  • Experience working with AI and predictive modelling an advantage
  • You must be a self-motivated individual who can use their initiative to fulfil the business' data needs.
  • Good commercial acumen with an ability to understand business objectives.
  • A good communicator, capable of presenting complex information to a variety of audiences, both verbally and in writing.
  • Sharp critical thinking skills.
  • A champion of robust and accurate data.

    Data Analyst - Additional Info

    This is a brilliant time to join this business as they move into a new phase of development. You will based remotely but should be able to come to the office (Berkshire) twice a month.

jobTitle: Data Analyst Insight Manager - Fluent French speaker
jobDescription: Data Analsyt Insight Manager/Business Insight Lead Warrington, Cheshire ****Must be able to speak fluent French to support the growth throughout Europe*** My client are one of Europe's leading providers of Integrated Supply Solutions to manufacturing industries for the provision of MRO (indirect) products. Our portfolio consists of Procurement Services, Transactional Pro...
fullDescription:
Data Analsyt Insight Manager/Business Insight Lead

Warrington, Cheshire

****Must be able to speak fluent French to support the growth throughout Europe***

My client are one of Europe's leading providers of Integrated Supply Solutions to manufacturing industries for the provision of MRO (indirect) products. Our portfolio consists of Procurement Services, Transactional Processing, Stores Management and Inventory Optimisation enabled by industry leading digital platforms. We deliver world class results to world class companies in industries such as Pharmaceuticals, Foods, Beverage, Automotive and Aerospace. We have more than tripled in size over the last six years growing our client spend from £80m to £300m.

As a result of the increible growth, we are looking for a fluent French speaking Business Insight Analyst Manager to join the business and be part of the growing journey.

Role Purpose:

The Business Insight Lead/Manager will support the business on its journey to become more data led. You will devise and implement a data driven culture and embed this into your team and the business, to ensure efficient and secure procedures for data handling and analysis with attention to data quality. You will drive the business strategic goals by utilising our data assets and analytical techniques to help drive better decision making and provide valuable business insights. You will work with key stakeholders across the business to scope out their requirements, facilitate data modelling and undertake complex analysis of data to help create actionable insight into our customers, assets, services, and strategic direction. As a Business Insight Lead/Manager, you will be delivering your findings to stakeholders of all levels within the business. This is a key strategic role and you will be telling a story, to generate thinking and guide our decision making. You will lead and develop the data team to introduce and deliver a reporting suite to measure key statistics within the business.

Key Deliverables:

  • Build robust statistical models from the data and use the best coding practices to generate reproducible work
  • Explore and visualize the data to present the 'story' of the data in a meaningful way, and to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Support strategic and operational decision making to create impact
  • Deliver a data driven culture through embedding it into your team and the business.
  • Deliver efficient and secure procedures for data handling and analysis with attention to data quality.
  • Drive the business strategic goals by utilising our data assets and analytical techniques to help drive better decision making and provide valuable business insights.
  • Deliver your findings to stakeholders of all levels within the business.
  • Deliver a reporting suite to measure key statistics within the business.

Experience required:

  • A highly motivated, positive, and enthusiastic attitude with the ability to exceed internal and external stakeholder expectations on a day to day basis.
  • Coding experience (R, Python, SQL, SAS or similar)
  • Ability to interpret and analyse data to provide concise and insightful reporting.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills including ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
  • The ability to influence decision making using factual data
  • Commercial experience in data insight
  • Strong, resilient, and driven leadership style.
  • Ability to lead and drive a high performing team.
  • Experience in working in a fast paced, data driven environment.
  • Minimum 5 years' experience of co-ordinating/managing data centric projects
  • Evidence of effectively employing data science techniques for insight and data products delivery as well as management project outcomes
  • Minimum 5 years' experience of presenting and influencing senior stakeholders
  • Good working knowledge of data management processes and systems
  • Good understanding of business data and security practices
  • Good understanding of data governance i.e. GDPR, ICO

jobDescription: The Data Analyst is accountable for providing agreed services to set group of Bureaucustomers. The service to the customers should be timely and accurate in line with thecustomer SLA or SLD or otherwise agreed service. Including, data entry, validation, reporting, analysis and the maintenance of the customer’s portfolio. The Data Analyst will be the key contact for the set group of customers in all Bureau related matters striving...
fullDescription:
The Data Analyst is accountable for providing agreed services to set group of Bureau
customers. The service to the customers should be timely and accurate in line with the
customer SLA or SLD or otherwise agreed service. Including, data entry, validation, reporting, analysis and the maintenance of the customer’s portfolio. The Data Analyst will be the key contact for the set group of customers in all Bureau related matters striving to deliver
excellence customer service whilst working within their team.

Key Duties
• Act as the day to day customer contact, providing energy reports, data, telephone support and advice to LASER customers.
• Import or manually enter energy data into the database from billing files, paper bills, and portal downloads and other Internet based data services. Synchronise the database with the online web-portal
• Highlight anomalies and unusual patterns of use within large quantities of data using M&T software.
• Use M&T software and Microsoft packages, such as Excel, to analyse and validate data for accuracy and completeness, produce graphs and reports detailing validation results, energy usage and cost.
• Raise queries with energy suppliers or customers relating to invoicing queries or meter reading issues.
• Deal with internal and external customers by telephone, email and occasional meetings.
• Develop and maintain an awareness of the energy industry and significant national and international policies relating to Climate Change. Attend training events and seminars as appropriate.

jobDescription: Company Description    International SOS is the world’s leading medical and security services company with over 10,000 employees working in 1,000 locations in 90 countries. We were founded on the principle of putting the patient first and this is still true today. Led by 5,200  medical professionals and 200 security specialists our teams work night and day to find solutions to protect our clients in whatever situatio...
fullDescription:
Company Description

International SOS is the world’s leading medical and security services company with over 10,000 employees working in 1,000 locations in 90 countries. We were founded on the principle of putting the patient first and this is still true today. Led by 5,200 medical professionals and 200 security specialists our teams work night and day to find solutions to protect our clients in whatever situation they may be facing; we assess, advise and assist from a medical, security and logistical perspective to help safeguard travellers internationally through providing invaluable local knowledge and expertise on a global scale.

International SOS Government Services administers the TRICARE Overseas Program (TOP) benefit, providing high-quality, accessible health care services for U.S. Military service members, family members, retirees, and other eligible beneficiaries overseas.

Job Description

We are currently recruiting a Data Analyst to join our growing team, based in Chiswick, West London. The Data Analyst will be a hands-on 'individual contributor’ in development, deployment, enhancement, performance fine tuning and support of the TRICARE reporting efforts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Processing of data and delivery of associated reports.
  • Support the delivery of contract deliverables to the client.
  • Conduct research and collect data which will help in continual product improvement / development that will meet internal and external client needs.
  • Ensuring high quality data is collected and integrity of the data.
  • Designs and implements any on-going data reports to ensure data consistency over time and prevent correctly formatted but unreasonable data from being loaded into decision support systems.
  • Design and implement SQL Server data, Tabular and Power BI solutions utilizing various tools and scripting.
  • Analysis of information using various statistical methods.
  • Developing of data models that can be used for data analysis and presentation.
  • Define and deliver automated and self-service reports to the business.

Qualifications

Required Experience & Skills

  • Data modeling and analysis experience.
  • Data visualization and presentation skills.
  • Strong knowledge of relational database concepts and structures.
  • Good understanding of data ingestion, data processing and data pipelining.
  • Demonstrable knowledge of MS SQL Server.
  • Strong knowledge of DAX, T-SQL, C#, D3, R or Python or any other statistical programming language for advanced analyses and predictive analytics.
  • Ability to write stored procedures and functions.
  • Statistics analysis a plus.
  • Ability of developing data models in Power BI, Power Pivot or Tabula.
  • Technical degree in computer, information or data sciences.
  • Sense of ownership, urgency and self-motivation.
  • Good business acumen, able to understand and drive the business requirements and convert to technical solution, communicating back in the most appropriate way to the relevant stakeholders.
  • Cultural sensitivity and awareness. Ability to work in a multi-lingual, multi-cultural environment where collaboration is the norm.

Additional Information

Diversity & Collaboration

Our company brings together remarkable people and enables them to be themselves.

At International SOS, we offer a great working environment, thanks to our commitment to a flexible working environment, diversity, and development.

We celebrate diversity on a global scale. We encourage every colleague to bring their personal best by creating an environment of inclusion and equal support.

Our success is the result of diverse ideas, skills, and cross-cultural understanding.

www.internationalsos.com

International SOS has been recognised as a Top Employer in the UK by the Top Employer’s Institute (TEI) for 2020

fullDescription:
DATA ANALYST

MILTON KEYNES

35,000 - 40,000

Are you ready to take the next step in your career join a reputable company? Do you have a curious mindset and the drive to want to explore and understand analytical problems? If you want to deliver insight for key business questions, then this could be the perfect role for you!

THE COMPANY

This leading E-Commerce organisation is growing their analytics function and looking to add a Data Analyst to the mix. With a great working culture, you will be able to add value to the overall successes of the business while sitting amongst a team of highly skilled analysts.

THE ROLE

As a Data Analyst you will be analysing customer centric data. To deliver this, you will be

  • Using SQL extract customer data to understand customer behaviours and incorporate your findings into actionable insight and decision making.
  • Involved cross-functionally to assist in day to day problems and projects.
  • Delivering insight across to stakeholders to ensure the best methods and processes are in place
  • Involved with report automation and trend spotting

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Commercial experience with Tableau and PowerBI
  • Confident user of SQL
  • Strong communication skills

THE BENEFITS

  • Great training opportunities to get involved with advanced analytic tools
  • Pension scheme
  • Healthcare

HOW TO APPLY

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Gina Falleroni via the apply link on this page.

jobDescription: A fastest growing IT Services company is looking for a vibrant Data Analyst to join its rapidly expanding Data team based in London. fullDescription:
A fastest growing IT Services company is looking for a vibrant Data Analyst to join its rapidly expanding Data team based in London. This is an exciting role for the company with interviews occurring ASAP so please apply now if you are interested.

Data Analyst Responsibilities:

  • Ensuring high quality of Data across the Business
  • Analysing data trends
  • Working closely with Developers to build automated reports
  • Provide valuable insights through the use of data visualisations
  • Communicate findings to senior Stakeholders in the Business

Data Analyst Requirements:

  • 3+ years commercial experience in an analytical role
  • A numerical degree from a leading university
  • Excellent communication skills both written and oral
  • Strong understanding of SQL and other databases
  • Excellent knowledge of MS Excel
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Knowledge of data visualisation tools: preferably Tableau

Data Analyst Desirables:

  • Knowledge of Salesforce
  • Some Machine Learning knowledge
  • Experience with AWS
  • Knowledge across other technical tools: QuickSight, Einstein, PowerBI

The salary bracket is £50,000 - £60,000 depending on experience.


If this role is of interest or you require more information, please get in touch with an updated CV to or call on to discuss further.

We also offer a referral fee for successful placement, so if someone you know is suitable, please also get in touch.

fullDescription:
Our client based in Theale is currently recruiting for a Category Analyst. This role would suit a candidate with strong data analysis skills, an advanced user of Microsoft Excel and excellent communicator.

The role

  • Your role will include tasks and projects to analyse, cleanse and present data via appropriate platforms and formats, review cost/price comparisons and prepare reports & data for clients and stakeholder business needs.
  • Work within and support company IT systems including inventory, procurement, consumption, quotations & contracts or other general business data systems as required.
  • Your work can support: new service site implementations, contract renewals, support service delivery and business as usual.
  • Gather, collate and analyse internal and external data producing reports and graphs, providing analysis and interpretation to support all stakeholders.
  • Data analysis, data cleanse, data comparisons, which may include product catalogue information, budget or spend reports, collating Vendor/Client/Company information.

The person:

  • Advanced Excel: confident in formulas, pivot tables, charts, Macro (VBA)
  • Attention to detail
  • Strong data entry skills
  • Excellent stakeholder, customer & vendor relationship skills
  • Excellent communication skills (oral and written) with ability to explain issues and remedies.
  • High level of organisation skills and delivering to deadlines.
  • Can quickly build up positive rapport with fellow work colleagues, customer and suppliers contacts.
  • Understanding database management systems and electronic order processing.

The role will require excellent analytical, influencing, negotiation and project management skills, in addition to your ability to influence incremental value through existing and new process development.

jobDescription: FJA are supporting a National Contractor who are recruiting for experienced Data Analyst in the Southern region.  The Data Analyst role is required so that work can be planned for Leakage Engineers relating to leakage activities, validation work and to support Supervisors with information required to do the job correctly and efficiently.  The Data Analyst will be required to analyse "night-lines" and targets for leaka...
fullDescription:
FJA are supporting a National Contractor who are recruiting for experienced Data Analyst in the Southern region.

The Data Analyst role is required so that work can be planned for Leakage Engineers relating to leakage activities, validation work and to support Supervisors with information required to do the job correctly and efficiently.

The Data Analyst will be required to analyse "night-lines" and targets for leakage detection based on high consumption and surrounding area maps for stability.

This is a temporary to permanent opportunity which offers a competitive salary and attractive benefits.

The Job:

  • To attend weekly targeting meetings with Engineers, Analysts and Supervisors to discuss proposed areas for targeting, techniques to be used and discuss any outstanding issues relating to priority jobs and areas of concerns
  • Analyse and manipulate large amounts of data
  • Deal directly with Supervisors and Technicians to organise any works
  • Use of in-house systems to track job progress and run back log reports

Requirements:

  • Previous experience within the water industry - we require somebody who has recent experience with planning and analysing DMA’s for validation
  • You will need to be flexible travelling around the Southern Region
  • You will have a Full Clean UK Driving Licence

Skills:

  • Experience with use of Microsoft Excel (advanced user skills) - manipulating data with use of formulas, generation and formatting of graphs and other data visualisations
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Organisation and time management skills - ability to manage your own workload
  • Confidence in your ability to anticipate what is needed
  • Flexibility and ability to use initiative

If you are interested in applying for a fantastic Data Analyst position, then click the 'apply now’ button.

Due to the high volume of applications we receive we are not always able to reply to all applications. If you haven’t heard back from us within 2 weeks, then please accept that your application has been unsuccessful for the role we currently have advertised.

Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of a person's gender, marital status, race, religion, colour, age, disability or sexual orientation. Every candidate will be assessed only in accordance with their merits, qualifications and abilities to perform the duties of the job.

jobDescription: My client, a well-known Maritime Insurance company with over 100 years experience providing Protection and Indemnity (P&I) cover is seeking a strong Data Analyst to join their team.Overall purpose of the roleWorking in the Data & Analytics team, ensuring that the Data Warehouse and other reporting capabilities are supported and developed in support of the Data Strategy. Providing delivery and insight on data relat...
fullDescription:
My client, a well-known Maritime Insurance company with over 100 years experience providing Protection and Indemnity (P&I) cover is seeking a strong Data Analyst to join their team.

Overall purpose of the role

Working in the Data & Analytics team, ensuring that the Data Warehouse and other reporting capabilities are supported and developed in support of the Data Strategy. Providing delivery and insight on data related projects as well as support tasks.

Primary responsibilities

· To maintain and develop the Data & Analytics (D&A) and Management Reporting capability across the business.
· Manage day to day BAU tasks and Support tickets.
· Help implement optimal reporting solutions working with internal stakeholders and external suppliers.
· Project work ensuring D&A deliverables met and implications are fully understood.
· Maintain regular communication and co-ordination between all relevant users/departments.
· Ensure the integrity and accuracy of operational business data.
· Follow best practice change and release processes.
· Ensure users are engaged and implications of D&A changes are understood.
· Ensure robust processes are in place to enable end to end data reconciliation.
· Ensure data governance procedures/processes are adhered to.
· Constantly develop technical and soft skills to drive improved performance.
· Assist in identifying poor data and provide input into potential solutions.
· Participate in technical discussions on technology choices, approaches, risks and considerations.

Technical skills + Qualifications

· Degree level qualification in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics or similar.
· At least 3 years MI/ ETL and Data Warehousing experience.
· Excellent communications skills, ability to liaise with all stakeholders in a non-technical capacity as required.
· Experience with MS Azure and Cloud DWH implementation.
· Experience with SQL Server stack.
· Ability to manage internal and external resources.
· Experience with Microsoft Power BI.
· Knowledge of APIs.
· Self-motivated with excellent problem solving and decision-making skills.

To ensure you understand how we process your data please take the time to review our Privacy Policy at https://privacy-policy

jobTitle: Senior Data Analyst - Start Up Hedge Fund
jobDescription: An exciting new Hedge Fund start up with plans to launch in January 2021 is looking for a high-performing Data Analyst to join the company. Based in offices in the City of London, the successful candidate will be required analyse and report risk relating  to trading activities whilst developing and enhancing these functions, in addition to supporting risk-related projects. The fund trades across multiple asset classes and data will form a si...
fullDescription:
An exciting new Hedge Fund start up with plans to launch in January 2021 is looking for a high-performing Data Analyst to join the company. Based in offices in the City of London, the successful candidate will be required analyse and report risk relating to trading activities whilst developing and enhancing these functions, in addition to supporting risk-related projects. The fund trades across multiple asset classes and data will form a significant contributor to its performance.

This fund has a clear plan for growth and scale and therefore the right candidate for this role will be willing to get involved with the grass roots of the company and help shape the data function. Applicants must demonstrate a strong understanding of how organisations manage, source and consume data together with a passion for increasing the accuracy and value of data.

Duties will include:

  • Develop a strong understanding of the organisation’s trading performance, the key underlying drivers, and the presentation of this to the relevant business stakeholders.
  • Coordinate with Operations, IT, Trading and Compliance teams to develop and implement data reporting strategies and framework
  • Assist in the design and to help monitor the operating effectiveness of the reporting framework, escalating reporting issues as necessary
  • Adapt the data architecture frameworks models with the growth of the trading activity
  • Creating and supporting data framework and strategies
  • Create a superior data management function to support the growth strategy and support the senior management team and business unit by furnishing them with risk reporting analyses, reviews,
  • recommendations, and advice in respect of business operations and strategies.
  • Help to run an enterprise risk reporting framework, including risk control strategy and risk appetite statements; cascade risk limits; monitor compliance and escalate any material breaches (subject to regulatory requirements).
  • Create a consistent understanding of data management throughout trading / asset management / investments activities.
  • Daily aggregation, validation, and monitoring of risk data reporting across business functions.

Requirements for the role:

  • Advanced MS Office skills - particularly Excel
  • Excellent analytical and data treatment skills
  • Experience building, automating, and maintaining data flow
  • Excellent skills in Power Bi and code languages are ESSENTIAL
  • Advanced SQL, Python, Power Bi and VBA skills. Expert mastering of R would be an advantage.
  • Proven experience of implementing on going risk reporting systems across business functions is an advantage.
  • Knowledge of the Investments Adviser Act of 1940, Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, MIFID, MIFID II, other ESMA regulations, FCA PERG would be an advantage

The successful candidate for this role will have strong sound data coding abilities and this will be tested during the interview process.

Please note that this role will be entirely office-based and that there will be no remote / homeworking option available.

This vacancy is being advertised by Montpellier Resourcing Limited. The services advertised by Montpellier Resourcing Limited are those of an Employment Agency.

jobDescription: FJR Finance is delighted to be partnering with a leading client in their field in Manchester in recruiting an experienced permanent Credit Controller/Data Analyst with a proven track record in results who also has sound data analytical and excel skills As Credit Controller your responsibilities will include:  Data Manipulation using advanced excel skills (V look ups, Pivot tables, Sum ifs)Rec...
fullDescription:
FJR Finance is delighted to be partnering with a leading client in their field in Manchester in recruiting an experienced permanent Credit Controller/Data Analyst with a proven track record in results who also has sound data analytical and excel skills

As Credit Controller your responsibilities will include:

  • Data Manipulation using advanced excel skills (V look ups, Pivot tables, Sum ifs)
  • Reconciliation and posting of daily cash receipts.
  • Reconciliation of client self-bill and Portals reports to the Company’s internal records.
  • Take ownership of queries and resolve in an efficient and timely manner.
  • Achievement of monthly collection targets and KPI’s
  • Chasing outstanding invoices from customers via telephone, emails in a proactive manner.
  • As well as credit control you will be responsible for working closely with the payroll and billing team, resolving queries and re-issuing credit notes, invoices and PO number
  • Good communication skills

The successful applicant will have the following experience and attributes:

  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience working as a credit controller
  • Outstanding data analysis and data manipulation skills.
  • Highly competent with Excel
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Very strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong customer service skills.
  • Enjoys working in a fast paced, commercial environment.
  • Excellent administration and organisational skills with the ability to prioritise workload
  • Reliable and flexible as to the needs of the business
  • Proactive and self-driven with a desire to prove themselves
  • A good level of general education - 'A’ levels or higher
  • Has a strong team work ethic and determination to complete their work to the best of their ability.

If you are interested and have the necessary experience, please contact Matt Timms at FJR Finance (Manchester) at your earliest convenience

jobDescription: Do you lead the way? Are you a grafter? Are you loyal? If yes, read below to see how you could be a part of our story! Card Factory plc is the UK’s number one retailer of greeting cards, wrap and gifts, selling a third of all cards in the UK.  Since our beginnings in 1997, our disruptive business model has fuelled organic growth to over 1,000 stores in every corner of the  UK and Republic of Ireland.  We...
fullDescription:
Do you lead the way?

Are you a grafter?

Are you loyal?

If yes, read below to see how you could be a part of our story!

Card Factory plc is the UK’s number one retailer of greeting cards, wrap and gifts, selling a third of all cards in the UK.  Since our beginnings in 1997, our disruptive business model has fuelled organic growth to over 1,000 stores in every corner of the UK and Republic of Ireland.  We have an outstanding growth story, consistently opening 50 new stores a year in recent years – with more opening all the time.

Card Factory focuses on the value and mid-market segments of the UK’s large greeting card market.  Our scale and vertically integrated business model (in-house design team, print facilities, central warehousing and retail operations) differentiate us from competitors through price and quality.  We enjoy impressive brand equity with UK shoppers.

We are also developing new routes to market for our products in the UK and overseas.  These rapid growth areas include franchise operations and wholesale agreements with major retailers in the UK and Australia.

Scope and purpose of role

We are well-placed to take advantage of continued growth opportunities in the UK and overseas.  We are looking for a Commercial Data Analyst to join us as our journey continues.  In this commercial and forward-looking role, you will work with the Finance, Commercial and Retail teams.  You will be responsible for significantly improving our business insight, analysis and reporting – to improve the performance and decision-making of our routes to market.

Main Responsibilities
  1. Performance measures to support and challenge the business

Using your excellent knowledge of Power BI, create compelling reporting to inform our colleagues, from the Board Room to the store, on how we are performing against our targets.  Ensure visibility and understanding of timely, clear and relevant KPI’s e.g. LFL sales volume and value, profit and returns for each channel through a suite of reports and dashboards  

  1. Analysis and insight to influence strategy

In partnership with the Commercial Finance team and Senior Leaders, create new insight tools to influence and monitor our strategic goals e.g. competitor analysis, basket analysis, seasonal analysis, trials monitoring 

  1. Evolve our Business Intelligence Capability

In collaboration with IT, develop the information available via our data warehouse and BI platforms, giving us capability to report on new and evolving data sets.  As the Superuser for BI, support BI project workstreams with requirements gathering, testing and user training   

  1.  Governance and controls

Work with IT and business users to ensure reports give the right information, to the right people, at the right time, using Sentinel to provide security and governance over our data. Manage user access groups to ensure colleagues have access to relevant information.  Monitor system performance to check information and reporting is accurate and work with IT and business users to resolve issues as they arise. 

The Ideal Candidate
  • Proven ability to design and create visually appealing, insightful reports and dashboards through Power BI;
  • Excellent analytical and Excel skills, and a willingness to get involved with learning new systems;
  • Logical, methodical approach, with high attention to detail;
  • Experience of other insight tools e.g. Python, SQL, SAP, MS Access would be an advantage;
  • Intellectual curiosity to understand the financial and non-financial drivers of the business and their implications for decision-makers;
  • Proven ability to build productive business relationships with a wide network of finance and non-finance colleagues;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication styles and confidence to influence a variety of senior stakeholders;
  • Desire to bring insight and challenge to the business to improve revenue and profitability;
  • Passionate about being part of a culture where continuous improvement is delivered;
  • The tenacity to work through details and deliver rigorous and meaningful insight.
About The Company

In return we offer a wide range of benefits to support your physical, mental and financial wellbeing.

  • 25 holidays + 8 bank holidays
  • Save as you Earn scheme
  • 15% Staff Discount
  • Discounted Gym Memberships
  • O2 open mobile contracts
  • Salary Finance
  • Pension 
  • Discounted Car Leasing
  • Employee Care
  • Flex My Day
  • Card Factory Foundation
  • MyCardFactory App: discounts at leading retailers

Disclaimer: If needed, this role may involve out of hours and weekend working to support the business needs and the ideal candidate will hold a full clean driving license as travel between group sites could be required at necessary times. 

This is an exciting role with genuine prospects for the right candidate. If this role describes you and your career aspirations, click apply now.

For any questions email:  (we do not accept CVs/Applications via email) 

We reserve the right to close this vacancy once sufficient suitable applications have been received. We advise applying early to avoid disappointment as applications will be reviewed regularly. 

No agencies please.

jobDescription: Job Title: Data Analyst Trainer Job ID: 02034 Location: Home based Job Type: Permanent Salary: £40-55k Industry: Education  Who do we need? We are looking for a proactive, passionate, and committed professional to join our team of Learning and Development Coaches (LDC) to be focused on delivering our We are looking for a proactive, passionate, and committed professional t...
fullDescription:
Job Title: Data Analyst Trainer

Job ID: 02034

Location: Home based

Job Type: Permanent

Salary: £40-55k

Industry: Education

Who do we need?

We are looking for a proactive, passionate, and committed professional to join our team of Learning and Development Coaches (LDC) to be focused on delivering our We are looking for a proactive, passionate, and committed professional to join our team of Learning and Development Coaches to be focused on delivering our Data Analyst apprenticeship programme.

Having a background of working with Data Analyst qualifications you will be able to transfer your knowledge and experience in order to enhance the provision we provide and make a real difference to the learners you engage with. Ideally, you will have knowledge and/or experience of BCS’s qualification portfolio. We need someone who is a natural coach, someone who is excited about their role and committed to developing and passing on their knowledge to the next generation of Data Analysts, Encouraging both colleagues and customers alike. We are growing strongly, and our Data Analyst programme is gaining the attention of some very impressive clients to date.

About our product

On this apprenticeship, our learners develop the tools and techniques to execute detailed investigations and analysis, where they’ll be able to identify the right solution to meet their employer’s needs. They gain the British Computer Society’s (BCS) Data Analyst qualification, the DELL EMC and BCS Diploma Data Analysis Concepts.

Arch are also delighted to partner with Tableau on this programme, giving learners exclusive access to Tableau licenses and bespoke content.

You will support the apprentice in creating a portfolio that shows their ability to carry out these tasks at the correct level for the qualification:

  • Collect data to/from a range of systems.
  • Follow data and security standards, policies and procedures to activities.
  • Carry out database queries across tables to extract data for analysis
  • Use a range of techniques to identify and predict trends and patterns in data.
  • Help with data quality checking and cleansing.
  • Summarise, present and make recommendations from the results of data analysis.

DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS

  • Dell EMC Data Science Associate Certificate
  • BCS Diploma in Data Analysis Concepts
  • Data Analyst Level 4 Apprenticeship

What you’ll get up to here as a Learning and Development Coach

LDC’s in our team are the lynchpin that guide, encourage, and - where necessary - challenge learners to ensure that they turbo-charge their careers through their apprenticeship. This means building a strong relationship with the person’s line manager too.

Our learners could be 16 or they could be 50, we have a variety of exciting clients which means our learners could be from within the UK Government, a well-recognised company and brand, or a small start-up, so you will have to be able to adapt your style and approach to what is needed.

Here’s a taste of what you’ll be doing to deliver our market leading Data Analysis programme

  • The opportunity to guide and support learners throughout their journey whilst they undertake a world class apprenticeship product designed by BCS
  • Supporting each learner to progress effectively through their programme, benefiting in the short term, laying foundations for long term career success and ensuring they successfully get through their 'End Point Assessment’
  • Interacting regularly with all your learners, whether face-to-face or virtually, utilising the technology tools we provide
  • Using those interactions to ensure progress and evidence of learning is captured
  • Using a coaching approach to help learners reflect and embed what they are learning in a way that makes a difference to them, their line manager, their teams and their employer
  • Being an active member of the team, collaborating to improve what we do and learn from each other
  • Continuously coaching to the level expected of a Grade 1 Ofsted Provider- it’s one of our proudest achievements and you will part of the top 4% of all training providers.

What do you get for working with us?

Perhaps unusually for this sort of role, you will flourish with us if you are a willing and able team player; we do lots together, learning together, figuring out how we can improve and supporting each other.

We are one of the UK’s leading providers of apprenticeships: growing fast but sensibly and driven by an ambition to do apprenticeships the right way for the benefit of learners, employers, and the UK economy.

If this sounds like a good match, then please get in touch ASAP as interviews are taking place immediately.

The ideal candidate needs to be:   A Microsoft Excel Power User  Proficient in creating dashboards, pivots, graphs etc…   A positive person  Capable of working in a fast paced environment  Able to manage time effecti...
fullDescription:
Our large distribution Client in the Wigan area (WN5) is looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join their growing team.

The ideal candidate needs to be:

  • A Microsoft Excel Power User

  • Proficient in creating dashboards, pivots, graphs etc…

  • A positive person

  • Capable of working in a fast paced environment

  • Able to manage time effectively

  • Driven to "want more"

Standard hours 8AM-4PM Monday to Friday.

This position will lead to permanent employment for the right candidate.

Free parking and onsite canteen available.

To Apply: Please submit your CV online. For more information please call our office, open between 9am-5pm Monday-Friday.

"Taskmaster Resources LTD is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy"

**No Recruitment Fees or related costs are paid by workers for applying or accepting this role with Taskmaster**

jobDescription: A leading consultancy are looking to hire a Senior Data Analyst The role of Data Analyst is focused on the process of inspecting, cleansing, modelling and visualising data with the objective of discovering and leveraging useful information, that can be used  to support evidence based decision making. Our data analyst is expected to make recommendations about the methods and ways in which our engagement teams use and analyse data to improve q...
fullDescription: A leading consultancy are looking to hire a Senior Data Analyst The role of Data Analyst is focused on the process of inspecting, cleansing, modelling and visualising data with the objective of discovering and leveraging useful information, that can be used to support evidence based decision making. Our data analyst is expected to make recommendations about the methods and ways in which our engagement teams use and analyse data to improve quality and the usefulness of data systems. Key activities include, but not be limited to: * Defining data requirements to support business issues / queries * Defining the process for how data will be captured and managed * Collecting and interpreting data * Analysing results * Identifying patterns and trends in datasets * Visualising the data to convey complex data sets into meaningful management information * Defining new data collection and analysis processes Role description: The Data Analyst will be required to support engagement teams with a number of tasks, which are supported through various data collection, interrogation and visualisation activities. Typical examples of these are included below: * Volume analysis: forecasting capability and capacity against expected volume and throughput. * Through life cost modelling: analyses design, manufacture and in-service support costs to understand the key drivers and trade-offs between options and product lifecycle phases. * Effective inventory management: uses data analysis and forecasting techniques to ensure clients only hold stock required which reduces product loss. Essential Experience: * Experience working as a data analyst in a corporate function * Knowledge and/or certifications demonstrating capability working with data models and reporting packages (ideally Power BI) * Ability to analyse large datasets * Ability to design and develop comprehensive reports * Strong verbal and written communication skills * An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving * Demonstrable experience of success within a range of complex project environments and sectors * Proven ability to integrate well into a team and build relationships with senior stakeholders

jobDescription: Forward Role are working with a an exciting FinTech brand in Manchester. This is a well-established business who have grown from strength to strength over the years, and have no plans to stop. They are developing new products and services, and growing the  team faster than ever. The company have won awards for their fantastic customer service, along with various other recognitions for innovation, tech, digital transformation and fundr...
fullDescription:
Forward Role are working with a an exciting FinTech brand in Manchester. This is a well-established business who have grown from strength to strength over the years, and have no plans to stop. They are developing new products and services, and growing the team faster than ever.

The company have won awards for their fantastic customer service, along with various other recognitions for innovation, tech, digital transformation and fundraising/charity support!

As a Senior Data Analyst you will be working with huge quantities of data and turning it in to insight to help make business decisions and drive business growth. You will play a central role in developing customer analysis and insight, understanding performance, predicting customer behaviours and identifying areas for business improvement.

Role & responsibilities:

  • Working with key stakeholders across the business, you will research and understand business problems and collaboratively problem solve
  • Search data warehouse and data lakes for useful data (structure and unstructured), and continuing to look for ways to improve data collected
  • Build, deliver and maintain insightful reports and visualisations with Power BI
  • Build and implement complex data and statistical models
  • Analyses of commercial data, marketing performance, customer management and product performance

Skills & experience:

  • Previous experience in an insight driven, technical analytics or data science role
  • Strong experience using SQL, DAX, R / Python, Excel
  • Ability to create dashboards and data visualisations using tools such as Power BI
  • Previous experience of building and implementing complex models
  • Statistical analytics skills and experience working with data science techniques (or strong interest in this area)
  • Strong commercial awareness, ability to solve business problems and drive strategy with data

If you are interested in this opportunity, please get in touch with Sophie on or email

As an industry leading, nationwide Marketing, Digital, Analytics, IT and Design recruitment agency, we are continually receiving new assignments to work on, so keep a close eye on our website, Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter pages for a full list of current permanent and interim opportunities as well as marketplace news and fun stuff.
Forward Role is operating as an employment agency.

jobTitle: Data Analyst - up to £60,000  Bonus  Benefits - Wimbledon
jobDescription: Data Analyst - up to £60,000 + Bonus + Benefits - Wimbledon A market leading client of mine are currently embarking on a large transformation programme to be a part of a new team that will be responsible for the delivery of a new data warehouse, tools, procedures and policies. The Data Analyst will be joining the  business at a very exciting time as they are investing, growing and transforming their busin...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst - up to £60,000 + Bonus + Benefits - Wimbledon

A market leading client of mine are currently embarking on a large transformation programme to be a part of a new team that will be responsible for the delivery of a new data warehouse, tools, procedures and policies. The Data Analyst will be joining the business at a very exciting time as they are investing, growing and transforming their business to provide a better service to new and existing customers.

The Data Analyst will be responsible for taking lead on upscaling the data maturity within the organisation as part of a 3-year transformation programme. To do this, the Data Analyst will be responsible for defining data related policies, standards, metrics and processes whilst also identifying areas to improve the quality of data.

The role of Data Analyst will require the successful person to have past experience implementing data governance, data frameworks and putting all the necessary rules and procedures in place.

Data Analyst - Key Skills:

  • Set up data governance
  • Set up all data frameworks, policies & procedures
  • SQL
  • Strong stakeholder management expertise
  • Strong reporting skills

Data Analyst - Desirable Skills:

  • Informatica
  • Tableau
  • Snowflake
  • Any relevant certifications
  • Experience working within a regulated environment

If you are interested in this great opportunity of Data Analyst that will allow you to enhance your skillset whilst working within a growing company, then please apply with a copy of your updated CV in the initial instance and you will be contacted to discuss the role.

Data quality / Data quality analyst / BI Quality Analyst / Business Intelligence Quality Analyst / Improving data quality / Data quality improvement

jobDescription: Ark Schools is looking for an enthusiastic team player to join our strategy team as a Data Analyst Apprentice. They pride themselves on having a sector-leading approach to information systems and data analysis. You will use sector leading tools to interpret  and present data. You will be working alongside the wider Data and Insight Team, with a focus on analysing data that is captured from a wide range of online technology platforms.  <...
fullDescription:
Ark Schools is looking for an enthusiastic team player to join our strategy team as a Data Analyst Apprentice. They pride themselves on having a sector-leading approach to information systems and data analysis. You will use sector leading tools to interpret and present data. You will be working alongside the wider Data and Insight Team, with a focus on analysing data that is captured from a wide range of online technology platforms.

A typical day

  • Participate in meetings with the wider analyst team to understand key priorities
  • Work with other teams to understand their priorities, and learn how data is used across Ark
  • Support with the export of key data sources from a range of online learning platforms
  • Develop experience with web analytics tools - full training will be provided so don't worry if they are new to you
  • Work with the Head of Insight and Director of Strategy to create and monitor dashboards to support organisation key performance indicators
  • Maintain data tables which are shared with key stakeholders on a regular basis
  • Over time, write summaries and short reports which provide insight into the data

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • You enjoy learning new concepts quickly and are keen to learn and share knowledge with others
  • You love problem solving and enjoy finding simple and practical solutions to complex problems, with a curious mindset always asking 'why’
  • You enjoy being part of a team, collaborating with others and have good interpersonal skills
  • You are enthusiastic, self-motivated and keen to achieve

Perks and benefits

  • Discounts
  • Pension
  • WhiteHat community

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects:

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

jobDescription: Mpeople Recruitment are currently recruiting for a Metering Data Analyst (Energy Sector) on behalf of our client that are a household name and reputable business. The Metering Data Analyst would be responsible for assisting the management of our client’s metering portfolio, as well as internal and external stakeholders. The role includes industry process and project management of metering services or query management....
fullDescription:
Mpeople Recruitment are currently recruiting for a Metering Data Analyst (Energy Sector) on behalf of our client that are a household name and reputable business.

The Metering Data Analyst would be responsible for assisting the management of our client’s metering portfolio, as well as internal and external stakeholders. The role includes industry process and project management of metering services or query management. Successful and efficient completion of these processes will set our client apart from other suppliers and will support our vision of market leading services.

Duties and responsibilities will include:

  • The Management of all Meter/Automatic Meter Readers installation, exchanges, removal or asset update data flows ensuring all data sources are aligned and maintained.
  • Sourcing Meter Asset Managers details and updating all relevant systems and ensuring all appointments and de-appointments are correct.
  • Resolving any issues that may arise from incorrect meter and/or AMR data in a timely and effective manner.
  • To manage and remedy industry meter reading rejections.
  • Liaise with customers, metering partners, reading agencies, other gas suppliers and internal stakeholders to resolve meter and data queries in a timely and effective manner.
  • To support the business with its AMR and SMART meter roll out strategy.
  • To request, remove or re-synchronize AMR devices with metering agencies within agreed SLA’s.
  • Ensure meter readings are obtained and submitted to the industry within a specified timeframe.
  • Process industry file flows that update relevant meter points so that the supply point data held is accurate both at industry and supplier level to allow accurate billing.
  • Maintain and develop high levels of customer services to support the business’ operational and sales functions.
  • Providing regular and adhoc reports.

Experience of working within an Operations function within an Energy Supplier would be very adventagous. It is also desirable that you have experience working as an 3rd party agent such as a MOP (Meter Operator) or MAM (Meter Asset Manager).

What is our client are looking for in a candidate?

  • Good verbal and written communication skills.
  • An analytical mind-set.
  • Strong organisational skills.
  • Able to prioritise within a busy challenging environment.
  • Excellent attention to detail and a high level of accuracy in all areas of work.
  • The initiative to propose solutions and to take action independently and the confidence to effectively challenge the status quo.
  • Flexible approach to work, with a willingness to be involved in other areas of the business as required.
  • Ability to successfully persuade, influence and negotiate with internal and external parties.
  • Proven working knowledge of MS Office including MS Excel.

What's in it for you?

  • Excellent annual bonus structure
  • Free car parking and smart casual dress
  • Regular company paid team building outings
  • Flexitime and generous holidays
  • Discounts and childcare vouchers
  • Weekdays only - no weekend work

Please note that Mpeople cannot respond to all applicants due to the high volumes of CV's received on a daily basis. Should you not receive a response within 5 working days please accept this as not been successful. Mpeople wishes you all the best in your job search.

jobDescription: Data Analyst - Global Events Business Up to £35,000+ Bonuses + Benefits SW London/Remote Flexibility  My Client… is a multiple award-winning producer of investment conferences for Africa and Latin America’s energy sectors, due to expansion a new opportunity has arisen for a highly motivated Data Analyst to join the clients successful Marketing team. This  ro...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst - Global Events Business

Up to £35,000+ Bonuses + Benefits

SW London/Remote Flexibility

My Client… is a multiple award-winning producer of investment conferences for Africa and Latin America’s energy sectors, due to expansion a new opportunity has arisen for a highly motivated Data Analyst to join the clients successful Marketing team. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen, and exceptional written and oral communication skills to communicate effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders. A successful candidate will be data and insight driven with a strong understanding of marketing KPIs and marketing automation technology.

The Candidate:

Supported by the Head of Marketing and the Head of Digital Marketing, the successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing data trends, building audience development strategies, owning the management of the database and quality of leads, and recommending channels, strategies and techniques to increase lead generation across target markets. Utilising their marketing technology platforms, you will be a champion of data, connecting it throughout the customer journey, and generating the insights that will shape our digital and live events and products.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Identify industry trends, innovations or technologies to increase data sets within new markets
  • Analyse data trends in order to recommend appropriate strategies, techniques & channels
  • Build audience development plans in line with target markets & data gaps
  • Own the integration between our marketing automation, registration and attendee networking platforms to ensure a seamless experience for customers moving from each stage of the customer value journey
  • Assist with running complex data queries to segment and personalise data sets
  • Oversee marketing asset creation, tags, naming conventions and lists to ensure database adheres to agreed structure
  • Own the marketing database management strategy that ensures data quality, supports audience segmentation and data hygiene
  • Use reports and dashboards to analyse campaign results, draw insights from data and share recommendations with the team
  • Create and distribute monthly reports to monitor data trends and benchmark KPIs
  • Manage website maintenance and optimization projects which enhance our ability to capture and convert organic web traffic

Knowledge & Skills:

  • Excellent knowledge of marketing automation and CRM technology (Pardot & Salesforce highly desirable)
  • Deep analytical skills with demonstrated ability to translate complex data into concrete business recommendations
  • Ability to articulate power of insight to stakeholders of all levels of experience
  • Strong experience in areas including database management, insight development, audience segmentation and data enrichment
  • Experience developing implementation roadmaps and processes around new technology
  • Experience in operational benchmarking and metrics including acquisition rates, conversion rates, database growth, lead nurture, engagement, MQL/SQL
  • Familiarity with data privacy regulations such as GDPR and PECR
  • Experience in events and/or digital publishing industry would be a bonus
  • Ideally some experience of working with and generating insights from data visualisation platforms (Salesforce Einstein and Power BI ideal)
  • Proficient in bringing together a wide mix of source data through the journey into insight (Instagram & Facebook etc.)

jobDescription: Opportunity to join EdTech business as first Marketing Data Analyst - Home Based (London)Your new companyBased in London, you'll be joining a Global EdTech business formed in 2019 who are on a mission to improve digital learning for mid-level professionals/executives across a range of subjects and qualification types. They have partnered with some of the most  respected universities in the world to de...
fullDescription:
Opportunity to join EdTech business as first Marketing Data Analyst - Home Based (London)

Your new company

Based in London, you'll be joining a Global EdTech business formed in 2019 who are on a mission to improve digital learning for mid-level professionals/executives across a range of subjects and qualification types. They have partnered with some of the most respected universities in the world to deliver a fully immersive learning experience, using AI technology, to take use through the Digital Age. There has been a lot of positive attention from around the globe for this firm, and they are continuing to grow their base across the coming years. They are therefore growing their Marketing team to deal with increased demand and brand awareness, and a Marketing Data Analyst is fundamental to this long-term project.

Your new role

As the lead Data Manager in the Marketing team, you will be optimising Digital campaigns, managing the Marketing funnel to ensure ROI is increased and overall contribute to the growth of the business. You will also aid with Paid Campaigns, run demand forecasting, assist with SEO best practice, create reports & dashboards and conduct high-level insight analysis into customer & marketing data. You will also be the lead for attribution modelling and ensuring all marketing decisions are data-led.

What you'll need to succeed

  • 5-6 years experience in Marketing data analytics
  • Background in scale-up businesses
  • Google Analytics, Google Data Studio & Tableau/Power BI
  • Excellent Analytical and Microsoft Excel skills.
  • Working knowledge of Paid Channels & SEO best practice
  • Track record in providing performance marketing analysis
  • Experience with common statistical methods and applications (A/B testing, probability, regression)



What you'll get in return

A very generous salary & benefits including Health Insurance, Pension Contribution & a Discretionary bonus. Also the opportunity to play a key part in a well-respected business with high ambitions in the growth sector of Digital learning.

What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

fullDescription:
MERJE is looking for an experienced Data professional to join a major FS company and support the continuous improvement of data management and data governance. You will be joining an established Financial Services business with presence across Europe. As such, this role may require travel both within the UK and abroad. On offer is a salary of £50,000 - £60,000 dependent on experience.

This company is unable to provide sponsorship

Key Responsibilities of the Senior Data Analyst:

  • Identify, investigate and resolve data issues to optimise the data governance programme and mitigate data related risks
  • Identify valuable data sources, automate processes, pre-process structured & unstructured data, etc.
  • Analyse large amounts of information, identifying trends and patterns and using these to inform improvement efforts
  • Provide in depth development knowledge and act as the subject matter expert for related issues
  • Maintain supplier & stakeholder relationships

Required knowledge and experience for the Senior Data Analyst role:

  • Extensive Python programming skills and experience
  • Strong SQL SSMS/SSIS analysis & development skills
  • Significant experience and expertise in data & information quality management and data modelling
  • Experience in a regulated environment - understanding the legal framework that regulates the processing of personal data
  • A logical and analytical approach
  • Master Data Management experience would be beneficial, in addition to all of the above

Please note, should feedback not be received within 28 days due to the large volume of applications, unfortunately your application has been unsuccessful. However, we may be in touch with similar relevant opportunities.
