fullDescription:
Brook Street are recruiting for an experienced Data Analyst for one of our well established public sector organisations. You will be working on the Statistics Team, reporting to the Head of Business Intelligence. If successful, duties include:

-Gather data/intelligence for customers, disseminate and present to customers in reports and dashboards.
-Develop metrics and quality assure and test accuracy of these metrics.
-Deliver effective reports at pace across the organisation functions to achieve business plan targets and agreed outcomes.
-Support end-users in using and understanding reports/dashboards.
-Capture feedback on products to drive continuous improvement.

The successful candidate will demonstrate:
-Adaptable and comfortable learning new systems, software and packages.
-Experience using Excel
-Strong communication skills
-Experience setting up and maintaining reports and dashboards using business intelligence/reporting tools. PowerBI is desirable.
-Use of database systems (e.g. SQL Oracle, Microsoft Access).

This is a full time, temporary position, initially until April 2021 with potential to be extended. Due to covid-19 the role will be working from home. It is 37 hours a week Monday to Friday. If you feel you have the skills and knowledge to fulfil this role, please submit your application.

jobTitle: Insight Data Analyst - Alteryx, SQL & Tableau
jobDescription: Position: Insight Data Analyst – (Alteryx, SQL & Tableau) Location: Central London, (zone 1) Start date: ASAP – 4 weeks Role type: permanent Salary: £60-65k + 15% pension + 10% bonus + medical Ins + 25 days holiday  The Client Our client is an award winning & thrivin...
fullDescription:
Position: Insight Data Analyst – (Alteryx, SQL & Tableau)

Location: Central London, (zone 1)

Start date: ASAP – 4 weeks

Role type: permanent

Salary: £60-65k + 15% pension + 10% bonus + medical Ins + 25 days holiday 

The Client

Our client is an award winning & thriving International Plc based in Central London who require a dynamic Insight Data Analyst to work on a group wide greenfield project. Based in their prestigious HQ this exciting opportunity requires candidates from a Plc/Blue-chip background.

The Role as Insight Data Analyst

The client is seeking an Insight Data Analyst (Alteryx, SQL &  Tableau) to process and analyse large volumes of data, from various outputs using your findings to support the business in understanding information. The work will includes market analysis, data mining and analysis, product portfolio analysis, report development and customer requirement gathering for group wide projects as follows;

Duties;

  1. Applies data analysis and data modelling techniques, based upon a detailed understanding of the corporate information requirements, to establish, modify or maintain data structures and their associated components (e.g. Entity descriptions, Relationship descriptions, Attribute definitions).
  2. Participates in the development and maintenance of corporate data standards.
  3. Support stakeholders and business users to define data & analytic requirements.
  4. Work with the business to identify additional internal and external data sources to bring into the data environment and mesh with existing data
  5. Story board, create and publish standard reports, data visualisations, analysis and presentations.
  6. Develop and implemented a forecasting algorithm using Alteryx and R.
  7. Develop and implemented various operational Tableau dashboards.
  8. Develop logical models for new company structure

The Insight Data Analyst Candidate

The client is seeking somebody who is dynamic, engaging, has strong stakeholder management skills, is self-motivated and can work independently. In addition to excellent communication skills (written/verbal), you must have gravitas and be able to demonstrate the following:

Alteryx – 2+ years

SQL 

Tableau visualisations

Data Modelling

Good stakeholder management

Ability to actualise requirements

Deep understanding of Data Governance

Good team fit / Enthusiasm

Data Evangelist - needs to show a love of all things data

Hadoop / HDFS (if possible)

Hive (if possible)

Data Science techniques (if possible)

You will be required to process and analyse large volumes of data, from various outputs using your findings to support the business in understanding information. The work will include market analysis, data mining and analysis, product portfolio analysis, report development and customer requirement gathering

SENIOR REVENUE DATA ANALYST

BRIGHTON

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Senior Revenue Data Analyst will have the following skills and experience:

  • Strong SQL coding
  • Tableau
  • Python/R would be beneficial
  • Excellent communication skills

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Ria Verma via the Apply link on this page.

fullDescription:
General Overview

This role reports to the Head of Data & Insights and the primary focus is to support the data and insights team with the continued development of spend analysis data structure, business intelligence tools and visualisations for my client's HQ and it's wider network.

The role offers the successful candidate the opportunity to work with stakeholders across several departments developing my client's team’s analysis and reporting capabilities via their spend analysis tool. You will help to bring insights directly to the business, enabling my client to make informed data driven decisions on a daily basis.

Main Responsibilities

  • Interpret stakeholder reporting requirements, analyse data and provide outgoing reports
  • Identify and interpret trends/patterns in large datasets
  • Filter and "clean" data by reviewing validation reports and performance indicators to locate and correct code & data process problems
  • Produce and track key performance indicators
  • Contribute to the ongoing development of the spend analysis tool’s reporting capabilities
  • Assist with system administration and issue resolution
  • Document end to end reporting process
  • Support the potential build of a savings & compliance reporting process, both off-line and via the tool
  • Be available to train and support end users on the use of my client's spend analysis tool
  • Assist with communications process with different business levels internally
  • Be prepared to work on other complimentary spend reporting projects
  • Assist in opportunity analysis through further data investigation

Required experience:

  • Strong analytical, quantitative and problem-solving skills
  • Query building (MS SQL)
  • Competence in MS Office - including Project, Access and Excel
  • Experience of ETL such as Alteryx tools a plus
  • Willingness to learn new tools and systems
  • Technology experience or interest
  • Good attention to detail
  • Good organisational skills
  • Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills
  • Comfortable in dealing with all levels of company executives
  • Team player but also able to determine workload and be self-motivated
  • General enthusiasm for growth and a willingness to be hands on

The candidate must be able to demonstrate up-to-date technical competence, knowledge & understanding to be consi...
fullDescription:
We are looking for a Data Analyst lead to join our growing team, based in the North-West of England.

The candidate will be required to successfully deliver digital apprenticeships programmes for Data Analyst Level 4 apprentices and IS Business Analyst Level 4 apprentices.

The candidate must be able to demonstrate up-to-date technical competence, knowledge & understanding to be considered for the role, of:

  • Identifying, collecting and migrating data to/from a range of internal and external systems
  • Manipulating and linking different data sets as required
  • Interpreting and applying the organisations data and information security standards, policies and procedures to data management activities
  • Performing database queries across multiple tables to extract data for analysis
  • Performing routine statistical analyses and ad-hoc queries
  • Using a range of analytical techniques such as data mining, time-series forecasting and modelling techniques to identify and predict trends and patterns in data
  • Assisting with production of performance dashboards and the production of a range of ad-hoc and standard data analysis reports
  • Summarising and presenting the results of data analysis to a range of stakeholders making recommendations

Key Responsibilities:

  • Deliver high quality training, coaching and assessment to apprentices
  • Act as course lead for curriculum development; supporting existing tutors with delivery and CPD
  • Inspire, motivate and raise apprentices’ aspirations through their passion for the sector.
  • Conduct regular face-to-face sessions and progress reviews with apprentices and their employers, complemented by eLearning.
  • Adhere to all NowSkills policies & procedures, Education & Skills Funding Agency, Ofsted and Awarding Body requirements.
  • Share best practice amongst the Operations Team and attend all internal meetings/training as required.
  • Maintaining continued professional development (CPD) and keeping up to date with all industry developments and practices.

Experience and Qualification requirements:

  • Industry experience in roles similar to Data Analyst (and IS Business Analyst)
  • Related qualifications pertaining to the roles of Data Analyst (and IS Business Analyst)
  • A keen interest in education and a passion to train, assess and coach apprentices in their digital careers
  • Recognised teaching/training qualification is essential
  • Must have excellent administrative skills with the ability to prioritise workloads, work methodically, accurately and effectively under pressure while maintaining a positive attitude
  • Resilience and adaptability when dealing with challenge or change, or support apprentice to overcome barriers to career and personal development
  • Full driving licence and own transport is essential
  • Excellent English, Maths and digital skills

NowSkills is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

Become part of our team and apply today!

jobDescription: Data Analyst - Water sector - Home based Location:- Home Based (Trips to clients sites will be across the South East region but only once or twice a month) Salary:- £25,000 - £30,000 basic (Depends on experience within the Water sector and Stakeholder communication) Role: As a Data Analyst you will be focusing on various areas wit...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst - Water sector - Home based

Location:- Home Based (Trips to clients sites will be across the South East region but only once or twice a month)

Salary:- £25,000 - £30,000 basic

(Depends on experience within the Water sector and Stakeholder communication)

Role:

As a Data Analyst you will be focusing on various areas with in a Utility provider, analysing aspects from pressure management, leakage, quality, volume, assets etc… You need to have worked on water projects previously linked in to a Water provider due to the nature of the work and being home based. There isn't a team to get you up to speed with how a water operator works and the project team with has an induction, project briefing then required to hit the ground running.

Phase one is 6 months of undertaking a data review regarding the advanced pressure management of the water network. Identifying the peak times, areas of weakness to the assets and recommendations for future projects. By collating the data and spotting issues with the network it will allow the team to develop various solutions be it physical improvements or digital solutions. The second phase is then delivering the schemes identified, analysing the data from the projects to support the cost-saving and energy reduction which is the aim of the schemes. Supporting the project and programme manager leading the projects, your role is remote working, supporting the clients team, collating data, working with the Engineering teams, and understanding the DMA data and what the correct outcomes should be for each scheme.

Required Experience:

  • HNC/HND Ideally in Digital / Data / Engineering related subject
  • Experience of Water operating companies, just understanding how they work will be a good grounding for you.
  • Driving license as you may be required to come into the office for client meetings if required in the future. This would be more ad-hoc and may not even be required due to the current COVID policies.

To Apply:

You must be living and authorised to work in the UK to apply for this position.

Please contact Phil/Ramsey at The Resolute Group on or call

All applications are kept confidential and will not be used without your permission.

jobDescription: An exciting opportunity has arisen for an Energy Data Analyst based in Bristol. The team you would be working in is primarily responsible for preparation of the prices that we charge electricity suppliers for the use of the electricity network.  We are looking for a data analyst who can engage with a wide stakeholder base within the energy sector. We’ll value your existing skills and experiences while providing the opportunit...
fullDescription:
An exciting opportunity has arisen for an Energy Data Analyst based in Bristol.

The team you would be working in is primarily responsible for preparation of the prices that we charge electricity suppliers for the use of the electricity network.

We are looking for a data analyst who can engage with a wide stakeholder base within the energy sector. We’ll value your existing skills and experiences while providing the opportunity for individuals with an agile approach and mind set, to further develop their career.

This is a role within the regulated electricity networks and requires a strong attention to detail in order to ensure compliance with both internal and external bodies.

The candidate will be able to use their love of data to look deeper to find the stories behind the figures.

Interviews are scheduled for w/c 1 February 2021.

Main Responsibilities

To assist in the provision of specialised services in revenue modelling, connections, sales and demand forecasting, DUoS pricing and the determination and publication of line losses. Also to provide technical support to the distribution business to enable well informed strategic, operational and regulatory decisions to be made whilst supporting the production of gross margin figures in the monthly financial results.

  • Assist in the maintenance and development of costing and price setting; model and develop distribution network losses; and assist in the production of line loss adjustment factors.
  • Interpret and apply capital costs for tariff modelling.
  • Acquisition of metering data from various internal systems, either using standard reports or SQL (mostly Oracle).
  • Collect, process and analyse electricity sales and import data for use in the company financial results, regulatory returns, financial forecasts, and business analysis.
  • Assist in the development and implementation of new models to maintain and improve these processes in a changing environment.
  • Support the production of the gross margin figures in the monthly financial results, including use of the ledger system in such items as accrual monitoring and invoice processing.
  • Apply weather normalisation to sales and demand.
  • Any other data analysis/acquisition appropriate to the role.

On a day to day basis you will:

  • use your agile mind to tackle a range of complex issues whilst looking for simple, implementable but robust and well evidenced solutions
  • engage with other team members and other stakeholders to identify clearly the extent and scope of the issue
  • use your excellent excel skills including vlookups, sumifs, pivot tables etc. to analyse large data sets to identify causes, trends
  • ideally you will use SQL skills to extract data to assist with getting to the answers that we need
  • you’ll need an excellent memory for retention of complex processes because some tasks will only be repeated annually

The Ideal Candidate

  • Appropriate academic qualification in a numerical or financial discipline (degree level).
  • Ability to deal with complex problems.
  • Good numeracy and literacy.
  • Excellent computing skills in a range of PC based applications and client/server databases including SQL coding (Oracle / ANSI) and advanced Microsoft office skills
  • Have an understanding of the DNO Licence price control formulae and the associated licence conditions.
  • Knowledge of the electricity industry, particularly distribution would be advantageous.
  • Willingness to learn and find solutions to problems independantly
  • Confidence to deal with internal stakeholders
  • Able to deal with enquiries from members of the public or other businesses.

This vacancy will close at noon on 20 January 2021.

Please note that the starting salary may be £41,008 until such time as all of the elements of the role can be met.

fullDescription:
Data Analyst
Location: Southampton or UK Wide home based
12 month FTC
Package: Salary £23,000 + 3% flex fund + 25 days annual leave + 5% pension + Life assurance

The Company

Set up by the Department of Health in a unique partnership with technology experts Sopra Steria, NHS Shared Business Services (NHS SBS) provide essential corporate back office services to other NHS organisations. 

NHS SBS is the market leader in corporate services with around 40% of the NHS using one or more of our products.? With unrivalled knowledge and experience, we provide high-quality, value-for-money finance, procurement and employment services to the NHS, helping them overcome any challenges they face in the back office.?  

We work closely with NHS organisations all over the country to replace outdated, time-consuming and error-prone paper processes, with affordable digital systems and more efficient ways of working, and in addition to our core services, we are designing and developing innovative digital technologies and piloting brand new ways of working, which further improve efficiency and quality, and better support the NHS workforce to deliver world-class patient care.  We are passionate about using our expertise to save the NHS time and money and are more relevant today than ever before.

The Day Job

In this role you will manage a complex and demanding workload and be able to work to deadlines ensuring that all payroll processing activities within the ESR (Electronic Staff Record) and Staff Bank systems are completed within the weekly and monthly payroll deadlines and contractual service level agreements. You will work closely with the customer to ensure files transmitted are timely and accurate and you will be managing highly sensitive and confidential personal information.
There will be a requirement to work from 1am to 9.30am for 2 days a week in-line with India Teams. The other 3 days will be UK hours.

Main Duties and Key Responsibilities

  • Dealing with queries as they arise from customer and Employment Services teams by telephone, email and attending meetings as required.
  • Uploading and sending files to third parties as per schedule.
  • Escalating performance issues of systems to the Payroll Manager.
  • To participate and implement processes in order to continuously improve effectiveness and efficiencies.
  • Ensure that ESR and Staff Bank processes are actioned in line with schedules and KPIs.
  • Produce performance reports as required,
  • Ensure audit trails are maintained and spot checked for compliance
    User testing of new systems and upgrades

Essential Skills

  • Excellent communication and organisational skills with high level of attention to detail.
  • Confident use and understanding of computers.
  • Excellent all-round I.T skills including working knowledge of Microsoft Office.
  • Strong Microsoft Excel experience, able to produce meaningful management reports using dashboards, pivot tables, v-lookups, formulas, macros.
  • Strong communication skills both verbal and written
  • Strong customer service experience, stakeholder engagement and able to build relationship quickly.
  • Strong ability to work in accordance to Data Protection regulations

Desirable skills

  • Experience of Oracle systems
  • Lean six sigma awareness
  • Understanding of payroll process

Reasons why you should apply to us

  • We’re big – really big. With that comes career growth opportunities - we offer excellent training, you’ll join a company where development and progression is actively encouraged and not just something we talk about.
  • We have an enviable client list – we work with some of the biggest names out there.
  • We ensure our working environment is supportive and collaborative, everyone has a voice and all opinions count.
  • Our goal is to disrupt the market, not just follow the status quo.
  • Sustainability is really important to us, in fact we are within the top 1% of companies worldwide tackling climate change and managing our emissions.

Digital Data Analyst required to join leading Insurance organisation. You will be responsible for delivering regular digital analytics reporting to senior stakeholders such as to Marketing, SEO and Optimisation teams.

    • Some knowledge of custom dimensions and custom metrics in digital analytics.

    • Knowledge of dashboards / workspaces
    • Understanding of how cookies used for digital analytics tracking (desirable)
    • Some understanding of data layer (desirable

For full details please contact Katie Collins

Data Analyst

Salt are partnered with an amazing FinTech business who have been ranked in Tech Track's top 50 fastest growing business' in the UK. They are now looking to hire a Data Analyst to help drive analysis and reporting within one of their Product teams. They're a business that can offer great development, working environment and benefits!

As a Data Analyst you'll be working very closely with the Product Manager to help develop the products by offering deep insights into existing and new features. You'll be working with data from numerous different sources, help to manipulate that data and present back your findings to your team.

·Understand requirements from the business on reporting needs and helping to establish KPI's

·Present finding back to stakeholders in the business

·Help to develop the data structures and maintain the databases

What experience they're looking for:

·3 years' + experience as working as a Data Analyst

·Ideally worked in a FinTech or Product focused startup business

·Very strong SQL skills

·Strong Excel skills

·Experience with reporting / dashboard technologies such as Tableau, Google Studio or Looker

·Bsc in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or Economics

In their benefits package they include a flexible working environment, great pension scheme and healthcare benefits. Plus an amazing new state of the art office! (When people are able to go there)…

If you think this opportunity sounds of interest and you're looking for your next role, please do apply and we look forward to speaking with you.

jobDescription: Senior Data Analyst - £65,000- Banking - Manchester  Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4-star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well. They have undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. For example, they’ve revolutionised their mobile banking app so that ...
fullDescription:
Senior Data Analyst - £65,000- Banking - Manchester

Join a well-established player in the Banking industry who for ten consecutive years have held a four-star Fair banking mark and a 4-star rating on Trustpilot to recognise that we help customers manage money well.

They have undergone a huge digital transformation in the past few years. For example, they’ve revolutionised their mobile banking app so that it now has 3x the function it had when they started and have really exciting plans in the pipeline. Their aim is to have the group be one of the leading digital businesses in Manchester and they are well on their way to achieving this vision.

It’s been incredible to watch them grow and develop over the past few years into a business the on the one hand is slick, efficient and commercial, but also fosters a culture of putting people first - whether this by ensuring staff are happy, fulfilled and healthy, or the vast amount of volunteering and fundraising they do for good causes each year.

They are now looking for a full stack data analyst to join a diverse and friendly team; taking data and engineering it into useful analysis and models that will inspire growth of the business.

You will steer the development of customer analysis to provide insight into historical performance, future forecasts, and opportunities for strategic improvements.

In this role you will:

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to iteratively deliver deep research into business problems.
  • Find useful structured and unstructured data in their Data Warehouse and Data Lake; suggesting and designing extensions that will improve their capabilities.
  • Design, prototype, deliver and maintain reports in Power BI, using SQL and DAX.
  • Design, prototype, deliver and maintain models in tools like R/Python/AWS Sagemaker, using data science toolkits like dplyr or ggplot2.
  • Be comfortable learning a data transformation tool like Matillion or SSIS.
  • Be comfortable working in an Agile Kanban workflow to safely code review, test and deploy solutions, using source control to manage changes.
  • Collaborate with product teams on a regular basis to plan and prioritize requests, discuss requirements, and ensure delivery of successful business outcomes.
  • Use data science techniques to identify and take advantage of commercial opportunities, delivering more targeted acquisition, successful customer/portfolio management, and product performance.
  • Use statistical methods and visualisation to measure and monitor the effectiveness of strategies, initiatives, the development of new products and risk management.
  • Provide meaningful commentary to help decision-makers act on findings.
  • Contribute to enhancements to the analytics and data science architecture.

About you:

  • Comfortable with SQL, DAX, R or Python, and advanced Excel.
  • Comfortable with visualisation development using tools like Cognos, SSRS, Power BI or Business Objects.
  • Experience in statistical and problem solving, with a deductive and curious mind.
  • Commercial awareness, preferably in the financial services industry.
  • A positive, enthusiastic, and methodical attitude to development, business intelligence and data science.

Why work here?

As well as having the opportunity to work with, and learn from, one of the most commercially focused and results driven businesses in the North West, you’ll find lots of great extras too! These include:

  • Hapi benefits program, including discounts at leading supermarkets, cinemas, and other leading retailers
  • On-site gym with free personal training
  • Personal lockers and showers
  • Basic 23 days holiday, plus public holidays. You will get an extra days’ holiday for every year served (up to 28 days)
  • An extra day of annual leave (taking the starting total to 24) on your birthday
  • Ability to buy and sell holiday entitlements
  • Paid Charity volunteer day, where the company give one working day a year to every employee to help a charity
  • On-site training centre and self-learning facilities

Please note due to high volumes of applications unfortunately we are not always able to respond to all unsuccessful applicants. However we wish everyone who applies the very best with their job search.

Data Analyst (SQL)

Portsmouth

You will offer insight into the data business and through different analysis techniques, unearth factors that had not previously been contemplated and follow them through to resolution.

fullDescription:
In a nutshell, this employer is a software company operating in the energy sector. Their world class Software as a Service platform is the go-to option for leading energy suppliers and new market entrants alike. To understand what they do, think about your home. Somebody supplies your energy, and those suppliers are their customers. They need software to manage your account. They provide a wide range of solutions from signing up customers, taking meter readings and generating bills, to the roll-out of smart metering, managing revenue leakage and the interaction with energy comparison sites.

They are based in Nottingham in the UK but are expanding into other territories across the globe. They have just over 200 employees and are one of the fastest growing tech businesses in the country.

Position
Working across the entire Managed Services function, you will engage with multiple business areas including Operations, Billing and SMART teams in order to provide detailed analytical insights.

Responsibilities
- Supporting clients and internal users with multiple data requests. Working across multiple business streams to 'fact-find' for the Managed Services department.
- Creating and maintaining data and data dashboards.
- Presenting data for internal and external use.
- Creating and presenting client reports as necessary.
- Identifying and fixing problems as they occur, spotting and resolving data anomalies.
- Playing an active role in identifying opportunities for process improvement.
- Providing ad-hoc support to the Service Desk to assist with support tickets.

Requirements

ANALYTICAL -You should be comfortable working with large data sets and using that data to create both internal and client reports.

INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE - Ideally, you will already be working within the energy sector, preferably with some Operations process knowledge.

FLEXIBLE - Every day is different, and you will need to be able to confidently deliver across multiple workstreams.

SKILL - You will be SQL savvy, with a strong understanding of Excel. Presentation skills and good attention to detail are also essential.

Benefits
- 33 days holiday including 8 bank holidays
- Option to buy or sell 5 extra days per year
- An extra day off for your birthday
- Prioritised mental health
- Discounted travel passes
- Health insurance

They also partner up with Vitality to offer incentives to help you stay fit and well including:
- 50% Off Virgin Active membership
- Free Amazon Prime
- £99 Apple watch
- Regular health & fitness checks
- Starbucks coffee each week
- 25% off healthy food at Ocado
- Free cinema tickets

Their office is based in Nottingham City Centre, just 5 minutes from the train station.

Please note, all roles will be home-based until at least the middle of February.

fullDescription:
A market leading business based in Didsbury requires a Credit Controller / Data Analyst to join a highly successful and established Credit Control team.

The position has been created due to the success and growth of the business over the last 18 Months.

Reporting directly to the Credit Control Manager, key responsibilities will include;

- Reconciliation and posting of daily cash receipts.

- Reconciliation of client self-bill and Portals reports to the Company’s internal records.

- Take ownership of queries and resolve in an efficient and timely manner.

- Achievement of monthly collection targets and KPI’s

- Chasing outstanding invoices from customers via telephone, emails in a proactive manner.

- You will be responsible for managing a number of key accounts.

- Maintaining good relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

- Resolve customer complaints efficiently.

- As well as credit control you will be responsible for working closely with the payroll and billing team, resolving queries and re-issuing credit notes, invoices and PO numbers.

The successful applicant will have the following experience and attributes:

- Ideally has previous experience working as a credit controller

- Outstanding data analysis and data manipulation skills.

- Highly competent with Excel

- Excellent attention to detail.

- Very strong communication skills.

- Enjoys working in a fast paced, commercial environment.

- Has a strong team work ethic and determination to complete their work to the best of their ability.

- Proactive and self-driven with a desire to prove themselves

If you have the skills and experienced required and want to work for a successful, growing business that will offer support and development for you career, then please don’t hesitate to apply.

fullDescription:

CEVA Logistics headoffice B.V.

Job description:

About the role 

A unique role working alongside one of our prestigious clients. To deliver and thereafter ensure a contract wide suite of generic KPI’s are in place and maintained in order to demonstrate performance, effectiveness and thereafter efficiency to both CEVA and the client. Based on this, implement innovative improvement initiatives via Quick Fixes, Kaizens and project plans in line with Lean methodology, with a view to continuous improvement culture.
  • Provide contract wide data analysis and interrogation leading to root cause and a conscience s to ensure associated action plans for improvement are put in place and adhered to.

  • Provide contract wide KPI Co-ordination, maintenance and support

Proven track record of working in a busy office environment, PC literate, with a working knowledge of relevant word processing and spreadsheet packages, Ability to balance conflicting priorities and work to tight deadlines, Good level of numeracy, Good attention to detail, Good written and oral communication skills with the ability to present to Senior management internally and Customer facing, 

If this sounds like your next role, apply below

jobDescription: The role of Data Analyst is focused on the process of inspecting, cleansing, modelling and visualising data with the objective of discovering and leveraging useful information, that can be used to support evidence based decision making. Our data analyst  is expected to make recommendations about the methods and ways in which our engagement teams use and analyse data to improve quality and the usefulness of data systems. Key activities includ...
fullDescription:
The role of Data Analyst is focused on the process of inspecting, cleansing, modelling and visualising data with the objective of discovering and leveraging useful information, that can be used to support evidence based decision making. Our data analyst is expected to make recommendations about the methods and ways in which our engagement teams use and analyse data to improve quality and the usefulness of data systems. Key activities include, but not be limited to:

  • Defining data requirements to support business issues / queries

  • Defining the process for how data will be captured and managed

  • Collecting and interpreting data

  • Analysing results

  • Identifying patterns and trends in datasets

  • Visualising the data to convey complex data sets into meaningful management information

  • Defining new data collection and analysis processes

Role description:

The Data Analyst will be required to support engagement teams with a number of tasks, which are supported through various data collection, interrogation and visualisation activities. Typical examples of these are included below:

  • Volume analysis: forecasting capability and capacity against expected volume and throughput.

  • Through life cost modelling: analyses design, manufacture and in-service support costs to understand the key drivers and trade-offs between options and product lifecycle phases.

  • Effective inventory management: uses data analysis and forecasting techniques to ensure clients only hold stock required which reduces product loss.

  • Historical cost benchmarking: assesses what has been paid previously for the same or similar items and uses that information to determine a future comparable cost.

As a Manager you will be able to resolve unusual and nonstandard problems and issues, is aware of alternative options and approaches to situations, can guide and advise others in this skill and is able to look ahead and anticipate. Displays extensive practical experience and applied knowledge of the subject in a wide range of work situations. Is seen as a role model for others and people will seek their advice. May be involved in coaching or mentoring activities related to this skill.

Requirements

We're looking for candidates with the following:

Essential:

  • Experience working as a data analyst in a corporate function

  • Knowledge and/or certifications demonstrating capability working with data models and reporting packages (ideally Power BI)

  • Ability to analyse large datasets

  • Ability to design and develop comprehensive reports

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

  • An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving

  • Demonstrable experience of success within a range of complex project environments and sectors

  • Proven ability to integrate well into a team and build relationships with senior stakeholders

  • Proven analytical and skeptical mindset with an ability to develop solutions to technical problems

Preferred:

  • BPSS or SC security clearances desirable

  • Undergraduate degree (e.g. BSc, BA)

  • Previous experience working within the Defense industry

What is in it for you?

As we're responsive to client demands, your role will be varied and challenging, providing you with an opportunity to work with a wide variety of high profile clients. We're also exceptionally passionate about providing you with the necessary skills, experience and training to help you develop both personally and professionally. You'll therefore be included on our specific Operate training framework, tailored to match your skills, needs and career aspirations. Fully funded by us, you'll complete externally accredited qualifications that will benefit you in the role you are working in. Our training programme is further enhanced through a variety of softer skills training sessions focusing on your relationships and leadership skills.

In addition to the client projects and training, our employees are also rewarded with various other as part of your employment

• Our dedicated internal Careers Service.

• Competitive salary plus a potential discretionary bonus (performance related)

• 25 days standard holiday pro rata, with options to increase this through your benefits package

• Flexible benefits scheme that can be tailored to suit your (and your family's) needs.

• Provision of a group pension plan with additional funding provided by PwC

jobDescription: Our client, with offices based near Stamford, is seeking a Commercial Data Analyst to look at sets of data from within the commerce sector, producing accurate & insightful reports and sets of data based on purchase & brand trends across a network of organisations. This is not a numbers based data analyst role but more of a commercial analyst that can put data in to comprehensive work centric reports to maximise commerce activi...
fullDescription:
Our client, with offices based near Stamford, is seeking a Commercial Data Analyst to look at sets of data from within the commerce sector, producing accurate & insightful reports and sets of data based on purchase & brand trends across a network of organisations.

This is not a numbers based data analyst role but more of a commercial analyst that can put data in to comprehensive work centric reports to maximise commerce activity.

To be considered for this Commercial Data Analyst position, you will have excellent PC literacy in MS Office including Excel (advanced level), Word, BI, keeping up to date with data tools and current trends online across the commercial sector, reading industry publications & blogs.

You will create project templates which detail objectives and processes, assist with project input to support the project team within agreed timescales.

This is a varied and involved analytical position which requires the ability to work as part of a team, the ability to read sets of data and interpret, some one with strong verbal and written communication skills, strong report writing ability and a strong work ethic.

This position offers the chance to join a growing organisation and offers a very good benefits package. Please note that interviews will not commence for this role until January 2021.

Owing to the Covid-19 situation in the UK and Worldwide, please note that there could be delays in cv selection and interview processes to ensure safety of both job seekers and clients alike. However, you can be assured of our commitment to your job search and we will keep you updated through all stages of the recruitment process.

Infinity Recruitment Consultancy Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent, contract and temporary recruitment. By applying you will be registered as a candidate with Infinity Recruitment Consultancy Limited, your personal data may be added to our database as part of the application process. Our privacy policy is available on our website and explains how we will use your data.

jobDescription: Insight Data Analyst required initially for a 12 Month FTC. The main purpose of the role is to provide insightful and actionable analytics to key stakeholders to inform planning and decision making for the business and be an expert in the data the business holds. The role holder will adopt a consultative approach  to bring together data and provide analysis and recommendations to the business. This involves leading the business in the...
fullDescription:
Insight Data Analyst required initially for a 12 Month FTC.

The main purpose of the role is to provide insightful and actionable analytics to key stakeholders to inform planning and decision making for the business and be an expert in the data the business holds. The role holder will adopt a consultative approach to bring together data and provide analysis and recommendations to the business. This involves leading the business in the bringing together and analysis of a range of data sources to help address business objectives and achieve the best business decisions remaining one step ahead of the market.

Duties will include analysing data, making suggestions and giving conclusions - not just talking about it. "Storytelling" getting out there talking to the business and giving insights. Creating and delivering Powerpoint presentations, infographics. Analysis of customer base (new, retentions, etc). Presenting skills needed. Data, excel, PowerBI, Dashboard reporting tools and SQL skills.

Based in Leeds, West Yorkshire. Salary c £35 k plus benefits.

jobDescription: Senior Finance Data Analyst - Brighton Description My client based in Brighton our embarking on a new phase of growth and our looking for a Senior Finance Data Analyst to join their expanding Data function. They recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community. Their commitment  to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects them to the diverse communi...
fullDescription:
Senior Finance Data Analyst - Brighton

Description

My client based in Brighton our embarking on a new phase of growth and our looking for a Senior Finance Data Analyst to join their expanding Data function. They recognise the benefit of inclusive practices to better build a diverse community. Their commitment to ensuring inclusion fuels and connects them to the diverse community that they serve.

They are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of family makeup, race, sexuality, religion, gender identity, disability or age.

Note on working practices during the Coronavirus outbreak

At the time of writing, all office based staff are on a rota system, combining optional time their our covid-secure office with working from home.

About the role

As Senior Finance Data Analyst, you will work within our UK based team. You will be responsible for providing business analysis and insight to a variety of different stakeholders across the whole organisation. This will include analysis of large datasets as well as preparing and cleaning data, and designing and building interactive dashboards in Tableau.

You should be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including querying large datasets, and best practice data visualisation. Additionally, you should be committed to transforming data analysis into actionable insights which can drive business performance.

We are looking for someone who will be confident in collaborating with departments across the business, proactively identifying opportunities by analysing data to understand how we can optimise customer lifetime value and unit economics, as well as driving a culture of excellence in data management and visualisation.

Key Responsibilities of Senior Revenue Economics Analyst:

  • Interpreting data and analysing results using statistical techniques
  • Identify areas of opportunity within the business, including through using data modelling techniques
  • Work directly with leadership and stakeholders to gather requirements, align solutions, provide status updates, and present findings.
  • Expanding our suite of company wide dashboards, with a focus on best practice and evangelise their use throughout the company.
  • Identifying opportunities to develop new reports and analytics to deliver insights and drive higher levels of business performance
  • Performing deep-dive analysis to gain insight into how our customers are using our platform
  • Development of our toolkit of internal pricing reports and dashboards, with a focus on automation

Requirements

The Successful Applicant:

  • Minimum of 5 years' experience of data analytics, working with large datasets from multiple sources
  • Experience with Tableau or similar data visualization/reporting tool
  • Exceptional analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Proven skills in Excel and SQL.
  • Experienced in R.
  • Python programming knowledge is preferred but not essential.
  • Experience with Big Data manipulation preferred
  • Knowledge of the principles of data warehouse design and the challenges posed by data quality
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, adept at report writing and presenting findings
  • Strong commercial awareness, previous experience within an ecommerce or marketplace business preferred but not essential
  • Ability to set own priorities and take accountability for delivery to communicated timelines

Benefits

  • 22 Days holiday, with 1 additional day for each year of continued service up to a maximum of 25 days.
  • Workplace Pension
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Dog friendly office
  • Fresh fruit
  • Fresh coffee
  • Your birthday Lay-in
  • Regular social events

If you'd like to learn more about this excting company and role please hit the apply now button.

For more information about Shift F5 and the opportunities we have to offer follow us on Twitter @F5_Jobs

Shift F5 Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

jobDescription: Vacancy: Data Analyst Skills: SQL, Tableau, Excel  Location: Manchester, with some travel within the Greater Manchester and Cheshire Area and some remote working Salary: Up to £40,000  The Role A great opportunity has come up for a Data Analyst in Manchester with an expanding organisation who are becoming a big name in...
fullDescription:
Vacancy: Data Analyst

Skills: SQL, Tableau, Excel

Location: Manchester, with some travel within the Greater Manchester and Cheshire Area and some remote working

Salary: Up to £40,000

The Role

A great opportunity has come up for a Data Analyst in Manchester with an expanding organisation who are becoming a big name in their field.

We are looking for a well-rounded Data Analyst, with good technical skills but also someone who likes to understand and work with people and customer data. You will be charged with owning the analysis and insight on key business operations, making insightful recommendations and driving business change and growth.

This position sits in an expanding team with a mix of levels from senior managers to entry level analysts starting out their careers.

This role will have a hybrid working pattern post Covid, across the office in Manchester City Centre, another side in South Manchester / Cheshire and some remote working. For now, the position will be remote, and we can on-board someone ASAP remotely.

The role comes with a great benefits package including 25days annual leave, a good pension, your birthday off and days off for charitable exploits as well as flexible working patterns.

Responsibilities

  • Use data to understand business performance and make meaningful insights on opportunities and improvements
  • Analysis of customer insights to improve customer processes thus driving revenue growth
  • Ownership of reporting and analysis - the ability to drive impactful change
  • Become the focal point of understanding business performance
  • Drive forward business growth through the use of data
  • Run projects and trials on new areas within data
  • Work with stakeholders across the business
  • Own entire projects from inception through to delivery

Role Requirements:

  • Essential - Strong skills in SQL
  • Essential - Strong Reporting Skills - ideally in Tableau but any considered
  • Essential - Excel Skills
  • Essential - Experience working with customer / consumer data
  • Bonus - Experience working with contact centre data and consumer centric reports
  • Bonus - Tableau

The Company

A rapidly growing organisation who have expanded quickly despite the current pandemic, they have taken new office space which will seat an additional 120 people.

What's left to say? You know what to do. If you're the type of person that reaches for the stars and wants to work in a fun supportive environment and rapidly progress your career whilst working with the latest technologies in data and you've got the relevant technical experience as a Data Analyst hit that apply button to submit your application now.

Interviews for this position will be commencing immediately so be sure to not miss out! You will be contacted by a phone call or by email to book an appointment, please be patient.

Vacancy: Data Analyst

Skills: SQL, Tableau, Excel

Location: Manchester, with some travel within the Greater Manchester and Cheshire Area and some remote working

Salary: Up to £40,000

fullDescription:
We are looking for a strong administrator/data analyst, ideally from a financial services background, to work for a large organisation in Basildon (although initially this role will be working from home due to government guidelines). We seek someone who is available immediately as this is a temporary Maternity cover role for approx 6 months (possibly longer). We require excellent knowledge of Excel together with a good work ethic, a proactive and self-motivated approach and someone who is able to perform repetitive tasks. Duties will include processing large volumes of financial proposals, checking details with internal departments, performing credit checks and entering data from one system to another in an accurate but speedy manner. If you have the skills we seek, please read on :-

Essential skills : -

Excellent knowledge of using Excel, Outlook, Word and Adobe

Good communication skills

Strong administrative / data analyst experience

Happy to perform repetitive task

Good data entry skills - accurate and speedy

Previous experience of working within a Financial Services sector would be beneficial

Experience of working in an environment where strict compliance, policies and procedures are paramount

Self motivated and proactive

Additional information : -

Hours Mon - Fri 8.30am - 5.00pm (1 hour unpaid lunch break)

Free parking when on site

Rate of pay £15.00 per hour worked

Temporary for approx 6 months, possibly longer

Keywords : Administrator ; Finance ; Banking ; Financial Services ; Credit Control ; Data ; Analyst

jobDescription: The purpose of this role is to provide insightful and meaningful member and market information to key stakeholders across MPS so that we can make informed and member focused decisions and remain one step ahead of the market. This is a fixed term contract  for 12 Months.  Job Description  12% company pension contribution (3% from the individual)Annual bonus scheme (for permanent roles)Priv...
fullDescription:
The purpose of this role is to provide insightful and meaningful member and market information to key stakeholders across MPS so that we can make informed and member focused decisions and remain one step ahead of the market. This is a fixed term contract for 12 Months.

Job Description

  • 12% company pension contribution (3% from the individual)
  • Annual bonus scheme (for permanent roles)
  • Private Medical Insurance
  • Health Care Cash Plan
  • 25 days annual leave, plus bank holidays

Main Responsibilities

  • Use internal and external data sources to ensure the business has a robust understanding of what is happening in our markets and our membership
  • Creating compelling presentations, in various formats including verbal, powerpoint and inforgraphics.
  • Use date and information to identify risks and opportunities that may arise in future whilst proactively making recommendations that provide focus for further discussion.
  • Help to develop insight led decision making capability across the organisation by provision of accurate and engaging analysis and reporting
  • Produce reporting on members, membership and market share for key stakeholders including Exec and Senior Leaders and ensure appropriate and effective communication channels are utilised.
  • Develop self-service dashboards for key stakeholders to monitor changes in membership
  • Working with our external data suppliers to get data that informs market size and identifies prospects
  • Providing SME input for strategic and other projects

The Ideal Candidate

The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate some or all of the following:

  • Experience of analysing data and presenting it in an engaging and informative way
  • Ability to use data to tell a story by providing information, impact, potential outcome and suggestions.
  • Keenness to work with other departments, influence people and make an impact.
  • Presenting and influencing skills
  • Experience of working within a healthcare or membership based organisation
  • Good Excel skills
  • Basic SQL, Power BI and dashboard reporting tools

This is a 12 month FTC / Secondment. Due to the urgency of this vacancy we may start to review applications and interview prior to the closing date, so please apply as soon as possible.

About The Company

Medical Protection Society (MPS) is the world’s leading protection organisation for doctors, dentists and healthcare professionals. We protect and support the professional interests of more than 300,000 members around the world, in countries as diverse as the United Kingdom, South Africa and Hong Kong.

We strive to be much more than a last line of defence by being at our members’ side at every step, offering support, advice and world-class defence. Membership provides access to expert advice and support together with the right to request indemnity for complaints or claims arising from professional practice.

We continue to invest in our team to ensure that we are delivering the best possible service for members. This was recognised in 2016 when we were awarded an Investors in People Silver award.

jobDescription: Overview of the Service Line & Team  In Audit, you will join a growing team of over 750 relationship driven, curious, problem solvers who add value to their clients daily. Our Audit Teams provide audit assurance services which are vital to our clients' business control and credibility. Our  expertise ranges from servicing private, entrepreneurial companies through to UK listed companies, financial services, p...
fullDescription:
Overview of the Service Line & Team 

In Audit, you will join a growing team of over 750 relationship driven, curious, problem solvers who add value to their clients daily. Our Audit Teams provide audit assurance services which are vital to our clients' business control and credibility. Our expertise ranges from servicing private, entrepreneurial companies through to UK listed companies, financial services, public sector bodies and some of the largest FT Global organizations in the world. By joining a unique integrated structure, you will benefit from working in collaborative teams and be given responsibility for delivering robust and independent audit services in a supportive environment. 

In a rapidly changing business world, we also care about our industry and have long pressed for a debate on audit competition. We believe that companies and their shareholders alike deserve the benefits that increased competition can bring and are committed to playing an active role in shaping its future.

The financial services audit department works internationally to provide seamless, cross-border services to our clients. As a member of the team you will experience a broad range of clients across various sectors to build your knowledge and understanding of the financial services market.

Teams within Financial Services:

Banking:

The banking group covers clients such as emerging banks and UK operations of large international banks.

Insurance:

The insurance group covers clients from entrepreneurial insurance brokers to Lloyd's syndicates and large international underwriters.

Job Purpose

Are you an analytical, data-driven graduate? Are you interested in a role that offers an opportunity to shape the future of audit through data-driven solutions? This unique opportunity offers technical challenge, a creative open problem-solving environment, and quick responsibility and progression.

As a Data Analyst, your time would usually be split between working at client premises, working in the office and studying for your professional exams.  However due to the current pandemic situation Mazars continues to work remotely only visiting the office and client sites on a restricted basis.

The purpose of the position is to fundamentally unlock insights contained in data and create solutions to challenges related to the delivery of external audit.

What you'll do:

  • Work on Mazars' most strategic audit clients, including many high profile international listed companies – delivering full cycle external audits as part of the audit team. You will work in many different industry sectors including banking and insurance, retail and the automotive sector to name a few. Exposure to multiple sectors will provide you with a broad view and understanding of the economy.
  • Innovation ambassador, promoting new ideas to our audit teams and working as part of a network of innovation champions. As part of this community you will be designing, developing and trialling new processes and technology.
  • Complement your STEM degree with business application and knowledge, discovering how companies work, including processes, controls, accounting and reporting systems.
  • Experience secondment opportunities to other departments within Mazars, where data science is critical; business areas may include quantitative services, actuarial, consulting and forensics – in the UK and overseas.
  • Anticipate client needs and formulate solutions to client issues.
  • Shape the future of audit through data-driven solutions.

The Person 

Role requirements:

  • A relevant masters; i.e. in business analytics, data-science, statistics or equivalent programme focused on data and analytics
  • Data analytics skills from a related degree or experience (work experience is not essential)
  • Keen interest in technology
  • Strong work ethic; the desire to innovate, get things done, and to learn and progress.
  • Interpersonal skills; the ability to influence, build client relationships with a foundation of trust and responsibility.
  • Analytical skills; the ability to accurately and diligently assimilate information, grasp concepts quickly, research and solve problems.
  • Independent; the ability to think critically, challenge when appropriate, and to apply professional scepticism.
  • Attention to detail and strong time-management skills.
  • Credible and effective communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Affinity with our values; in particular, respect for individuals, diversity and integrity.

Desirable requirements:

  • Background in any programming language such as Java, Python, R
  • Linux knowledge
  • Knowledge of one: MS SQL, MySQL, NoSQL, Postgre SQL
  • Knowledge of any visualisation technologies such as Power-BI, QlikView, Tableau

Training

We will fund your study towards the CFAB, following successful completion of this we will then go on to fund your study towards an MSc in Applied Data Science.

You will receive a full study package to ensure that you successfully complete your professional qualification. This includes time off to study, attend college and complete online courses. Your professional qualification is only part of the story at Mazars; we support all our trainees with a blended approach to training and development including classroom study, 1:1 coaching, and soft skills training. As part of the financial services audit team, you will have the opportunity to sit the banking or insurance specific exams within the ACA qualification.

You will be supported by a mentor and an appraising manager to keep your career and aspirations on track.

Key Skills:

  • Strong qualitative and quantitative analysis skills necessary
  • Multilingual(German or other EU language) a plus but not essential

If you have the necessary skills to hit the ground running in this role then please do apply ASAP.

jobDescription: Data Analyst Margate based, but travel throughout Kent £12 Per Hour Monday - Friday, 9.00am - 5.00pm  Temporary - Ongoing Our client, a medical facility based in Margate, is looking for a Data Analyst to be responsible for reporting and analysing trends or anomalies to the team Manager and Facilities Directorate and id...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst

Margate based, but travel throughout Kent

£12 Per Hour

Monday - Friday, 9.00am - 5.00pm

Temporary - Ongoing

Our client, a medical facility based in Margate, is looking for a Data Analyst to be responsible for reporting and analysing trends or anomalies to the team Manager and Facilities Directorate and identifying any inconsistencies or lapses in results.

The role will work closely with members of the Facilities department therefore will need to be able to work with staff of varying levels. Excellent communication skills are required to be successful in this role.

As the Data Analyst, you will be responsible for the…

  • Monitoring team performance against SLAs and KPIs and interrogate data to discover any recurring features that lead to potential failures
  • Produce both regular and ad-hoc reports for the internal Senior Leadership team and client teams
  • Interrogate data to identify patterns and trends.
  • Production of reports both for measuring statistics locally and for Director and Board-level reports.
  • Interpret complex data and create visual representation of this data to make it accessible, understandable, and useable for the Facilities team
  • Combine data sets across multiple sources and technologies

Person Specification:

  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Ability to work with large amounts of information and prioritize data request
  • Will need a good foundation in interpreting requests for data and turn these into visual reports
  • Ability to communicate and work across multi team set up essential to role
  • Highly levels of accuracy and attention to detail due to large requirement for input of data
  • Best in class problem solving skills required
  • Competency in literacy, particularly in the use of Excel highly desirable
  • Ability to find and propose/implement solutions to continually improve essential
  • Must be able to meet deadlines in a fast paced, reactive environment

If you would like to find out more, please call freephone: or email your CV

About Morgan Jones:

fullDescription:
Technical Systems & Data Analyst

A leading insurance organisation requires a Hands on Technical Systems & Data Analyst as part of a major systems replacement programme.

The role requires skills & experience across the following areas:

  • Strong data analysis skills with a strong knowledge of the SQL Suite in particular T-SQL as well as C# as that is what the current system is built in.
  • Reverse engineering experience of existing systems.
  • Process models and data models knowledge and applying those data models when needed.
  • Be able to clearly demonstrate to technical and non technical staff how data is captured, how it's verified and played back.
  • Any systems replacement experience would be advantageous.
  • Insurance experience would be preferred but isnt essential for this role.

This is an urgent contract requirement on a long running programme if you have the required skills and experience please send your CV and suitable applicants will be contacted accordingly.

Eames Consulting is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

We have a...
fullDescription:
New job opportunity for a 3-month Senior Data Analyst contract , remote working with occasional office visits.

£320 + VAT per day
3-month contract (outside IR35)
Remote working with occasional office visits (Oxford, Slough, Reading)

Your new company
We are a leading construction and infrastructure business in the UK. We have a large number of sites across the country and we are forever expanding our business. To continue to grow as a business, we understand the importance of company information and data and its value in creating plans for improvement. We are undertaking a project to improve our business analysis method and so, right now, we require a Senior Data Analyst.

Your new role
You will be responsible for providing improved reports allowing the organisation to get the most out of their data which can then be used to create plans for business improvement. You will be required to link all the various data inputs to create a joined-up source which will allow for more useful and efficient data analysis. You will be required to ensure that the inputs are correctly capturing the best and most useful data. You will then be responsible for designing some of the reports.

This role is mainly working from home however occasional visits to the offices in Oxford, Reading and Slough will be required.

What you'll need to succeed
The successful candidate will have a strong background using Power BI as a tool for data analysis. You will also be proficient and confident using Microsoft Excel. You will have a track record of business improvement through data analysis and with an eye for detail.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

fullDescription:
Summary of Sales Data Analyst

This role is part of the Business Operations Team inside the display organisation. The vision is to excite businesses with display solutions and deliver the most impactful experiences. The exciting things Display team will be involved includes the growth 4 different categories covering LCD Monitor, Hospitality Display, LED Signage and Smart Signage.

This role will report directly into the Business Operations Manager, and then to Head of Department. This is a diverse role that will predominantly engage with the sales force including BD managers and channel managers, as well as Product Management and marketing teams.

Location - Chertsey
Salary - £156 per day
Contract length - 31 December 2021

Responsibilities of Sales Data Analyst

  • You will be responsible for improving 3 key aspects of the business
  • Providing support and pricing to the unmanaged channel partners
  • Support the strategy of solutions development by working with the product management and marketing teams to support the solutions BD manager with market research, proposition development, legal contract set up, marketing collateral and go to market plans
  • Support the BD manager and channel teams with tender response documentation and proposal development documentation on special or high projects
  • Provide support for business reporting
  • Coordinate the staff sales initiatives
  • Support the head of display on key strategic initiatives as required

Key competencies of Sales Data Analyst

  • Educated to degree level (Business Management, Marketing Management)
  • Strong in Excel (pivot tables, advanced formulas, macros is a plus)
  • Good skill in most Microsoft office software (Powerpoint, Word)
  • Experience in Salesforce ideally or other similar CRM system
  • Experience in handling, manipulating and interpreting large data sets
  • An analytical eye
  • Strong verbal, written and presentation skills
  • Focused on the quality of detail
  • Strong numeracy / commercial acumen

Benefits: Bonus scheme, staff discounts, 25 days holiday (after AWR), staff restaurant and onsite parking


Please note: As you can appreciate we are currently overwhelmed with applications and we can therefore only contact those applications that have relevant skills for positions that we currently have available. Should you not hear from us within a week, you have been unsuccessful on this occasion.
March Recruitment is an equal opportunities employer and complies with all relevant UK legislation. If you are successful in your application, you will be required to attend a full registration with one of our Consultants which will involve you providing a current passport, any relevant visas and completing relevant tests and a full competency based interview.
Please note that by applying for this vacancy you accept March Recruitment’s Privacy Policy and GDPR Policy which can be found on our website and therefore give us consent to contact you.

You will be tasked with collating data gained from external sources so t...
fullDescription:
I have teamed up with a housing developer who are based in South West London who are looking for a Data Analyst to join work alongside their Marketing team based at head office

The bulk of the job role will be working on 2 key programmes which are Microsoft Dynamics & Microsoft Excel so to have knowledge of how to use those would be desirable to the employer. You will be tasked with collating data gained from external sources so that the marketing teams can adapt their strategies to ensure that the properties are advertised in the best way possible

The ideal candidate would be someone who has at least 1 years experience in a Data Analyst role previously & has some knowledge on either the property or new build construction sector. You will also need to be confident enough to present your findings on data to senior management teams

If you would like to apply for this role please do so below or for more information please contact Zoe Georgiou at the Fawkes & Reece London office

Come and work for one of the best kept secrets in I.T on a number of exciting projects to keep you busy in 2021.The company<br ...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst – Excellent Financial Services opportunity   
Location: Edinburgh
Package:  Up to £50,000 + competitive bens

A great opportunity for a Data Analyst work with our clients within Financial Services in Edinburgh.

Come and work for one of the best kept secrets in I.T on a number of exciting projects to keep you busy in 2021.

The company

Private Sector ? 
The Private Sector in Sopra Steria covers a range of different markets including Banking, Insurance, Retail, Travel, Transport and Utilities. We help our customers participating in these markets to develop, deliver and operationalise their digital transformation strategies. Successful customer outcomes are achieved by gaining a deep understanding of their business and technology issues combined with our 50 years’ experience in technology and business transformation.

Our capabilities and credentials across a range of Private Sector markets enable the design, delivery and management of business transformation programmes, help our clients respond to changing customer demands, keep ahead of the competition, and safeguard their systems from evolving business and technology risks. 

The day job
In Data & Analytics, you will have the responsibility of helping our customers make better use of data for business decisions and operations to drive customer interactions.

Our team is unique in the financial services industry in that they have end-to-end responsibility for data which includes multi-channel customer contact, analytics, data-related technology and change delivery. 

We are seeking experienced Analysts with either Banking or Financial Services exposure where you understand regulated environments/processes.

Key responsibilities:

  • Deliver high quality, clear and accurate current state management information within agreed timescales.
  • Input into quality business solutions, including analysis solutions.
  • Typically work independently on single or multiple projects or small components (workstreams) of larger projects that are multi-disciplined.
  • Utilise your expert knowledge and experience using SQL / SAS / Teradata and at times Hadoop to interrogate data for investigations during project work.
  • Liaise with various levels of Stakeholders for detailed business requirements & project status updates
  • Understand business processing within heavily regulated environments.
  • Desirable skills/knowledge:
  • Regulatory processing / execution
  • Hadoop / ETL / Tableau / Python

Essential skill sets:

  • Data Analysis for Analytical extractions, manipulation and wrangling using  SAS / SQL / Teradata
  • Experience in a business change environment
  • Good understanding of business analysis methodology
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Deep understanding of data quality and data governance
  • Excellent MS Office skills, ability to use Excel, Word, Powerpoint, Visio and MS Project to a high standard
  • Fraud business knowledge; Data streaming experience; Spark experience; Engineering for machine learning; Agile methodology and delivery

Reasons why you should apply to us

  • We’re big – really big. With that comes career growth opportunities - we offer excellent training, you’ll join a company where development and progression is actively encouraged and not just something we talk about
  • We have an enviable client list – we work with some of the biggest names out there
  • We ensure our working environment is supportive and collaborative, everyone has a voice and all opinions count 
  • Our goal is to disrupt the market, not just follow the status quo
  • Sustainability is really important to us, in fact we are within the top 1% of companies worldwide tackling climate change and managing our emissions

jobDescription: We are currently looking for a Spatial Data Analyst to join a large analytics function of a industry leading Environmental company in London. As the Spatial Data Analyst the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:<b...
fullDescription:
We are currently looking for a Spatial Data Analyst to join a large analytics function of a industry leading Environmental company in London. As the Spatial Data Analyst you will be responsible for leading data lead business decision making.

KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

The role reports in to an analytics manager within a route team. As the Spatial Data Analyst the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:

1. The role will engage with operations teams to proactively improve processes and gain insight to KPI's

2. In this role you will evaluate new business contract opportunities using models of a variety of resourcing scenarios and GIS Software to spatially analyse KPI's.

3. The data analyst will adapt SQL queries and reports and combine excel models to predict/ calculate resources.

4. The Data Analyst will require outstanding communication skills to present data driven solutions to senior stakeholders.

ROLE REQUIREMENTS:

To be successful in your application to this exciting opportunity as the Spatial Data Analyst we are looking to identify the following on your profile and past history:

1. Relevant degree in a Mathematics / Computer Science field

2. Proven industry experience in coding in SQL and using GIS for analysis

3. A working knowledge and practical experience with analysis of complex datasets in a deadline driven role

Key Words: GIS Geoinformatics Computational Mathematics data analysis SQL Excel Spatial Route
