jobDescription: Overview of the Service Line & Team  In Audit, you will join a growing team of over 750 relationship driven, curious, problem solvers who add value to their clients daily. Our Audit Teams provide audit assurance services which are vital to our clients' business control and credibility. Our  expertise ranges from servicing private, entrepreneurial companies through to UK listed companies, financial services, p...
fullDescription:
Overview of the Service Line & Team 

In Audit, you will join a growing team of over 750 relationship driven, curious, problem solvers who add value to their clients daily. Our Audit Teams provide audit assurance services which are vital to our clients' business control and credibility. Our expertise ranges from servicing private, entrepreneurial companies through to UK listed companies, financial services, public sector bodies and some of the largest FT Global organizations in the world. By joining a unique integrated structure, you will benefit from working in collaborative teams and be given responsibility for delivering robust and independent audit services in a supportive environment. 

In a rapidly changing business world, we also care about our industry and have long pressed for a debate on audit competition. We believe that companies and their shareholders alike deserve the benefits that increased competition can bring and are committed to playing an active role in shaping its future.

The financial services audit department works internationally to provide seamless, cross-border services to our clients. As a member of the team you will experience a broad range of clients across various sectors to build your knowledge and understanding of the financial services market.

Teams within Financial Services:

Banking:

The banking group covers clients such as emerging banks and UK operations of large international banks.

Insurance:

The insurance group covers clients from entrepreneurial insurance brokers to Lloyd's syndicates and large international underwriters.

Job Purpose

Are you an analytical, data-driven graduate? Are you interested in a role that offers an opportunity to shape the future of audit through data-driven solutions? This unique opportunity offers technical challenge, a creative open problem-solving environment, and quick responsibility and progression.

As a Data Analyst, your time would usually be split between working at client premises, working in the office and studying for your professional exams.  However due to the current pandemic situation Mazars continues to work remotely only visiting the office and client sites on a restricted basis.

The purpose of the position is to fundamentally unlock insights contained in data and create solutions to challenges related to the delivery of external audit.

What you'll do:

  • Work on Mazars' most strategic audit clients, including many high profile international listed companies – delivering full cycle external audits as part of the audit team. You will work in many different industry sectors including banking and insurance, retail and the automotive sector to name a few. Exposure to multiple sectors will provide you with a broad view and understanding of the economy.
  • Innovation ambassador, promoting new ideas to our audit teams and working as part of a network of innovation champions. As part of this community you will be designing, developing and trialling new processes and technology.
  • Complement your STEM degree with business application and knowledge, discovering how companies work, including processes, controls, accounting and reporting systems.
  • Experience secondment opportunities to other departments within Mazars, where data science is critical; business areas may include quantitative services, actuarial, consulting and forensics – in the UK and overseas.
  • Anticipate client needs and formulate solutions to client issues.
  • Shape the future of audit through data-driven solutions.

The Person 

Role requirements:

  • A relevant masters; i.e. in business analytics, data-science, statistics or equivalent programme focused on data and analytics
  • Data analytics skills from a related degree or experience (work experience is not essential)
  • Keen interest in technology
  • Strong work ethic; the desire to innovate, get things done, and to learn and progress.
  • Interpersonal skills; the ability to influence, build client relationships with a foundation of trust and responsibility.
  • Analytical skills; the ability to accurately and diligently assimilate information, grasp concepts quickly, research and solve problems.
  • Independent; the ability to think critically, challenge when appropriate, and to apply professional scepticism.
  • Attention to detail and strong time-management skills.
  • Credible and effective communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Affinity with our values; in particular, respect for individuals, diversity and integrity.

Desirable requirements:

  • Background in any programming language such as Java, Python, R
  • Linux knowledge
  • Knowledge of one: MS SQL, MySQL, NoSQL, Postgre SQL
  • Knowledge of any visualisation technologies such as Power-BI, QlikView, Tableau

Training

We will fund your study towards the CFAB, following successful completion of this we will then go on to fund your study towards an MSc in Applied Data Science.

You will receive a full study package to ensure that you successfully complete your professional qualification. This includes time off to study, attend college and complete online courses. Your professional qualification is only part of the story at Mazars; we support all our trainees with a blended approach to training and development including classroom study, 1:1 coaching, and soft skills training. As part of the financial services audit team, you will have the opportunity to sit the banking or insurance specific exams within the ACA qualification.

You will be supported by a mentor and an appraising manager to keep your career and aspirations on track.

jobDescription: In Consulting, you will join a growing team of 300 relationship driven, strategic thinkers who take pride in the positive impact they can have on society whilst advising the boardrooms of UK and International clients across all sectors. Our Consulting teams  support clients in solving business critical, complex problems through a broad range of services including risk assurance, technology advisory, business transformation, regulatory consul...
fullDescription:
In Consulting, you will join a growing team of 300 relationship driven, strategic thinkers who take pride in the positive impact they can have on society whilst advising the boardrooms of UK and International clients across all sectors. Our Consulting teams support clients in solving business critical, complex problems through a broad range of services including risk assurance, technology advisory, business transformation, regulatory consulting and actuarial support. Our expertise ranges from financial services and insurance to retail, government and education. In a rapidly changing business world, we help clients overcome the challenges that they face today and prepare for whatever the future may hold.

Our National Data and Automation (D&A) service line provide data governance, data advisory services, data analytics, advanced (AI-ML) analytics, platform development and robotic process automation (RPA) services across a portfolio of clients. The D&A service line is part of our national Technology Consulting and Assurance practice that provides wider technology consulting service to a range of clients nationally and internationally. 

Our broad range of clients and sectors in our portfolios across the country include:

  • Financial Services, Banking, Insurance and Investment
  • Corporates/Private Sector/Industry & Services
  • Central and Local Government
  • Retail and Consumer products organisations
Job Purpose

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be working within the Technology Consulting and Assurance Services team in delivering various Data and Analytics engagements to a range of clients from BFSI and Corporate sector clients across London and the UK.

Role & Responsibilities
  • Working closely with the Data Analytics manager in delivering Data Analytic engagements for clients across UK.
  • Understanding client requirements.
  • Ensuring all stakeholders are kept fully informed of any issues arising and the progress of the work.
  • Extract data from various ERP systems either through ETL or developing data pipelines.
  • Process structured and unstructured data to automate business process and provide meaningful insights.
  • Develop rich visuals which provides deeper insights into data.
  • Delivering work to the highest technical standards including ensuring work is conducted in line with Mazars Quality standards.
  • Ensuring all work is undertaken to budget and meets client KPIs.
  • Building and developing long term relationships with senior stakeholders across all clients as well as within Mazars.
  • Clearly understanding the wider service line capabilities of Technology Consulting and Assurance and the wider firm and how these may benefit clients.
  • Identifying new business opportunities.
  • Supporting with proposals and pitches.
Skills, Knowledge and Experience
  • Previous experience working in a consulting environment.
  • Desire to grow and develop the data analytics practice.
  • Ability to think creatively, generate innovative ideas, challenge the status quo and deliver work effectively.
  • Interpersonal skills; the ability to build client relationships with a foundation of trust and responsibility.
  • Analytical skills; the ability to think critically, research and solve problems.
  • Ability to multitask and work to tight timelines.
  • Affinity with our values; in particular, respect for individuals, diversity and integrity.

Technical skills:

  • Expertise in working with open source technologies such as Python for data analysis and application development.
  • Experience developing APIs under relevant frameworks and using Python libraries such as NLP.
  • Ability to independently write complex SQL/T-SQL queries and develop SQL Database design.
  • Thorough understanding of relational database design concepts and best practices.
  • Hands on experience working with large data sets, structure/unstructured data.
  • Knowledge of MS power tools such as Power Automate and Power Apps is desirable.
  • Hands on experience of design and development of Azure cloud-based data solutions.
  • Experience in Banking or Insurance industries.
  • Knowledge of Data visualization concepts using open source technologies or tools such as power BI, Tableau, Qlik etc;
  • Experience with Extract Transform Load/ELT tools such as SSIS.
  • Knowledge of ERP systems such as SAP, MS Dynamics etc. is an advantage.
  • Some data engineering experience building data pipelines from various data sources.
  • Experience in leveraging Machine learning or AI techniques for solution development.
  • Working knowledge of Data Lake & Datawarehouse.
  • Any experience in Big data tools and technologies.
  • Advanced degree or any certifications within data / cloud technologies.
Inclusion and Diversity

At Mazars inclusion and diversity are central to our values. We recognise that being an inclusive and diverse organisation makes us stronger as a business.

We seek to attract and recruit people who reflect the diverse nature of our clients and communities, regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, nationality, faith or belief, social background, age and disability. Mazars selects candidates based on skills, knowledge, qualifications and experience.

fullDescription:
A leading architect company is looking to bring on board a vastly experienced Senior Data Analyst to join its rapidly growing Data team. This is a key recruit for this company as this role will sit as the lead Analyst to help create dashboards and report on the growing data from multiple data streams.

Senior Data Analyst Responsibilities:

  • Manage the end to end data processing
  • Provision of data linkage between front end analytical solutions and the back end data structures
  • Lead and grow a small team of analysts to help gather and understand the data requirements across the company
  • Communicate with various internal stakeholders on data issues
  • Continue to assess the companies changing needs

Senior Data Analyst Requirements:

  • Extensive experience with SQL: Querying, designing and building dashboards
  • Experience working with CRM/ERP systems
  • Design and building ETL pipelines (SSIS/ Azure)
  • Must have strong Microsoft background – Azure data platforms
  • Strong data visualization skills (preferably Power BI)
  • Excellent communication skills

The salary bracket is £65,000 - £70,000 depending on experience, interviews are happening ASAP with a start date as soon as possible.

If this role is of interest or you require more information, please get in touch with an updated CV to or call on to discuss further.


We also offer a referral fee for successful placement, so if someone you know is suitable, please also get in touch.

Experience of data visualisation software would also be advantageous. Data Analyst: Key duties The Pricing team works closely with underwriting teams...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst

Job Market: Insurance / Data Analysis

Data Analyst: About the role

This is a role within the Actuarial pricing team of a leading Lloyd’s insurance company, and will suit a graduate with a numerate degree and with good working knowledge of SQL. Experience of data visualisation software would also be advantageous.

Data Analyst: Key duties

The Pricing team works closely with underwriting teams

• Building pricing models to allow underwriters to price, compare and monitor accounts
• Performing detailed statistical analysis on individual accounts to support underwriting and quotation
• Performing ad-hoc analysis of new business opportunities and portfolio/segmental performance
• Providing support to underwriters during business planning
• Assessing outwards reinsurance pricing


The Data Analyst will support the pricing team to leverage data from a range of sources to provide data insights and to enhance
pricing and portfolio analytics capabilities.

Note that this is not an Actuarial role and as such actuarial study support is not provided.

Main Responsibilities:

• Preparation of monthly pricing-related management information
• Helping to design, build and enhance pricing analytics and reporting capabilities
• Supporting the collection, maintenance and exploration of pricing data so that it is available to be used in modelling by the Pricing Actuaries
• Building, developing and documenting streamlined, efficient processes to support pricing using various technologies
• Communicating and presenting data-derived insights to business stakeholders
• Collaborate, present and share knowledge with the wider Actuarial team
• Assistance for other pricing team activities as required

Data Analyst: Key requirements

Essential

• Strong IT skills, including comprehensive knowledge of Excel and VBA
• Good working knowledge of SQL
Desirable
• Tableau
• Experience with Machine Learning
• Good working knowledge of R

• 2.1 or 1st degree in Mathematics or numeric subject (e.g. Physics, Engineering, Statistics)
• 3 or more strong 'A’ levels, including Mathematics

fullDescription:
My client is a large PLC consultancy organisation who have an exciting opportunity for a recent graduate to join their analytical team.

This is an ideal opportunity if you have graduated recently (2019 and 2020 graduates only) with a numerical related degree and are looking to develop your career in an analytical field.

This role offers a fantastic opportunity for a self-motivated, highly numerate graduate to make a significant difference within a well-established and rapidly growing organisation.

Your day to day will consist of…….

  • Proactively and collaboratively develop Analysis and Insight to support Operations
  • Report making to help deliver optimal management decisions
  • Identify, quantify and prioritise opportunities to enhance operational efficiency and produce world-class deliverables fit for a world-class operation to drive continuous improvement.
  • Apply analytical and technical ability to ensure the team delivers the highest standards of analysis and reporting to key stake holders

What we want from you…...

  • Minimum 2:1 within a numeric based degree i.e. Maths, Economics, Business, Psychology, Physics etc.
  • Proficient in use of Microsoft Office product suite, particularly Excel i.e. Pivot Tables and V-Lookups
  • Working knowledge of one or more of the following: SQL, R, Python, C++, Java
  • Clear, logical analytical approach to problem-solving
  • Ability to investigate data, find trends, forecast performance and provide insightful recommendations

It's a bonus if you have!

  • Previous experience presenting information to key stake holders
  • Proficient use of VBA's
  • Previous experience using SAS
  • Knowledge and practical experience with Power BI and Cloud collaboration solutions

If you are interested in this fantastic opportunity based near Leeds, please apply direct with an updated CV.

jobDescription: SENIOR DATA ANALYST 3-6 MONTH CONTRACT £350-£450 PER DAY REMOTE/CENTRAL LONDON This position as a Senior Data Analyst will allow you to operate within a renowned e-commerce delivery company. The Senior Data Analyst will operate alongside the Data Science function and will influence executive decisions surrounding the companies online  pl...
fullDescription:
SENIOR DATA ANALYST

3-6 MONTH CONTRACT

£350-£450 PER DAY

REMOTE/CENTRAL LONDON

This position as a Senior Data Analyst will allow you to operate within a renowned e-commerce delivery company. The Senior Data Analyst will operate alongside the Data Science function and will influence executive decisions surrounding the companies online platform. The Senior Data Analyst will create visualisations and offer insight into customer data that influences return of investment for the company. The Senior Data Analyst will be heavily involved within the product and business teams, and will gain commercial experience that will excel their career to the next level.

THE COMPANY

This company offers an online delivery platform for various products. They are known for having Data and Analytics at the forefront of their decision making, and have invested heavily in this department. Now going through another recruitment phase, they offer cutting edge technological experience, as well as insight and support from their valued Senior Management. Having this company on your CV will certainly make you stand out to any potential employer.

THE ROLE

The Senior Data Analyst will be assisting and offering insight to the wider business, through the analysis of customer and product data. The aim is to inform the company, which areas to invest in to maximise return on investment. This will specifically involve:

  • Working closely with a Data Science lead to understand requirements.
  • Assisting the Data Science team with bespoke analytics and offering insight into the data.
  • Creating dashboards using Looker.
  • Running SQL queries on the data to extract information.
  • Analysing customer spending and customer interaction changes over time, to inform the company on which areas to invest in.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

As a Senior Data Analyst you will be required to have the following experience:

  • Expert level SQL query skills.
  • Commercial experience using Looker as a visualisation tool.
  • Commercial experience operating within the retail or e-commerce sector.
  • Extensive commercial experience within a product focused business.
  • Proven ability to offer insight into customer focused data, with the aim of improving return on investment.
  • Experience working in a 'cutting edge' company in regard to their Data and Analytics function is highly desirable.

THE BENEFITS:

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will receive between £350-£450 per day over an initial 6-month period. As well as the opportunity to work on a variety of interesting and exciting projects.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Matthew Collett via the Apply link on this page.

jobDescription: * Be part of an UK SaaS success story, revolutionising recruitment* Collaborative and supportive team environment* Career defining role with a flexible and progressive organisationAbout JobAdderJobAdder is a dynamic and innovative Software as a Service (SaaS) organisation with over 130 employees across 5 countries and customers worldwide.We are a leading recruitment management platform that assists...
fullDescription:
* Be part of an UK SaaS success story, revolutionising recruitment
* Collaborative and supportive team environment
* Career defining role with a flexible and progressive organisation

About JobAdder

JobAdder is a dynamic and innovative Software as a Service (SaaS) organisation with over 130 employees across 5 countries and customers worldwide.

We are a leading recruitment management platform that assists companies and recruitment agencies to create a competitive advantage within their recruitment and hiring processes.

With Seek as our parent company we are fortunate to have access to a broad range of multinational resources whilst still maintaining our unique identity and the ability to make quick decisions.
All of our people actively contribute to our culture by lifting each other up, approaching problems with a positive mindset, sharing success, celebrating diversity and making software people want to use.

Our plans haven't changed through COVID19 and we will be scaling rapidly in the next 12-18 months. We cannot wait to help play a role in rebuilding a variety of industries with our clients and partners.

The Benefits

* An excellent remuneration package
* Flexibility to put your family first at all times
* Tools of the trade
* Collaborative team - positive and empathetic people who love to laugh either through social distancing in the office or virtually from home!
* Team building, fun activities and lots of social events
* Career Progression

The opportunity and responsibilities:

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst who can hit the ground running and work on the following tasks:

* Data migrations from clients legacy applications that involve restoring, mapping, updating and transferring into the target database
* Preparing reports for stakeholders and project team
* Creating visualisations of data
* Provide analysis to various internal departments across the business
* You will be part of a team of Project Managers, Business Analysts and Datas Analysts
* Generating information and insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns
* Developing strategies to optimise the quality of data delivery
* Devising new data collection and analysis processes
* Assessing quality of data and removing or cleaning data

Experience required:

If the following describes you, we would love to chat:

* Ability to work on multiple projects at the same time - Detail orientated
* Comfortable with autonomy, ambiguity and variety
* Have an appetite for a new work environment where you love coming to work everyday
* Excellent analytical skills - the ability to identify trends, patterns and insights from data.
* Presentation skills - ability to write and speak clearly to easily communicate complex ideas in a way that is easy to understand
* Problem solving skills
* You gain satisfaction from making a significant impact on client's business
* Understanding of databases such as SQL Server, Oracle and SAP
* Understanding of ETL framework and ETL tools including Alteryx and Microsoft SSIS

How to Apply for the role

To apply please attach your CV and a brief cover note explaining why you believe you would be the ideal candidate for this role.

We respond to ALL applicants. Tip for those who have read this far: we love video cover letters, give us your best shot!

fullDescription:
Lead Data Analyst – Manchester - circa £75,000

Interviewing and onboarding for this role will be going ahead remotely while Covid-19 restrictions are in place.

On behalf of our client, we are looking for an experienced Lead Data Analyst in Manchester. As a Lead Data Analyst, you will manage the development of customer analysis to provide insight into past performance, future forecasts, and opportunities for strategic improvements.

The Lead Data Analyst will be required to:

  • Design, prototype, deliver and maintain reports in Power BI, using SQL and DAX.
  • Design, prototype, deliver and maintain models in tools like R/Python/AWS Sage maker, using data science toolkits like dplyr or ggplot2.
  • Find useful structured and unstructured data in our Data Warehouse and Data Lake; suggesting and designing extensions that will improve our capabilities.
  • Be comfortable learning a data transformation tool like Matillion or SSIS.
  • Be comfortable working in an Agile Kanban workflow to safely code review, test and deploy solutions, using source control to manage changes.
  • Collaborate with product teams on a regular basis to plan and prioritize requests, discuss requirements, and ensure delivery of successful business outcomes.
  • Provide meaningful commentary to help decision-makers act on findings.


Benefits for the Lead Data Analyst:

  • Flexible working
  • Free On-site Gym Membership
  • Free parking and great public transport links

jobDescription: Greencore Boston are currently looking for a Technical Officer to support the delivery of the site complaints and microbiological systems and to deliver the required information and reports in relation to them.  Troubleshoot the Data Capture system performance on a day to day basis and write/introduce new procedures as required to ensure that there is no break in data records and data integrity is maintained at all times.<li...
fullDescription:
Greencore Boston are currently looking for a Technical Officer to support the delivery of the site complaints and microbiological systems and to deliver the required information and reports in relation to them.

  • Troubleshoot the Data Capture system performance on a day to day basis and write/introduce new procedures as required to ensure that there is no break in data records and data integrity is maintained at all times.
  • Collate and report on compliance with the complaints and microbiological systems to ensure that these manufacturing unit processes are audit ready at all times
  • Allocate each customer complaint to the appropriate person for action and track its progress through the process to ensure that complaints are dealt with in a timely manner and in accordance with the procedures.
  • Collate, analyse and present technical reports or answers to ad hoc questions to provide internal and external stakeholders with the appropriate level and frequency of information required to deliver their objectives.
  • Actively manage the technical databases, both day to day and ongoing developments, to ensure data accuracy, ability to deliver reporting requirements and forward planning to update in line with operational or technical requirements
  • Attend established business networks across the division and group, internal forums and customer meetings to share the requested results and analysis
  • Update all Raw Material information systems to ensure that the latest information is available to anyone who interrogates the system
  • Maintain Greencore and Customer central KPI to ensure that reporting requirements are compliant with the appropriate protocols and support in the preparation for and the delivery of such information during technical audits
  • Liaise with site QA, Process and NPD to ensure nutritional testing is done to meet launch deadlines and nutritional schedules
  • Ability to use web based lab system in order to prepare micro and nutritional reports
  • It would be useful to have familiarity with customer portals and functionality e.g. Evolve, Mcreate, Mycore, WPP, Spar – training will be given.
  • Liaise with site teams to ensure all hygiene swabbing is done as per schedules ( Micro, Allergens, Meat species, ATP ) and sufficient stock of testing kits is maintained.
Job Description

You may not have heard of us, but we’re sure you’ve tried our products. We’re a vibrant, fast-paced leading food manufacturer. Employing 12,200 colleagues across 16 world-class manufacturing sites and 18 distribution depots across the UK. We supply all the UK’s food retailers with everything from Sandwiches, soups and sushi to cooking sauces, pickles and ready meals.

Here in Boston we employ around 400 colleagues and produce ready to eat salads, prepared vegetables and snacks for many of the major retailers such as Coop, Boots, Greggs, Costco, Spar and BOL.

What we’re looking for
  • Degree calibre capability in Information Technology with specialist knowledge of databases and data analysis techniques and competent with large and complex data sets
  • Problem solving and decision-making skills
  • Advanced knowledge of Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint and ability to learn new systems quickly
  • Knowledge of statistical Process Control techniques
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience in chilled food manufacturing would be an advantage but is not essential

If this sounds like you, join us and grow with Greencore, and be a part of driving our future success.

What you’ll get in return
  • Competitive salary and job-related benefits
  • Holidays
  • Pension up to 8% matched
  • Company share save scheme
  • Greencore Qualifications
  • Exclusive Greencore employee discount platform

Throughout your time at Greencore, you will be supported with on the job training and development opportunities to further your career.

fullDescription:
Data Analyst (Cyber Security)
Utilities
Remote / Warick
6 months
£350 - £400 per day

Data Analyst with experience of Cyber Security systems required to join an international energy supplier.

Typically managing Data Sets, usage of PowerBI and Excel and presenting findings via Tableau.

Data Analyst Responsibilities:

  • Advanced analytical knowledge of data
  • Perform complex analyses
  • Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion
  • Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets
  • Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines
  • Creation of Operational Metrics
  • Helping develop reports and analysis
  • Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata
  • Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements
  • Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalisation
  • Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems
  • Generating reports from single or multiple systems
  • Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports
  • Training end users on new reports and dashboards
  • Providing technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing

Data Analyst Requirements:

  • Expert Excel Skillsets
  • Experience with Service now (SNOW) portal
  • Experience with Configuration management database (CMDB)
  • Technical understanding of Operating Systems including Windows, Linux, UNIX etc
  • Technical Understanding of network appliances
  • Work experience as a data analyst or in related field.
  • Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
  • Ability to analyse existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.
  • Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms.
  • High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large scale databases.
  • Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
  • Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Bachelor's degree

Candidates will ideally show evidence of the above in their CV in order to be considered.

Permanent, City of London & Remote Working (100% due to pandemic, fully flexible  arrangements upon return to operational environment.) BI Analyst / SQL Data Analyst required to work with a multi-national Fintech company operating within...
fullDescription:
BI Analyst / SQL Data Analyst - Insurance, Fintech, MySQL/ PostgreSQL, Yellowfin, Qlik, Tableau, Business Objects. Datamarts, Datawarehousing, c£50k - £65k +Bonus +Benefits. Permanent, City of London & Remote Working (100% due to pandemic, fully flexible arrangements upon return to operational environment.)

BI Analyst / SQL Data Analyst required to work with a multi-national Fintech company operating within the Insurance sector. You will be responsible for Data Visualisation and Business Intelligence output for clients from the perspective of both report generation and dashboard development.

This role requires a solid understanding of datamarts, datawarehouses and multiple data sources, SQL concepts & principles in order to create meaningful business intelligence, reports and visualised data (graphs etc) using a variety of data visualisation tools from Yellowfin, Business Objects, Tableau or Qlik/Qlikview. Experience with just one of these tools is more than sufficient.

The BI Analyst / SQL Data Analyst will work closely with the BI Platform Product Owners and Product Manager to understand how data insights can be best utilised and build both reports, dashboards and automated reporting functionality as required by both internal and external clients. Internal stakeholder engagement to report on data governance and external client facing work to understand requirements and respond to ad-hoc data requests will form a significant part of this role. Some ETL work will be required (Talend is the employed tool but experience with any open-source or Java based ETL tools are acceptable) and as such you will work with both datamarts and datawarehouses in order to deliver data visualisation output utilising a range of tools listed above.

We are searching for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst / SQL Data Analyst / ETL Developer / Data Visualisation Analyst who possesses a solid understanding of data mapping and data testing in a range of environments. You may have been working with a mixed environment - (for example) MySQL, PostgreSQL and/or AWS Redshift - or solely within one of these or even simply SQL Server. You will ideally be able to manipulate data within SQL, manage data datamarts and datawarehouses and utilise various BI & DV tools combining experience of report writing and dashboard development. Excellent communication skills are pre-requisite and experience working in a client facing capacity would be a distinct advantage. Insurance / Life Insurance experience an advantage but non-essential.

Excellent opportunity to work within a stable, multi-national environment within a key role enabling the enhancement of enterprise level systems within a growing Fintech/Insurtech environment. Located in the City of London with excellent benefits and career progression prospects.

The company is onboarding staff during the pandemic with 100% work from home until normal business operation can be resumed at which point a flexible approach to a mix of office and home working will be enabled and fully supported.

jobDescription: Our London market insurance client is currently seeking a Data Analyst to work on various predictive analytics projects which aim to use predictive modelling to build better pricing models for the business. You will work alongside Data Engineers and Predictive  Modellers to source data, discover and fix data issues, and work with various teams in the business to enrich data across the organisation. Although the role is very hands-on technica...
fullDescription:
Our London market insurance client is currently seeking a Data Analyst to work on various predictive analytics projects which aim to use predictive modelling to build better pricing models for the business. You will work alongside Data Engineers and Predictive Modellers to source data, discover and fix data issues, and work with various teams in the business to enrich data across the organisation. Although the role is very hands-on technically, the Data Analyst is expected to own conversations within the business and act as a Business Analyst at times in order to come to resolutions and move onto the next issue.

Essential skills/experience:

- Insurance experience and sound knowledge of how insurance businesses function (London markets preferred but not essential)

- SQL expertise

- Experience of heavy data wrangling / dealing with difficult data

Other useful experience:

- Exposure to working with/close to Pricing and Actuarial teams within insurance businesses

- Python

- Experience of working with cloud technology such as Azure, AWS or Google Cloud Platform

Please note this role will be entirely remote whilst the client's office remains closed. Post-Covid restrictions it is expected the contractor comes into the office twice per week. The role is OUTSIDE IR35.

If interested, please apply immediately and we'll endeavour to get in touch with successful candidates ASAP.

Eames Consulting is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their issues and questions and address them via relevant data-based solutions  Extract, transform and model data to create a self-service data ...
fullDescription:
My client is looking for a outstanding individual who has 3 + years as a Data Analyst in a data driven environment, experience within the Financial Services Industry focusing on insurance.

  • Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their issues and questions and address them via relevant data-based solutions
  • Extract, transform and model data to create a self-service data analytics platform
  • Provide ad-hoc reports to answer business questions
  • Design, implement and maintain intuitive dashboards and insights for enabling data-driven decisions
  • Define and create appropriate KPIs for tracking business metrics
  • Engage with end-users and provide support where required
  • Collaborate with the team to create a backlog of work to achieve the roadmap milestones.
  • Solid experience building, deploying, maintaining, and supporting reports via SSRS/SSIS or BI tools (ELK, Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
  • Ability to define and create appropriate KPIs and insightful stories to track the right metrics in business dashboards
  • Advanced SQL skills to extract and model data from a variety of data sources
  • Experience implementing Data Warehouse models, ETL processes
  • Experience with SDLC within a Data Warehouse context, including experience using Git and familiarity with Continuous Integration and Deployment
  • Excellent communication skills with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Proactive and motivated team player
  • Creative problem solver
  • Strong attention to details
  • Good understanding of Data Security practices
  • Familiarity with basic statistical concepts

Successful candidates ideally will have the following skills and experience:

  • 3+ year experience as a Data Analyst in a data-driven environment
  • Experience within the Financial Services Industry, with a focus on the Insurance Industry.
  • Professional demeanour and strong communication skills, both written and oral, facilitating effective communication to all levels of management.
  • Pro-active, self-motivated and good use of own initiative
  • Excellent sense of organisation, initiative and prioritisation of objectives, with the ability to balance multiple projects and other responsibilities

jobDescription: A well known Accountancy & Business Advisory Firm is looking for a new junior Data Analyst to join their ever growing team based in Reading.  Client Details Data Analyst - Accountancy & Business Advisory The organisation is a large accountancy and business advisory firm providing integrated advice and solutions to help businesses navigate a changing world. The compan...
fullDescription:
A well known Accountancy & Business Advisory Firm is looking for a new junior Data Analyst to join their ever growing team based in Reading.

Client Details

Data Analyst - Accountancy & Business Advisory

The organisation is a large accountancy and business advisory firm providing integrated advice and solutions to help businesses navigate a changing world.


The company operates in multiple locations across the UK, employing over 5,000 people offering tax, audit and assurance, and a range of advisory services.

Description

Data Analyst - Accountancy & Business Advisory

Responsibilities

  • Import/export/set up of data in systems along with data manipulation and analysis.
  • Carry out first-line support tasks on software we provide technical support on.
  • Contribute to and encourage knowledge documentation and sharing in the Support team with resolution of calls.
  • Proactively analyse, identify and remedy potential issues with software as part of the support process.
  • Work with the others to carry out software and file integration testing.
  • Check for any issues with the operation of the new applications with the existing system software and applications.
  • Contribute to the smooth running of the team by following business processes of integration and automation and helping to improve those processes.

Profile

Data Analyst - Accountancy & Business Advisory

Requirements

  • MS Office skills must be competent overall, but strong in Excel (essential)
  • Using MS Excel, must be able to analyse, manipulate and check large amounts of data quickly using in-built tools such as copy/paste values, text to column, filtering, sorting, lookups, conditional formatting, tables, pivot tables (essential)
  • Ability to understand CSV, flat and XML files
  • Experience of import/export of data into systems to carry out such work
  • Hands on knowledge of databases including MS Access, SQL and/or Oracle
  • Salesforce administration knowledge
  • Automation tool knowledge
  • Must be capable of working with remotely located colleagues and clients using tools such as WebEx and Skype (essential)
  • Experience of supporting software systems either on premise or cloud systems

The ideal candidate will be:

  • Quick to learn new software and processes to carry out testing.
  • Able to work on their own initiative and as part of a team.
  • Strong on their inter-personal and communication skills.
  • Good with their administrative and process skills, with an ability to handle multiple tasks methodically and systematically.
  • Able to carry out tasks and work showing attention to detail.
  • A good verbal communicator who enjoys and is at ease with conversations and meetings with internal personnel at all levels.
  • In touch with technology developments and an interest in learning new things.
  • Ideally capable of problem solving and, having analytical and research skills.

Job Offer

A basic salary of up to £25,000 plus excellent company benefits and a defined route for rapid progression within the company.

fullDescription:
Lead Data Analyst - Manchester

Lead Data Analyst, with strong experience in SQL, DAX, data analysis and Power BI is required by a leading banking company in Manchester. If you have any experience in Python, R, AWS or Snowflake then this would be a bonus. My client is looking for a lead data person due to growth that are able to analyse data, crunch the numbers but then transform the data into a commercial setting, reporting to the business what the numbers mean in commercial terms. The key skillset they are looking for is:

  • Over 8 years of Data & insight analysis experience
  • Experience of Data Science, forecasting, and financial modelling
  • Design, prototype, deliver and maintain reports in Power BI, using SQL and DAX.
  • Previous experience of working with complex data sets
  • Ideally some experience in financial services or similar industry with a wide range of complex data
  • Ability to find useful structured and unstructured data in a Data Warehouse and Data Lake, then suggesting and designing extensions that will improve data capabilities
  • If you have any experience of AWS, Python or R then this would be a bonus

This Senior Data Analyst role is part of a wider data team of 10 people made up of both data analysts and data engineers. You will be interrogating the data, analysing it and then reporting what it means to the wider business. This means you will work with product owners and other stakeholders on a wide range of projects. These include acquisition, for example, analysing the data on how many customers are brought on board and present business cases on where improvements can be made through analysis. Other areas could be the overall marketplace of the which products will be most appealing to consumers and why. As the senior data analyst, your job will be use date to drive revenues

My client is open on salary at the moment and they offer excellent benefits including working from home.

To apply press apply now or send your CV to matthew.leach @ Circlerecruitment.com

?

fullDescription:
We are currently supporting a highly recognised Training Provider based in the East Midlands.

This Training Provider is rated as outstanding and part of a Social Enterprise.

The company has an excellent reputation and has strong values for the delivery of quality training.

To support growth, we are now looking to recruit a Data Analyst/Business Intelligence Developer.

This is a fixed term contract until March 2022, however there is a strong possibility of the role becoming permanent.

As an experienced MI Analyst and BI Developer you can expect:

Competitive Salary up to £31059
25 days+ bank holidays
Business mileage paid at 45 pence per mile
Pension Scheme and Health Care

The LMI Analyst will play a critical role in enabling, defining, and delivering management information and systems development across the group. By building strong relationships across the business, you will elevate new and improved insight that will inform key business decisions.

Duties and Responsibilities of the Data Analyst and Business Intelligence Developer

Help write and optimise SQL database applications
Programming views, stored procedures, and functions.
Report production using SSRS, MS Excel & PowerBI.
Writing queries used for front-end applications (websites, desktop applications, or cloud apps)
Development and deployment of bespoke databases as identified and agreed.
Ensure performance, security, and availability of databases.
Handle common database procedures such as upgrades, backups, recovery, migration, etc.
Assist with the support of other Company SQL databases as required.
Maintain and develop Labour Market Information working with stakeholders across the business
Maintain and develop the Company’s client databases, in close liaison with system software supplier and operational staff
Develop BI Capabilities of the team by reviewing, recommending, and assisting in the deployment of appropriate software.
Assist with the delivery of required management information to customers and partners to agreed timescales.
Prepare documentation and specifications

Skills and Experience Required for the MI Analyst/BI Developer

Proven experience using Power BI or other reporting suites such as Tableau, Qlik, SAP BI
Advanced knowledge of SQL Server 2012, MS Visual Studio, SSRS, SSMS, and SSIS
Previous experience working in a related Data Analyst or Business Intelligence role
Ability to analyze, model, and interpret data, ETL procedures
High level of mathematical ability and problem-solving skills
Full UK license and access to own vehicle

For further information please contact Simon Atkins- Pertemps Newcastle on .

Keywords: MI Analyst, Data Analyst, BI Developer, Business Intelligence Developer, SQL Server, MS Visual Studio

fullDescription:
Fantastic Career Opportunity - Best suited for a recent graduate looking to begin (or continue) their career within Data Analytics

Join a thriving business with a growing portfolio of national and international clients. Financially-secure organisation, who have been established for over 10 years locally, with Great Head Offices based in Tunbridge Wells town.

Within this role, you will be responsible for:
- Sourcing, gathering and collating data from a variety of means. on a variety of product launch performances for clients.
- Running calculations to measure key indicators for a variety of product launches.
- Interpreting and reporting on data for the Account Managers to present into clients.

Wide variety of interesting clients projects - UK and international.

Super Starting Salary - £24,000
Free Parking nearby.

Excellent training provisions - several graduates have joined and successfully developed with the team over the last couple of years.


For this position, the ideal candidate would…..
- Be a recent graduate (numerical / analytical focused courses preferred).
- Thrive on problem solving and particularly confident with numeracy / calculations.
- Be an enthusiastic team player, who enjoys working alongside others to deliver high quality work on projects.
- Enjoy learning and want to develop a career using this skill-set.

Monday - Friday 09.00 - 17.30. Permanent position.

Applications are open.

Contact me - Miles Dutton at Recruitment Solutions Tunbridge Wells with any queries, alternatively apply now for immediate consideration.

Are you interested in becoming a Data Analytics Trainer for one of Europe’s leading & most established IT & Data Training providers?

We need someone with both teaching/training & data analysis industry experience to provide hands on data related training to groups of data analyst apprentices, who will come from a variety of companies and industries.

  • 25 days holiday standard - with the ability to buy additional holiday days
  • Life Assurance (4x your basic salary)
  • Private Medical insurance
  • Season ticket loan
  • Discounted gym membership
  • Group income protection

jobDescription: Spencer Clarke Group are working closely alongside Kingston Council to provide them with a Data Analyst on a 3-6 month initial contract which may be extended. fullDescription:
Spencer Clarke Group are working closely alongside Kingston Council to provide them with a Data Analyst on a 3-6 month initial contract which may be extended.

This role is full time, Monday – Friday, fully remote working and offers a pay rate of £200-£250 per day. Negotiable dependent on experience.

As a successful Data Analyst, your duties will be:

  • Develop and utilise a range of workforce reports using the trust workforce systems.
  • These reports will include key performance indicators to drive performance and compliance.
  • To provide expert advice and support on iTrent data availability, data definitions, workforce systems and their workflow and data integrity in order to support managers to interpret workforce planning information.
  • Monitor iTrent HR Systems, highlighting trends/key issues and update HR Systems Change/Issue log, highlighting trends/key issues.
  • Keep end users up-to-date with system developments/changes.
  • Gather requirements relating to any change requests relating to iTrent and other HR systems as required.
  • Plan, lead and execute a range of HR Systems projects, manage change requests and deliver issue resolutions.

To be considered, you will have the following knowledge/experience:

  • Experience of working and manipulating iTrent data to present in a user friendly way
  • An understanding and experience of workforce metrics and KPI’s
  • Use of google, pivot tables and excel to manipulate and present data. Ideally, previous use of Google studio for dashboards
  • Workforce analytics to present key themes and data in a user friendly way, working with the ODBP Team and Data and Digital Team
  • Minimum 2 years work experience in related field

If you wish to be put forward, please apply below and contact Cameron Nicholls @ Spencer Clarke Group. /

jobDescription: Juice is delighted to be supporting a fantastic client in their search for a Data Analyst, based in central Stroud. My client is building a brand new credit department, so you will be part of an exciting new team, whilst joining a leading and well-established  organisation. As a Data Analyst you will be someone with exceptional attention to detail, possessing excellent analytical skills and excels when working with data. Key Re...
fullDescription:
Juice is delighted to be supporting a fantastic client in their search for a Data Analyst, based in central Stroud. My client is building a brand new credit department, so you will be part of an exciting new team, whilst joining a leading and well-established organisation.

As a Data Analyst you will be someone with exceptional attention to detail, possessing excellent analytical skills and excels when working with data.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Produce regular department management information, including performance and productivity reporting
  • Keeping up to date with regulatory changes & ensuring the department is operating compliantly
  • Assist with the analysis of the debt recovery strategies
  • Analysis of our Debt Collection agency performance and sharing of this data
  • Review processes & customer communications to ensure collections and customer engagement is optimised
  • Work with other Customer Service departments to help develop strategy to form part of credit policy and vulnerability policy
  • Develop and implement mechanisms that monitor and review adherence to policy and process

Key Skills and Attributes:

  • Very high level of computer literacy, with proven experience of MS Office and Excel
  • Excellent analytical and numerical skills
  • Work well under pressure
  • Organised and ability to meet deadlines.

This is a fantastic opportunity to progress and establish yourself as a Data Analyst. Please don’t hesitate to call the Cheltenham Branch to speak further about this position.

Hours: 5 out of 6 working days a week with three shifts, 08.30-17.00, 09.30 - 18.00 & 10.30 - 19.00. Including Saturday's.

jobDescription: Business Data Analyst - iGaming / Sportsbook Operator - Malta Arnold Ash have been retained to identify and attract a Commercial Business Data Analyst to join a successful award winning international Sportsbook Operator. You must be an Analyst with some experience in iGaming / Betting industry. Working closely with  the Commercial Director and Chief Marketing Officer, the successful Analyst will be pivotal in enabling...
fullDescription:
Business Data Analyst - iGaming / Sportsbook Operator - Malta

Arnold Ash have been retained to identify and attract a Commercial Business Data Analyst to join a successful award winning international Sportsbook Operator. You must be an Analyst with some experience in iGaming / Betting industry. Working closely with the Commercial Director and Chief Marketing Officer, the successful Analyst will be pivotal in enabling data driven business optimisation and growth.

Essential experience of the Business Data Analyst:

  • iGaming / Online Gambling experience
  • Proven negotiation and stakeholder management capabilities.
  • Strong Excel knowledge.
  • Experience with BI tools such as SQL, Power BI, SSAS, SSRS.
  • Knowledge of OLAP cubes is ideal.
  • Ability to create effective reports and dashboards to present information clearly.
  • Good communication with a team player attitude.

Responsibilities of the Business Data Analyst:

  • Analyse online data and player behaviours in relation to multiple products and KPI’s.
  • Work with key stakeholders to produce recommendations and insights to support business strategies and decision making.
  • Utilise datasets to identify business critical measures such as areas for optimisation and wrong behaviour.
  • Evaluate business processes and data needs to identify business needs.
  • Act as key point of contact Business Intelligence team and Commercial team for data requests.

Full company information and job description available upon application.

Business Data Analyst - iGaming / Sportsbook Operator - Malta

Analysis data mapping specifications (Concept, table and field level mapping) from existing systems

Development/maintenance of processes and procedures to support the data analysis and system adapter implementation phases of projects.

Support pre-sales activities.

Improve efficiency in system adaptor analysis and reduction of bugs caused by specification errors.

The company offer a competitive basic salary and a comprehensive benefits package. The Data Analyst will be working from home for the foreseeable future with some UK travel possible.

Data Analyst

jobDescription: We are looking for a Data Scientist to join a global market leader on a full time, permanent basis, in Banbury. If you are an experience Data Scientist or an Analyst with SQL and looking for a jump into being a Data Scientist, we want to hear from you! The  role is responsible for the timely delivery of actionable results to support customer retention and acquisition growth within the Company. You will be expected to have strong commu...
fullDescription:
We are looking for a Data Scientist to join a global market leader on a full time, permanent basis, in Banbury. If you are an experience Data Scientist or an Analyst with SQL and looking for a jump into being a Data Scientist, we want to hear from you! The role is responsible for the timely delivery of actionable results to support customer retention and acquisition growth within the Company.

You will be expected to have strong communication, insight and storytelling techniques based upon the audience you are engaging with and being able to communicate and present back to the Management team - focusing on marketing and sales growth.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Serve as technical expert on the team, coordinating with the entire direct marketing team to support direct mail and wider marketing team functions, optimise data and system processes, and drive future innovation
  • Build machine learning systems to understand cross-channel interactions (online and offline)
  • Perform statistical analysis across diverse datasets to drive and measure performance
  • Execution and management of direct marketing campaigns including designing and writing programs and packages for extraction, segmentation, and statistical analysis on large datasets
  • Create holistic dashboards and reporting solutions that drive effective business decision-making for all levels of management
  • Pair knowledge of customer data, structures, and business rules, with an understanding of business needs to identify opportunities for new programs, support integration of new data elements and systems, scope and prioritize technical project work for the team
  • Research and evaluate advanced statistical and machine learning models, emerging tools and technologies in reporting, analytics, and data science
  • Participate in marketing database, customer data platform (CDP) and any other cross-functional projects as a subject matter expert on data science and advanced programming.
  • Provide support and training to the users on developed tools and solutions
  • Develop scalable tools to drive automation and optimize business processes

Key Skills and Experience required:

  • Professional experience performing database programming, data science and analytics.
  • Demonstrates advanced programming skills in R, Python, SQL, and SAS
  • Experience analysing multi-channel marketing campaigns involving A/B testing, multivariate testing, and segmentation techniques
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Domo, Power BI and Tableau is preferred.
  • Experience with Data Science in the cloud (AWS, Azure, Google) is preferred
  • Knowledge in advanced analytics concepts and algorithms (e.g., machine learning, statistical learning, Bayesian methods, neural networks, natural language processing, etc.)
  • Strong attention to detail, with an innovative problem-solving mindset

What's in it for you?

Benefits include a competitive salary of up to £42,000 and rewarding benefits package, health and life insurance, pension, annual salary reviews, free parking, and recognition and discount schemes. Your development and motivation are key to their success, therefore a complete a comprehensive induction programme and personal development training needs will regularly be assessed.

jobDescription: LTK Consultants have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the team in Birmingham. You will be employed on a full-time, permanent basis and in return, you will receive a salary of £25,000 per annum plus benefits. LTK Consultants is a leading automotive consultancy and training organisation dedicated to providing business solutions to companies throug...
fullDescription:
LTK Consultants have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the team in Birmingham. You will be employed on a full-time, permanent basis and in return, you will receive a salary of £25,000 per annum plus benefits.

LTK Consultants is a leading automotive consultancy and training organisation dedicated to providing business solutions to companies throughout the UK. Our services range from analysing the current market, through designing and developing solutions for growth to implementing & managing solutions.

What you will be doing as our Data Analyst:

- Data collection, input and production of reporting suite for each client and agents (daily/weekly/monthly)

- Distribution of reports to Senior Management Team

- Managing and manipulating large amounts of data to provide summarised analysis

- Producing high-quality management information

- Collating and producing ad-hoc reports and updates

- Extracting data from multiple reports and combining into single reports with dashboard commentary

- Producing written and verbal presentations of data analysis in an informative and approachable manner

What we are looking for in our Data Analyst:

- Demonstrable analytical skills, a passion for data and the ability to get into the detail whilst understanding the bigger picture

- Attention to detail and the ability to follow process – MUST

- Excellent mathematical and statistical skills

- PC numeracy and literacy (Microsoft Excel advanced ability is a must)

- SQL and/or Microsoft Access experience desirable

- Accuracy of data entry

- A demonstrable flexible approach to changes in the working practices and procedures

What are the benefits of joining our team as our Data Analyst?

- 22 days holiday + statutory bank holidays

- Flexible working hours

- Free on-site car parking

- Contributory Auto Enrolment Pension Scheme

- Staff facilities

- Health cash plan once passed probation

- Career progression actively supported

We are looking to recruit fun, outgoing people to join our vibrant culture where you really can make a difference, if that is you and you would like to join us as our Data Analyst click ‘Apply’ now. We’d love to hear from you!

jobDescription: Senior Informatics Data Analyst (9-month FTC)Location: Milton KeynesAs we move into 2021, the testing of Covid-19 samples remains of paramount importance. Due to this, we are currently recruiting for highly analytical individuals with a thorough knowledge of laboratory processes to help deliver this service. This role is based  in Milton Keynes within a laboratory solely focused on the testing of Covid-19 samples. <br...
fullDescription:
Senior Informatics Data Analyst (9-month FTC)
Location: Milton Keynes

As we move into 2021, the testing of Covid-19 samples remains of paramount importance. Due to this, we are currently recruiting for highly analytical individuals with a thorough knowledge of laboratory processes to help deliver this service. This role is based in Milton Keynes within a laboratory solely focused on the testing of Covid-19 samples.

Key responsibilities:
To lead the design and implementation of Bioinformatics Systems
To provide support to the end users and to the LIMS Developer
To provide data for and attend data quality meetings
To be responsible for the Informatics Data Scientists
To evaluate solutions and technologies to determine suitability
To manage relationships with various departments

Requirements:
Experience in programming languages (ideally SQL)
Knowledge of laboratory information management system (LIMS) platforms
A bachelors degree in a relevant discipline
Experience working with complex data sets
Line management experience

This is an excellent opportunity to use your skills in the fight against Covid-19. If you would like to hear more pleased send your CV to or apply within.

jobDescription: Business Data Analyst - FundsWest London/SurreyUp to £90k + Bonus & Benefits This is an excellent role supporting instrument and reference data globally. Business areas supported include Structured Products, Equities, Funds, Product Control, IT teams, Risk, Compliance, Operations & External Clients.The ideal candidate will have experience with in-depth use of full Life Cycle De...
fullDescription:
Business Data Analyst - Funds
West London/Surrey
Up to £90k + Bonus & Benefits

This is an excellent role supporting instrument and reference data globally. Business areas supported include Structured Products, Equities, Funds, Product Control, IT teams, Risk, Compliance, Operations & External Clients.
The ideal candidate will have experience with in-depth use of full Life Cycle Development from inception to live launch and maintenance.

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

Maintain a GoldenCopy Fund reference data followed by data distribution to key downstream funds & trading systems

Work on internal projects and external projects, taking the PM lead on some smaller projects. Some level of Consultancy will be required to external teams to help them source the right data or define their requirements more fully. Second level support on Production issues will be required from time to time on more complex issues. Sometimes this person will support the Operations teams in delivering new Fund Launch types. Helping to define the right structure and set up for new Funds that do not fit current available structures. The Data Dictionary is being migrated to a new third party platform and this person will assist in delivering some components of that.

  • Perform analysis to define detailed requirements and solutions for Business requirements and problems
  • Take the lead on small projects to deliver new functionality or content in Product Hub
  • Provide Consultancy to other Project teams on how to meet their requirements from Product Hub
  • Provide Consultancy and support to Operations teams on Fund Launches and changes
  • Support Production Support in the resolution of more complex issues
  • Keep Stakeholders informed on progress and current status
  • Maintain the Data Dictionary
  • Provide regular reporting updates on progress to the Programme Manager
  • Data Gap Analysis, Data Reconciliation with upstream and downstream systems.
  • Exception Management and Data Remediation to enhance data quality.

Technical Knowledge:

Specialized in MS Excel, SQL (Oracle, SQL Server), Excel Pivots, Power BI for data analysis; experience in DevOps tools like Git, Splunk, Jira

Platforms - MS Azure, Apache Hadoop, SAP, Oracle, Power Bi, MS SQL, Salesforce, CitiDirect, SharePoint, MS Project, O365, Atlassian Jira & Confluence and Workfront.

jobDescription: Lead Data Analyst – Manchester - circa £75,000 Interviewing and onboarding for this role will be going ahead remotely while Covid-19 restrictions are in place. On behalf of our client, we are looking for an experienced Lead Data Analyst in Manchester. As a Lead Data Analyst, you will manage the development of customer analysis to provide insight into past performance, future forecasts, and opportunities for strategic  ...
fullDescription:
Lead Data Analyst – Manchester - circa £75,000

Interviewing and onboarding for this role will be going ahead remotely while Covid-19 restrictions are in place.

On behalf of our client, we are looking for an experienced Lead Data Analyst in Manchester. As a Lead Data Analyst, you will manage the development of customer analysis to provide insight into past performance, future forecasts, and opportunities for strategic improvements.

The Lead Data Analyst will be required to:

  • Design, prototype, deliver and maintain reports in Power BI, using SQL and DAX.
  • Design, prototype, deliver and maintain models in tools like R/Python/AWS Sage maker, using data science toolkits like dplyr or ggplot2.
  • Find useful structured and unstructured data in our Data Warehouse and Data Lake; suggesting and designing extensions that will improve our capabilities.
  • Be comfortable learning a data transformation tool like Matillion or SSIS.
  • Be comfortable working in an Agile Kanban workflow to safely code review, test and deploy solutions, using source control to manage changes.
  • Collaborate with product teams on a regular basis to plan and prioritize requests, discuss requirements, and ensure delivery of successful business outcomes.
  • Provide meaningful commentary to help decision-makers act on findings.


Benefits for the Lead Data Analyst:

  • Flexible working
  • Free On-site Gym Membership
  • Free parking and great public transport links


How to Apply if You’re Interested in this Job

If this sounds like your perfect role, click Apply without delay!

If it’s not quite the job you’re looking for, details of all our current roles can be found on our website, www.adriasolutions.co.uk



Lead Data Analyst - Manchester – circa £75,000

jobDescription: A leading consultancy are looking to hire a Data Analyst - Manager The role will be based in Cardiff, however as a result of the wide variety of clients and projects, you may be asked to work in other locations and beyond, sometimes at short notice and sometimes  over lengthy periods of time. Your desire and ability to do this will be discussed as part of the recruitment process. Candidates who are unable or do not wish to work on projects i...
fullDescription: A leading consultancy are looking to hire a Data Analyst - Manager The role will be based in Cardiff, however as a result of the wide variety of clients and projects, you may be asked to work in other locations and beyond, sometimes at short notice and sometimes over lengthy periods of time. Your desire and ability to do this will be discussed as part of the recruitment process. Candidates who are unable or do not wish to work on projects in other locations will still be considered. As a Manager you will be able to resolve unusual and nonstandard problems and issues, is aware of alternative options and approaches to situations, can guide and advise others in this skill and is able to look ahead and anticipate. Displays extensive practical experience and applied knowledge of the subject in a wide range of work situations. Is seen as a role model for others and people will seek their advice. May be involved in coaching or mentoring activities related to this skill. Requirements We're looking for candidates with the following: Essential: * Experience working as a data analyst in a corporate function * Knowledge and/or certifications demonstrating capability working with data models and reporting packages (ideally Power BI) * Ability to analyse large datasets * Ability to design and develop comprehensive reports * Strong verbal and written communication skills * An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving * Demonstrable experience of success within a range of complex project environments and sectors * Proven ability to integrate well into a team and build relationships with senior stakeholders * Proven analytical and skeptical mindset with an ability to develop solutions to technical problems

jobDescription: A leading consultancy are looking to hire a Senior Data Analyst The role of Data Analyst is focused on the process of inspecting, cleansing, modelling and visualising data with the objective of discovering and leveraging useful information, that can be used  to support evidence based decision making. Our data analyst is expected to make recommendations about the methods and ways in which our engagement teams use and analyse data to improve q...
fullDescription: A leading consultancy are looking to hire a Senior Data Analyst The role of Data Analyst is focused on the process of inspecting, cleansing, modelling and visualising data with the objective of discovering and leveraging useful information, that can be used to support evidence based decision making. Our data analyst is expected to make recommendations about the methods and ways in which our engagement teams use and analyse data to improve quality and the usefulness of data systems. Key activities include, but not be limited to: * Defining data requirements to support business issues / queries * Defining the process for how data will be captured and managed * Collecting and interpreting data * Analysing results * Identifying patterns and trends in datasets * Visualising the data to convey complex data sets into meaningful management information * Defining new data collection and analysis processes Role description: The Data Analyst will be required to support engagement teams with a number of tasks, which are supported through various data collection, interrogation and visualisation activities. Typical examples of these are included below: * Volume analysis: forecasting capability and capacity against expected volume and throughput. * Through life cost modelling: analyses design, manufacture and in-service support costs to understand the key drivers and trade-offs between options and product lifecycle phases. * Effective inventory management: uses data analysis and forecasting techniques to ensure clients only hold stock required which reduces product loss. Essential Experience: * Experience working as a data analyst in a corporate function * Knowledge and/or certifications demonstrating capability working with data models and reporting packages (ideally Power BI) * Ability to analyse large datasets * Ability to design and develop comprehensive reports * Strong verbal and written communication skills * An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving * Demonstrable experience of success within a range of complex project environments and sectors * Proven ability to integrate well into a team and build relationships with senior stakeholders

This high volume and multi-faceted role has the responsibility for SSI processing, uploading new customer details  to the bank and monitoring SWIFT messaging systems, making relevant amendments to Standard Settlement and payment instructions when requested. Additionally, you will be tasked with ne...
fullDescription: Leading commercial bank is in search of a data specialist with specific experience working on the registration process of new clients to the bank. This high volume and multi-faceted role has the responsibility for SSI processing, uploading new customer details to the bank and monitoring SWIFT messaging systems, making relevant amendments to Standard Settlement and payment instructions when requested. Additionally, you will be tasked with new bond creation and registering ISDA and CSA information whilst taking an active role in projects and system enhancement initiatives. Previous use of CIF, Accord and SUN would be beneficial.

Job Purpose Work with the Finance team to improve the integrity of data in our Time & Fees sytem and deliver improvements to benefit the wider firm. Role...
fullDescription:
An exciting opportunity to join our finance team in delivering a data integrity improvement project.  Although this will begin as  a fixed term contract, there could be an opportunity for career progression for the right candidate.

Job Purpose

Work with the Finance team to improve the integrity of data in our Time & Fees sytem and deliver improvements to benefit the wider firm.

Role & Responsibilities

  • Support the Finance Business Partners on a Data improvement project which will seek to simplify the data in our systems
  • Engagement with our Shared Service Centre to implement updates and changes to our data.
  • Use excel to explore and analyse data sets. Collaborate with the Finance team and wider firm to make required data changes in a timely and accurate manner.

Skills & Experience Required

  • Profficient user of Excel, confident with the use of filters, formulas and pivot tables.
  • A keen eye for detail with a strong focus on ensuring data accuracy
  • Experienced with handling large data sets
  • Familiar with databases
  • Effective communicator able to convey key messages succinctly via email
  • Familiarity with a Times & Fees system wuld be preferential but not essential.
  • Good time management and ability to work to set deadlines
  • Adaptable to meet changing business requirements

£22 per hour - PAYE
Preston
4 Months contract

The Company:

Advantage Resourcing are currently recruiting for a Data Analyst for a 4 Months project with our prestigious defence engineering client in Preston.

The Role

The purpose of the Supply Chain Data Analyst is to conduct data analysis to improve the supply chain operations. Your job will help increase efficiency and reduce costs.

Main Duties:

  • Support engagement activities with the various customers identify data requirements/interfaces and collecting data
  • Recommending improvements to improve performance and reduce costs
  • Work with a number of stakeholders across various functions and business units to deliver service optimising capability in an agile manner
  • Development of models, capabilities and process which can be used to analyse and manipulate data, identify trends enhancing our support to the UK Hawk fleet
  • Plan and implement supply chain optimisation projects
  • Oversee inventory procedures (minimum balances, inventory additions, advance internal orders)
  • Locating and defining new process improvement opportunities

Successful Supply Chain Data Analyst:

  • Ideally similar experience & current SC Clearance with a Defence background
  • Ability to undertake numerical & statistical data analysis tasks.
  • Validation of data analysis.
  • Communicating analysis & key insights.
  • Understanding analysis constraints.
  • Knowledge of MS Office BI toolset Power BI, Cognos or Tableau Data visualisation and working experience of OPUS and Simlox would be ideal.
  • Competency in data modelling, including knowledge of SQL
  • Competency of supply chain process, inventory forecasting, demand management, inventory planning, warehouse planning

If you wish to apply for this Supply Chain Data Analyst, please apply with your up to date CV. Ref 837182

Advantage Resourcing is a service driven recruitment consultancy.
