fullDescription:
Are you an expert with Tableau software? Do you have the experience and certificates to show for it? A tech-enabled, B2C start-up within the Edtech space needs you to join their data analysis team on a 4-month basis. You will have a creative and analytical mind - going beyond the call of duty to provide original reports and insights on user information.

The Role

  • Discover creative and original insights from the data and relay it to stakeholders, high-level clients, and C-suite.
  • Perform ad-hoc analysis on requirements from C-suite.
  • Sort through large user data sets from the company’s mobile app
  • Display your results and insights in clear, interactive, and informative Tableau dashboards for all levels and areas of the company to understand

Essential Requirements

  • 2+ years’ experience with Tableau software
  • Comfortable dealing with stakeholders, high-level clients and C-Suite
  • Evidence of high-level reporting for a well-regarded/established SME
  • 2:1 or higher from a Russell Group University
  • Some form of Tableau certification

Non-Essential Requirements

  • Experience at a Tableau/Alteryx-orientated consultancy
  • Bi/multilingual
  • Experience in an Edtech / Tech-Enabled / App service before

jobDescription: DATA ANALYST (CONTRACT)£125-150 PER DAY6 MONTHSFULLY REMOTE A major retailer is looking to add a Data Analyst to their team to manually move & input data in order to assist on an ERP system migration. THE ROLE:  As a Data Analyst, you will be helping to migrate data from a legacy ERP system to a newly developed system. You'll be responsible for...
fullDescription:
DATA ANALYST (CONTRACT)
£125-150 PER DAY
6 MONTHS
FULLY REMOTE

A major retailer is looking to add a Data Analyst to their team to manually move & input data in order to assist on an ERP system migration.

THE ROLE:

As a Data Analyst, you will be helping to migrate data from a legacy ERP system to a newly developed system. You'll be responsible for validating the data coming from the legacy system, improving the data quality and correctly inputting the data to the new database.

In specific, you can expect to be involved in the following:

  • Pulling legacy data into Excel and/or Google Sheets
  • Performing Data Validation within Excel / Google Sheets
  • Cleansing & fixing Data inaccuracies
  • Inputting clean, accurate data into the new ERP System.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

The successful Data Analyst will have the following skills and experience:

  • A strong appreciation of databases and an understanding of the theory behind them
  • Experience managing data in an Excel or Google Sheets environment
  • Experience working with ERP systems and in working to improve Data Quality
  • A background in retail would be a benefit but overall a quick learner is desired!

THE BENEFITS:

The successful Data Analyst will receive between £125 and £150 per day over an initial 6-month period.

HOW TO APPLY:

Please register your interest by sending your CV to Joseph Pyne via the Apply link on this page.

PLEASE NOTE: While this is a fully remote position, the applicant must have the Right to Work in the UK without sponsorship

jobDescription: At Utilita we believe in enabling people to be the best that they can be. Our determination to succeed is achieved by us working together with a common goal: to service our customers in the best possible way and challenge the status quo. So how do we do that?  By using innovative technology. Our award-winning App, My Utilita, is one of the top three of its kind on Google Play, and our cont...
fullDescription:
At Utilita we believe in enabling people to be the best that they can be. Our determination to succeed is achieved by us working together with a common goal: to service our customers in the best possible way and challenge the status quo.

So how do we do that?

  • By using innovative technology. Our award-winning App, My Utilita, is one of the top three of its kind on Google Play, and our continued focus on using new technology is why Utilita is ranked third in the Southern Tech 100. Our regulator, OFGEM, has praised us for the technology we use to interact with our vulnerable customers.
  • We have a product to be proud of. Utilita were the first to install a SMART meter back in 2008. We currently have around 800,000 customers and we are going from strength to strength, diversifying our portfolio into other pay as you go offerings.
  • Making a difference for our customers. Every month Utilita gives customers the chance to win free energy and cash prizes through our customer Jackpot.
  • Making a difference to the community. As others move away from the high street, Utilita have opened several Retail Hubs across the country. Helping to integrate into the community by offering free use of community rooms and a local service.

In order to ensure we can do all of that, we provide:

  • A continuous development culture, through our leadership programmes, apprenticeships and learning platforms.
  • Employee engagement we appreciate our staff and want to know what they think. We were recently awarded "one to watch" by the Sunday Times 100 Best Companies to work for, a vote of confidence from our staff that we’re doing lots of things right.
  • We have a peer recognition scheme - the Great 8 - because we understand how good it feels to be valued and appreciated.

What part can you play in making a difference?

Joining a small team of analysts, you will investigate and resolve data exceptions in the Meter Operations, Meter Asset Management and Smart Meter Change of Supplier processes.

You will be liaising with internal departments and external companies to ensure the accuracy of the data we send out and validate the data that we receive, to ensure the correct information is held and the Smart Meter configurations are accessible in our customer database.

You will be working closely with Gas and Electric Settlements and Field services teams, as well as supporting the Commercial Finance team with the resolution to meter rental charge related queries.

What do we need from you?

Knowledge and understanding of the energy industry. You will have a keen eye for detail and high level of numeracy and accuracy. You will be experienced in using spreadsheets or databases and working with large volumes of data.

You will be an effective communicator both written and verbally. You will be able to spot trends and identify discrepancies. You can adjust and thrive in a fast growing, challenging industry and can work alone as well as part of a team.

What can we give back in return?

  • A great work life balance. We have moved to the new normal where we offer the option to work from home, With occasional visits to the office for team days etc.
  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays.
  • The opportunity to win tickets to major outdoor events with Utilita Extra - when they are back up and running! Including, gigs and shows at the Utilita Newcastle and Birmingham arenas.
  • Discounted employee energy tariffs.
  • Utilita bonus scheme.
  • We are a patron of the Princes Trust and offer all our staff a paid volunteering day every year plus various fun fund raisers.
  • A health care scheme that includes dental, eyecare, treatments and diagnostics health consultations.
  • Employee Assistance Programme with access to counselling support, legal and financial advice 24/7 365 days a year, as well as a GP line and Your Care.
  • Access to hundreds of discounts including gym memberships, shops, restaurants, travel and accommodation.

jobDescription: Data Analyst, Derby A new role with a rapidly expanding and multiple award-winning company in Derby. Data plays an increasingly important part of their business and as a result of continued growth, they have an excellent opportunity for a talented Data Analyst to join them. The firm uses an SQL based case management system to manage the recovery of bulk  debts and as the basis of internal and external reporting...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst, Derby

A new role with a rapidly expanding and multiple award-winning company in Derby.

Data plays an increasingly important part of their business and as a result of continued growth, they have an excellent opportunity for a talented Data Analyst to join them. The firm uses an SQL based case management system to manage the recovery of bulk debts and as the basis of internal and external reporting.

This role will cover the full spectrum of data management and analysis, from accurate client reporting to collating performance data and using it to help define and optimise their operational strategies.

They are looking for a hands-on individual who is a natural problem solver with excellent data analytical skills and overall data accuracy. The successful candidate will be a self-starter who takes on responsibility for all things 'data’.

Key responsibilities:

  • Review the current data capture, reporting and overall use of data in the business.
  • Deliver the results under the direction of the Operational Management team.
  • Use performance data to help identify and highlight any debt recovery trends with particular clients, industries or the department as a whole.
  • Own and drive new KPIs, metrics and tools relevant to the collections business performance.
  • Recommend improvements and present findings as required by the Operational Management team.
  • Work with the Management team to identify ways in which data informs team strategy and ensures focus on total quality management.
  • Work with the Systems Development team where required to review data extraction and transfer.
  • Continually improve client reporting.
  • Ensure accuracy of data at all times.
  • Support the Business Development team with data requirements for clients, pitches, and marketing.
  • Manage and deliver specific data-related projects for the business as required; and
  • Take ownership of data management/analysis and be able to communicate information to different levels within the business.

Candidate background

  • Have experience of data analysis in a commercial setting.
  • Have experience in working with large data sets.
  • Possess excellent IT skills with the ability to produce informative reports.
  • Have advanced skills in Microsoft Excel.
  • Have knowledge and experience of SQL.
  • Be able to prioritise your own workload to meet deadlines; and
  • Have great communication skills including the presentation of data and findings.

jobDescription: This role would suit someone with a great knowledge of SQL Server, a guru of SSIS & construction of reporting suites and ideally someone with previous experience with Azure. Client Details My client is a partnership-driven firm that works closely with a diverse mixture of both local and multinational firms to facilitate their growth and allow them access to facilities that are unrivalled in regards to locat...
fullDescription:
This role would suit someone with a great knowledge of SQL Server, a guru of SSIS & construction of reporting suites and ideally someone with previous experience with Azure.

Client Details

My client is a partnership-driven firm that works closely with a diverse mixture of both local and multinational firms to facilitate their growth and allow them access to facilities that are unrivalled in regards to location, services and environment. They are a champion for flexible working and provide start-up with the environment needed to prosper.

Description

· You will be responsible for redesigning the way the firm creates reports & visualisation of the firms data. (Power BI predominantly)


· Improving, designing and advancing the data warehouse & capture and ETL (SSIS) processes.

· Own the backlog for this area and help define the technical data tools and report priorities.

· Over time manage a small team of similar type resources and oversee the expansion of the team.

· Develop new data tools and services by understanding the business requirements, priorities and needs and provide a solution to them.


· Contribute to the company's data governance (e.g. geographical standards) and standards across all Instant systems, providing data quality audit and reports where needed.

· Be the go-to Power BI report creation specialist for any internal super users with Power BI queries

Profile

Essential Skills:

- ETL development (SSIS Package Knowledge)

· Hands on expert knowledge of Power BI (inc. DAX), Azure (data factory, SQL, data lake), SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)

-Azure (data factory, SQL, data lake)

· Strong data interrogation and analysis skills through use of tools such as SQL

· Strong communicator - Effective user liaison to all levels of seniority, effective at building relationships

Desirable Skills

- Exceptional excel skills

- R & Python skills

Job Offer

A salary of up to £60,000 is on offer to the successful candidate as well as a bonus scheme and in line with the firms values flexible working post quarantine.

jobDescription: Are you an experienced CRM Data Analyst ready for your next temporary assignment? If so, this international organization awaits your arrival. Data Analyst You will respond to email inquiries from retailer's customer service centres utilizing a CRM tool. The majority of these will be where is my parcel type inquiries - circa 70%. The individual will then need to investigate the query using a number of dif...
fullDescription:
Are you an experienced CRM Data Analyst ready for your next temporary assignment?

If so, this international organization awaits your arrival.

Data Analyst

You will respond to email inquiries from retailer's customer service centres utilizing a CRM tool. The majority of these will be where is my parcel type inquiries - circa 70%. The individual will then need to investigate the query using a number of different systems, analyzing the information/data that they provide and then drawing appropriate conclusions. Then appropriate responses will need to be selected and returned to the retailer. Furthermore, escalations will need to be raised where appropriate and resolved with a customer-focused mindset.

Required skills

  • Practically minded on performing investigations using multiple computer systems.
  • Good communication skills - verbal and written.
  • Comfortable with remote working.
  • Excel literate - V-Look-ups, Pivot Tables

Preferred skills

  • Experience with Zendesk/CRM tools
  • Comfortable with online spreadsheets/Quips

YOU WILL WORK REMOTELY

Interested? Apply Now!!

Parkside Recruitment Ltd is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy. Parkside Recruitment is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

jobDescription: IBOR Management Information Data Analyst Venn Group is currently recruiting for an IBOR Data Analyst to work at a global international investment bank in London. This contract opportunity offers an initial project delivery of approximately 12 months with a view to extend further. This role is best suited for an experienced Business Analyst with a hands on Project Management skillset who understands complex regu...
fullDescription:
IBOR Management Information Data Analyst

Venn Group is currently recruiting for an IBOR Data Analyst to work at a global international investment bank in London. This contract opportunity offers an initial project delivery of approximately 12 months with a view to extend further.

This role is best suited for an experienced Business Analyst with a hands on Project Management skillset who understands complex regulations, data management and who has worked on multiple projects in the banking / financial services industry.

The candidate will be responsible for overseeing the IBOR Discontinuation Programme, supporting the delivery of regulatory driven project and complex change across the EMEA region. This role will support by developing MI solutions and providing data extracts to the project stakeholders in a timely and professional manner.

It is essential that that the candidate has worked a solid understanding of banking and financial instruments required, technical expertise required to analyse data sourced from bank system infrastructure and can interface between Finance and Control, Front Office, OAD and PD-ITSD to provide reports and updates to SteerCo members.

The ideal candidate will come have demonstrable experience in project management and have had oversight of a regulatory project, as they will be responsible facilitating appropriate governance for change. The candidate should also have significant experience using waterfall, agile and hybrid methodologies.  

Additional responsibilities include; IBOR data requests from to regulators, creation of ad-hoc reporting, and to develop key metrics for reporting dashboards. It is required that the candidate has previous experiencing working with the business on project scope & goals, objectives & business justification, secure resources (people and budget) and can justify the project objectives.

Further duties include; performing complex data analysis, data interpretation, process mapping, and management reporting.

It is advantageous to have a PRINCE2 /PMI qualification, Agile accreditation or equivalent experience.

To explore this opportunity, please contact the Financial Services team at Venn Group on and email your CV to .

jobDescription: Sales Data Analyst  Havant £25-35K based on experience This role will support senior management with sales data reporting including sales forecast v sales results; performance reports, analysing sales conversions, assisting with the development of CRM and other duties. Advanced Excel is essential in this role,  along with understanding how technology can improve per...
fullDescription:
Sales Data Analyst

Havant

£25-35K based on experience

This role will support senior management with sales data reporting including sales forecast v sales results; performance reports, analysing sales conversions, assisting with the development of CRM and other duties. Advanced Excel is essential in this role, along with understanding how technology can improve performance and business efficiency, knowledge of MS Power Bi is also highly desirable.

Main Duties:

  • Producing regular performance management reports
  • Forecast sales performance v target
  • Managing multiple tasks and projects of varying size
  • Analysing data and systems to identify opportunities for performance improvement, to spot trends and to improve business efficiency
  • Analysing data to spot trends
  • Employee bonus and commissions calculations
  • Regularly analysing data to ensure accuracy and keep errors to a minimum
  • Support, work closely and provide input to internal CRM development team
  • Having an awareness of the wider business, so that the analysis can be completed in context

Skills and Knowledge:

  • Advanced user in Microsoft Excel
  • Excellent analytical and numerical skills
  • Ability to analyse and produce reports and recommendations
  • Keen eye for accuracy and detail orientated
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Demonstrate a high level of integrity and professionalism
  • Experience in using a BI tools such as Microsoft Power BI or Tableau or basic SQL would be highly desirable
  • Be able to work autonomously

jobDescription: Graduate / Entry level Data Analyst Your new companyA well established and successful company operating within the growth industry of environmental compliance and consultancy. The company has achieved year on year growth and is the perfect environment for a driven individual to fulfil their working ambitions.Your new role To be an integral part of the compliance team providing technical support and a...
fullDescription:
Graduate / Entry level Data Analyst

Your new company

A well established and successful company operating within the growth industry of environmental compliance and consultancy. The company has achieved year on year growth and is the perfect environment for a driven individual to fulfil their working ambitions.

Your new role
To be an integral part of the compliance team providing technical support and a high level of customer service to existing customers, ensuring a positive retention record is maintained and building strong customer relations. Carrying out detailed data analysis when required and supporting the sales team in the achievement of company growth targets by offering technical input with the securing of new business and ensuring opportunities are optimised within the existing customer database. This is an ideal opportunity for an outgoing, analytical, intelligent and ambitious individual looking to make an impression and develop within a forward-thinking company.

What you'll need to succeed

  • Educated to degree level you will have strong IT skills and be an expert using MS Excel
  • You will be excited by data and have a logical and methodical approach to data analysis.
  • At the very least you need to be outgoing with a strong focus on customer service.
  • You will work well in a team and will be flexible and open to change when business demands require.
  • You must have a strong work ethic, working well under pressure with excellent organisational skills and the ability to meet deadlines.
  • A UK driving license will be required in order to carry out on-site customer visits.


What you'll get in return

You can expect a basic salary of £19,000 (£23,000 with Bonus achievements), opportunity and support with personal development and progression, attractive holidays, flexible working hours, pension, medical insurance, sabbaticals, access to employee benefits platform and membership to the all-encompassing employee health and well-being programme, Other benefits include regular team building events, volunteering opportunities and many more.

What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

jobTitle: Actuarial Data Analyst - Health and Benefits
jobDescription: The RoleHealth and Benefits (‘H&B’) is a specialist centre of excellence in all aspects of health, wellbeing and risk consulting for corporate clients. With more than 200 consultants and support staff in the UK, this team provides a broad range of services to support  the design, financing and management of integrated health solutions that are tailored to meet clients’ needs.The H&B team assists clients in ma...
fullDescription:
The Role
Health and Benefits (‘H&B’) is a specialist centre of excellence in all aspects of health, wellbeing and risk consulting for corporate clients. With more than 200 consultants and support staff in the UK, this team provides a broad range of services to support the design, financing and management of integrated health solutions that are tailored to meet clients’ needs.
The H&B team assists clients in many ways, including to:
•    Benchmark existing employee benefit provisions and costs.
•    Design appropriate benefit programmes.
•    Finance and/or broker benefit programmes appropriately.
•    Consider broader wellness strategies.
•    Respond proactively to market developments and changes in legislation.
•    Establish proactive and robust governance frameworks.

Within the H&B team is a specialist actuarial/financial modelling and data analytics unit. The function of the specialist unit is spread across three main areas:
1) Data Analytics
The actuarial unit is at the forefront of H&B research and strategic innovation arm involving medical and employee benefit related data analytics and benchmarking. The unit is actively looking at areas of “connectivity” for our clients across the benefits spectrum, helping them to understand changing behaviours and trends. The successful candidate will be instrumental in driving the creative thinking in this area.
2) Accounting for post-retirement medical plans
This involves actuarial calculations and the preparation of disclosures for around 30 post-retirement medical plans for financial accounting purposes. The team also advises clients on related issues such as medical cost inflation and around de-risking of retiree medical plans.
3) Financial Modelling - supporting broking and consulting teams
The actuarial unit provides support to healthcare and risk benefits consultants within H&B, including work on financial modelling to deliver new and innovative solutions to clients on their health and risk related benefit programmes (examples include; independent pricing of employee benefits, captive reserving and assisting clients who wish to self-finance by developing funding strategies).
Responsibilities:
You will be expected to assist with the actuarial team’s expansion across each of the three core areas. Projects and tasks are likely to include:
  • Development of our data analytics proposition, incorporating advanced financial modelling and data science principles around innovative solutions covering healthcare and risk related programmes.
  • Data manipulation and actuarial calculations in respect of the preparation of financial accounting disclosures.
  • Preparation of written reports for financial disclosure documentation.
  • Financial modelling, including the benchmarking of underwriters’ terms against in-house rate calculations by modelling historical claim and risk profiles. Provision of financial modelling and intellectual support to brokers and consultants across H&B.
The Requirements
  • Candidates should have a genuine interest in data.  Ideally they would be part, nearly or newly qualified actuaries; or have a desire to pursue actuarial qualifications. 
  • Some knowledge and experience of working in the UK benefits market.
  • A background or interest in data analytics is a prerequisite, together with a strong skillset in proposition development.
  • Experience with programme languages such as R or Python and database systems such as SQL. 
  • An enthusiastic attitude and the ability to work independently are also attributes that we are looking for.
Flexibility on location base
Equal opportunity employer

fullDescription:
Data Analyst

Data Idols are working with a well know client who are looking for a Data Analyst to join an existing data team. Our client is an online innovator and they are disrupting the e-commerce space. This role is currently remote but as restrictions lift you will be expected to travel into their London office a few days a week.

THE ROLE

Within this Data Analyst role, you will be working closely with members of the Data Team. Ensure the tracking of relevant data points and validate data that is received. As a Data Analyst, you will be supporting the wider business with analytical insights, will be very confident in using SQL to retrieve data and have 3+ years commercial experince using Python and R.

YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • 3+ years of commercial experience
  • Experienced in Python and R
  • Able to use SQL to retrieve data
  • Ability to translate data into commercial insights

This is an outstanding opportunity for a SQL and Python confident Data Analyst to join an exciting company on a permanent basis with a great salary and benefits package. Please submit your CV for consideration.

SALARY

£40,000 - £50,000

Data Analyst

fullDescription:
Data Analyst - PowerBi, Excel, SQL - South Kent - Up to £30,000 plus benefits - ASAP Start

My client currently has a very exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join a talented team who devise Data solutions to report requirements, write reports or oversee the accuracy and integrity of externally produced reports.

Due to the pandemic, this role will initially be carried out on a remote basis however you will be required to travel to the office in South Kent at least twice a week.

This role will also require SC Clearance so all applicants will have to hold a valid British passport and be able to provide full UK address history for the last 5 years.

Daily Duties

  • Put data quality and accuracy at the forefront of your output with an eye always on the reports purpose and the information required
  • Identify areas to increase efficiency and automation of processes
  • Identify, evaluate and implement services and tools to support data validation and cleansing
  • Produce and track KPI's
  • Develop and support reporting processes
  • Monitor and audit data quality

Skills Required

  • Excellent understanding of Data Analysis
  • Strong ability in interpreting trends and patterns in data
  • Data modelling, enrichment and transformation
  • Creation of data workflows and document procedures
  • Knowledge of Data Protection and GDPR
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • The ability to produce clear graphical representations and data visualisations
  • Strong technical skills within the following;
    • PowerBI
    • MS SQL
    • MS Excel
    • PHP
    • Data Integration & Analytics

Due to this role requiring SC Clearance all applicants will have to hold a valid British passport and be able to provide full UK address history for the last 5 years.

This a great role for an individual to join a fantastic company who really look after their staff, provide excellent benefits, career progression and have a very low staff turnover. If you are looking for a challenging and varied role within Data Analysis, then please click apply now to be considered.

Suitable candidates will be contacted within 24 hours of applying.

This role is being managed by Jamie - Senior IT Recruitment Consultant at Pearson Whiffin.

Data Analyst - PowerBi, Excel, SQL - South Kent - Up to £30,000 plus benefits - ASAP Start

jobDescription: The Opportunity   A fantastic opportunity has arisen for a Senior Data Analyst to join a high-growth PE backed, Online FMCG business. After exceptional growth over the last 3-years this business is still thriving in the current climate & now wants to invest heavily in data  to maintain the growth trajectory. You will have a direct line into the C-Suite and have the opportunity to quickly progress into a 'Head of’ ...
fullDescription:
The Opportunity

A fantastic opportunity has arisen for a Senior Data Analyst to join a high-growth PE backed, Online FMCG business. After exceptional growth over the last 3-years this business is still thriving in the current climate & now wants to invest heavily in data to maintain the growth trajectory. You will have a direct line into the C-Suite and have the opportunity to quickly progress into a 'Head of’ role.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Report and monitor trading performance, including making recommendations on algorithm changes for sales and stock purchases.
  • Report and monitor customer metrics associated with lifetime value ('LTV’), suggesting ways to improve LTV.
  • Oversee and construct trials/experiments to improve revenue, profitability or other strategic goals (eg customer growth).
  • Prepare presentations, reports and case studies for the wider business to understand performance trends or communicate trials.
  • Attending pricing and trading meetings for specific geographical areas.
  • Maintaining a data dictionary, ensuring all KPIs and data points are defined within the business and used consistently.
  • Support the wider business through deep dives or other bespoke analysis to help drive improved profitability.
  • Support growth initiatives with bespoke analysis.
  • Creation of wire frames for development in Qlik or other reporting tools.
  • Overseeing and developing analysts.

Requirements:

  • Strong SQL skills
  • Advanced MS Excel skills
  • Advanced MS PowerPoint and Word skills
  • High standards of accuracy
  • Qliksense (beneficial)
  • Python / R (beneficial)

fullDescription:
Data Analyst – Senior Officer (Public Health Division)

Public Sector Organisation
Fully Remote Working

We are currently working with a public sector organisation who are needing the interim support of an experience data and intelligence analyst to assist them for the next 5 months at least, as the permanent member of staff is currently seconded to another team.

Key Experience:

  • Substantial experience of statistical analysis and interpretation of complex data from a variety of sources
  • Substantial experience and knowledge of epidemiological methodologies
  • Substantial experience and knowledge of working with multiple sets of health and/or social care related datasets
  • Substantial experience of managing relationships with wide range of stakeholders including colleagues, external partners and citizens to shape Public Health outcomes
  • Substantial experience of the development, maintenance, evaluation and review of systems and supporting tools to support the data requirements of a large and complex organisation
  • An understanding of data security and confidentiality
  • Ability to manipulate, analyse, interpret and communicate complex data
  • Effective IT skills including Excel, Powerpoint and Word
  • Advanced data analysis skills using at least one of the following: SQL, GIS, statistical analysis software for example Stata, SPSS, R
  • Highly developed knowledge of data analysis, information gathering and/or research approaches and techniques
  • Ability to prepare and present briefing papers/reports/business cases to a variety of audiences

Please note – In order to be considered for this role you need to have public sector experience in the following areas: NHS, Local Government or Public Health England.

Duration: 5 months initially

Start date: January 2021
Rate: Negotiable depending on experience
Inside IR35

For more information on this or other Public Sector Jobs, please in the first instance email your CV to the Team at or call

fullDescription:
Job Title:          Reporting and Inventory Data Analyst (Planning)

Sector:             Contract Logistics/Supply Chain/Logistics

Location:          Dutton

Pay:                 c£14.00 per hour

Duration:          6 months (potentially extended)

The Role:

The Reporting and Inventory Analyst will have previously worked within a transport/logistics environment, and will be responsible for:
  • Managing the stock holding data
  • Looking for trends in the data
  • Comparing inbound plan against inbound actuals
  • Comparing outbound plan against outbound actual
  • Preparing KPIs on Partner
  • Handling all Stock queries presented by customer
  • Creating Excel data
  • Presenting data in a simple way


Key Skills & Competencies:
  • Reporting and Inventory Analyst experience within warehousing, logistics, distribution & supply chain
  • Good IT skills, including Microsoft office – Word/Excel/Outlook
  • You will have a common sense approach and be able to take action on your own initiative

The Company:

We have recently started collaborating with one of most successful leading global logistics companies in the market.  They have recently won a new contract and the need has arisen for an Operations Centre to support the Warehouse function.

The contract is essentially a storage and distribution business, and the Operations team will support the supply chain process, as the key conduit between the warehouse, the transport team and the customer for whom the product is being distributed.

Benefits:
  • Free onsite parking
  • Friendly and positive environment
  • Strong possibilities to grow within the company
  • Weekly wages

Further details:
  • 6 months assignment on this particular project with the possibility of an extension

Please note that we reserve the right to close the vacancy prior to the application deadline/closing date once a sufficient number of applications have been received. If you haven't heard back from us within 2 weeks, please assume that unfortunately on this occasion your application has been unsuccessful.

jobDescription: Join us as a Data Analyst with BAE Systems (Full-time, Permanent)   Role Detail: BAE Systems are excited to offer an opportunity to the right individual as a Data Services Engineer within the Air Sector business unit. You will be a key member of a high performing team ensuring our Business Intelligence & Analytics Competency Centre (BIA...
fullDescription:
Join us as a Data Analyst with BAE Systems

(Full-time, Permanent)



Role Detail:

BAE Systems are excited to offer an opportunity to the right individual as a Data Services Engineer within the Air Sector business unit. You will be a key member of a high performing team ensuring our Business Intelligence & Analytics Competency Centre (BIACC) services are available and performant with a keen focus on customer satisfaction. 


Undertaking project development as part of a wider team enhancing the safe release of high-quality delivery as part of a wide range of product development using well-respected technologies to support your work.


A key responsibility will be supporting senior developers and project leads to complete key tasks contributing towards wider deliverables to ensure safe and robust improvements into operation.


You will be required to use your technical knowledge to trouble shoot incidents, identify issues, implement fixes or workarounds, and consider approach to software delivery with the support from the wider team.


The successful candidate will have a good understanding of the management of data, and the principles and approaches that influence their performance.


The role presents opportunities to develop your career within a fast growing data management and software development domain and to work with innovative technology alongside those developing the next generation aircraft. A great many training opportunities are available to support you in your self-development within a culture that embraces diversity.


You will be located at our Warton site in Lancashire but whilst the ongoing restrictions in relation to the pandemic are in place, the team is working from home.



Role Requirements:

The role will provide Technical leadership of a small agile data team delivering high quality solutions to business problems within the Air Sector as part of the Business Intelligence and Analytics Competency Centre (BIACC). As part of the BIACC You will work closely with other agile data and visualization teams reporting into the Data Exploitation and Services Manager.


Your experience and leadership qualities will empower your team to achieve their best. You will act as a mentor to the junior members nurturing them and enabling their development.


The successful candidate will have excellent knowledge of IM&T systems providing direction and guidance as to potential approaches and solutions to business requirements and understand the technical aspects influencing good design and performance. 


You will be required to undertake and provide leadership of tasks contributing to the successful delivery of projects and remediation of faults within service solutions. Using your experience to trouble shoot development, identify issues, implement fixes or workarounds, and take ownership of root cause analysis of the incident. Escalating to senior management of the BIACC where appropriate.


You will have a good understanding of how your activities integrate into the activities of the wider technical teams within the BIACC and IM&T including an understanding of the work of the architectural design team.


The candidate will require good communication skills and be customer focused; must understand technical instructions and be able to communicate technical information to others



Essential Experience:

  • Understanding of IT systems and the principles and approaches that influence their performance
  • Knowledge and experience relevant to creating design specifications, modelling data, testing, validating, deploying and supporting data management in an agile manner
  • Experience with some of the following; ETL technologies, SQL, TSQL, Data Dictionary creation and management data cataloguing, data quality management and principles and policies within the data layer
  • Translate business requirements and rules into technical design specifications
  • Work with tabular, multidimensional and relational data sets to create conformed data models
  • Record and monitor development activities in a change management database
  • Investigate and respond to incidents in a timely and responsive manner ensuring breeches of service level agreements do not take place achieved within an ITIL Framework
  • Oversee and contribute to the creation of user guides and standard operating procedures in support of solutions created by the team



Desirable:

  • Experience with Data Virtualisation, Application of data quality principles, SSIS, warehousing/vaults
  • Knowledge and understanding of the data needs of BI and analytics toolsets. SQL Server 2016 – 2019 Familiarity with Backup and Restore, and configuration of SQL server, User administration Roles, database sizing.

jobDescription: An exciting job opportunity for a Supply Chain Data Analyst based in Oxford, paying £30-£35kYour new roleMy client is looking for a highly motivated individual to join their Supply Chain team as a Analyst - Diagnostics. This role will suit someone who works well under pressure in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.The successful candidate requires a collaborative approach wo...
fullDescription:
An exciting job opportunity for a Supply Chain Data Analyst based in Oxford, paying £30-£35k

Your new role
My client is looking for a highly motivated individual to join their Supply Chain team as a Analyst - Diagnostics. This role will suit someone who works well under pressure in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.

The successful candidate requires a collaborative approach working closely across the business with key stakeholders and across many departments. The successful candidate will convert the finished goods demand plan/forecast and ensure that production has the required flow of materials to ensure the right products are made to the right quantity, at the right time.

Responsibilities include:

  • Work with the Demand Planner and the Supply Chain Manager for Biologic Diagnostics to create and implement production schedules ensuring the inventory buffers are maintained within the agreed range.
  • Working closely with the internal stakeholders to understand the business requirements and translate this into a clear and executable plan for production.
  • Analysing data across multiple departments to deliver weekly reports for key stakeholder meetings
  • Work closely with finance to raise purchase orders, processing works orders and reconciling invoices
  • Highlighting and escalating concerns which may impact our customers or business needs
  • Management of buffer stock through the use of Demand Driven Materials Requirement Planning
  • Work with key stakeholders to proactively manage inventory, reducing the risk of aged / obsolete stock.


What you'll need to succeed
The ideal candidate will have analysis experience ideally within a Supply Chain environment. Requirements include:

  • Experience of working in a regulated and non-regulated, fast paced, manufacturing environment
  • Extensive scheduling experience, working knowledge of BOM's/routing.
  • Proactive, adaptable and collaborative mindset with a flexible approach to changing daily priorities
  • Has an eye for detail, strong level of accuracy and works well under pressure
  • Exceptional communication skills with confidence to communicate with stakeholders at all levels
  • Drive to 'make things happen', enable solutions and use best practices in the process
  • Commercial awareness with a clear understanding of the need to deliver the plan.


What you'll get in return

  • Flexible working options available
  • Growing organisation
  • Excellent benefits
  • Very competitive salary
  • Opportunity to develop & progress


What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

fullDescription:
This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced data analyst to make an impact in this large well-established financial firm. Working in a dynamic environment, this role will be joining a passionate marketing team, to deliver online data and web performance insights.

You will be working alongside the Digital Development Manager, Data Scientists, partner agencies and the marketing team to own, manage and drive the performance metrics. Using programming tools to maintain and create automated reports and deliver insights to internal stakeholders. You will have the opportunity to Identify additional analytics tools that could be utilised to enhance capability and online user behaviour, with the full resources of this huge brand behind you.

This role would suit someone who has previously worked in data manipulation and ROI analysis, to improve performance marketing and CX metrics.

This is a technical role with exposure to:

  • Google Analytics, Adobe analytics & Tag Management Solutions
  • SAS & Python
  • VBA/SQL


This is an enthusiastic and driven business who believe in a work life balance and plenty of development opportunities.

If you would like to find out any further information on the role, or think you would be a great fit, please apply with an updated CV.

jobDescription: Our client are fast growing digital business. Due to continued growth they are now looking for a Digital Analyst to join the team.         Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities Customer & Data Intelligence  Be the custodian of the digital data agenda ensuring a customer-centric marketing and optimisation focus is adopted cross-channel at every turn tracking pe...
fullDescription:
Our client are fast growing digital business.

Due to continued growth they are now looking for a Digital Analyst to join the team.


Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities

Customer & Data Intelligence

  • Be the custodian of the digital data agenda ensuring a customer-centric marketing and optimisation focus is adopted cross-channel at every turn tracking performance against forecast and year-on-year
  • Drive deeper insight into digital marketing channels inclusive of a category and feed perspective to supplement the strategic growth agendas of third party agencies across PPC and SEO campaigns
  • Enhance digital CRM insights and analytics to drive customer retention and reactivation across online channels through data-led testing strategies
  • Leverage data threads to deliver funnel analysis and provide insight on audience behaviour, to unearth and inform new opportunities across all ecommerce trading and category zones inclusive of but not limited to search, sorting rules, product recommendations, PLPs
  • Continually review, interrogate and refine customer journey and campaign performance to maximise payback and development to lifetime customer, inclusive of but not limited to platforms, devices, usability, UX and user journey; ensuring online and offline journeys are consistent and complementary
  • Collaborate with internal and external sources to evolve and develop models, methodologies, tools and techniques to improve accuracy of insight across all territories in a digital era giving consideration to contactable and non-contactable audiences
  • Manage website tagging requirements with internal development team to inform analysis

Customer Journey & Data Understanding

  • Analyse web traffic and key metrics / drivers to deliver recommendations and actionable insights on ways to further improve the site
  • Support conversion optimisation efforts through ideation, consultancies and testing strategies borne from actionable, data-driven recommendations to enhance end-to-end customer journey and experience funnel underpinned by set-up, tracking and in-depth, segmented reporting
  • Explore, interpret and interrogate customer propensity to maximise conversion to sale across all digital platforms and channels mapping offsite to onsite journey
  • Leverage data intelligence to proactively identify pain points across platforms whereby enhancements can lead to marginal and/or significant gains in conversion and ROI such as browsers, devices, pages

Digital Analysis Platforms

  • Identify ways to improve analytical procedures to improve agility and efficiency through the automation of marketing reports
  • To be the primary product owner of all digital analysis platforms demonstrating a full understanding of metrics inclusive of but not limited to site analytics (ideally Google Analytics, Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Firebase or similar), site data manipulation (Supermetrics) and other associated digital tech platforms (ideally Bazaarvoice, Emarsys, Google Adwords, Facebook, Conversant or similar tech platforms)
  • Demonstrate commercial appreciation of how such external analytical platform metrics equate, marry and conflict within internal systems, with the ability to fully submerge into and translate the data from the range of sources into simple business clarity and understanding through management reporting
  • Liaise with Analyst peers to integrate digital analytics with trading and customer insights and manipulation adopting SQL and drawing data from business warehouse

Marketing Management & Analytics

  • Create, identify and track data trends across online landscape in order to set ecommerce benchmarks and KPIs
  • Champion analytics best practise, relevant measures and effective communication of information; develop methodologies and vision in reporting
  • To ensure the manipulation of adhoc analysis and results into relevant scenarios, model business cases and comparative measures to move towards conclusion and recommendation
  • Continually review and develop processes for analysis and insight, pioneering improvements
  • Maintain current and new systems to ensure delivery of accurate information
  • To utilise operational and marketing systems to interrogate and deliver actionable insight
  • Identify gaps in the current data capture strategy to create an improvements roadmap and collaboratively implement enhancements
  • Maintain and support data integrity and validation through management of all analytics and digital measurement tools
  • Maintain market awareness of status quo and industry best practise to develop analysis techniques
  • Utilise different analytical techniques incorporating visualisation and reporting to bring analysis to life - Data Story Telling
  • Demonstrate confidence in working with large datasets with the ability to turn data into insight
  • A good understanding of data manipulation tools (such as SQL)
  • Robustly adopt and deploy statistical techniques to evaluate test robustness and levels of confidence

Excellent package on offer

jobDescription: Sagacity launched in August 2005 offering consulting solutions to large blue-chip organisations within the mobile telecommunications sector in the UK. Over the last 10 years Sagacity has evolved into a specialist data solutions provider owning and solving complex technical and business change initiatives in a practical and hands-on way. Our industry expertise has grown to include utilities and financial  services and we now have exper...
fullDescription:
Sagacity launched in August 2005 offering consulting solutions to large blue-chip organisations within the mobile telecommunications sector in the UK.

Over the last 10 years Sagacity has evolved into a specialist data solutions provider owning and solving complex technical and business change initiatives in a practical and hands-on way. Our industry expertise has grown to include utilities and financial services and we now have experience in a range of different geographies including Ireland, Poland, and Australia.

Our Data Analysts:

  • Are experts in turning large quantities of complex client data into insights which can be used to inform decision making and drive business benefit
  • Are quick to identify incomplete and diverse data sets, pin pointing data issues which may affect the accuracy and completeness of any analysis performed
  • Recognise the importance and value of understanding the data they are analysing, validating the information provided and reconciling the data sets as part of the Data Analytics Cycle
  • Are experienced in producing data visualisations, detailed reporting and analytics underpinned with clear business commentary
  • Work closely with multi-disciplined teams to deliver end to end client solutions in a timely manner
  • Balance the technical and analytical demands of their role with the need for strong engagement with our clients and consultants alike
  • Are open minded and flexible with a thirst for knowledge and an appetite for continuous development

What success looks like in the role

  • Clear, concise and insightful data analytics which enable our clients to make sound business decisions based on fact
  • Ability to translate data analysis into targeted information which can be converted into actionable improvements, based on specific client / industry need
  • Continued improvement of Sagacity’s Product Suite through the delivery of robust data insight
  • Ability to take accountability and ownership for client and internal deliverables
  • Work as part of a Data Analytics team proving knowledge transfer support, peer to peer reviews and mentoring as a team to increase the team’s skill sites and drive continuous learning

Competencies & Behaviours

  • 5+ years of relevant experience
  • Commercial experience within Telecoms, Banking or Utilities industries; or within a data related consultancy company
  • Have strong applied technical and analytical skills using SQL and Excel
  • Experience in Python, R or statistical modelling would be preferred
  • Ideally be educated to degree level in a numerate subject, and with strong A-levels in mathematical/ scientific based subjects
  • Have excellent communication skills
  • Have a keen eye for detail
  • Have pride in your deliverables
  • Are highly organised and good at planning
  • Good at working independently and as part of a team
  • Are flexible and self-motivated
  • Are good under pressure
  • Able to travel throughout the UK
  • Can be based at our London Office
  • Have the right to work in the UK
  • Have a commitment to personal development

jobDescription: Vacancy: Data Analyst Skills: Power BI with DAX ideally but not essential  Location: Leeds Salary: Up to £40,000  The Role Brand new role for a Data Analyst for a Retail organisation in Yorkshire. This is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic Data Analyst who is keen to take their career to the next level and ...
fullDescription:
Vacancy: Data Analyst

Skills: Power BI with DAX ideally but not essential

Location: Leeds

Salary: Up to £40,000

The Role

Brand new role for a Data Analyst for a Retail organisation in Yorkshire.

This is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic Data Analyst who is keen to take their career to the next level and take ownership of a BI Solution. All of the tools are in place, we are now looking for someone to really kick on the companies reporting capability. Reports will be in PowerBI and it would be advantageous to have knowledge of DAX but not essential.

"no more same old bar charts" - we are actively looking for someone to overhaul the MI here, what is in place at the moment is going in the bin and we have effectively a blank canvass. We are looking for someone to create something visually stimulating and different. You will manage the full realm of reporting and guide senior managers on insights.

This role does have the ability for substantial remote / home working, probably something like a 2/3 day split to begin with but then that can lessen over time. You will need to occasionally travel to another office in Yorkshire too (once / twice a month to begin with) if that.

There is the opportunity for you to also start to grow a team with entry level hires this year (graduates / apprentices).

For this role we aren't necessarily looking for loads of experience - this is more about the person, the love for their craft and desire push themselves on in their career.

Responsibilities

  • Take ownership of the companies BI Solution (Power BI)
  • Translate multiple data sets into practical business insight through the reporting mechanisms.
  • Responsible for the creation of visual reports and dashboards within Power BI.
  • Create a data driven culture throughout the organisation
  • Maximise the efficiency and use of the BI tool
  • Guide readers through a compelling data-driven story.

Role Requirements:

  • Essential - Skills in PowerBI (or similar tool)
  • Essential - Strong Reporting Skill - able to create clear, concise, insightful reports that are visually stimulating
  • Bonus - Experience working with company metrics and KPI's
  • Bonus - DAX programming would be ideal and highly advantageous.

The Company

This is an awesome opportunity to join a company early within its data journey, produce some great insights, see the fruits of your work and really develop your career.

Apply now!

What's left to say? You know what to do. If you're the type of person that reaches for the stars and wants to work in a fun supportive environment and rapidly progress your career whilst working with the latest technologies in data and you've got the relevant technical experience as a Data Analyst hit that apply button to submit your application now.

Interviews for this position will be commencing immediately so be sure to not miss out! You will be contacted by a phone call or by email to book an appointment, please be patient.

Vacancy: Data Analyst

Skills: Power BI with DAX ideally but not essential

Location: Leeds

Salary: Up to £40,000

Oscar Technology is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

To understand more about what we do with your data please review our privacy policy in the privacy section of the Oscar website.

fullDescription:
Calling all data analysts with strong analytical mind and a passion for telling a story through data. A well-established e-commerce/FMCG business is looking for you. This business needs an enthusiastic interim analyst to come in ASAP and develop create high level insights from large data sets

The Role:

  • Analyse past and present, internal and customer level data
  • Form detailed insights from the dashboards created by developers
  • Liaise your insights with C-Suite to help them grow and streamline their business
  • Support the developers in building out clear and informative dashboards.

Essential Requirements:

  • 1+ years' experience using a dashboarding tool.
  • Exposure to Excel and SQL.
  • Understanding of a high-growth, SME environment

fullDescription:
Data Analyst

London

Up to £45,000 + Competitive bonus & benefits

The Company

Join a leading challenger bank that is disrupting the current space and changing the way things work. You will join a dynamic team, that will encourage you to collaborate with different teams throughout the business, in order to expand on your current skill set and progress in new areas. This company tried to ensure it remain at the forefront of technology and will see that you do too.

The Role

In this role, you will be responsible for supporting the delivery of new account volumes and account profitability. This includes challenging where the market budget is spent, by identifying and prioritising opportunities related to new accounts and driving the strategy behind this as well as analytics. You will:

  • Model, using SQL & SAS, Roa/NPV impacts of different initiatives, underwriting changes and new credit products to inform business strategy
  • Lead all key analysis for new accounts reporting and forecasting, using SQL & SAS
  • Drive new accounts and spend roadmap, working with acquisition marketing teams to identify and define new customer opportunities

Key Skills and Requirements

  • Strong modelling experience and data extraction using SQL and SAS
  • Financial Modelling experience with experience of a financial product valuation methodology such as credit card, savings and loans.
  • Strong logical and methodological approach in solving complex commercial problems

HOW TO APPLY

Interested? Please register your interest by submitting your CV directly by applying to this advert.

fullDescription:
CityGrad is delighted to be supporting the Convex 2021 Graduate Programme.

About Convex

Stephen Catlin established the Catlin Underwriting Agencies syndicate at Lloyd’s in 1984. From there, it grew into a global insurer that regularly outperformed the market and wrote US$6bn in annual premium when it was acquired in 2015.

In 2019, Stephen Catlin and Paul Brand co-founded Convex with $1.7bn of initial committed capital to underwrite insurance and reinsurance for complex specialty risks. The company received an A.M. Best rating of A- (Excellent) and regulatory approval to operate in London and Bermuda. We have also welcomed leaders in their fields from across the insurance industry, bringing a diversity of thought and approach.

Our aspiration at Convex is to use data and technology to make better decisions. In order to help achieve this goal, Convex has a Data Culture team to ensure that we manage our data as well as possible through collaboration, communication and continuous improvement.

Key Responsibilities

The team is looking to hire a Graduate to work with the team and the business in the formation and implementation of the right data culture with Convex, with the overall goal of making better business decisions through our data being more accessible, reliable and trustworthy.

fullDescription:
Leading UK Law firm require a Data Analyst to join an expanding team to cover the full spectrum of data management and analysis, from accurate client reporting to collating performance data and using it to help define and optimise operational strategies.

Client Details

Leading UK Law firm

Description

Leading UK Law firm require a Data Analyst to join an expanding team to cover the full spectrum of data management and analysis, from accurate client reporting to collating performance data and using it to help define and optimise operational strategies.

Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, with day-to-day reporting to the Debt Recovery Managers, you will be a hands-on individual who is a natural problem solver with excellent data analytical skills to take on responsibility for all things 'data'.

Key responsibilities:

  • Review the current data capture, reporting and overall use of data in the business
  • Utilise SQL coding / querying and advanced Excel / VBA skills to manage, manipulate and analyse large data sets.
  • Deliver the results under the direction of the Operational Management team
  • Use performance data to help identify and highlight any debt recovery trends with particular clients, industries or the department as a whole
  • Own and drive new KPIs, metrics and tools relevant to the collections business performance
  • Recommend improvements and present findings as required by the Operational Management team
  • Work with the Management team to identify ways in which data informs team strategy and ensures focus on total quality management
  • Work with the Systems Development team where required to review data extraction and transferal
  • Continually improve client reporting
  • Ensure accuracy of data at all times
  • Support the Business Development team with data requirements for clients, pitches and marketing
  • Manage and deliver specific data-related projects for the business as required; and
  • Take ownership of data management/analysis and be able to communicate information to different levels within the business.

Key Skills:

  • Have experience of data analysis in a commercial setting
  • Have experience in working with large data sets
  • Possess excellent IT skills with the ability to produce informative reports
  • Have advanced skills in Microsoft Excel
  • Have knowledge and experience of SQL
  • Preferably have experience of working with Liberate
  • Be able to prioritise your own workload to meet deadlines; and
  • Have great communication skills including the presentation of data and findings.

Profile

  • Have experience of data analysis in a commercial setting
  • Have experience in working with large data sets
  • Possess excellent IT skills with the ability to produce informative reports
  • Have advanced skills in Microsoft Excel
  • Have knowledge and experience of SQL
  • Preferably have experience of working with Liberate
  • Be able to prioritise your own workload to meet deadlines; and
  • Have great communication skills including the presentation of data and findings.

Opportunity to join an expanding team

Opportunity to develop Data and Reporting capabilities

fullDescription:
Systems Data Analyst 1 Year Contract Norwich

Successful business situated near Norwich requires a Systems Data Analyst on a 1 year contract. A new business system is currently being configured to improve and streamline the company and therefore are looking for a Data Analyst to join their Systems Implementation team, to work on data cleansing and development of the new system.

  • Utilise your analytical skills and deep understanding of data analysis and insight to provide clear, effective recommendations for the system implementation to help achieve new systems objectives.

  • Coordinate the cleansing of the data required to be input into the new system.

  • Attend, summarise and note key actions from all system related meetings

  • Support the team by completing progress reports on the actions for your area of involvement

  • Implementation and drive though these actions with the owners.

  • Provide data analysis and research skills to aid the smooth implementation of the new system.

You will have prior experience in a data analyst role or similar, be personally dynamic and possess the ability to think laterally and systematically work through issues. Intermediate Excel skills are essential. Knowledge of implementing a new system is desirable.

Contact Sam Holt at Big Sky Additions for further information.

fullDescription:
Howarth Morris have an exciting Finance/Data Analyst opportunity for a PE backed digital marketing business near Wigan. This is a newly created permanent role, to provide additional support to the finance team during a period of change. This role represents a superb opportunity for any junior candidate looking to join a modern and vibrant SME business with a friendly and open work culture.

Key Responsibilities

- Raising self-bill customer invoices, which will include accessing supporting documentation from customer portals.
- Completing month end affiliate reconciliations to produce an accurate revenue figure.
- Creation of monthly reports from accounting software i.e. Aged Debtor and Creditor reports.
- Preparation of excel files to be used by the Partnerships Team to record monthly revenue.
- Work with Affiliates to ensure transactions are efficiently verified and processed for payment.
- Maintaining and updating monthly reporting for Management Accounts support.
- Maintain nominal structure for all companies within Sage 200.
- Assist in maintaining accuracy of data within the CRM system.
- Assist and provide cover where required with other Finance duties i.e. Purchase Ledger processing.

Candidate Requirements

- Highly numerate with excellent attention to detail.
- Excellent knowledge of finance systems and Excel skills (including formulas and data manipulation)
- Analytical and motivated to investigate numerical variances.
- AAT training may be provided to the right candidate
- Experience of working in a month-end environment and managing workload to achieve deadlines.

Howarth Morris

fullDescription:
Human Recognition Systems have an exciting opportunity for aData Analyst to join our team in Liverpool. You will join us on a full time, permanent basis and in return, you will receive a competitive salary, depending on experience.

We are an extraordinary technology brand looking for extraordinary people.

From humble beginnings, Human Recognition Systems has risen to become a global leader, providing state-of-the-art digital identity solutions to some of world’s most demanding workplaces. Our customers, including major organisations like airports and construction companies, expect an unparalleled level of innovation and quality from our products and services.

From our employees, we expect commitment, trust and imagination to be your driving forces. In return, you can expect to play a key role in our story and join a dynamic market leader at a crucial stage of its development. At Human Recognition Systems, you can expect more.

In return as ourData Analyst you will receive the following benefits:

- 24 days holidays, increasing with service

- Subsidised gym memberships

- Study Assistance

- Life Assurance and Critical Illness Cover

- Recruitment Bounty

What does a Data Analyst do?

As our Data Analyst, you will be working closely with the Business Analyst, you will help to define reporting requirements across all departments, reporting on financials, service, product utilisation, and customer satisfaction as well as identifying trends through insightful analysis of the data. The need to be agile is key as the business is constantly changing, so a project orientated mind is essential with the ability to be proactive.

- Preparing reports for internal and external audiences using business analytics reporting tools, creating data dashboards, graphs, and visualisations

- Communicating data insights to the directors, team managers and the wider team to ensure the most important metrics are made aware of in the company

- Monitoring and auditing data quality

- Identifying, evaluating, and implementing services and tools to support data validation and cleansing

- Liaising with internal and external clients to fully understand data content

- Identifying areas to increase efficiency and automation of processes

- Setting up and maintaining automated data processes

Our ideal Data Analyst:

- At least 3 years’ experience in a similar position

- A degree or qualification in a data related subject

- Significant experience using Microsoft Power BI to build clear graphical visualisations

- Strong knowledge of relational databases and demonstrable SQL skills

- Knowledge and experience in ETL processes

- Awareness around data security and GDPR

- Excellent numerical, analytical, verbal, and written communication skills

- Exceptional self-motivation, persistence, and diligence

- Experience with business CRMs (e.g. Salesforce, Hubspot) would be desirable

If you feel you have the necessary skills and experience to be successful in this Data Analyst role click ‘apply’ today. We’d love to hear from you!

Data cleanse and validation

Solid Excel and data manipulation skills are a must
Knowledge of system implementation is desirable

Good communication and relationship building skills

fullDescription:
Data Analyst - Remote Working

A Global analytical consultancy is looking for a Data Analyst to join them on an initial 3-month fixed term assignment. They work with many of the world’s leading household names, advising them on how to improve their sales and marketing functions, through deep research, reporting and analysis.

As a Data Analyst, you’ll be performing a varied role where you will;

  • Delve deep into the data to process, cleanse and validate it through executing queries, writing scripts and data manipulation
  • Attend project meetings to present project status updates and managing any delays, or data errors accordingly.
  • Publish the data onto the company’s proprietary software
  • Ensure that the client and relevant teams can utilise and access the data successfully.

Ideally this role would suit someone with prior Data Analysis / Database Administration experience along with;

  • Relational database management experience
  • Experience of SQL is essential
  • MS Office - particularly Excel experience for graphs / charts
  • Understanding of project management principles would be extremely beneficial, however not essential.

This role will be remote for the duration of this assignment with the possibility of extension or permanent employment.

Data Analyst - Remote Working

jobDescription: Our client is a leading medical and dental school offering international levels of excellence in research and teaching. In this post you would provide senior health data...
fullDescription:
Our client is a leading medical and dental school offering international levels of excellence in research and teaching. This role is based within one of the main departments in the school and will contribute to the aims of the unit through providing senior health data science support for the researchers accessing data from large electronic health record databases for research studies.

In this post you would provide senior health data science support for the maintenance and support of a large SQL database containing health care records. You would need to understand the related metadata, codes, concepts and table structures relating to this data and manipulate, extract and analyse these data for subsequent use in data visualisation software and research.

You would provide senior health data science support to researchers and students for funding and fellowship applications and, where appropriate, provide health data science supervision of projects.

To be considered for this post you will have worked in a similar post previously and have a Higher degree or Undergraduate degree in the relevant field or subjects. You will have prior experience of using T-SQL to manage data using CTE and Dynamic SQL techniques. Experience of SQL Server triggers, stored procedures and functions and experience of data migrations and transformation packages using SSIS.

This post is being offered on a temporary basis for 3 months initially, and to be considered you will ideally need to be available to start as soon as possible.

As a specialist Recruitment Practice, we are committed to building inclusive and diverse organisations, and welcome applications from all sections of the community. We invest in your journey as a candidate and are committed to supporting you in your application.

In order to apply please submit your CV in the first instance and begin to prepare your supporting statement. Should your experience be suitable, we will send you the full job description and will arrange for a call and/or meeting to brief you on the role.

*Please note, we are currently experiencing high volumes of interest in vacancies so it may not be possible to answer any individual queries on positions prior to an application*

fullDescription:
Senior Data Analyst –  Contract £500 - £650 per day

Interviewing and onboarding for this role will be going ahead remotely while Covid-19 restrictions are in place.

On behalf of our client, we are looking for a highly experienced Senior Data Analysts on a contract basis. Adria Solutions has an exciting opportunity for a talented Senior Data Analyst to join our client based in Manchester. They are constantly improving and developing new app features based on customer feedback and have won the award for Best Use of IT in the past, So if you are an exceptional Senior Data Analyst looking to join a fast paced and rapidly growing company this is the contract for you.



The Senior Data Analyst will be required to:

  • Find useful structured and unstructured data in our Data Warehouse and Data Lake; suggesting and designing extensions that will improve our capabilities.
  • Design, prototype, deliver and maintain reports in Power BI.
  • Design, prototype, deliver and maintain models in tools like R/Python/AWS Sagemaker, using data science toolkits like dplyr or ggplot2.
  • Be comfortable learning a data transformation tools
  • Be comfortable working in an Agile Kanban workflow to safely code review, test and deploy solutions, using source control to manage changes.
  • Use data science techniques to identify and take advantage of commercial opportunities, delivering more targeted acquisition, successful customer/portfolio management, and product performance.


How to Apply if you’re Interested in this contract position:
