jobDescription: Project Control Data Analyst Would you like to play a key role in our Air Sector organisation supporting our US customer on complex and challenging projects? We currently have an excellent opportunity for Project Control Data Analysts to join our F35 Project Integration teams at our  Samlesbury site. As a Project Control Data Analyst, you will be you will be working with key internal stakeholders to collate, an...
fullDescription:
Project Control Data Analyst

Would you like to play a key role in our Air Sector organisation supporting our US customer on complex and challenging projects? We currently have an excellent opportunity for Project Control Data Analysts to join our F35 Project Integration teams at our Samlesbury site.

As a Project Control Data Analyst, you will be you will be working with key internal stakeholders to collate, analyse and schedule performance data across multiple projects to help ensure project performance through the lifecycle. You will be analysing performance data in line with contractual reporting requirements and turning data into management information to support business decisions.

This role will provide you with the opportunity to play a pivotal role in key US contracts, in a well-structured business that offers career development and on-going support.

Your main responsibilities as a Project Control Data Analyst will involve:

Proactively working with key internal stakeholders to collate and analyse cost and schedule performance data for multiple projects

Through the application of data analytical toolsets and methodologies, you will use current and past performance data to identify trends, and predict future performance

Confirm and validate all data and forecast information entered into the cost/schedule toolset each reporting period, ensuring all checks and balances are performed

Analyse cost and schedule performance variances against agreed project plans, and assist in identifying route cause and corrective actions

Provide key performance data inputs into customer reports for senior management review, in line with contractual monthly timescales

Your skills and qualifications:
Essential:

Good quantitative and analytical skills / experience

Ability to analyse and interpret data with a high level of attention to detail

Ability to present complex data in a simplified format, tailored to the relevant audience

Validation of data analysis, communicating analysis & key insights, Understanding analysis constraints

Advanced in the use of Microsoft Excel

Desirable:

Understanding of Project Control / Project Management techniques

What we're looking for in you:

You should have an analytical mind, strong business acumen, problem-solving skills and attention to detail. You will be a logical and creative thinker with excellent communication and presentation skills both written and verbally enabling you to deal with a fast-paced environment along with the ability to prioritise workloads and to know when to seek guidance.

Location: Samlesbury

Salary: £32,660 + dependent on experience

Benefits: Our employees receive an excellent benefits package which includes a competitive pension scheme, enhanced annual leave allowance and a Company contributed Share Incentive Plan. We also offer a range of additional benefits such as flexible working, an employee assistance programme, Cycle2work and many local and national employee discounts. Some employees may also be eligible for an annual incentive.

BAE Systems

BAE Systems is one of the world's leading global defence, security and aerospace companies. We work at the cutting edge of technology, creating more than 100 new inventions every year for customers in over 100 countries.

BAE Systems Air

If you'd like to make a real difference where it counts, BAE Systems is the place for you.

From keeping soldiers, sailors and pilots safe to helping countries prosper, from developing the next generation of supersonic aircraft to investing in the next generation of super-smart talent - at BAE Systems, we work together to give our customers an essential edge in protecting the things that really matter. Lives, livelihoods, ways of life.

As part of our Air team, you could be working at the edge of what is technologically possible, shaping the future to ensure our customers are ready to face challenges we cannot even imagine today. You could be developing and evolving the technologies that will defend the UK for generations to come and supporting our customers around the globe.

Join us and you'll be encouraged and rewarded to excel in this important work. Apply your talent where it counts.

We recognise that an inclusive and diverse workplace - where all employees feel respected, valued and able to achieve their full potential - is vitally important. Not only does it inspire creativity and collaboration, it's good for business. We celebrate our differences and believe our diverse skills, abilities and perspectives strengthen our culture and our overall performance.

We welcome applications from all suitably qualified people.

Please be aware that many roles working for BAE Systems will be subject to both security and export control restrictions. These restrictions mean that factors including your nationality, any previous nationalities you have held, and/or your place of birth may limit those roles that you can perform for the organisation.

Due to the volume of applications we receive, we sometimes close our vacancies early. It is therefore advisable to apply as early as possible if you would like to be considered for a role with BAE Systems.

In a nutshell, you will work closely with a range of different audiences in the business to produce accurate data to ensure future planning for the company is as accurate as possible. fullDescription:
Data Analyst Up to £42,000 per annum + Benefits


My client, a leading PLC business based in Leicester, is currently looking to recruit a data analyst / MI Analyst to join their growing team.


In a nutshell, you will work closely with a range of different audiences in the business to produce accurate data to ensure future planning for the company is as accurate as possible.


Key responsibilities will include:


Create monthly dashboard reports for directors and managers.


Produce weekly and monthly reports for quality, sales and production teams.


Develop the quality of data entry and capture.


Develop growth model calculations and data.


Working closely with IT and business users to define data needs for Finance projects and assignments as needed.


Collecting, analysing and publishing information on trends to enable more proficient business planning.


Support the wider team with ad hoc insight and analysis when required.


You will be/have:


Excellent and proven Excel skills including VBA and PowerPivot


Experience of SSRS & Power BI


Good SQL knowledge.


Ability to analyse and interpret large data sets.


Having a general understanding of day to day accounting would be beneficial but not essential.


If the above sounds like you, please apply now for immediate consideration!

Macildowie is a specialist recruitment consultancy with a rich history of enhancing the careers of professionals across the Midlands and the Northern Home Counties. We have an unrivalled understanding of the local market place and recruit for the majority of the region's premier employers. To search for all of our live jobs please visit us at macildowie.com.

Macildowie are a recruitment business working on behalf of a client to recruit this role. Your personal data may be forwarded to that client company as part of the application process. fullDescription:
My client is a large Plc organisation who have an exciting opportunity for 3 recent graduates to join their analytical team based in Newcastle.

This is an ideal opportunity if you have graduated recently (2019 and 2020 graduates only) with a numerical related degree and are looking to develop your career in an analytical field.

This role offers a fantastic opportunity for a self-motivated, highly numerate graduate to make a significant difference within a well-established and rapidly growing organisation who have a large office based in Newcastle.

Your day to day will consist of…….

  • Proactively and collaboratively develop Analysis and Insight to support Operations
  • Report making to help deliver optimal management decisions
  • Identify, quantify and prioritise opportunities to enhance operational efficiency and produce world-class deliverables fit for a world-class operation to drive continuous improvement.
  • Apply analytical and technical ability to ensure the team delivers the highest standards of analysis and reporting to key stakeholders

What we want from you…

  • Minimum 2:1 within a numerically based degree i.e. Maths, Economics, Business, Psychology, Physics etc.
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office product suite, particularly Excel i.e. Pivot Tables and V-Lookups
  • Clear, logical analytical approach to problem-solving
  • Ability to investigate data, find trends, forecast performance and provide insightful recommendations

If you are interested in this fantastic graduate opportunity based in Newcastle, please apply directly with an updated CV.

jobDescription: Job Description Senior Data Analyst or Data Scientist  3 months maybe longer £21 per hour Full time ideally Part- time considered. The newly established Centre for Clinical Effectiveness and Health Data Science is one of the largest centres in the Institute of Population Health Sciences. CCEHDS ...
fullDescription:
Job Description

Senior Data Analyst or Data Scientist

3 months maybe longer

£21 per hour

Full time ideally

Part- time considered.

The newly established Centre for Clinical Effectiveness and Health Data Science is one of the largest centres in the Institute of Population Health Sciences. CCEHDS carries out research to improve population health, reduce health inequalities, and innovate, develop, and deliver quality improvement programmes using electronic health records from primary care, acute care and other settings. CCEHDS is a founding partner of the innovative Discovery Programme and hosts the Wellcome Trust Doctoral Training Programme - Health Data in Practice

Job purpose

To provide senior health data science support for researchers accessing data from large electronic health record databases for research studies such as the REAL Health research programme

To provide senior health data science support for the maintenance and support of a large SQL database containing health care records. To understand the related metadata, codes, concepts and table structures relating to this data and manipulate, extract and analyse these data for subsequent use in data visualisation software and research.

To provide senior health data science support to CCEHDS researchers and students for funding and fellowship applications and, where appropriate, provide health data science supervision of projects.

Main duties and responsibilities

To work with the Director and CoDirector to provide senior health data science support to the REAL Health Programme and related research support CCEHDS researchers on aspects of health data science research conduct, including specification of metadata, data management and curation.

Provide senior health data science support for SQL database maintenance and data extraction using CTE and Dynamic SQL, with knowledge of SQL Server triggers, stored procedures and functions.

Provide support for data migrations and transformation packages using SSIS.

Support normalisation and database management, particularly in AWS RDS or other cloud based hosting.

Contribute to outputs of data for use in a statistical package such as R or STATA and data visualisation.

Contribute to development and curation and cataloguing of metadata concepts using standardised terminologies such as Snomed and creation of standardised coded data from free text and other unstructured data formats and the sources of this information including EMIS web.

Assist in the support and training of Masters, PhD students,QI fellows and researchers in CCEHDS engaged in research using electronic health record data as appropriate.

Maintain appropriate databases, keeping accurate written and computerised records and ensure data integrity and security in compliance with HRA standards of good clinical practice

Ensure data handling is securely maintained and in conformance with governance policies and the e provisions of the Data Protection Act, NHS legislation, GDPR and similar laws/regulations.

Liaise with academic colleagues and clinical and other research collaborators across the School of Medicine and Dentistry, NHS organisatons and nationally/internationally

Liaise with national and international academic colleagues within this discipline

Experience / Skills

Experience of using T-SQL to manage data using CTE and Dynamic SQL techniques

Experience of SQL Server triggers, stored procedures and functions

Knowledge of statutory legislation regarding data handling and local information governance policies and maintainance of secure data processing

Knowledge of Microsoft Office software (Outlook, word, Excel, Powerpoint, Access)

Knowledge of normalisation and database management, particularly in AWS RDS

Experience of using programming languages (such as Python, C#, Javascript) to create ETL or visualisation applications.

Experience of data visualisation, particularly in Power BI, Dash, RShiny, Angular or Tableau.

Experience of STATA, R or other statistical packages

Knowledge of GP IT systems (EMIS Web)

Understanding of NHS structure and primary health care organisation

A proven capacity to be proactive, to work independently, and to build and work effectively in teams.

Ability to organise work and prioritise appropriately within the project timetable

Good problem solving and analytical skills, with the ability to identify potential problems and liaise appropriately with others to manage and resolve them effectively,

Good communication skills both oral and written

Qualifications

Higher degree in relevant field or relevant experience

Undergraduate degree or equivalent in relevant subject or equivalent experience

Health & Safety Considerations

Health and Safety processes in place in accordance with government guidelines.

jobDescription: Job Title: Senior Data Analyst – Retail/Ecommerce Company   Location: Reading/Remote Working     Salary: Up to £55,000 depending on experience plus benefits    About the Retail/Ecommerce Company  Growing retail/ecommerce company seeking a talented Senior Data Analyst to become a ke...
fullDescription:
Job Title: Senior Data Analyst – Retail/Ecommerce Company  

Location: Reading/Remote Working    

Salary: Up to £55,000 depending on experience plus benefits   

About the Retail/Ecommerce Company 

Growing retail/ecommerce company seeking a talented Senior Data Analyst to become a key member of their dynamic team. This forward-thinking ecommerce-based company sells and distributes a range of books and tech products and is one of the largest global third-party Amazon partners. They have a collaborative, friendly and entrepreneurial culture. The new Senior Data Analyst will have the autonomy to make a big impact whilst receiving support and opportunities to grow and develop.  

About the Senior Data Analyst Role  

The Senior Data Analyst will play a key role in modelling the results of customer activity in response to pricing changes.  
 

Key Responsibilities for the Senior Data Analyst:  

  • Leveraging data about customers, products and competitors 
  • Performing analysis, data mining and trend spotting 
  • Collaborate with internal teams to create pricing algorithms 
  • Refine and analyse large data sets to produce tangible business strategies 
  • Create and improve dashboards 

About You  

You’ll be a talented data analyst with a strong quant background, looking to progress your career within a growing ecommerce company.  
 

Skills and experience needed for the Senior Data Analyst role:  

  • Experience in a data analyst/scientist role 
  • Advanced Excel skills 
  • SQL skills 
  • Experience in a retail/ecommerce environment beneficial 
  • Dashboarding and data visualisation experience beneficial 

For more information about the Data Analyst role or to apply please send your CV to Neil at  or call .

jobDescription: Data Analyst vacancy in a large public sector organisation in Coalville £26,622 - £29,580 including 26 days annual leave, remote working & generous benefits package This post is subject to a DBS clearance. Hays IT are working in partnership with a large public sector organisation in Coalville to recruit a Data Analyst on a permanent basis. You the successful candidate will be expected to perform st...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst vacancy in a large public sector organisation in Coalville
£26,622 - £29,580 including 26 days annual leave, remote working & generous benefits package

This post is subject to a DBS clearance.

Hays IT are working in partnership with a large public sector organisation in Coalville to recruit a Data Analyst on a permanent basis. You the successful candidate will be expected to perform statistical analysis, data mining and retrieval processes on a large amount of data to identify trends, producing actionable insights and other relevant information. You will develop the use of data from reporting to predictive modelling and working closely with colleagues across the organisation to build understanding of data and systems. You will deliver powerful insights from available and new data streams that will enable the group to effectively manage its resources and meet its objectives.

Main tasks and responsibilities:

  • Perform statistical analysis, data mining and retrieval processes on a large amount of data, to identify trends, create management dashboards providing in depth insights.
  • Develop raw data to gain insights from available and new data streams, in order to obtain greater knowledge of our assets, maximizing income, manage our resources and operate effective and efficient processes.
  • Handle potentially incomplete data sets, clean up data to produce predictive modelling.
  • Ensure robust testing pre-release of all reports and related dashboards; support and comply with change control working practices within ICT & Digital Services.
    • Integrate and mashup distinctive data sets, pulling data from multiple, disparate sources to provide EMT with an at-a-glance view of the business.
    • Discover new insights to assist the organisation plan, manage our resources and processes effectively, enabling the group to meet its priorities and objectives.
    • In collaboration with the Data base administrator create and maintain SQL functions, procedures and reports along with supporting the SQL data views and core record systems and processes.
    • Create complex reports/insights using SSRS, BI Dashboards.

In order to apply for this role, you must have the following skills and experience:

  • Degree or equivalent in ICT discipline or equivalent experience.
  • Previous experience in a Data or Insights Analyst role.
  • Extensive experience of working with large complex SQL datasets. Interpreting this data and cross correlating to other data sets to produce relevant executive insights and dashboards.
  • Extensive experience writing complex queries in SQL as well as a background in integration of datasets and Big Data.
  • Experience creating complex SQL functions and procedures.

If you have the relevant experience and would like to apply, please submit your CV.

Hays Specialist Recruitment Limited acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and employment business for the supply of temporary workers. By applying for this job you accept the T&C's, Privacy Policy and Disclaimers which can be found at hays.co.uk

I am looking for an experienced Data Analyst who will be able to translate business requirements into well designed, conceptual, logical a...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst

I am currently looking for a Data Analyst to come and join my client who are embarking upon a technological transformation. The Data Analyst position will play a massive role in this transformation as the data and information will be at the very heart of what they do. I am looking for an experienced Data Analyst who will be able to translate business requirements into well designed, conceptual, logical and physical data modeals and structures. As well as performing the ETL process of data integration between systems.

Key skills for the role:

  • Strong data analysis experience
  • Experience of meta-data management
  • Experience of data quality management
  • Experience of corporate and regulatory compliance
  • Experience of relational data base technologies; e.g. Oracle, SQL Server
  • Experience of relational and multi-dimensional data model design
  • Experience of data mining models and statistical techniques
  • Knowledge of reference data management
  • Knowledge of master data management
  • Knowledge of data life-cycle management
  • Knowledge of using QDI Compose, Replicate and Catalyst
  • Knowledge of data interoperability and Integration frameworks and ETL best practice
  • Knowledge of Ethical Standards Framework
  • Experience of using an ITSM tool
  • Proficient communication skills to bridge the gap between technical and business language to ensure shared understanding and effective solution delivery;
  • A degree, HND or equivalent qualification, and/or have significant relevant experience.

If you believe you are ticking a number of the boxes above and would like to be considered for the role please do apply to the position. Furthermore, if you have any queries you wish to discuss you can reach me on

jobDescription: We are currently working in partnership with a high profile government sponsored national project in the Milton Keynes area. They are seeking a Senior Informatics Data Analyst for their laboratory. This role will be on a rotating shift pattern, including  days and nights. PURPOSE OF THE ROLE: Reporting to the COO the role of the Senior Informatics Data Analyst is to primarily lead the design and implementation ...
fullDescription:
We are currently working in partnership with a high profile government sponsored national project in the Milton Keynes area. They are seeking a Senior Informatics Data Analyst for their laboratory. This role will be on a rotating shift pattern, including days and nights.

PURPOSE OF THE ROLE:

Reporting to the COO the role of the Senior Informatics Data Analyst is to primarily lead the design and implementation of Bioinformatics Systems. The role holder must be able to manage effective relationships with key stakeholders (i.e. Laboratory / Operations / IT) and provide support to the Head of Laboratories in analysing Bioinformatics Data .

In addition to the above the role holder will provide administrative and operational support to end users as well as provide support to the LIMS Developer with regard to identifying data integrity issues, analysing the root cause and implementing a fix to the solution.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

To act as the Design Authority for Bioinformatics Systems

To ensure that Bioinformatics Systems are implemented and maintained to meet the business requirements.

Provision of data for and attendance at all internal and external data quality meetings.

Design and implement informatics components of projects.

To manage relationships with key stakeholders (i.e. Laboratory / Operations / IT).

To evaluate technologies and solutions and determine suitability for Bioinformatics Systems.

To report to the Head of Laboratories with regards to progress of projects, identification of issues and proposal of solutions.

Provide estimates on resourcing and timescales for delivery.

To provide operational support to end users

PERSON SPECIFICATION:

ESSENTIAL CRITERIA

  • Strong communication skills both written and oral.
  • Experience in using programming languages such as SQL.
  • Knowledge of laboratory information management systems platforms.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Good understanding of data architecture and design.
  • Highly attentive to detail.
  • Educated to degree level or higher in computing, scientific or engineering discipline or equivalent relevant experience.
  • Experience working with complex data sets.
  • Thorough knowledge of laboratory processes and procedures and automated systems.
  • Being visible and available as a leader for all data analysis requirements including laboratory quality assurance schemes
  • Ability to interact effectively with internal and external parties in order to progress projects.
  • Ability to establish and maintain good working relationships with key stakeholders (i.e. Laboratory / Operations / IT).
  • Ability to communicate both written and orally, clearly and persuasively, explaining complicated matters simply, tailoring delivery methods/media to suit the audience’s needs and understanding.
  • Ability to clarify, plan and prioritise own work and that of the others in order to achieve objectives.
  • Ability to work proactively in order to ensure objectives are met in a timely manner.
  • Must be self-motivated with a strong work ethic.
  • Must take pride in own work, setting and achieving high standards for self and working with others.
  • Ability to analyse complex problems and propose solutions while satisfying any constraints imposed by the business i.e. resource or time.
  • Ability to consider wider impact of decisions, assessing possible outcomes and their likelihood.
  • Ability to challenge decisions and proposals appropriately to ensure processes are robust.
  • Ability to identify when escalation

jobTitle: BI Analyst / SQL Data Analyst - London, £50k - £65k
jobDescription: BI Analyst / SQL Data Analyst - Insurance, Fintech, MySQL/ PostgreSQL, Yellowfin, Qlik, Tableau, Business Objects. Datamarts, Datawarehousing, c£50k - £65k +Bonus +Benefits. Permanent, City of London & Remote Working (100% due to pandemic, fully flexible  arrangements upon return to operational environment.) BI Analyst / SQL Data Analyst required to work with a multi-national Fintech company operating within...
fullDescription:
BI Analyst / SQL Data Analyst - Insurance, Fintech, MySQL/ PostgreSQL, Yellowfin, Qlik, Tableau, Business Objects. Datamarts, Datawarehousing, c£50k - £65k +Bonus +Benefits. Permanent, City of London & Remote Working (100% due to pandemic, fully flexible arrangements upon return to operational environment.)

BI Analyst / SQL Data Analyst required to work with a multi-national Fintech company operating within the Insurance sector. You will be responsible for Data Visualisation and Business Intelligence output for clients from the perspective of both report generation and dashboard development.

This role requires a solid understanding of datamarts, datawarehouses and multiple data sources, SQL concepts & principles in order to create meaningful business intelligence, reports and visualised data (graphs etc) using a variety of data visualisation tools from Yellowfin, Business Objects, Tableau or Qlik/Qlikview. Experience with just one of these tools is more than sufficient.

The BI Analyst / SQL Data Analyst will work closely with the BI Platform Product Owners and Product Manager to understand how data insights can be best utilised and build both reports, dashboards and automated reporting functionality as required by both internal and external clients. Internal stakeholder engagement to report on data governance and external client facing work to understand requirements and respond to ad-hoc data requests will form a significant part of this role. Some ETL work will be required (Talend is the employed tool but experience with any open-source or Java based ETL tools are acceptable) and as such you will work with both datamarts and datawarehouses in order to deliver data visualisation output utilising a range of tools listed above.

We are searching for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst / SQL Data Analyst / ETL Developer / Data Visualisation Analyst who possesses a solid understanding of data mapping and data testing in a range of environments. You may have been working with a mixed environment - (for example) MySQL, PostgreSQL and/or AWS Redshift - or solely within one of these or even simply SQL Server. You will ideally be able to manipulate data within SQL, manage data datamarts and datawarehouses and utilise various BI & DV tools combining experience of report writing and dashboard development. Excellent communication skills are pre-requisite and experience working in a client facing capacity would be a distinct advantage. Insurance / Life Insurance experience an advantage but non-essential.

Excellent opportunity to work within a stable, multi-national environment within a key role enabling the enhancement of enterprise level systems within a growing Fintech/Insurtech environment. Located in the City of London with excellent benefits and career progression prospects.

The company is onboarding staff during the pandemic with 100% work from home until normal business operation can be resumed at which point a flexible approach to a mix of office and home working will be enabled and fully supported.

A successful can...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst - B2B Events

An opportunity has arisen for a highly motivated Data Analyst to join an industry leading, global b2b events marketing team.

The role of Data Analyst requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen, and exceptional written and oral communication skills to communicate effectively to technical and non-technical stakeholders.

A successful candidate will be data and insight driven with a strong understanding of marketing

KPIs and marketing automation technology.

Supported by the Head of Marketing and the Head of Digital Marketing, the successful candidate will be responsible for analysing data trends, building audience development strategies, owning the management of the database and quality of leads, and recommending channels, strategies and techniques to increase lead generation across target markets.

Utilising our client’s marketing technology platforms, you will be a champion of data, connecting it throughout the customer journey, and generating the insights that will shape our client’s digital and live events and products.

Key Candidate profile:

• Excellent knowledge of marketing automation and CRM technology (Pardot & Salesforce highly

desirable)

• Deep analytical skills with demonstrated ability to translate complex data into concrete business

• Ability to articulate power of insight to stakeholders of all levels of experience

• Strong experience in areas including database management, insight development, audience segmentation and data enrichment

• Experience developing implementation roadmaps and processes around new technology

• Experience in operational benchmarking and metrics including acquisition rates, conversion rates, database growth, lead nurture, engagement, MQL/SQL

  • Familiarity with data privacy regulations such as GDPR and PECR
  • Experience in events and/or digital publishing industry would be a bonus
  • Ideally some experience of working with and generating insights from data visualisation platforms (Salesforce Einstein and Power BI ideal)
  • Proficient in bringing together a wide mix of source data through the journey into insight (Instagram & Facebook etc.)

Lipton Media is a specialist media and tech recruitment agency based in London. We specialise in all forms of b2b sales, marketing and creative positions, including conferences, exhibitions, awards, summits, publishing, digital, outdoor, TV, radio and business intelligence and technology.

Our clients range from small start-up companies to FTSE 100 listed businesses. We work with candidates at every stage of their career from undergraduates looking for their first entry point into sales to senior managers and directors looking for their next challenge.

fullDescription:
Our client in Leeds city centre, is a financial services firm with offices in Leeds city centre. Working as part of the wider Marketing & Communications team, our client is looking for a Data Analyst to work on an initial 12 month fixed term contract with the aim of working with and delivering data relating to target clients.

To be considered for this excellent opportunity, you will demonstrate experience of working within a similar data led role, with strong analysis skills and Advanced knowledge of Excel. In addition, you will have the following:

  • Graduate calibre ideally or A Level educated
  • Excellent knowledge of Excel including V Lookups, Pivot Tables, with strong numerical skills
  • Experience of working with numerical Data, manipulating and cleansing data and producing management reports using Excel
  • 1st class communication skills across all mediums

Working within a small team, your duties & responsibilities will be varied and will include the following:

  • Working with the client database, extracting raw data, cleansing and manipulating using Excel to produce reports.
  • Assessing and analysing data and conducting product insight investigations, looking for trends and customer patterns
  • Analysing data, to target clients with the right form of communications, using this data to assess the range of products that should be directed to them
  • Working with clients to onboard them to the system, managing any queries and updating client communications on the site
  • Managing client email communications and other forms of communication and reporting thereon

If you have the skills and experience outlined above, please contact us immediately to be considered for this position. Without the above skills and specific data, analytical and communications experience, your application will not be considered.

Due to the volume of responses currently received, we are unable to reply to every individual application. If your skills fit our criteria, we will be in contact with you within 24-48 hours.

jobDescription: Due to a surge of new Digital projects, a fantastic opportunity has arisen with one of our forward thinking North East based clients. This is an opportunity for to make that next step in your career and join a forward thinking and supportive business and become a key figure in new and exciting pro...
fullDescription:
Due to a surge of new Digital projects, a fantastic opportunity has arisen with one of our forward thinking North East based clients.

As well as a very competitive salary the benefits package within the market is highly attractive (happy to discuss in more detail).

This is an opportunity for to make that next step in your career and join a forward thinking and supportive business and become a key figure in new and exciting projects and clients. Furthermore a career path which will enable you to develop and work with diverse thinking teams, clients and new technologies and work with Data and Technical teams across the organisation on current and exciting new systems and applications, as well as developing yourself.

As a key member of the team, you will be working within the data team and alongside our technology team to take raw data from key sources and transform this into useable information to enable the business to better use its data.

Due to Covid this for now will be a remote position.

Main Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Working within the Data Team and alongside technology team, to take raw data from key sources and transform this into useable information
  • Support colleagues from across the wider business to get the most out of the data they collect. This includes performance reporting, continuous improvement, gaining more insights to support innovation and change management
  • Flexibility in undertaking responsibilities, in keeping with the needs of the business, whilst supporting wider business colleagues and clients
  • Displaying results in effective Power BI visuals, or equally used by our Data Scientist and combined with other data for further analysis with results pushed back to core system

Key Skills and Experience (Not all Essential)

  • Experienced SQL developer combining data from multiple data sources
  • Expert knowledge of data migration and integration techniques e.g. ETL, SSIS
  • Proven analytical skills including evaluation, analysis and visualisation
  • Understand the importance of adhering to coding standards and documenting processes
  • Knowledge and experience of Azure DevOps

jobDescription: Job Title: Data Analyst Location: Bradford (Office Based) Salary: £22,000 to £26,000 Job Type: Full Time, Permanent About the company Head-quartered in Bradford, we are a leading manufacturer and supplier of FMCG productsto wholesalers and independent buying groups worldwide. Including premium quality, own-brand e...
fullDescription:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Bradford (Office Based)

Salary: £22,000 to £26,000

Job Type: Full Time, Permanent

About the company

Head-quartered in Bradford, we are a leading manufacturer and supplier of FMCG productsto wholesalers and independent buying groups worldwide. Including premium quality, own-brand everyday essentials, from personal care and hygiene products, to PPE Kits and smart LED ranges.

As a multinational with over 25 years in the industry, we have dedicated administration and production facilities in India and China to support our growing global operation. Our commitment to our tradepartners and consumers is tomanufacture andsupply a diverse range of Healthcare and fast-moving consumer goods that continually exceed expectations in quality, price and performance for the global market place.

The role:

We’re looking for someone with extensive experience oflysis a data anand data mining to provide new customer insights, new markets and new opportunities as well as optimising revenue, product range selection, sales focus and marketing opportunities.

You will be analysing a broad range of internal data to spot trends and opportunities for increased sales and additional revenue amongst existing and lapsed customers, as well as helping to forecast changing customer requirements and future market demand.

Key Duties:

  • Continuous improvement in our understanding of customer requirements.
  • Produce regular written briefings to management on changes and advances across our customer base.
  • Support our sales teams by providing detailed analysis of order frequency, order mix, order value, retention and growth trends across all customer groups.
  • Provide insight facilitating better customer segmentation and marketing personalisation.
  • Further inform our sourcing and stock control approach through product and category performance analysis.
  • Increase our understanding of the customer journey among different buyers.
  • Mine data across multiple internal and external sources.
  • Source and integrate relevant external data to create new insights.

About you:

  • Have 2/3 years’ experience in a relevant role.
  • Should have hands-on experience to use Zoho CRM, Phocas, Net stocks and Sage.
  • The ability to work independently with little or no supervision.
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Exceptional analytical approach.
  • Strong data analysis skills and real attention to detail.
  • Ability to turn mass data into actionable insight.
  • Expert in Excel, good working knowledge of PowerPoint.

jobDescription: Data Analyst£30,000 - £40,000 pa plus excellent benefits packageChorley / Remote Are you an ambitious Data enthusiast who is looking for an opportunity to work with a company who can provide limitless opportunities as they grow?Do you have 1-2 years (possibly more!) experience handling a database with large datasets?Do you possess advanced computer skills and knowledge of addi...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst

£30,000 - £40,000 pa plus excellent benefits package

Chorley / Remote

Are you an ambitious Data enthusiast who is looking for an opportunity to work with a company who can provide limitless opportunities as they grow?

Do you have 1-2 years (possibly more!) experience handling a database with large datasets?

Do you possess advanced computer skills and knowledge of additional databases such as SQL Server and MySQL?

If so, please read on as this a unique opportunity for a talented Data Analyst looking to really make their mark in the industry right now and reap the rewards from doing so..

The company

They are a leading provider of guest wifi analytics for hospitality venues, but they can provide the infrastructure to collect data and insight about their customer's guests, their behaviours and habits. Which makes them the authority on customer insight in hospitality.

Their insight post COVID has never been more valuable. They help create a single customer view that enable brands and venues to proactively engage with their guests, build up detailed customer personas, and differentiate and identify loyal customers from sporadic ones. They support growing revenue by targeting the right guests and maximising marketing budgets, making them go further and giving an ROI on any spend.

They are a fast-paced, entrepreneurial business with a hugely talented team. The culture is hard-working but fun, their values are based on loyalty, honesty, tenacity, innovation, authenticity, agility, and above all teamwork.

The role

As the Data Analyst in the team, you will:
* Analyse the firm's operations for trends, volume, demographics, and operator metrics to support decisions
* Develop analytics to identify trend lines across several data sources within the organisation
* Utilise historical data sets and planned product changes to model and forecast business trends
* Apply predictive analysis and tools to forecast and employ business analytics (including an enhanced ability to quantify and qualify data)
* Undertake operational research to identify and recommend optimal/near-optimal solutions to complex challenges.
* Responsible for tracking and reporting on department initiatives and status reports This is a great opportunity to develop your skills whilst playing a major role in shaping the continued future growth in the UK and worldwide. Opportunities for progression are endless for the right person!

What skills will you need
* Bachelor's degree in Information Management, Computer Science, or Statistics Mathematical, or in a technical field is preferred
* Minimum of 1 year of experience handling a database with large datasets.
* Advanced computer skills, knowledge of additional databases such as SQL Server and MySQL.
* It is also essential you are familiar with data warehousing, data mining, and data mapping.
* You should have experience working with high performance distributed SQL query engines
* Quantitative skills: Knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis software to provide quantitative and qualitative data analysis
* Research skills: It is essential that applicants can undertake in-depth research, quantify the information, and produce qualitative and quantitative reports.
* Advanced Excel skills including producing easy to understand graphs for wider dissemination
* Key Skills
* Is engaging and proactive
* Has excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Is tenacious and agile
* Is results orientated
* Has excellent organisation and time management skills
* Is a self-starter with ability to prioritise team and individual workloads
Please send me your CV by applying to this advert and once received, I will call you to discuss the opportunity in more detail and next steps. One not to be missed, for sure!

jobDescription: We are looking for an experience Data Analyst to work at the QEQM Margate, Kent. Role: The Facilities Data Analyst will be responsible for the collation, interpretation, and presentation of various data sets pertaining to cleaning within Facilities. The role-holder will have the ability and confidence to use the systems and platforms currently in place to record data, and be responsible for translating it into comprehens...
fullDescription:
We are looking for an experience Data Analyst to work at the QEQM Margate, Kent.

Role:

The Facilities Data Analyst will be responsible for the collation, interpretation, and presentation of various data sets pertaining to cleaning within Facilities.

The role-holder will have the ability and confidence to use the systems and platforms currently in place to record data, and be responsible for translating it into comprehensive reports, graphics and charts, as well as maintaining the data within the systems.

You will be responsible for reporting and analysing trends or anomalies to the team Manager and Facilities Directorate, and identifying any inconsistencies or lapses in results.

The role will work closely with members of the Facilities, therefore will need to be able to work with staff of varying levels. Excellent communication skills are required to be successful in this role.

This role is an integral part of the team, adding true value to the business.

Key responsibilities:

  • Monitoring team performance against SLAs and KPIs, and interrogate data to discover any recurring features that lead to potential failures.
  • Produce both regular and ad-hoc reports for the internal Senior Leadership team and client teams.
  • Interrogate data to identify patterns and trends.
  • Work with other members of the department to ensure data is updated and provided in a timely manner.
  • Production of reports both for measuring statistics locally and for Director and Board-level reports.
  • Interpret complex data and create visual representation of this data to make it accessible, understandable and usable for the Facilities team

  • Combine data sets across multiple sources

The ideal Candidate will have:

  • Excellent analytic skills
  • Ability to work with large amounts of information
  • Ability to interpret requests for data and turn these in to reports
  • High level of communication skills - both written and oral
  • Highly levels of accuracy and attention to detail due to large requirement for input of data
  • Problem solving skills
  • High levels of IT literacy, particularly in the use of Excel
  • Find and propose/implement solutions to continually improve service delivery
  • Critical thinking; able to review numbers, trends, data and present findings
  • Meeting deadlines in a fast paced, reactive environment
  • Creative and adaptive thinker

If you believe you have what it takes to be a Data Analyst, then we would love to hear from you.

fullDescription:
Data Analyst

UKROEd currently has an exciting opportunity for a permanent Data Analyst to work within our Data Security & Information Management Team on a permanent basis.

UKROEd is the wholly-owned trading subsidiary of the Road Safety Trust, a registered charity and company limited by guarantee. Since its creation in April 2014, the Trust has established itself as the leading independent funding body for road safety research and practical interventions in Great Britain.

Purpose of the Role

UKROEd manages and administers the National Driver Offender Retraining Scheme (NDORS) on behalf of the police service in the UK. The company functions as a legal body with responsibility to collect and distribute police cost recovery, as well as funding the necessary activities of the NDORS scheme.

The scheme provides:

  • course design, review and development;
  • research and evaluation;
  • instructor, trainer, monitor and assessor training;
  • trainer and provider licence, issue and compliance, as well as assessment and personal development advice and guidance focused on quality and consistency;
  • data security with administration of the attendance process;
  • policy, procedure, guidance and general advice to promote consistency in the provision of scheme courses;
  • user and internal stakeholder liaison and guidance focused on quality.

The Data Analyst will be responsible for identifying the most appropriate data, sources of data, and metrics, to reveal trends and insight in key performance indicators, in support of strategic and operational business decision-making and continual process improvement.

The Data Analyst will lead on the day-to-day transaction service management tasks for the DORS+ system and the online Managed Learning Environment, which support the National Driver Offender Retraining Scheme. The two systems are referred to as the "DORS+ Service". We are ideally looking for a competent professional who has experience of data analysis to inform strategic and operational business decision-making.

The successful candidate will have the ability to support across all areas of the organisation and to work collaboratively, both internally and externally across our stakeholder landscape. They will also have proven customer service experience, attention to detail and excellent communication skills.

We are offering a competitive benefits package and you would be joining a supportive team, with excellent training and professional development opportunities.

The post is a full-time permanent role, based on a 37.5 hour working week (Mon-Fri) with some flexibility on time allocation. Weekend and out of hours working may be required from time to time to support critical business activities.

The role is predominantly office-based in Central Manchester with some national travel required.

The salary for the post is £40,000.

The post is pensionable and offers 28 days of annual leave per year in addition to statutory holidays.

Please note this post is also subject to the successful candidate either holding or being able to successfully obtain NPPV Level 3 vetting.

To request an application pack, please click on apply and submit your latest CV with a short covering letter.

Completed applications must be submitted by 5:00 pm on Monday 18 January 2021.

fullDescription:
MP&L Data Analyst required for an organisation based in Coventry.

Your new company
You will be working for a manufacturing organisation based in Coventry who are looking to add an MP&L Data Analyst to their team.

Your new role
You will be working in the MP&L team and will have responsibility for ordering and expediting raw material and bought out parts, along with day to day contact with customers, monitoring parts through production in line with the schedule requirement.This will also involve making sure that inventory levels are kept at the correct levels so that the production plans can be executed. In order to do this effectively you will need to forecast demand and use Kanban methods to ensure raw materials are ordered in time and take into account lead times. You will work closely with suppliers and also internally with the production teams.

What you'll need to succeed
In order to succeed you will have worked in a similar position previously within a fast paced manufacturing environment such as aerospace, automotive or defence. You will be a highly analytical individual and will be comfortable in producing accurate forecasts and managing accurate inventory levels. You will need to be an advanced user of Microsoft Excel to ensure that you have the capability to do this accurately. You will need to comfortable with liaising with demanding suppliers and will be a confident communicator with both internal and external stakeholders.

What you'll get in return
In return, you will receive a salary of between £30,000 - £35,000 dependent on experience.

What you need to do now

fullDescription:
data - insight - customer - sales - marketing - crm - analysis - retail

Our client is an industry leading business that consistently strives to innovate digital and marketing performance leading to great customer experiences across all platforms. 

This is an exciting opportunity for a Marketing Data Analyst to join a growing team and help take their marketing efforts to another level. 

Role Requirements

• Manage all customer requirements, utilising client data to tell story.

• Keep on top of all projects and have a strong understanding of client needs.

• Work on different databases and systems to acquire the required information.

• Carry out several analysis and develop reports, working alongside the IT team and other parts of the business. Therefore make suggestions and propose changes for best outcome.

• Develop your marketing experience and knowledge.

Gaining an understanding of different systems and conducting analysis based on customer requirements.

Person Specification

• Previous experience in a Retail Analytics role

• Advanced Excel

• Understanding of Access or SQL Server Management Studio would be a bonus

• Marketing experience or knowledge, with commercial experience would also be a big bonus

If you would like more information in regards to this opportunity then feel free to give me a call on or alternatively email

If you are not interested but know somebody who would be then we can offer other incentives for anybody who can refer successful candidates.

The company is ideally looking for someone who is based in Cl...
fullDescription:
My client is seeking a Junior Data Analyst to join their well-established company in the Clitheroe. This is a perfect opportunity for someone who has recently graduated with a Maths, Computer Science or Statistics degree and is at the beginning of their career and has a little experience either via work placement or working as an analyst for a year or two.

The company is ideally looking for someone who is based in Clitheroe (or local) or willing relocate. The salary for this role is between £18,000 - £23,000.

This role will provide you with everything you need to embark on a successful career within data analytics and will provide you with excellent training and career progression.

Required skills

  • BA Honours in Maths, Statistics, Computer Science or Physics or similar - MUST
  • Skilled in using Excel
  • Experience in Data Cleansing
  • Experience creating data sets, migrating data
  • Knowledge visualising data
  • Knowledge of SQL -
  • Knowledge/experience of visualising data


The client is looking to fill this opportunity immediately, so please apply ASAP or get in touch on to discuss in further detail or send your CV direct to me at (thomas . warburton @ itecco . co . uk).

Built on a foundation of industry-leading technology, a world-class team and a scientific approach to building a truly recognisable brand, ITECCO are fast becoming the UK's most influential IT recruitment company

Keywords: Analysis, and Data Analysis, SQL, Analyst, Excel, Graduate

jobDescription: Data Analyst £35,000 per year  Bolton   Monday-Friday 9am-5pm  Why should you work for us? "High 5’s for the little things as well as the big" "I love that the CEO is always on the floor saying hello, this makes a huge difference" "The main difference I have found is the bond...
fullDescription:
Data Analyst

£35,000 per year

Bolton

Monday-Friday 9am-5pm

Why should you work for us?

"High 5’s for the little things as well as the big"

"I love that the CEO is always on the floor saying hello, this makes a huge difference"

"The main difference I have found is the bond between staff members and teams, this is awesome and refreshing"

"Families don’t let each other down, and that’s why I think we are doing well"

"LOVE inductions and training SHINE"

How do we keep our family feel during these challenging times?

  • Live Instagram Q&As with the CEO and staff from all areas of the business
  • Monthly Buzz Awards celebrating success across the business
  • Social events planned by you and the Love Social Committee team
  • Daily business updates

The role

Due to continued success we have a fantastic new opportunity for a results-driven, passionate, and hard-working Data Analyst to join our thriving development team. We have a new data warehouse, rich in content and are looking for an experienced data analyst who can join us to help our business users become more data driven and use the self-serve functionality of our data models as well as create and evolve the master reporting suite for our key reports.

Data Analyst main duties include:

  • Reporting to the Development Manager the Data Analyst will be responsible for building reporting tools and dashboards in power BI
  • Reconciling data to source using SQL
  • Liaising with business stakeholders to get reporting requirements
  • Liaising with data engineers to build additional functionality
  • Building measures in SSAS for self-serve reporting
  • Tutoring business users in accessing data from the self-serve model
  • Producing adhoc reports for the business
  • Taking ownership of the reporting suite

Data Analyst experience/Skills:

  • Minimum of 2 years’ experience working in the following programmes; Tableau/ Power BI, SQL Azure SSAS Tabular Experience
  • Minimum of 2 years SQL experience
  • Analytical mind with at least 2 years data analysis experience
  • Excellent attention to detail
  • The ability to explain technical concepts to stakeholders without a technical background
  • Able to follow complex logic
  • Self-motivated with a passion for learning new technologies and concepts
  • Team Player

Working at Love has it perks! Take a look at some of our benefits…

  • Access to Love Loyalty Club and exclusive shares
  • Healthcare package
  • Competitive Holiday entitlement
  • Flexible working (part office/ part home based)
  • Employee discount scheme
  • Exciting social events including themed celebrations and parties, charity functions and conferences
  • Fantastic progression opportunity with clear succession planning and the opportunity to complete qualifications
  • An experienced and committed Learning and Development team providing a warm welcome
  • Regular incentives and rewards including the monthly Buzz Awards recognising best newcomers, top performers and service heroes
  • A secure future through our Pension plan
  • Refer a Friend Scheme rewarding up to £300 in vouchers!
  • Branded Clothing

If you are ready to pursue the road to adventure, grow with a successful, award winning energy consultancy, and work in a role you're destined to LOVE, don’t hold back! Get in touch!

* We are an equal opportunities employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Should you require any additional support during the recruitment process due to a disability, please contact us so we can assist you.



If you haven’t received a phone call or an invitation to interview after two to three weeks, unfortunately you haven’t been successful on this occasion

jobDescription: Page Personnel are recruiting a Data Analyst for a high performing and market leading, services led business, based in Leeds.  Client Details Page Personnel are recruiting a Data Analyst for a high performing and market leading, services led business, based in Leeds.  Description As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for providing meaningful data and analysis to stakeholders ...
fullDescription:
Page Personnel are recruiting a Data Analyst for a high performing and market leading, services led business, based in Leeds.

Client Details

Page Personnel are recruiting a Data Analyst for a high performing and market leading, services led business, based in Leeds.

Description

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for providing meaningful data and analysis to stakeholders across the business to aid with key decision making.

Duties will include, however are not limited to, exploring and identifying trends in data, processing reports, producing and suggesting new ways of reporting, client analysis and presenting this back to stakeholders internally in a clear and understandable format.

This is a fantastic opportunity for an analytically minded candidate looking to progress and develop their skills in a commercial, fast paced environment.

Profile

The successful candidate will:

  • Have experience in a relevant role previously
  • Have strong Excel skills
  • Have very good verbal and written stakeholder management skills
  • Have used Power BI/Tableau/data visualisation tools previously

Job Offer

£28,000 - £32,000 + free on site parking + 26 days annual leave (plus bank holidays) + flexible working + pension scheme + competitive benefits + excellent development opportunity + permanent role

jobDescription: We are looking for a Data Analyst lead to join our growing team, based in the North-West of England. The candidate will be required to successfully deliver digital apprenticeships programmes for Data Analyst Level 4 apprentices and IS Business Analyst Level 4 apprentices. The candidate must be able to demonstrate up-to-date technical competence, knowledge & understanding to be consi...
fullDescription:
We are looking for a Data Analyst lead to join our growing team, based in the North-West of England.

The candidate will be required to successfully deliver digital apprenticeships programmes for Data Analyst Level 4 apprentices and IS Business Analyst Level 4 apprentices.

The candidate must be able to demonstrate up-to-date technical competence, knowledge & understanding to be considered for the role, of:

  • Identifying, collecting and migrating data to/from a range of internal and external systems
  • Manipulating and linking different data sets as required
  • Interpreting and applying the organisations data and information security standards, policies and procedures to data management activities
  • Performing database queries across multiple tables to extract data for analysis
  • Performing routine statistical analyses and ad-hoc queries
  • Using a range of analytical techniques such as data mining, time-series forecasting and modelling techniques to identify and predict trends and patterns in data
  • Assisting with production of performance dashboards and the production of a range of ad-hoc and standard data analysis reports
  • Summarising and presenting the results of data analysis to a range of stakeholders making recommendations

Key Responsibilities:

  • Deliver high quality training, coaching and assessment to apprentices
  • Act as course lead for curriculum development; supporting existing tutors with delivery and CPD
  • Inspire, motivate and raise apprentices’ aspirations through their passion for the sector.
  • Conduct regular face-to-face sessions and progress reviews with apprentices and their employers, complemented by eLearning.
  • Adhere to all NowSkills policies & procedures, Education & Skills Funding Agency, Ofsted and Awarding Body requirements.
  • Share best practice amongst the Operations Team and attend all internal meetings/training as required.
  • Maintaining continued professional development (CPD) and keeping up to date with all industry developments and practices.

Experience and Qualification requirements:

  • Industry experience in roles similar to Data Analyst (and IS Business Analyst)
  • Related qualifications pertaining to the roles of Data Analyst (and IS Business Analyst)
  • A keen interest in education and a passion to train, assess and coach apprentices in their digital careers
  • Recognised teaching/training qualification is essential
  • Must have excellent administrative skills with the ability to prioritise workloads, work methodically, accurately and effectively under pressure while maintaining a positive attitude
  • Resilience and adaptability when dealing with challenge or change, or support apprentice to overcome barriers to career and personal development
  • Full driving licence and own transport is essential
  • Excellent English, Maths and digital skills

NowSkills is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity.

Become part of our team and apply today!

jobDescription: Business Data Analyst Automotive An opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst / Business Analyst with a knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Power BI and SQL to join a leading automotive consultancy, operating on a European scale and working with major car manufacturers. The Business Data Analyst wi...
fullDescription:
Business Data Analyst

Automotive

An opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst / Business Analyst with a knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Power BI and SQL to join a leading automotive consultancy, operating on a European scale and working with major car manufacturers. The Business Data Analyst will support decision makers within the business through quantitative and qualitative data analysis and accurate reporting of trends and insights.

Office Based, commutable from - Thatcham, Hungerford, Whitchurch, Newbury, Basingstoke, Andover, Marlborough, Wantage, Didcot, Reading, Wokingham, Hook

Salary:up to £36,000

The Role

  • Interpret business and customer data, analysing the results to provide ongoing, accurate reporting.
  • Develop data analytics and other strategies to optimise efficiency and quality.
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary sources and provide insights into performance and opportunities.
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
  • Filter and "clean" data by reviewing reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct problems.
  • Work with management to prioritise business and information needs.
  • Locate and define new process improvements with existing reporting methods.
  • Leverage expertise regarding data models, data mining and segmentation techniques to drive process efficiencies.

The Candidate

  • Proven experience of supporting management teams through manipulating and analysing business data is a must for this role.
  • A degree, or equivalent, in the areas of business, statistics or computer science is advantageous.
  • Strong Microsoft Excel skills are a necessity for this position.
  • A working knowledge of reporting and visualisation packages, particularly Microsoft SSRS and Power BI is required.
  • You should be experienced with SQL databases.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate large amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Previous experience within the automotive industry is advantageous but not essential.

Apply in Confidence

To apply for the position of Business Data Analyst please forward your CV to Kayleigh Bradley, Senior Recruitment Consultant at Glen Callum Associates Ltd or call Kayleigh directly for a further chat on the job.

JOB REF 3482KB - Business Data Analyst

Glen Callum Associates are a leading automotive recruitment consultancy with a vast amount of experience of operating within the automotive aftermarket on a Global scale.

jobDescription: Job Title: Senior Data Analyst – Retail/Ecommerce Company   Location: Reading/Remote Working     Salary: Up to £55,000 depending on experience plus benefits    About the Retail/Ecommerce Company  Growing retail/ecommerce company seeking a talented Senior Data Analyst to become a ke...
fullDescription:
Job Title: Senior Data Analyst – Retail/Ecommerce Company  

Location: Reading/Remote Working    

Salary: Up to £55,000 depending on experience plus benefits   

About the Retail/Ecommerce Company 

Growing retail/ecommerce company seeking a talented Senior Data Analyst to become a key member of their dynamic team. This forward-thinking ecommerce-based company sells and distributes a range of books and tech products and is one of the largest global third-party Amazon partners. They have a collaborative, friendly and entrepreneurial culture. The new Senior Data Analyst will have the autonomy to make a big impact whilst receiving support and opportunities to grow and develop.  

About the Senior Data Analyst Role  

The Senior Data Analyst will play a key role in modelling the results of customer activity in response to pricing changes.  
 

Key Responsibilities for the Senior Data Analyst:  

  • Leveraging data about customers, products and competitors 
  • Performing analysis, data mining and trend spotting 
  • Collaborate with internal teams to create pricing algorithms 
  • Refine and analyse large data sets to produce tangible business strategies 
  • Create and improve dashboards 

About You  

You’ll be a talented data analyst with a strong quant background, looking to progress your career within a growing ecommerce company.  
 

Skills and experience needed for the Senior Data Analyst role:  

  • Experience in a data analyst/scientist role 
  • Advanced Excel skills 
  • SQL skills 
  • Experience in a retail/ecommerce environment beneficial 
  • Dashboarding and data visualisation experience beneficial 

For more information about the Data Analyst role or to apply please send your CV to Neil at  or call .

jobDescription: Due to a surge of new Digital projects, a fantastic opportunity has arisen with one of our forward thinking North East based clients.  As well as a very competitive salary the benefits package within the market is highly attractive (happy to discuss in more detail). This is an opportunity for to make that next step in your career and join a forward thinking and supportive business and become a key figure in new and exciting pro...
fullDescription:
Due to a surge of new Digital projects, a fantastic opportunity has arisen with one of our forward thinking North East based clients.

As well as a very competitive salary the benefits package within the market is highly attractive (happy to discuss in more detail).

This is an opportunity for to make that next step in your career and join a forward thinking and supportive business and become a key figure in new and exciting projects and clients. Furthermore a career path which will enable you to develop and work with diverse thinking teams, clients and new technologies and work with Data and Technical teams across the organisation on current and exciting new systems and applications, as well as developing yourself.

As a key member of the team, you will be working within the data team and alongside our technology team to take raw data from key sources and transform this into useable information to enable the business to better use its data.

Due to Covid this for now will be a remote position.

Main Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Working within the Data Team and alongside technology team, to take raw data from key sources and transform this into useable information
  • Support colleagues from across the wider business to get the most out of the data they collect. This includes performance reporting, continuous improvement, gaining more insights to support innovation and change management
  • Flexibility in undertaking responsibilities, in keeping with the needs of the business, whilst supporting wider business colleagues and clients
  • Displaying results in effective Power BI visuals, or equally used by our Data Scientist and combined with other data for further analysis with results pushed back to core system

Key Skills and Experience (Not all Essential)

  • Experienced SQL developer combining data from multiple data sources
  • Expert knowledge of data migration and integration techniques e.g. ETL, SSIS
  • Proven analytical skills including evaluation, analysis and visualisation
  • Understand the importance of adhering to coding standards and documenting processes
  • Knowledge and experience of Azure DevOps

jobDescription: Senior Informatics Data Analyst*Senior Informatics Data Analyst required by leading Biotech firm based in Milton Keynes*A leading Biotech firm, based in Milton Keynes, currently require a Senior Informatics Data Analyst to join a team in designing Bioinformatics systems for the company. The Senior Informatics data Analyst will ensure that Bioinformatics Systems are implemented  and configured to meet business requirem...
fullDescription:
Senior Informatics Data Analyst

*Senior Informatics Data Analyst required by leading Biotech firm based in Milton Keynes*

A leading Biotech firm, based in Milton Keynes, currently require a Senior Informatics Data Analyst to join a team in designing Bioinformatics systems for the company. The Senior Informatics data Analyst will ensure that Bioinformatics Systems are implemented and configured to meet business requirements while managing key relationships with stakeholders across the business, inclusive of IT/Ops and Lab services.

Upon joining, the Senior Informatics Data Analyst will not only design, implement and maintain Bioinformatics systems but also provide support to the Head of Laboratories in analysing Bioinformatics Data. The Senior Informatics Data Analyst will work closely with the LIMS Development team as well as Informatics Data Scientists to interpret and capture useable Bioinformatics data.

In terms of skills, we are looking for Senior Informatics Data Analysts with good experience of programming languages, such as SQL, a solid knowledge of Laboratory Information Management System platforms (LIMS) as well as a strong knowledge of working with complex data sets and laboratory processes.

This opportunity would suit a Senior Informatics Data Analyst who is looking to work with a leading Biotech who are helping in the fight against disease a very current issue. If this sounds exciting, please apply within!

Key Words: Senior Informatics Data Analyst, Biotech. Bioinformatician, Bioinformatics, Systems, Laboratory, LIMS, Laboratory Information Management Systems, Data Scientist, Data, Complex Data Sets, Milton Keynes

jobDescription: NHS England and Improvement is expanding their analytical capacity and are looking to recruit new apprentices to support the NHS. They are recruiting to two teams, one supporting the Midlands region, the other the South East. You will work with regional  colleagues on a variety of performance, clinical and quality areas to help support delivery of high quality services for patients.  A typical day  Design...
fullDescription:
NHS England and Improvement is expanding their analytical capacity and are looking to recruit new apprentices to support the NHS. They are recruiting to two teams, one supporting the Midlands region, the other the South East. You will work with regional colleagues on a variety of performance, clinical and quality areas to help support delivery of high quality services for patients.

A typical day

  • Design a regional data collection around hospital-based outbreaks - working with the COVID outbreak administrative teams, agree what data requires collecting, designing a form for collection and the backend to collate the returning information.
  • Developing a storyboard presentation for a healthcare community on a clinical pathway - that includes data from a wide range of sources and sets out the key messages
  • Summarise a set of data, to be regularly updated, to show how a region compares to others clinical areas, covering spend, efficiency, clinical outcomes and patient satisfaction.
  • Consider and respond to the impact of COVID on various services
  • Generating graphs and tables from various data sets
  • Producing business intelligence reports
  • Log, analyse and manage problems in order to identify and implement the appropriate solution, ensuring that the problem is fixed
  • Interpretation of data, statistics, evaluation, or simple modelling or forecasting as needed.
  • Discussing and assessing priorities with end users and customers
  • Maintaining, cleansing and exploration of data on various databases

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • You are inquisitive and methodical in applying analytical skills.
  • You have a high attention to detail
  • Use a mix of SQL, VBA, R & Tableau to work directly with large data sets and produce analysis at scale. As an analyst you’ll be taught to use these technical tools.
  • You will need to build good working relationships and be reliable
  • You need to be able to work to a deadline, fulfilling your role as part of a team.
  • Great communication skills
  • Great problem solving skills - you are an active listener and ask for clarification when building a solution

Perks and benefits

  • WhiteHat community
  • Pension

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects:

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

jobDescription: Ark Schools is looking for an enthusiastic team player to join our strategy team as a Data Analyst Apprentice.
