You will be working alongside the wider Data and Insight Team, with a focus on analysing data that is captured from a wide range of online technology platforms.  <...
fullDescription:
Ark Schools is looking for an enthusiastic team player to join our strategy team as a Data Analyst Apprentice. They pride themselves on having a sector-leading approach to information systems and data analysis. You will use sector leading tools to interpret and present data. You will be working alongside the wider Data and Insight Team, with a focus on analysing data that is captured from a wide range of online technology platforms.

A typical day

  • Participate in meetings with the wider analyst team to understand key priorities
  • Work with other teams to understand their priorities, and learn how data is used across Ark
  • Support with the export of key data sources from a range of online learning platforms
  • Develop experience with web analytics tools - full training will be provided so don't worry if they are new to you
  • Work with the Head of Insight and Director of Strategy to create and monitor dashboards to support organisation key performance indicators
  • Maintain data tables which are shared with key stakeholders on a regular basis
  • Over time, write summaries and short reports which provide insight into the data

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • You enjoy learning new concepts quickly and are keen to learn and share knowledge with others
  • You love problem solving and enjoy finding simple and practical solutions to complex problems, with a curious mindset always asking 'why’
  • You enjoy being part of a team, collaborating with others and have good interpersonal skills
  • You are enthusiastic, self-motivated and keen to achieve

Perks and benefits

  • Discounts
  • Pension
  • WhiteHat community

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects:

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

jobDescription: There is no shortage of data collected from across the NHS. As a Data Analyst working for The NHS, you will be part of a large, dynamic team. You will deliver high quality analytical outputs, using good, relevant technical skills in data management, business  intelligence and analytics, and data science.  A typical day  Cleanse and manage data (including processing)Quality assure data and analyti...
fullDescription:
There is no shortage of data collected from across the NHS. As a Data Analyst working for The NHS, you will be part of a large, dynamic team. You will deliver high quality analytical outputs, using good, relevant technical skills in data management, business intelligence and analytics, and data science.

A typical day

  • Cleanse and manage data (including processing)
  • Quality assure data and analytical outputs following best practice guidelines
  • Integrate data feeds from disparate sources
  • Respond to incoming requests for information in a timely and efficient manner
  • Develop business intelligence reports
  • Plan, design, manage, execute and report tests, using appropriate tools and techniques
  • Be highly numerate and use a variety of analytical techniques to provide high quality, timely analysis and intelligence relating to key priorities
  • Be adaptable when finding analytical solutions to problems, to analyse and triangulate data in innovative ways and present findings clearly to a range of audiences
  • Log, analyse and manage problems in order to identify and implement the appropriate solution, ensuring that the problem is fixed
  • Work collaboratively with colleagues across our team and the wider organisation.

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • IT skills
  • Highly numerate / mathematical skills
  • Basic statistical knowledge
  • Experience of generating reports from the analysis of raw data
  • High level of computer literacy (Microsoft Excel is essential; relational database experience and familiarity with analytical software/coding languages such as SAS, Python and R is beneficial)
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to re-prioritise

Perks and benefits

  • WhiteHat community
  • Pension

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects:

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

jobDescription: Vacancy: Data Analyst Skills: SQL, Excel, Python Location: Manchester / Oldham Salary: Up to £45,000  The Role If you are currently an analyst but aspire to be a Data Scientist or Data Engineer then this is absolutely the role for you! We are looking for someone who has a couple of years or so working in industr...
fullDescription:
Vacancy: Data Analyst

Skills: SQL, Excel, Python

Location: Manchester / Oldham

Salary: Up to £45,000

The Role

If you are currently an analyst but aspire to be a Data Scientist or Data Engineer then this is absolutely the role for you!

We are looking for someone who has a couple of years or so working in industry as an analyst but wants to take that next step in their career and work with some more advanced analytical technologies. Best of all - this company can provide the training and development for you to get there.

You will have a wider team around you and the team is responsible for identifying and driving the adoption of best practices for data collection, aggregation and analysis in addition to surfacing new insights from this data via statistical analysis, modelling and techniques such as machine learning.

This position is based in greater Manchester and is offered on a split working pattern, 2/3 days in a week can be done remotely.

Role Responsibilities

  • Implementing speed improvements and costing decreases for common queries
  • Produce internal monitoring dashboards
  • Providing data experience to the development team to help with data issues such as performance at scale
  • Understanding and being able to explain/define what different data is
  • Development work as required for prototyping or data-specific tasks
  • Optimisation of data-related processes
  • Handling data in a safe and secure manner
  • Identifying new potential data sources

Role Requirements:

  • Essential - SQL - Programming, Data extraction, Queries etc.
  • Essential - Experience with a business intelligence tool - Tableau, PowerBI, Looker etc.
  • Essential - Good communication skills to gather data reporting requirements.
  • Bonus - knowledge of Python or R
  • Bonus - knowledge of Data Engineering principles.

The Company

This is an awesome opportunity to join a company, produce some great insights, see the fruits of your work and really develop your career.

Apply now!

What's left to say? You know what to do. If you're the type of person that reaches for the stars and wants to work in a fun supportive environment and rapidly progress your career whilst working with the latest technologies in data and you've got the relevant technical experience as a Data Analyst hit that apply button to submit your application now.

Interviews for this position will be commencing immediately so be sure to not miss out! You will be contacted by a phone call or by email to book an appointment, please be patient.

Vacancy: Data Analyst

Skills: SQL, Excel, Python

Location: Manchester / Oldham

Salary: Up to £45,000

Oscar Technology is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

To understand more about what we do with your data please review our privacy policy in the privacy section of the Oscar website.

jobTitle: Telephone Billing Analyst / Data Analyst / Business Analyst
jobDescription: Job Title: Telephone Billing Analyst Location: City of London Salary: Competitive Job Type: Full Time, Permanent The company is a leading IT, Print and Telecoms Solutions company in the heart of the City of London. They're based at the centre of the business district, and are surrounded by bars, restaurants, cafes, pop-ups, and there's even a bit ...
fullDescription:
Job Title: Telephone Billing Analyst

Location: City of London

Salary: Competitive

Job Type: Full Time, Permanent

The company is a leading IT, Print and Telecoms Solutions company in the heart of the City of London. They're based at the centre of the business district, and are surrounded by bars, restaurants, cafes, pop-ups, and there's even a bit of greenery nearby!

You can find their office in the middle of multiple transportation hubs, such as Liverpool Street, Old Street, Moorgate, Barbican stations.

They believe in creating an environment in which people can thrive; they encourage everyone to maintain a healthy work/life balance, and they strongly believe in investing in employee's futures. They're looking for ambitious, driven, and hardworking people to join the team.

The Role:

Due to new business developments, they are looking for a telecoms Billing Analyst. It is the perfect Billing Specialist position for an ambitious individual looking for a long-term career within an expanding company.

On a day to day basis, you will:

  • Ensure Daily Call Rejects is resolved on a daily basics
  • Ensure Monthly CDR's are imported in a timely manner
  • Ensure un-costed/fixed charges are allocated
  • Ensure all Rejected Calls have been allocated including Matching CLI's to Customer accounts and Call Rejects before running the bill run
  • Run the monthly bill run for both IT and Telecoms
  • Deal with invoice queries and credits
  • Run Monthly commission reports
  • Control and manage high call alerts on a daily basics
  • Check for any customer leaving notifications and deal with them accordingly
  • Apply Call Barring for non-payment invoices
  • Load contract details for Telecoms & IT Clients

Key Requirements:

  • Previous working experience in a similar role (essential)
  • Telecoms aBILLity Billing Platform knowledge (Not essential but an advantage)
  • Good analytical skills
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills
  • Meticulous organisational skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent verbal and written skills
  • Knowledge on SQL (Not essential but an advantage)

What you get in return:

  • Basic salary
  • 28 days annual leave (Jan - Dec), which increases one day per year to a max of 33 days (including Bank Holidays)
  • Pension Scheme
  • Private Healthcare
  • Life Assurance
  • Good Attendance Bonus Scheme
  • Long term career opportunities
  • Training and Development
  • Company Days Out
  • Team recognition events

If this role sounds like a fit for you, please click the APPLY button to send your CV & Cover Letter for this role.

Candidates with experience of: Data Scientist, Data Solutions analyst, MI Analyst, MI Data Analyst, Business Insight Analyst, Data Insight Analyst, Data mining, Data modelling, Statistician, Econometrics, Data Modelling will also be considered for this role.

jobDescription: Job Description Senior Data Analyst or Data Scientist  3 months maybe longer £21 per hour Full time ideally Part- time considered. The newly established Centre for Clinical Effectiveness and Health Data Science is one of the largest centres in the Institute of Population Health Sciences. CCEHDS ...
fullDescription:
Job Description

Senior Data Analyst or Data Scientist

3 months maybe longer

£21 per hour

Full time ideally

Part- time considered.

The newly established Centre for Clinical Effectiveness and Health Data Science is one of the largest centres in the Institute of Population Health Sciences. CCEHDS carries out research to improve population health, reduce health inequalities, and innovate, develop, and deliver quality improvement programmes using electronic health records from primary care, acute care and other settings. CCEHDS is a founding partner of the innovative Discovery Programme and hosts the Wellcome Trust Doctoral Training Programme - Health Data in Practice

Job purpose

To provide senior health data science support for researchers accessing data from large electronic health record databases for research studies such as the REAL Health research programme

To provide senior health data science support for the maintenance and support of a large SQL database containing health care records. To understand the related metadata, codes, concepts and table structures relating to this data and manipulate, extract and analyse these data for subsequent use in data visualisation software and research.

To provide senior health data science support to CCEHDS researchers and students for funding and fellowship applications and, where appropriate, provide health data science supervision of projects.

Main duties and responsibilities

To work with the Director and CoDirector to provide senior health data science support to the REAL Health Programme and related research support CCEHDS researchers on aspects of health data science research conduct, including specification of metadata, data management and curation.

Provide senior health data science support for SQL database maintenance and data extraction using CTE and Dynamic SQL, with knowledge of SQL Server triggers, stored procedures and functions.

Provide support for data migrations and transformation packages using SSIS.

Support normalisation and database management, particularly in AWS RDS or other cloud based hosting.

Contribute to outputs of data for use in a statistical package such as R or STATA and data visualisation.

Contribute to development and curation and cataloguing of metadata concepts using standardised terminologies such as Snomed and creation of standardised coded data from free text and other unstructured data formats and the sources of this information including EMIS web.

Assist in the support and training of Masters, PhD students,QI fellows and researchers in CCEHDS engaged in research using electronic health record data as appropriate.

Maintain appropriate databases, keeping accurate written and computerised records and ensure data integrity and security in compliance with HRA standards of good clinical practice

Ensure data handling is securely maintained and in conformance with governance policies and the e provisions of the Data Protection Act, NHS legislation, GDPR and similar laws/regulations.

Liaise with academic colleagues and clinical and other research collaborators across the School of Medicine and Dentistry, NHS organisatons and nationally/internationally

Liaise with national and international academic colleagues within this discipline

Experience / Skills

Experience of using T-SQL to manage data using CTE and Dynamic SQL techniques

Experience of SQL Server triggers, stored procedures and functions

Knowledge of statutory legislation regarding data handling and local information governance policies and maintainance of secure data processing

Knowledge of Microsoft Office software (Outlook, word, Excel, Powerpoint, Access)

Knowledge of normalisation and database management, particularly in AWS RDS

Experience of using programming languages (such as Python, C#, Javascript) to create ETL or visualisation applications.

Experience of data visualisation, particularly in Power BI, Dash, RShiny, Angular or Tableau.

Experience of STATA, R or other statistical packages

Knowledge of GP IT systems (EMIS Web)

Understanding of NHS structure and primary health care organisation

A proven capacity to be proactive, to work independently, and to build and work effectively in teams.

Ability to organise work and prioritise appropriately within the project timetable

Good problem solving and analytical skills, with the ability to identify potential problems and liaise appropriately with others to manage and resolve them effectively,

Good communication skills both oral and written

Qualifications

Higher degree in relevant field or relevant experience

Undergraduate degree or equivalent in relevant subject or equivalent experience

Health & Safety Considerations

Health and Safety processes in place in accordance with government guidelines.

jobTitle: Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Visualisation, Python
jobDescription: Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Visualisation, Python My client, a rapidly growing organisation within the healthcare industry, is seeking a Data Scientist to join their Research Engineering & team. The successful Data Scientist will work on producing Data Analysis and Data visualisation insights on the algorithmic  data for the company’s medical device. The company is seeking a bright and creative Data ...
fullDescription:
Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Visualisation, Python

My client, a rapidly growing organisation within the healthcare industry, is seeking a Data Scientist to join their Research Engineering & team. The successful Data Scientist will work on producing Data Analysis and Data visualisation insights on the algorithmic data for the company’s medical device.

The company is seeking a bright and creative Data Scientist to assist in the build of modular and scalable code, written in Python and its subsequent libraries, NumPy and Pandas for plotting and Data visualisation; in order to demonstrate key trends which will support the Research & Engineering team in the improvement of their algorithms.

The Company

As the Data Scientist, you will be joining this healthcare-based organisation at an exciting time of growth. With a rapid increase in their client base, they are at a pivotal point in business development and as such are in need of new and exciting talent. You will be joining an organisation who values caring, enthusiastic and passionate forward-thinkers who are willing to learn and get stuck-in.

What’s Required?

To be successful within this role the Data Scientist will need to have the following skillset:

  • Experience of Python including NumPy, Brokeh, Matplotlib and similar, either through commercial experience of from a relevant STEM-based MSc degree
  • Ability to operate with Linux on a day-to-day basis
  • Ability to build modular and scalable code
  • Good database experience
  • Experience of Data Visualisation with another programming language is highly beneficial as well as experience of Hadoop, Apache Spark or another similar processing engine

What Next?

This is an excellent opportunity not to be missed. We are seeking someone who is keen to learn and progress in their career. It’s an exciting, progressive company who are looking to invest in the right employee to push the business forward! Apply now for immediate consideration.

Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Visualisation, Python, Medical Device, Healthcare, Algorithm, NumPy, Pandas

Corriculo Ltd acts as an employment agency and an employment business.

jobDescription: We are looking for a Data Scientist to join a global market leader on a full time, permanent basis, in Banbury. If you are an experience Data Scientist or an Analyst with SQL and looking for a jump into being a Data Scientist, we want to hear from you! The  role is responsible for the timely delivery of actionable results to support customer retention and acquisition growth within the Company. You will be expected to have strong commu...
fullDescription:
We are looking for a Data Scientist to join a global market leader on a full time, permanent basis, in Banbury. If you are an experience Data Scientist or an Analyst with SQL and looking for a jump into being a Data Scientist, we want to hear from you! The role is responsible for the timely delivery of actionable results to support customer retention and acquisition growth within the Company.

You will be expected to have strong communication, insight and storytelling techniques based upon the audience you are engaging with and being able to communicate and present back to the Management team - focusing on marketing and sales growth.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Serve as technical expert on the team, coordinating with the entire direct marketing team to support direct mail and wider marketing team functions, optimise data and system processes, and drive future innovation
  • Build machine learning systems to understand cross-channel interactions (online and offline)
  • Perform statistical analysis across diverse datasets to drive and measure performance
  • Execution and management of direct marketing campaigns including designing and writing programs and packages for extraction, segmentation, and statistical analysis on large datasets
  • Create holistic dashboards and reporting solutions that drive effective business decision-making for all levels of management
  • Pair knowledge of customer data, structures, and business rules, with an understanding of business needs to identify opportunities for new programs, support integration of new data elements and systems, scope and prioritize technical project work for the team
  • Research and evaluate advanced statistical and machine learning models, emerging tools and technologies in reporting, analytics, and data science
  • Participate in marketing database, customer data platform (CDP) and any other cross-functional projects as a subject matter expert on data science and advanced programming.
  • Provide support and training to the users on developed tools and solutions
  • Develop scalable tools to drive automation and optimize business processes

Key Skills and Experience required:

  • Professional experience performing database programming, data science and analytics.
  • Demonstrates advanced programming skills in R, Python, SQL, and SAS
  • Experience analysing multi-channel marketing campaigns involving A/B testing, multivariate testing, and segmentation techniques
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Domo, Power BI and Tableau is preferred.
  • Experience with Data Science in the cloud (AWS, Azure, Google) is preferred
  • Knowledge in advanced analytics concepts and algorithms (e.g., machine learning, statistical learning, Bayesian methods, neural networks, natural language processing, etc.)
  • Strong attention to detail, with an innovative problem-solving mindset

What's in it for you?

Benefits include a competitive salary of up to £42,000 and rewarding benefits package, health and life insurance, pension, annual salary reviews, free parking, and recognition and discount schemes. Your development and motivation are key to their success, therefore a complete a comprehensive induction programme and personal development training needs will regularly be assessed.

jobDescription: Lead Data Analyst / Data Scientist inro £45,000 - £50,000++ Plus Extensive Benefits London W1 / Remote  This inspiring organisation, with operations spanning over 75 countries, specialises in providing Consultancy & Professional Services within the fields of Tax, Accountancy, Audit and Legal. The rapidly growing fifth specialism, and one that underp...
fullDescription:
Lead Data Analyst / Data Scientist

inro £45,000 - £50,000++ Plus Extensive Benefits

London W1 / Remote

This inspiring organisation, with operations spanning over 75 countries, specialises in providing Consultancy & Professional Services within the fields of Tax, Accountancy, Audit and Legal. The rapidly growing fifth specialism, and one that underpins all they do, is Data Science.

They have just created a new opening for a Lead/Experienced Data Analyst / Data Scientist to join their niche Data Analytics / DS team.

Key Skills Sought:

  • Strong proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Power BI (or similar data visualisation software)
  • Educated to BSc level - ideally a Graduate in Mathematics, Financial Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Opertional Research or similar numerically based Degree.
  • Strong data visualisation and data analysis ability (cleanse, mine, extract) - able and eager to tell the story behind the data
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Machine Learning experience - Python highly desirable
  • Strong MS Excel skills

In return, you can expect to work with professional like minded Scientists on extremely interesting subject matters and industries - i.e. Retail, Media, TV, Web, Social Media, Manufacturing and Finance, with projects and clients of all sizes and to be using many OR tools and techniques such as Predictive Modelling; Database Querying and Data Mining; Customer Segmentation; Real Time Dashboard Reporting; Data Analysis; Business Modelling, Machine Learning etc and for a company that actively encourages funded training to expand your skill set and who is dedicated to your career advancement.

This role represents 'the best of both worlds’: a small, niche, nifty Analytical team within the setting of a large solid, stable Global organisation.

Due to the high number of applications we receive, we are unfortunately unable to respond to everyone in person. Applications are processed within 24-48 hours, so if you have not heard back from us by then, please assume your application has been unsuccessful. However, this does not prevent you from applying again to our other roles….

fullDescription:
Data Analyst/ Scientist - Analytics Consultancy

Data, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Science, Consultant, Database, Technology, IT, Data, Software, BI

This is an exciting opportunity for an aspiring Graduate Data Analyst or Scientist to make the next step in their career, with a rapidly growing Consultancy. The company is a market-leading data-driven consultancy based in Edinburgh, who work with their blue-chip clients to deliver, configure and implement innovative business solutions.

In the role, successful applicants will use their existing technical and analytical skills to solve challenging business problems in a capable and dynamic environment. Due to the nature of their work as a consultancy, expect a fast-based, project environment.

Required:

- 2.1 or above from a leading university in a numerical or computational subject

- A/B's at A-Level and above or equivalent

- Experience applying modelling and/or analytical skills

- A genuine interest in Technology

- Ambition and drive to progress rapidly within the company

There is a good benefit package, as well as a friendly working environment in a great office in Central Edinburgh.

If that sounds of interest, apply today!

Data, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Science, Consultant, Database, Technology, IT, Data, Software, BI

jobDescription: Job Title: Senior Data Analyst – Retail/Ecommerce Company   Location: Reading/Remote Working     Salary: Up to £55,000 depending on experience plus benefits    About the Retail/Ecommerce Company  Growing retail/ecommerce company seeking a talented Senior Data Analyst to become a ke...
fullDescription:
Job Title: Senior Data Analyst – Retail/Ecommerce Company  

Location: Reading/Remote Working    

Salary: Up to £55,000 depending on experience plus benefits   

About the Retail/Ecommerce Company 

Growing retail/ecommerce company seeking a talented Senior Data Analyst to become a key member of their dynamic team. This forward-thinking ecommerce-based company sells and distributes a range of books and tech products and is one of the largest global third-party Amazon partners. They have a collaborative, friendly and entrepreneurial culture. The new Senior Data Analyst will have the autonomy to make a big impact whilst receiving support and opportunities to grow and develop.  

About the Senior Data Analyst Role  

The Senior Data Analyst will play a key role in modelling the results of customer activity in response to pricing changes.  
 

Key Responsibilities for the Senior Data Analyst:  

  • Leveraging data about customers, products and competitors 
  • Performing analysis, data mining and trend spotting 
  • Collaborate with internal teams to create pricing algorithms 
  • Refine and analyse large data sets to produce tangible business strategies 
  • Create and improve dashboards 

About You  

You’ll be a talented data analyst with a strong quant background, looking to progress your career within a growing ecommerce company.  
 

Skills and experience needed for the Senior Data Analyst role:  

  • Experience in a data analyst/scientist role 
  • Advanced Excel skills 
  • SQL skills 
  • Experience in a retail/ecommerce environment beneficial 
  • Dashboarding and data visualisation experience beneficial 

For more information about the Data Analyst role or to apply please send your CV to Neil at  or call .

This is an opportunity for to make that next step in your career and join a forward thinking and supportive business and become a key figure in new and exciting pro...
fullDescription:
Due to a surge of new Digital projects, a fantastic opportunity has arisen with one of our forward thinking North East based clients.

As well as a very competitive salary the benefits package within the market is highly attractive (happy to discuss in more detail).

This is an opportunity for to make that next step in your career and join a forward thinking and supportive business and become a key figure in new and exciting projects and clients. Furthermore a career path which will enable you to develop and work with diverse thinking teams, clients and new technologies and work with Data and Technical teams across the organisation on current and exciting new systems and applications, as well as developing yourself.

As a key member of the team, you will be working within the data team and alongside our technology team to take raw data from key sources and transform this into useable information to enable the business to better use its data.

Due to Covid this for now will be a remote position.

Main Roles and Responsibilities:

  • Working within the Data Team and alongside technology team, to take raw data from key sources and transform this into useable information
  • Support colleagues from across the wider business to get the most out of the data they collect. This includes performance reporting, continuous improvement, gaining more insights to support innovation and change management
  • Flexibility in undertaking responsibilities, in keeping with the needs of the business, whilst supporting wider business colleagues and clients
  • Displaying results in effective Power BI visuals, or equally used by our Data Scientist and combined with other data for further analysis with results pushed back to core system

Key Skills and Experience (Not all Essential)

  • Experienced SQL developer combining data from multiple data sources
  • Expert knowledge of data migration and integration techniques e.g. ETL, SSIS
  • Proven analytical skills including evaluation, analysis and visualisation
  • Understand the importance of adhering to coding standards and documenting processes
  • Knowledge and experience of Azure DevOps

jobDescription: Senior Informatics Data Analyst*Senior Informatics Data Analyst required by leading Biotech firm based in Milton Keynes*A leading Biotech firm, based in Milton Keynes, currently require a Senior Informatics Data Analyst to join a team in designing Bioinformatics systems for the company. The Senior Informatics data Analyst will ensure that Bioinformatics Systems are implemented  and configured to meet business requirem...
fullDescription:
Senior Informatics Data Analyst

*Senior Informatics Data Analyst required by leading Biotech firm based in Milton Keynes*

A leading Biotech firm, based in Milton Keynes, currently require a Senior Informatics Data Analyst to join a team in designing Bioinformatics systems for the company. The Senior Informatics data Analyst will ensure that Bioinformatics Systems are implemented and configured to meet business requirements while managing key relationships with stakeholders across the business, inclusive of IT/Ops and Lab services.

Upon joining, the Senior Informatics Data Analyst will not only design, implement and maintain Bioinformatics systems but also provide support to the Head of Laboratories in analysing Bioinformatics Data. The Senior Informatics Data Analyst will work closely with the LIMS Development team as well as Informatics Data Scientists to interpret and capture useable Bioinformatics data.

In terms of skills, we are looking for Senior Informatics Data Analysts with good experience of programming languages, such as SQL, a solid knowledge of Laboratory Information Management System platforms (LIMS) as well as a strong knowledge of working with complex data sets and laboratory processes.

This opportunity would suit a Senior Informatics Data Analyst who is looking to work with a leading Biotech who are helping in the fight against disease a very current issue. If this sounds exciting, please apply within!

Key Words: Senior Informatics Data Analyst, Biotech. Bioinformatician, Bioinformatics, Systems, Laboratory, LIMS, Laboratory Information Management Systems, Data Scientist, Data, Complex Data Sets, Milton Keynes

jobDescription: NHS England and Improvement is expanding their analytical capacity and are looking to recruit new apprentices to support the NHS. They are recruiting to two teams, one supporting the Midlands region, the other the South East. You will work with regional  colleagues on a variety of performance, clinical and quality areas to help support delivery of high quality services for patients.  A typical day  Design...
fullDescription:
NHS England and Improvement is expanding their analytical capacity and are looking to recruit new apprentices to support the NHS. They are recruiting to two teams, one supporting the Midlands region, the other the South East. You will work with regional colleagues on a variety of performance, clinical and quality areas to help support delivery of high quality services for patients.

A typical day

  • Design a regional data collection around hospital-based outbreaks - working with the COVID outbreak administrative teams, agree what data requires collecting, designing a form for collection and the backend to collate the returning information.
  • Developing a storyboard presentation for a healthcare community on a clinical pathway - that includes data from a wide range of sources and sets out the key messages
  • Summarise a set of data, to be regularly updated, to show how a region compares to others clinical areas, covering spend, efficiency, clinical outcomes and patient satisfaction.
  • Consider and respond to the impact of COVID on various services
  • Generating graphs and tables from various data sets
  • Producing business intelligence reports
  • Log, analyse and manage problems in order to identify and implement the appropriate solution, ensuring that the problem is fixed
  • Interpretation of data, statistics, evaluation, or simple modelling or forecasting as needed.
  • Discussing and assessing priorities with end users and customers
  • Maintaining, cleansing and exploration of data on various databases

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • You are inquisitive and methodical in applying analytical skills.
  • You have a high attention to detail
  • Use a mix of SQL, VBA, R & Tableau to work directly with large data sets and produce analysis at scale. As an analyst you’ll be taught to use these technical tools.
  • You will need to build good working relationships and be reliable
  • You need to be able to work to a deadline, fulfilling your role as part of a team.
  • Great communication skills
  • Great problem solving skills - you are an active listener and ask for clarification when building a solution

Perks and benefits

  • WhiteHat community
  • Pension

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects:

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

fullDescription:
Ark Schools is looking for an enthusiastic team player to join our strategy team as a Data Analyst Apprentice. They pride themselves on having a sector-leading approach to information systems and data analysis. You will use sector leading tools to interpret and present data. You will be working alongside the wider Data and Insight Team, with a focus on analysing data that is captured from a wide range of online technology platforms.

A typical day

  • Participate in meetings with the wider analyst team to understand key priorities
  • Work with other teams to understand their priorities, and learn how data is used across Ark
  • Support with the export of key data sources from a range of online learning platforms
  • Develop experience with web analytics tools - full training will be provided so don't worry if they are new to you
  • Work with the Head of Insight and Director of Strategy to create and monitor dashboards to support organisation key performance indicators
  • Maintain data tables which are shared with key stakeholders on a regular basis
  • Over time, write summaries and short reports which provide insight into the data

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • You enjoy learning new concepts quickly and are keen to learn and share knowledge with others
  • You love problem solving and enjoy finding simple and practical solutions to complex problems, with a curious mindset always asking 'why’
  • You enjoy being part of a team, collaborating with others and have good interpersonal skills
  • You are enthusiastic, self-motivated and keen to achieve

Perks and benefits

  • Discounts
  • Pension
  • WhiteHat community

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects:

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

jobDescription: There is no shortage of data collected from across the NHS. As a Data Analyst working for The NHS, you will be part of a large, dynamic team. You will deliver high quality analytical outputs, using good, relevant technical skills in data management, business  intelligence and analytics, and data science.  A typical day  Cleanse and manage data (including processing)Quality assure data and analyti...
fullDescription:
There is no shortage of data collected from across the NHS. As a Data Analyst working for The NHS, you will be part of a large, dynamic team. You will deliver high quality analytical outputs, using good, relevant technical skills in data management, business intelligence and analytics, and data science.

A typical day

  • Cleanse and manage data (including processing)
  • Quality assure data and analytical outputs following best practice guidelines
  • Integrate data feeds from disparate sources
  • Respond to incoming requests for information in a timely and efficient manner
  • Develop business intelligence reports
  • Plan, design, manage, execute and report tests, using appropriate tools and techniques
  • Be highly numerate and use a variety of analytical techniques to provide high quality, timely analysis and intelligence relating to key priorities
  • Be adaptable when finding analytical solutions to problems, to analyse and triangulate data in innovative ways and present findings clearly to a range of audiences
  • Log, analyse and manage problems in order to identify and implement the appropriate solution, ensuring that the problem is fixed
  • Work collaboratively with colleagues across our team and the wider organisation.

You must have

  • Five GCSE grades C - A* (4-9) or equivalent, including English and Maths
  • Level 3 qualification (A level, BTEC or equivalent)

Skills needed

  • IT skills
  • Highly numerate / mathematical skills
  • Basic statistical knowledge
  • Experience of generating reports from the analysis of raw data
  • High level of computer literacy (Microsoft Excel is essential; relational database experience and familiarity with analytical software/coding languages such as SAS, Python and R is beneficial)
  • Excellent time management skills with the ability to re-prioritise

Perks and benefits

  • WhiteHat community
  • Pension

Training provided:

  1. Training on the 18 month Standard Level 4 Data Analytics (DA4) apprenticeship.
  2. Being a WhiteHat apprentice means access to awesome social events, sports teams, insight/career days with other apprentices to grow your network, as well as your own personal Coach who will guide you through the qualification to help you achieve your full potential.
  3. As part of your WhiteHat Apprenticeship, you will have access to our Future Leaders Foundation modules to develop 6 key competencies, underpinned by well-being, self-awareness, motivation, conscientiousness, effectiveness and grit.

Future prospects:

After your Data Analysis Apprenticeship, you can progress into any Junior Data Analyst, Data Scientist and Data engineer role. You'll have the skills to run insight analytical projects from beginning to end and work within a Data Analytics team.

jobDescription: Vacancy: Data Analyst Skills: SQL, Excel, Python Location: Manchester / Oldham Salary: Up to £45,000  The Role If you are currently an analyst but aspire to be a Data Scientist or Data Engineer then this is absolutely the role for you! We are looking for someone who has a couple of years or so working in industr...
fullDescription:
Vacancy: Data Analyst

Skills: SQL, Excel, Python

Location: Manchester / Oldham

Salary: Up to £45,000

The Role

If you are currently an analyst but aspire to be a Data Scientist or Data Engineer then this is absolutely the role for you!

We are looking for someone who has a couple of years or so working in industry as an analyst but wants to take that next step in their career and work with some more advanced analytical technologies. Best of all - this company can provide the training and development for you to get there.

You will have a wider team around you and the team is responsible for identifying and driving the adoption of best practices for data collection, aggregation and analysis in addition to surfacing new insights from this data via statistical analysis, modelling and techniques such as machine learning.

This position is based in greater Manchester and is offered on a split working pattern, 2/3 days in a week can be done remotely.

Role Responsibilities

  • Implementing speed improvements and costing decreases for common queries
  • Produce internal monitoring dashboards
  • Providing data experience to the development team to help with data issues such as performance at scale
  • Understanding and being able to explain/define what different data is
  • Development work as required for prototyping or data-specific tasks
  • Optimisation of data-related processes
  • Handling data in a safe and secure manner
  • Identifying new potential data sources

Role Requirements:

  • Essential - SQL - Programming, Data extraction, Queries etc.
  • Essential - Experience with a business intelligence tool - Tableau, PowerBI, Looker etc.
  • Essential - Good communication skills to gather data reporting requirements.
  • Bonus - knowledge of Python or R
  • Bonus - knowledge of Data Engineering principles.

The Company

This is an awesome opportunity to join a company, produce some great insights, see the fruits of your work and really develop your career.

Apply now!

What's left to say? You know what to do. If you're the type of person that reaches for the stars and wants to work in a fun supportive environment and rapidly progress your career whilst working with the latest technologies in data and you've got the relevant technical experience as a Data Analyst hit that apply button to submit your application now.

Interviews for this position will be commencing immediately so be sure to not miss out! You will be contacted by a phone call or by email to book an appointment, please be patient.

Vacancy: Data Analyst

Skills: SQL, Excel, Python

Location: Manchester / Oldham

Salary: Up to £45,000

Oscar Technology is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

To understand more about what we do with your data please review our privacy policy in the privacy section of the Oscar website.

jobTitle: Telephone Billing Analyst / Data Analyst / Business Analyst
jobDescription: Job Title: Telephone Billing Analyst Location: City of London Salary: Competitive Job Type: Full Time, Permanent The company is a leading IT, Print and Telecoms Solutions company in the heart of the City of London. They're based at the centre of the business district, and are surrounded by bars, restaurants, cafes, pop-ups, and there's even a bit ...
fullDescription:
Job Title: Telephone Billing Analyst

Location: City of London

Salary: Competitive

Job Type: Full Time, Permanent

The company is a leading IT, Print and Telecoms Solutions company in the heart of the City of London. They're based at the centre of the business district, and are surrounded by bars, restaurants, cafes, pop-ups, and there's even a bit of greenery nearby!

You can find their office in the middle of multiple transportation hubs, such as Liverpool Street, Old Street, Moorgate, Barbican stations.

They believe in creating an environment in which people can thrive; they encourage everyone to maintain a healthy work/life balance, and they strongly believe in investing in employee's futures. They're looking for ambitious, driven, and hardworking people to join the team.

The Role:

Due to new business developments, they are looking for a telecoms Billing Analyst. It is the perfect Billing Specialist position for an ambitious individual looking for a long-term career within an expanding company.

On a day to day basis, you will:

  • Ensure Daily Call Rejects is resolved on a daily basics
  • Ensure Monthly CDR's are imported in a timely manner
  • Ensure un-costed/fixed charges are allocated
  • Ensure all Rejected Calls have been allocated including Matching CLI's to Customer accounts and Call Rejects before running the bill run
  • Run the monthly bill run for both IT and Telecoms
  • Deal with invoice queries and credits
  • Run Monthly commission reports
  • Control and manage high call alerts on a daily basics
  • Check for any customer leaving notifications and deal with them accordingly
  • Apply Call Barring for non-payment invoices
  • Load contract details for Telecoms & IT Clients

Key Requirements:

  • Previous working experience in a similar role (essential)
  • Telecoms aBILLity Billing Platform knowledge (Not essential but an advantage)
  • Good analytical skills
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills
  • Meticulous organisational skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent verbal and written skills
  • Knowledge on SQL (Not essential but an advantage)

What you get in return:

  • Basic salary
  • 28 days annual leave (Jan - Dec), which increases one day per year to a max of 33 days (including Bank Holidays)
  • Pension Scheme
  • Private Healthcare
  • Life Assurance
  • Good Attendance Bonus Scheme
  • Long term career opportunities
  • Training and Development
  • Company Days Out
  • Team recognition events

If this role sounds like a fit for you, please click the APPLY button to send your CV & Cover Letter for this role.

Candidates with experience of: Data Scientist, Data Solutions analyst, MI Analyst, MI Data Analyst, Business Insight Analyst, Data Insight Analyst, Data mining, Data modelling, Statistician, Econometrics, Data Modelling will also be considered for this role.

jobDescription: Job Description Senior Data Analyst or Data Scientist  3 months maybe longer £21 per hour Full time ideally Part- time considered. The newly established Centre for Clinical Effectiveness and Health Data Science is one of the largest centres in the Institute of Population Health Sciences. CCEHDS ...
fullDescription:
Job Description

Senior Data Analyst or Data Scientist

3 months maybe longer

£21 per hour

Full time ideally

Part- time considered.

The newly established Centre for Clinical Effectiveness and Health Data Science is one of the largest centres in the Institute of Population Health Sciences. CCEHDS carries out research to improve population health, reduce health inequalities, and innovate, develop, and deliver quality improvement programmes using electronic health records from primary care, acute care and other settings. CCEHDS is a founding partner of the innovative Discovery Programme and hosts the Wellcome Trust Doctoral Training Programme - Health Data in Practice

Job purpose

To provide senior health data science support for researchers accessing data from large electronic health record databases for research studies such as the REAL Health research programme

To provide senior health data science support for the maintenance and support of a large SQL database containing health care records. To understand the related metadata, codes, concepts and table structures relating to this data and manipulate, extract and analyse these data for subsequent use in data visualisation software and research.

To provide senior health data science support to CCEHDS researchers and students for funding and fellowship applications and, where appropriate, provide health data science supervision of projects.

Main duties and responsibilities

To work with the Director and CoDirector to provide senior health data science support to the REAL Health Programme and related research support CCEHDS researchers on aspects of health data science research conduct, including specification of metadata, data management and curation.

Provide senior health data science support for SQL database maintenance and data extraction using CTE and Dynamic SQL, with knowledge of SQL Server triggers, stored procedures and functions.

Provide support for data migrations and transformation packages using SSIS.

Support normalisation and database management, particularly in AWS RDS or other cloud based hosting.

Contribute to outputs of data for use in a statistical package such as R or STATA and data visualisation.

Contribute to development and curation and cataloguing of metadata concepts using standardised terminologies such as Snomed and creation of standardised coded data from free text and other unstructured data formats and the sources of this information including EMIS web.

Assist in the support and training of Masters, PhD students,QI fellows and researchers in CCEHDS engaged in research using electronic health record data as appropriate.

Maintain appropriate databases, keeping accurate written and computerised records and ensure data integrity and security in compliance with HRA standards of good clinical practice

Ensure data handling is securely maintained and in conformance with governance policies and the e provisions of the Data Protection Act, NHS legislation, GDPR and similar laws/regulations.

Liaise with academic colleagues and clinical and other research collaborators across the School of Medicine and Dentistry, NHS organisatons and nationally/internationally

Liaise with national and international academic colleagues within this discipline

Experience / Skills

Experience of using T-SQL to manage data using CTE and Dynamic SQL techniques

Experience of SQL Server triggers, stored procedures and functions

Knowledge of statutory legislation regarding data handling and local information governance policies and maintainance of secure data processing

Knowledge of Microsoft Office software (Outlook, word, Excel, Powerpoint, Access)

Knowledge of normalisation and database management, particularly in AWS RDS

Experience of using programming languages (such as Python, C#, Javascript) to create ETL or visualisation applications.

Experience of data visualisation, particularly in Power BI, Dash, RShiny, Angular or Tableau.

Experience of STATA, R or other statistical packages

Knowledge of GP IT systems (EMIS Web)

Understanding of NHS structure and primary health care organisation

A proven capacity to be proactive, to work independently, and to build and work effectively in teams.

Ability to organise work and prioritise appropriately within the project timetable

Good problem solving and analytical skills, with the ability to identify potential problems and liaise appropriately with others to manage and resolve them effectively,

Good communication skills both oral and written

Qualifications

Higher degree in relevant field or relevant experience

Undergraduate degree or equivalent in relevant subject or equivalent experience

Health & Safety Considerations

Health and Safety processes in place in accordance with government guidelines.

jobTitle: Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Visualisation, Python
jobDescription: Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Visualisation, Python My client, a rapidly growing organisation within the healthcare industry, is seeking a Data Scientist to join their Research Engineering & team. The successful Data Scientist will work on producing Data Analysis and Data visualisation insights on the algorithmic  data for the company’s medical device. The company is seeking a bright and creative Data ...
fullDescription:
Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Visualisation, Python

My client, a rapidly growing organisation within the healthcare industry, is seeking a Data Scientist to join their Research Engineering & team. The successful Data Scientist will work on producing Data Analysis and Data visualisation insights on the algorithmic data for the company’s medical device.

The company is seeking a bright and creative Data Scientist to assist in the build of modular and scalable code, written in Python and its subsequent libraries, NumPy and Pandas for plotting and Data visualisation; in order to demonstrate key trends which will support the Research & Engineering team in the improvement of their algorithms.

The Company

As the Data Scientist, you will be joining this healthcare-based organisation at an exciting time of growth. With a rapid increase in their client base, they are at a pivotal point in business development and as such are in need of new and exciting talent. You will be joining an organisation who values caring, enthusiastic and passionate forward-thinkers who are willing to learn and get stuck-in.

What’s Required?

To be successful within this role the Data Scientist will need to have the following skillset:

  • Experience of Python including NumPy, Brokeh, Matplotlib and similar, either through commercial experience of from a relevant STEM-based MSc degree
  • Ability to operate with Linux on a day-to-day basis
  • Ability to build modular and scalable code
  • Good database experience
  • Experience of Data Visualisation with another programming language is highly beneficial as well as experience of Hadoop, Apache Spark or another similar processing engine

What Next?

This is an excellent opportunity not to be missed. We are seeking someone who is keen to learn and progress in their career. It’s an exciting, progressive company who are looking to invest in the right employee to push the business forward! Apply now for immediate consideration.

Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Visualisation, Python, Medical Device, Healthcare, Algorithm, NumPy, Pandas

Corriculo Ltd acts as an employment agency and an employment business.

jobDescription: We are looking for a Data Scientist to join a global market leader on a full time, permanent basis, in Banbury. If you are an experience Data Scientist or an Analyst with SQL and looking for a jump into being a Data Scientist, we want to hear from you! The  role is responsible for the timely delivery of actionable results to support customer retention and acquisition growth within the Company. You will be expected to have strong commu...
fullDescription:
We are looking for a Data Scientist to join a global market leader on a full time, permanent basis, in Banbury. If you are an experience Data Scientist or an Analyst with SQL and looking for a jump into being a Data Scientist, we want to hear from you! The role is responsible for the timely delivery of actionable results to support customer retention and acquisition growth within the Company.

You will be expected to have strong communication, insight and storytelling techniques based upon the audience you are engaging with and being able to communicate and present back to the Management team - focusing on marketing and sales growth.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Serve as technical expert on the team, coordinating with the entire direct marketing team to support direct mail and wider marketing team functions, optimise data and system processes, and drive future innovation
  • Build machine learning systems to understand cross-channel interactions (online and offline)
  • Perform statistical analysis across diverse datasets to drive and measure performance
  • Execution and management of direct marketing campaigns including designing and writing programs and packages for extraction, segmentation, and statistical analysis on large datasets
  • Create holistic dashboards and reporting solutions that drive effective business decision-making for all levels of management
  • Pair knowledge of customer data, structures, and business rules, with an understanding of business needs to identify opportunities for new programs, support integration of new data elements and systems, scope and prioritize technical project work for the team
  • Research and evaluate advanced statistical and machine learning models, emerging tools and technologies in reporting, analytics, and data science
  • Participate in marketing database, customer data platform (CDP) and any other cross-functional projects as a subject matter expert on data science and advanced programming.
  • Provide support and training to the users on developed tools and solutions
  • Develop scalable tools to drive automation and optimize business processes

Key Skills and Experience required:

  • Professional experience performing database programming, data science and analytics.
  • Demonstrates advanced programming skills in R, Python, SQL, and SAS
  • Experience analysing multi-channel marketing campaigns involving A/B testing, multivariate testing, and segmentation techniques
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Domo, Power BI and Tableau is preferred.
  • Experience with Data Science in the cloud (AWS, Azure, Google) is preferred
  • Knowledge in advanced analytics concepts and algorithms (e.g., machine learning, statistical learning, Bayesian methods, neural networks, natural language processing, etc.)
  • Strong attention to detail, with an innovative problem-solving mindset

What's in it for you?

Benefits include a competitive salary of up to £42,000 and rewarding benefits package, health and life insurance, pension, annual salary reviews, free parking, and recognition and discount schemes. Your development and motivation are key to their success, therefore a complete a comprehensive induction programme and personal development training needs will regularly be assessed.

fullDescription:
Lead Data Analyst / Data Scientist

inro £45,000 - £50,000++ Plus Extensive Benefits

London W1 / Remote

This inspiring organisation, with operations spanning over 75 countries, specialises in providing Consultancy & Professional Services within the fields of Tax, Accountancy, Audit and Legal. The rapidly growing fifth specialism, and one that underpins all they do, is Data Science.

They have just created a new opening for a Lead/Experienced Data Analyst / Data Scientist to join their niche Data Analytics / DS team.

Key Skills Sought:

  • Strong proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Power BI (or similar data visualisation software)
  • Educated to BSc level - ideally a Graduate in Mathematics, Financial Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Opertional Research or similar numerically based Degree.
  • Strong data visualisation and data analysis ability (cleanse, mine, extract) - able and eager to tell the story behind the data
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Machine Learning experience - Python highly desirable
  • Strong MS Excel skills

In return, you can expect to work with professional like minded Scientists on extremely interesting subject matters and industries - i.e. Retail, Media, TV, Web, Social Media, Manufacturing and Finance, with projects and clients of all sizes and to be using many OR tools and techniques such as Predictive Modelling; Database Querying and Data Mining; Customer Segmentation; Real Time Dashboard Reporting; Data Analysis; Business Modelling, Machine Learning etc and for a company that actively encourages funded training to expand your skill set and who is dedicated to your career advancement.

This role represents 'the best of both worlds’: a small, niche, nifty Analytical team within the setting of a large solid, stable Global organisation.

Due to the high number of applications we receive, we are unfortunately unable to respond to everyone in person. Applications are processed within 24-48 hours, so if you have not heard back from us by then, please assume your application has been unsuccessful. However, this does not prevent you from applying again to our other roles….

fullDescription:
Data Analyst/ Scientist - Analytics Consultancy

Data, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Science, Consultant, Database, Technology, IT, Data, Software, BI

This is an exciting opportunity for an aspiring Graduate Data Analyst or Scientist to make the next step in their career, with a rapidly growing Consultancy. The company is a market-leading data-driven consultancy based in Edinburgh, who work with their blue-chip clients to deliver, configure and implement innovative business solutions.

In the role, successful applicants will use their existing technical and analytical skills to solve challenging business problems in a capable and dynamic environment. Due to the nature of their work as a consultancy, expect a fast-based, project environment.

Required:

- 2.1 or above from a leading university in a numerical or computational subject

- A/B's at A-Level and above or equivalent

- Experience applying modelling and/or analytical skills

- A genuine interest in Technology

- Ambition and drive to progress rapidly within the company

There is a good benefit package, as well as a friendly working environment in a great office in Central Edinburgh.

If that sounds of interest, apply today!
